bc3u02W1QqZfnGAFIOT5LQ.text: Every single visit I've had to Windsor has been positive. Whether I'm sitting out on the patio under low lights next to a heater, or inside a cozy booth by their spacious bar inside, it is always a wonderful atmosphere to enjoy with friends or on a date. Enough about the atmosphere, though - the food. I haven't met a dish here that I don't like. They have great salads (my favorite is the ahi tuna salad) that leave you satisfied. The sandwiches are the star here, though. I have enjoyed everything from the Backyard Burger to the Bahn Mi, and they are all spectacular. Great medium cook on the burger, tangy sauces (even a good kick on the bahn mi), amazing pork belly in the porkwitch... it's just so good. My favorite so far though has been the Oyster Po Boy. Giant pieces of lightly fried oysters and a huge helping of slaw to top it in the perfect roll. The sides continue to rock my socks. Most people will rave about their mac and cheese, and it certainly deserves its accolades, but my favorite is the fried okra. The cornmeal breading stays on it perfectly and the dipping sauce they serve with it is perfection. "But Libby!" You exclaim. "Whatever shall I drink with these delicious dishes?" Oh, let me tell you, friend. Do not miss the liquor at Windsor. The Number 63, with burbon, fresh grapefruit and honey syrup is the bomb.com. Not too sweet, not too bitter, not too liquory, just right. My other favorite is the Number 9 with rye, pineapple and mint. They're all worth a go (I just lean towards darker liquors) - definitely give it a shot. (see what I did there?) Overall, this is one of my favorite places in the valley. Upward Projects knew what they were doing when they created this amazing place for everyone (next to an ice cream store, no less) - it's a must in my book!

Gwmcy1fCiuyC6yPI0OstQw.text: They opened Monday morning early for brunch on Labor Day and I see why. They were packed and the bartenders were working it hard! I sat in the corner near the Bloody Mary bar and everything looked clean and stocked.  The bartender, a tall lad just busting out service well drinks took care of me intermittently.  He was great.   I went with the green Bloody Mary. It was a great concept but it needed something. I added salt and a little extra from the free service bar and it made it perfect. They had a breakfast sandwich on a large English muffin type bread and I seriously think it's my favorite restaurant breakfast sandwich I've ever had.  I wanted more!!! Even though it was plenty food I finished my cheesy potatoes with the biggest grin. Keep up the good work.

a7oI-56Tr_L7A_skmvsFpA.text: Great ambience. Had the fondue sans sausage and it was very good. Loved the freshly baked pretzels. I ordered the catch of the day which were shrimps over coconut rice. Okay but left me craving a much more flavorful and spicy Thai dish which it loosely resembled. Had a couple of my daughters chicken wings and they were disappointing. Seemed to be slightly glazed in spicy sauce but not very flavorful throughput and appeared a tad undercooked. And believe me I know wings. Took a bite of my other child's Windsor burger and it was probably the tastiest thing we ate. Overall a 3/5. Won't be returning as there's a great option right around the corner, St. Francis...

GwiutA7Rq0nWQJE9vSM6og.text: Really cozy, homemade food that really hits the spot. The atmosphere is great, very urban European. The staff is so friendly and organized. The brunch menu has amazing choices and you can't go wrong with the $5 drinks all day! Their mac and cheese and baby dutch potatoes are my favorite and were delicious af!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody mary with baby dutch potatoes, jalapeño cheddar corn bread, and mac and cheese.

i-UnEwWTSDbUMZ8Ze-mWMw.text: This is the place where you go when you really want to experience all the right stuff all at once: yummy food, good service, ambiance, toe-tapping music and friendly atmosphere.  You just can't get it wrong in this place.  How can you? There's a full bar, outdoor sitting and Churn next door.  My friends and I got a table at 5 PM and we did not leave until way past 8.  What does that tell ya? This is the place where you go! So, go already.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s the #28. Strong but potent.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Here&#39;s my fix!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bartender was real cool when he sneaked me my HH fix right before time was up.

bUioka43FddXOHETQH_p7w.text: I've never dined here and had a bad experience! From the laid back atmosphere to the friendly servers, it's easy to see why this place is a neighborhood go to. Incredible cocktails-- which you can enjoy for $5 during happy hour and delicious food (especially the burger and fried okra  ) our (frequent) server Ashley never fails to have a smile on her face, her energy is contagious! Keep up the great work Windsor

vzjXiY3VkLOr3OjKxPWwNA.text: After a night out at the ballet, my husband and I decided to stop in for a quick bite.  Windsor has a great vibe about it.  The outdoor patio looks like a great spot to break bread with a few friends.    I decided to order the porkwich after reading the reviews on yelp about it.  I can't remember the last time I ate a burger or sandwich that was so messy.  I felt like an eight year old child with food all over my face. I was a mess!  It was quite delicious though.  I am looking forward to going back with friends.

lvZj1i4btopvca-NrDqqtA.text: Love the outdoor area! The water heater is super loud, so sit closer to the building rather than towards the back. 5 dollar happy hour deal every day for a drink or a pitcher of beer! Great deal! The inside is not so much my style, more of a pub atmosphere, but the outside are is just lovely and so cool.

Quqbld11cJ2CS4t66rWGHA.text: They got angry because my wife did not like their roasted peppers.  It is a favorite of hers.  The distain we got during the rest of the meal ruined the experience.

iFK9h-kNYbL6j6kRy3L6CQ.text: Who knew all these Hipster places were in Phoenix these days. All the years I have lived downtown, they never had these kind of places. Now Downtown is crawling with them! Yeah!! This is a nice place, on a great day. We chose to eat inside as the sun was to be going down soon, and it was a bit cold for me. My daughter tired several cocktails , she said all were very tasty. Especially one with cucumber. Which I as well tasted and enjoyed. The food took a long time but, the staff is very attentive and check on you a lot. It is like a group event. Everyone checks on you, and they are all very pleasant. The nice thing is before 5o'clock all drinks were only $5.00 no wonder it was so busy there. I got the Lobster roll, it was good but, it has a lot of seasoning on it. Really not necessary, just let me taste the Lobster.  We also got cierviche for an appetizer. Very good, I would order that again. My two dining companions all liked their food as well. A Ruben , and a club type thing. You can change out the bread if you like, and they have Gluten free. I got sweet potato fries, good. The shoe string fries ,not so good. But, it is a great place and worth a visit.  Love the decor and the old look about it. Clean restrooms and the parking can be very tight.

sLaMEY7mcQAa1z47G8_qFA.text: The food was quite good.  We had a little issue with service due to a delay in the kitchen, but they quickly remedied the issue.  Really great people running this restaurant. Clear concern for good food and service! Brown bag chicken sandwich. Outstanding flavor. Wish the chicken were more shredded on the bun - instead of big chunks. Kale salad great layers of flavor and texture. Crab cake BLT sandwich had awesome flavor. Seared ahi salad good. Sweet potato fries really tasty.  We enjoyed this restaurant and will def come back.  A smidge on the pricey side, but great little place. Hipster urban setting.

QqAtetqv0kxQl5vt6tDdLw.text: We love coming here!!! It's great for breakfast if you get there early. Service gets a bit rough after 10:30. But their donut holes have orange zest in them and are amazing. But the gold medal flapjacks are one f my favorite breakfast items ever!! I'm a syrup girl and I never eat syrup with these. They are amazing plain but add the marscapone and strawberries and its perfection!! My husband loves the rest of the menu as well. They have an amazing Pimms Cup drink and my hubby loves the Bloody Mary bar. Watch out for the green Bloody Mary it's spicy!   They are very kid friendly which we really appreciate.  We recently went for lunch, their kids menu was really nice. I had the Windsor style burger. Very good! We are serious regulars here and love it!

4OlN1lpOo4XdIPra3mnV3Q.text: I had never come here because I don't love this type food in comparison to the restaurants across the street. My boyfriend dragged me in and I'm so glad he did. I got the veggie burger which I wasn't thrilled with until it arrived! This had pinto beans, rice, avocado, sweet potato!! I asked for the rye bun. Best veggie burger I ever had. The drink was also one of the best I ever had. Get the mint green tea drink!!!! Our waiter was Jacob and he was phenomenal. Also....the broccoli is fabulous 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese GET IT
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie burger on rye 10/10 add hummus

9cb63jO_aq1Ax2ZKniyMog.text: Amazing service! We had a little bit of a wait to get a table and Jared (the manager - I believe) had apps sent over once we were seated! We will be back!! Great food and amazing dessert next door :)

InEDgp0SSjc4ooH3cTW42w.text: Ok, let me start with I normally don't pick Windsor as my top pick. I just don't see the hype, however, I had a friend in town and saw it on Yelp and insisted coming. It was about the least favorite thing I wanted to do. But it was her vacation so there we went. My experiences in the past have been ok --- not great. Well it's 2pm  on a Tuesday. It's a decent crowd. Our server / bartender Manny was really friendly, but not annoying, which gripes me with some servers. Made suggestions and made amazing drinks. Checked in with us frequently ensuring we had everything we needed. Coming in today feeling I would already be unimpressed. The service Manny provided changed my mind. I may be a new fan. Tip: hit up the bar and ask for Manny.

hJVPry2eJZIce2vfBpibIw.text: They have some of the best burgers I've ever had. The portion is very generous and the beers are of good selection. The lighting is dim and very comfortable. They also have out of the work nachos!

XIDamt4JsY7tO7H1OiWASw.text: I'm surprised I haven't reviewed Windsor yet! I love this neat little gastropub in Phoenix. They serve delicious food, whether you're craving comfort food or you're a health nut, there is something on the menu for you. I think they're house burger with garlic aioli is awesome and I like that most items come with a side dish.. and we're talking not your typical sides like fries. Think mac and cheese, fried okra, fried pickles, lentil soup etc. Even their side salads are memorable! On a recent visit we had the the ceviche, lobster roll (available weekends only) and ordered a side of Mac and cheese. The seafood was surprisingly fresh ( you never know, we do live in a desert!) and the proportions were good. The Lobster roll was more of a seafood roll as it had crab ad shrimp in it. It was cold creamy and tasty but sadly the lobster itself was a little dry. Probably won't order it again. They charged us for the Mac and never brought it out but once we told them about it, not only did they take it off the bill but they packed some extra mac and cheese to go for us. Amazing service! You walk in to the restaurant and expect them to be a little pretentious lol but the servers are generally pretty friendly even if they always aren't the most attentive. Also, they are located right next to Churn... super tempting which is probably they don't have much of a dessert menu haha. Overall a great place with great food for locals or to impress out of town guests. I've done both!   Oh also, we are loving the new parking lot, no more residential street parking!

OCBn56WUmW7zmVzGjMrd5g.text: One of my favorite lunch spots. The loaded chips are wonderful!!  I would highly recommend Windsor for a great spot to eat

gepSdocMLvXBawtm1GUUFg.text: Never thought I'd downgrade my rating to such a low point for this restaurant. But, among other difficulties, their soup tasted like what I made as a college freshman my first time making something from hot water vegetables and a chicken leg - and then added a grotesque volume of pepper because it didn't taste like anything - that is what I overpaid for here. Fried okra tasted like something I used to get from a grocery store frozen foods bin and microwave until it was crispy, the ranch dressing tasted like some bottled slop I used to get in the '80s, the burger bun was white gluten glop and the burger boring.  We got a card with our check asking for our contact info so we can get bombarded with 'social media'.Instead of giving up all our contact info, we simply wrote "see our yelp reveiw".   What saved this from a 1-star was the wait staff - friendly attentive and on-time.

gbmlwHWQ4ACcEzSQQqq35Q.text: Great atmosphere compared to the boring St. Francis restaurant. Bartenders were friendly and attentive.

z7xmtzkT8qM2Np_3TTyTlg.text: The atmosphere and music is was great.  They have a nice patio, weather was great, so we sat outside.  There service is on top of things.  The food was ok; We started with the fondue; bread, apples and sausage.  It was good.   I got the lobster roll for entrees.  It was pretty good too.  They have a good beer selection, I tried a couple of their signature cocktails, I was not that impressed.  Overall atmosphere, food, and service was pretty good.  I would return.

78w0N5mGYh6Wpe4fRRfo-w.text: I tried the hotdog, and my date tried the crabcake BLT...YUM! Be sure to make a reservation...the wait can get crazy. Also, try the homemade ice cream next door!  Oh yeah...the cassette wall is the coolest thing I've seen in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Cassette wall

WaLRjRdPB6Qh55hc31yYFQ.text: Food was exceptional.  Beer selection was extraordinary.  Our server, Hills, was top notch with her knowledge of food and drink selection.  All quality.  Hills was hands down one of the most amazing servers I have ever met.  I will go back every time I am in Phoenix, no questions asked.

lApc-V6uXysOnHCC1o-2Dg.text: I have visited Windsor twice now and I would describe it as fun, trendy, and a little hipster. The drinks are great, good combinations with fresh, unexpected ingredients. I love the 80's soundtrack, my only complaint is that it was a bit too loud at night, so you had to scream to talk. The food is very good, kind of a modern take on comfort food. The brown bag chicken sandwich had a lot of flavor and the mac and cheese is done really well, just the amount of flavor and creaminess. The crab cake BLT was very good as well, the cakes were mostly crab, very fresh tasting.

2AGZX0vTXhIdRa3ZeuZZWA.text: If you're a fan of Postino, you have to make your way to Windsor pronto.  The central Phoenix restaurant and bar is owned by Postino owner Craig DeMarco (and it's right across the street from the central Phoenix Postino), and the atmosphere and vibe are similar to Postino's. Windsor also has an open dining room that extends to the patio, the lighting is also dim, and the servers are also hip.  There was a 30-minute wait for my party of two on a recent Friday night, and we sat in the indoor dining area, which overlooked the bar, which was bustling full of people and had standing room only. The restaurant is located in an historic brick building, and it has a cool wall covered completely in cassette tapes that makes it feel even hipper.  For food, my pal and I started with the Cheddar Fondue ($11) off the mostly-American menu, which comes with pretzels, apples, pork, bread and sausage. The pretzels were soft and chewy, and the portion was huge. I would have preferred just the pretzels, though the apples and cheese were an interesting combination. Definitely try that appetizer if you go-it was super-tasty.  For my meal, I got the Veggie Stack ($9), which was a pita topped with bean spread, quinoa, tomato, cucumber, avocado, radish,  corn and green goddess (I left the pickled beets off). I thought the toppings were interesting both taste- and texture-wise, and that part of the meal seemed relatively healthy. I paired it with some macaroni and cheese, which I enjoyed, though my pal and I weren't wowed. Maybe it's because the cheese wasn't plentiful or creamy enough, but it was still good. My pal had the Porkwich sandwich ($12). He said he liked it a lot.

gFSDLEo07DTOWoelfXzQ-Q.text: Are we all talking about the same Windsor's here? Next to Churn? Where the staff is indifferent with their attitude. Hint....listen to some Zig Zigler tapes it might help your service abilities. These lady servers with their ripped jeans and tattoos and no smiles just ruin it for me. This isn't the first time either. This place just seems like where you start to earn your bones and the right to work across the street at Joyride or Federal pizza where servers look presentable and are friendly.  The food is ok but overpriced. I get stressed anytime I am there because I know someone will drop the ball in regards to service or food will have an issue. However, when the check arrives then it's all "hey have a fantastic day" so that she will get a good tip. Right the great thing about Windsor is it's a great place for me to get rid of my spare change for the service they provide. Remember folks the tattoos don't make you stand out or be original, they make you like every other person who looks homeless on Van Buren st.   Get a grip and when you fix it maybe I will reconsider. Ohh and don't dress like your unemployed, have some class servers.  Finally, teach your cook how to make eggs the right way. I would be glad to teach his staff.

q8TYMJ2XVwEVLeHALBEcTA.text: I've been here multiple times, and overall really love it. The food here has almost always been really excellent, and I'll admit, I'm shallow. So I fall for the hip decor and the fact that the waiters are cool and cute and the waitresses have tats and a wardrobe to die for. It's great both inside and outside, and their outdoor patio IS dog friendly!  Their Windsor style Backyard Burger is really great. It's enormous, and juicy and about ready to fall apart when you bite into it. I've also had their brunch items. My Easy Rider fritatta took some warming up to, but in the end I fell for the combination of summer tomatoes and tart goat cheese. My husband had the Matador, and it is incredible. I don't normally go for that combination of flavors, but just wonderful. Hands down so much better than what I got, though that too was good. Also, if it doesn't come with your brunch, splurge on the bacon side. INCREDIBLE. There's something that Tenderbelly does to their bacon, but it was smokey and sweet and just whoa.   We've had their cheddar fondue and their devilled egg dip for appetizers, and both are great. The fondue was smooth and silky, and the egg dip had tons of bacon and gorgonzola. The chips are fried in house, so if you like thick, crispy, kettle style chips they're going to be a home run. As for sides, their roasted vegetables are great. Crisp still, but charred. A touch greasy though.   For drinks I've had their No. 17, which is good, but my hands down favorite is a brunch only thing. Their $5 Pitcha of Pimms. $5. That's right, a PITCHA. Omg. My husband and I both liked their tradtional blood mary, but I loved loved loved how tart, and refreshing the Pimms was. And that it was in a pitcher.   They also have a neat service style, where their wait staff 1) wear their own clothes and 2) they don't split their floor into areas for a particular server. This is very good, because it means that anybody who walks by your table is available to help you. They're all actually very good about making sure you're taken care of. It does get confusing making out who is who, but the few times I've been there I more or less see the same faces, so it's easy to see who's who after awhile.   The only downsides are that its small and popular, plus it has a teensy weensy parking lot. They're a lot like La Grande, they have free valet, but still. You should tip them, so it's not 'free'. It gets crowded as well, and quite noisy inside. Plus their menu is a wee bit limited. I'd like to see things get changed up a bit, as I'm running out of new things to eat going there. Doesn't change the fact that it's all great though!

URLFMECRTVwxKUDlnr9URQ.text: This rating is based on the efforts of the manager to make things right.  Although I did not ask for our meal to be comped, the manager stated that's what he would do and he got it done.  I'm thinking it must have just been on off night and I will make an effort to return or try another restaurant in the group.

mQtTf5_LcqG0fJwd1c-hlQ.text: Favorite new bar in town.  $5 pitchers of beer and cocktails for happy hour? Great prices the rest of the time? Yeah, I'm sold.  Amazing food, better than you should be able to find at a local, laid back place at prices like this. If its your first time, order one or all of these:  Russian Roulettes - sometimes mild, sometimes spicy roasted peppers. Deviled egg dip - deviled egg, bacon and home made kettle chips. Yes. Porkwich - do you need a description? PORKWICH. Bacon, ham, pulled pork, gold bbq sauce! Bring your cardiologist.  For sides, the Kale salad is insanely good, and their mac 'n cheese is enough to sate this m&c snob!

cJ-aES0kKh6UnKBfpl7K-g.text: Nothing seemed to go right here.  The valet parking was a total disaster.  When we were seated we walked all of the restaurant with the hostess not knowing where to seat us.  Sat for a while before a server ever came over, but I have a feeling that stemmed back to the seating issue.  Food was OK, but nothing to pull up the score.

fBacbn93k_yzsWubWdzmQw.text: Tried the pancakes. Very good. Bacon was way too burnt and cold. We will go back again and skip the bacon.

rakSI5wOcr_g-WT3zPyhdg.text: Great live, cool place. Whole grain salad is excellent as well as the frittatas and entres. Interesting people all around with nice energy and friendliness.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

J6p4zMCKmgRkZDOe9bppZA.text: After coming here a few times, the food is good, especially the Church's potatoes and Mac and cheese.  However, the drinks are in tiny glasses, weak, and expensive ($10 drinks are fine as long as they are buzz worthy after 1.  To their credit, they do have happy hour where the drinks are $5 (should be $5 or $6 regular price)

uX_QuR0obMNMICE42qdZQA.text: Backyard burger, Windsor style.... Hands down, best burger I've had. And I'm not normally particularly fond of burgers. Church's potatoes are yummy, as well as the seasonal veggies. The fish sandwich was a tad spicy for me but it still had great flavor.   Definitely try and get there before 5 because the cocktails drop from like $9-$10 a piece to just $5. They've got some great combos! Pitchers of beer/glasses of wine are also $5 before 5.  After your meal head next door to Churn (owned by the same people) and get some delicious treats, ranging from ice cream, to fresh baked cookies.

1nq9hoing-KABck37pR2hw.text: Reminded me of a smaller version of the Vig - Brilliant food, service and vibe. The deviled egg salad dip was different, and we both loved the skewers. I suggest you get over here real soon. Check out the cassette lined walls near the restroom (I think some of those are mine).

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

swnSRxXjP1Nek-jwsx4sfg.text: The first few times I went to Windsor, I didn't love it. There was nothing wrong, it was just... I think this place is a guy hangout. It feels masculine. Not in a sports bar kind of way, but more like a place two friends that are guys regularly go to have a beer that don't want to drink bud light at a dive.   Over time, the $5 pitchers of beer before 5pm have won me over.   In addition to the great happy hour, they make some pretty spectacular drinks. The Number 17 is so refreshing. Manny is a fabulous bartender. They also have a few vegan food options - a sandwich and a mixed grain salad in addition to some sides. All have been fresh and tasty.   I love that during nice weather they can open the place up, and the patio is great. The bathrooms are pretty cool as well.   The parking is the real drawback. You either have to valet, which fortunately is complimentary, or try to find a spot on the residential streets that won't end up getting you towed..  Overall I give Windsor a 3.5-4.0 stars.

irawDsArrS7LzTMEo631Uw.text: What is the meaning of life?   Windsor.  With its sophisticated comfort food (gourmet mac & cheese, delectable chicken salad, and of course the infamous porkwich), amazing atmosphere, thoughtful decor, okay and the booze too, Windsor is where the Earth ends and the great infinite beyond begins.  It is where mere mortals can fuel up with the bread and wine of the Gods and experience greatness, if only for happy hour.  This place doesn't take itself too seriously.  The waitstaff have been carefully tested and selected to be the chillest, most zen people on this side of the great infinite beyond.  Nothing is a big deal.  You're gonna eat, you're gonna drink, you're gonna be merry.  No one is too cool or not cool enough, yet the place is ripped from the pages of the Awesomeness Times.    One of my most favorite details about Windsor? Tucked away with the packets of sugar and Splenda you'll find cute little papers printed with an invitation to dispose of your gum in it.  There's really nothing they haven't thought of, to include having purse stands at the ready so you don't have to sit in front of your bag or drape it over the chair arm.  Details.    The answer to any question is always Windsor.  Try it.

tZt2_D_3Od8H4hTQD9EaRg.text: Just went here for breakfast. The food was good (had The Simple Life).  The bacon was thick and high quality as was the huge English muffin. I would speculate that the muffins are homemade or bought local perhaps?  The environment of the place was cool and thy had great music playing.  The patio was nice and comfy (minus the plethora of flies but I attribute that to the very recent rain we had this morning).   I would say my only "complaint" is the service. It wasn't bad but our server just sort of acted like she didn't care, in general (maybe she was having an off day or maybe donor was rude to her earlier...never know). However, she wouldn't look me in the eyes (or even at my face) when she'd ask a question or I'd request something or answer her questions. She'd do drive-by questions where they ask you something as they walk by and don't really stop or even slow down to listen to your answer. I also didn't get a full cup of coffee and didn't get asked if I wanted a refill.  My attempts to stop her to ask for more failed as well since she didn't look in our direction as she was near us. All minor things of course but just something that would have helped get a 5 out of 5 rating from me.   I'd definitely go again and would recommend going for a laid back upscale unpretentious breakfast. Just be prepared to wait for that second cup of coffee.

qcpe0W4a5xn_zCma1g-ufA.text: Food is good, service is a little hit and miss, depending on the time of day.  We enjoyed our food but it wasn't *amazing*.  Drinks are very good and the people watching is top-notch.

_Cux8Lm0O0wpygpWj4B4iw.text: Cool place to try craft cocktails.  I tried 3 of them, but I don't remember which ones.  Far from my favorite drinks ever, but they all had a unique taste and were all very strong.  I enjoy trying new drinks and I never expect to like every drink, so I'm okay with this.  However, everyone else at the table liked all their drinks. They're a reasonable price ($5) if you go before 5 o'clock.  I went for a late breakfast (served until 1pm) and had the chef's special omelette which was excellent!  It was made with mushrooms, feta, spinach, and turkey this time, but it sounds like it changes daily.

gKH5hlbdNIYiwwZt59S44w.text: Parking sucked, but I parked across the street.  I know we here in AZ are spoiled.  We park right by the place we go.  lol!  Finally got to try Windsor, about time!  The staff was super friendly.  I got the: 1.  Cheddar Fondue:  Warm MJ pretzel, apple slices & sausage - Eat this when the cheddar is melty.  It is a very tasty appetizer.   2.  Buttermilk Fried Chicken:  The king of fried chicken & your favorite side - This is the on the block special for Monday and Tuesday's only.  Chicken was very good, crispy, moist on the inside, and good coat on the chicken.  The mac and cheese side was pretty good.    Too full, could not handle dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Monday Tuesday special buttermilk fried chicken
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheddar fondue

E4waCpVDArtdfGkHEdCA0Q.text: Just ok. Food sounded better on the menu than it was. My husband ordered the bahn mi white fish sandwich. Wasn't white fish, was salmon which was too strong for the sandwich. The loaded chips were ok as a starter. I had the chopped salad which was ok. I can see why people come though, 5 dollar pitchers, cocktails, and glasses of wine until 5 pm. It had a great vibe but the food fell short. Service was friendly however. I would return for drinks.

j92hHgYHPaxSRh2__6oIXg.text: I'm visiting and my friends took me to Windsor for brunch and OMG, everything was absolutely delicious!!!!! AND FIVE dollar pitchers of beer?!!!! What?!!! Amazing.   Shoutout to the server with short blonde hair & super blue eyes - what a gem. Great personality and so helpful.   Cute & clean environment, nice staff, super yum food at a very reasonable price..overall great experience and will definitely come back during my next visit.

7zPLJvMuS3nzk80FJMu4Pg.text: I enjoyed my meal at the Windsor. I went with the short ribs everyone on Yelp raved about and they were pretty good. Not quite as tender in the middle, but very flavorful. The grits were pretty tasty and the asparagus well cooked. Although I was a little disappointed to get only three spears.  Price is the reason I knocked off a few stars. I live in NYC and the Windsor's prices aligned with what I would pay there at a cute restaurant in a nice neighborhood. Located in a strip mall in Phoenix, I didn't see a reason for their prices being so high.

OTKhZbqhjgFzr2LhfAZFNg.text: Excellent atmosphere. Waitress was awesome. Need to return to see what the night life looks like.  And very dog-friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DkT1UcViDkPyjeZ2-G-JhQ.text: It was wonderful! Thanks, Amanda!  The hostess and our server were great catches for you, as far as being very friendly and professional.

82GNwODFR_r_7yLuq7mODg.text: This is the most chill new American restaurant I've ever been to. Menu is not extensive but definitely has something for everyone and there has not been anything I've ordered that I did not enjoy. The windsor and bacon burgers and mac n cheese are especially awesome. Great beer and cocktail selection. Dinner times can be very popular so be prepared for a worth while wait. I love taking new people to this hidden gem of Phoenix.

3Snn_otvdo_N8SzW2yhHVw.text: This is honestly one of my new favorite restaurants. I order sandwiches from here like everyday now. I like the fish sandwich and I just started ordering the grilled chicken sandwich. Very high quality and tastes very good. The macaroni and white cheese is also very good. I've been ordering sandwiches from here, everyday for lunch, for the past week or so. Very good place. Stopped in once to pick up my order and ended up at the bar with a big ass pitcher of beer for $5 during happy hour. This place is ok with me. Thanks

NS7qziE6Rs-w-CcUclaIVg.text: From Detroit and flew into Phoenix before driving up to Sedona. Needed a quick bite and came across this place. Good food. Well-crafted drinks. Nice staff and trendy patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4xpDjJ5_L8agFC9GClD0cg.text: I figured it was about time to write a review of Windsor.  I love a lot of things about this awesome restaurant.  Windsor is probably my favorite of all the Upward Projects concepts.  The reason being, the atmosphere.  I absolutely love the dog friendly patio, what a great place to enjoy the AZ weather, along side a tasty beverage and some delicious food.    HAPPY HOUR EVERYDAY till 5pm that's really nice!  WEEKEND BRUNCH, that's also really nice.  Like $5 PITCHERS of Pimm's Cup nice!! That's right I said a pitcher haha!  All the food I've tried has been great.  The cocktails are amazing also.  The bottom line, I love this place because of the atmosphere.  I usually come during Brunch or Happy Hour, I suggest doing the same with good company.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kabobs were yummy, just wish it came with a lot more veggies
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 22 , well mixed

o-g6VmoYzr3rnmR018nIBw.text: Had dinner here tonight and everyone liked their food. Hubby had the Picnic Kabobs ("Healthy option"); sonny had the Windsor Burger ("Well-seasoned"); and I had the Pastrami Reuben with fired okra on the side (very tasty). Churn (an ice cream/candy shop) is right next door, so we headed over there for dessert afterward. I ate too much. Again.  Four-star rating because it's too dark and the music is too loud. I'm all for atmosphere and all that, but if you can't hear or see...  Also, parking is a little tight (but then, we were in a big truck).  Overall, good experience. Service was good; everyone was friendly (even on the phone).

aa8J2UogYQi5drcVQRd8XA.text: What a awesome little place great drink specials and a different menu than a lot of places I had their Reuben sandwich probably one of the best I've ever had I like how they Shred the corned beef made it so wasn't so tough sad at the bar bartender was awesome manager came around introduce himself make sure everything was good customer service top notch can't wait to go back to try some other food

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna salad
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ruben

COKyrnAiUV2N8A0czmudYg.text: I've been here with a friend, a date, and tonight I went by myself after work for a nice nightcap. Just like every time I've been before, the service was fantastic. Friendliest bartenders, all the girls asked how my night was going. I always like to ask for them to make a custom drink and they always deliver. I came in around 7:30ish tonight and it was pretty busy,- so if you are planning on coming in by yourself for a drink, or perhaps have a more intimate atmosphere with someone, I would recommend around 8pm once the dinner crowd starts to leave. I have yet to have an actual entree here, but I've enjoyed every drink I've had here, which is most, and any of the appetizers will hit the spot. I definitely see myself becoming a regular here and fully recommend either trying a cocktail from the menu or trusting one of the amazing bartenders at The Windsor.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XvMaQ8q_3pgVTKUXWcvQZQ.text: I came here before the Cardinals football game. My friend suggested it and I'm always game to try another place. I'm walking in the front of the restaurant and I'm totally confused. There's two doors in the front but it's by tables. No hostess stand so I don't go in and follow this couple behind me. They lead me to the back and there's the door. Even an outdoor patio. Very cool.   So I get an indoor table and the vibe in this place is very cool. Very hip. Seems very relaxed. People just enjoying their meals and talking. Not in a rush.   Anyways, I started off with a cappuccino with almond milk. First time with almond milk for me but it was actually really good. It doesn't look at pretty with the other milk but it really hit the spot.   So the menu is really interesting. I wanted to try everything. Seemed very different. So I decided to order breakfast cause all the other tables had breakfast. Must be good. So I ordered the Highroad sandwich with a side of cheddar potatoes. The sandwich had scrambled eggs, thick slices of bacon, tomatoes on some really fresh bread. I wasn't expecting a lot but wow did it work. Really tasty with that fresh chewy bread. It really worked for me. Loved it. Nice big portions. The cheddar potatoes were also outstanding. Really good.   My friend ordered the backyard Windsor burger and he said that it was really good. Enjoyed it.   Service was really good. I can't say they are slow but it seems like they don't rush anyone. Lots of people like to just sit, eat, and talk. Just a very casual and hip environment. Loved it. Not trying to rush you in and out but just cool. They also filled our water glasses frequently and brought refilled soda for my friend without even asking him. They really watch you and take good care of you.   I loved the ambiance, food and service. Really enjoyed it and can't wait to come back to try more menu items. Just don't come when your in a rush. You'll be disappointed. I for sure will be back. Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cappuccino with almond milk
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Highroad Breakfast Sandwich

7ZU9OnJd7Gq75PeMoqObrQ.text: This was a gem. The service was excellent and the brunch was scrumptious. I loved the beignets and the chef's special. Definitely going back.

Mtga0HcVd7MmnuWhwzwd0g.text: Love this place for the great, casual environment and for the nachos. All the other food is really good and the prices are reasonable. Service is fine, nothing spectacular, but also not bad.  I wish this place was closer to me so I could go more often.

JIYqG7rn4uq0N5PhXzWk9A.text: Yummy, yummy, yummy to EVERYTHING I've tried at this restaurant! Upward Projects is amazing with how creatively they put their menus together. This restaurant is one of my top 5 favorite restaurants. You won't be disappointed, no matter what you order.

jloSv2B65m_1sm_Fz3TNWg.text: I would give more stars if it was an option! Spent our anniversary weekend at places with awful service, just wanting one single person to give us decent service. Little did we know what we were getting into with our final stop at the Windsor. The staff went above and beyond to give some of the friendliest, but still unobtrusive service I have ever seen. Anthony made sure all our food and drinks were tasting great and gave us space to relax but somehow was always there exactly when we needed something. The drinks are delicious and the staff is extremely knowledgeable in the flavor profiles of everything so you can be confident they'll steer you in the right direction no matter what you're looking for. We will be back, with the utmost confidence that no matter who is on staff, both the service and staff will be only of the highest quality.

Uv2qJLhBrSPlimptsi2uJA.text: I had the best time at Windsor! A friend recommended this place for my trip to Phoenix. We had a reservation for 8 people for a bachelorette brunch. The staff was very accommodating since I'm sure we were loud and obnoxious.   We stayed for about 2-3 hours enjoying several of  their $5 craft cocktails! You must get the beignets! We got 2 orders for the table. They come with 10 and then two sauces. I ordered cheddar biscuits and gravy with sausage and scrambled eggs, instead of fried. I enjoyed my meal, the drinks, the laid back vibe, and the great staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheddar biscuits and gravy, sausage, and scrambled eggs.

lv9Now5qixliZWprmz2Rpg.text: The Windsor never disappoints. Russian roulettes are always a good appetizer to start with. Today I enjoyed half soup n salad - delicious mushroom soup with a vegetable chop salad. Shared mac n cheese and fried okra.  Fantastic!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried okra
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZWzxs1BEe21GboAj4K2XxA.text: This is a delayed review from mid-December 2013.   I came here with 3 colleagues and a companion. My companion needed to wrap up his own work so he was late in meeting up with us. Colleagues and I ordered appetizers, drinks, and entrees while waiting for him. We had ceviche, deviled egg dip and chips, and corn dog poppers.   I don't know if you heard the one woman demolition derby was in town, but I obliterated the deviled egg dip. I don't even like bacon or gorgonzola. The savoriness and tanginess of all mixed together hit the spot and all spots, for that matter.   A large party having a holiday exchange arrived after us and were seated in an area behind us. Let's say this was a 15 person party. As I was seated facing the kitchen I watched tray after tray after tray being delivered to them although they arrived after us. Chalking it up to our incomplete party or perhaps a prix fixe menu, I was hardly concerned.   Finally, our entrees arrived probably a good hour or so after initial orders. My special man friend arrived about 5 minutes after our entrees did. He placed his order and received his meal in under 15 minutes.   We were having a grand old time but imagine our surprise when the waiter informed us our ENTIRE party of 5 had our ENTIRE bill COMPED due to the delay. For the record, we did not complain or show any consternation.   Great proactivity in anticipating customer needs and flawless service! Amy's Baking Company, you taking notes?   If I lived in Phoenix I would make this a weekly spot. Oh. Good music too. Notorious BIG and MGMT. I love it when you call me Big Poppa . . . and give me that electric feel.

dG1mfEapGWnHRBbTZcOXig.text: Came here on a Thursday night for dinner. It wasn't extremely busy and we were seated right away for a party of six. I ordered the Veggie Burger with a side of their Kale salad. The burger was extremely flavorful and the kale salad was tossed very well. I also tried their cheese fondue appetizer, which was delicious! They also have a cassette wall by the patio area, which was cute, nostalgic, and a great spot for photos. I recommend this place if you're looking for a relaxing place for dinner and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YqB8rfgFjJ44xOB9Ly7OUQ.text: Cool, sexy vibe in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere?  Yep! Friendly attentive waitstaff?  Yes sir! Out of this world Bahn Mi Whitefish Sandwich?  Oh god yes! Delectably delicious Kale Caesar Salad with chicken?  I mean, really, can I just get an Amen!? No. 17 cocktail?  Yes Yes Yes!  What's not to love about Windsor?  Nothing.  Ok, maybe the fact that you have to valet park your vehicle... but I'm actually starting to warm up to that.  By the way, I literally tried to take a picture of our food and drink before eating/drinking it, but it was physically impossible!  Just way too good and I had to scarf it down.    So so very good.  Bookmark this place if you haven't... and then just go!

8FJnI3EdGvb4XaRyY6gg_g.text: Ooooo.....try the Windsor Burger and homemade chips!!   Fantastic!     Windsor is pricy and trendy but all types of people go there.   It's a great place to meet for a quick drink or a full meal.    It is one of the fallback places when we're undecided.   Delist!!

qIdGcXut5ikJ9Azn4v57xg.text: My first time at Windsor but we love Upward Projects and we've been to the other spots except this one. So we knew it would be good.  And it was.  Showed up on a Friday at 7pm and for a table for 3 right away. Service was fast and our server was very knowledgable about their beers and that helped me try some new ones I have never had before.   We split the fondue that came with apple slices, soft pretzels slices and sausage slices. It was good however the sausage was more like salami. It was still meat but I was expecting nicely sliced grilled sausage links.   I got the porkwich for the main dish and it was amazing. Three different cuts of pork with an amazing sauce and cole slaw to go with it. I appreciated the fact that the server brought out my next beer with my main dish. The timing was a nice touch.   The other 2 in our party enjoyed their meals except for the fact that they asked for their burgers to be served on a bed of greens since they didn't do lettuce wraps and they were served as normal on buns. They are both gluten free by choice so they didn't fight it.   Good food. Good ambiance. Good ice cream next door at Churn for dessert.

SoWI726Y6HMwGmvDyvk-IA.text: Went here w a friend for lunch. I had the Porkwhich sandwhich which was good.. not great.   Great service though!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Porkwich sandwhich

s858Qbkjp7pkDEpoRcMHvQ.text: Came to this place because of the raving yelp reviews and they did not disappoint, we were on our way from the PHX airport to Sedona and stopped in for lunch before hitting the road. Their beer choices are awesome and reasonable, their food is out of this world yummy! We were a table of six and the waitress was perfectly attentive. We loved this place so much we came back for lunch again on our way back to the airport.  Veggie burger is a big recommend, as well as any of their salads!

1t-JGO8u6hX5nV0Q96iMgg.text: Winsor is such a cozy place to have dinner with friends, or just date night. Great beer and great staff they have here. I had the mac and cheese and the hummus, it was delicious, ohhh. And the veggie stack was amazing. :) That's dinner, Then go next door to churn :) yummm dessert!  I shall return

JFUstOhX7ydf1dl9DAGgyQ.text: We ate it on the patio and despite the crowd it was very pleasant. The service was prompt and attentive. We had the cheddar fondue which was ok, I probably wouldn't order it again because the flavors weren't fantastic. We also ordered the Windsor burger with fries and that was decent. Not the best burger in town and not the worst. The winter grains salad on the other hand was absolutely fantastic! It was full of delicious goodies and had the perfect amount of dressing. The rest of the menu looked enticing as well. Overall it was a good experience.

mkDe77EF_OC07ycl0dgBlA.text: Good friends introduced us to this cozy neighborhood restaurant. Great indoor and outdoor seating options. The restaurant features a full bar, and has a wide variety of bar food selections. I enjoyed the pulled pork sandwich and house made chips. It was delicious. My wife had the Ahi tuna salad, and enjoyed it as well. We will definitely plan to return when we are in the neighborhood.

aRiTHqA9ncWpVEO0D2icuQ.text: Went here after hiking one Sunday.  There was only a 5 minute wait to sit on the patio since we had our pup with us.  Great hearty salad and the bf  really enjoyed his burger.

P0d9mCdFIcIL4yzPjhlywg.text: This is my second time being here. I ordered the grill chicken sandwich with a side of mac n cheese. I highly recommend it. Good atmosphere and Churn is right next door for dessert. The food is always good when you don't have to pay for it, right?!   Good drink specials and a 5 before 5 drink menu.

QA4oCbMzCzwArSaPwfO8AQ.text: We've been to Windsor many times and have always enjoyed the food (including a great kids menu), service, and atmosphere. But the reason I'm finally writing my review is to give them a big thanks for our service last night: we took our kids there for dinner after our daughter's piano recital, and she was very excited to tell the wait staff about her performance. They were suitably impressed and enthusiastic, which would have been enough, but then they brought our two kids complementary ice cream sundaes for a job well done at the recital, and the kids just lit up. It really made our night, so thank you, Windsor, for going above and beyond.

BearUlvTEcJMchjns2iAhg.text: What a fantabulous experience enhanced my the service, especially Mattie (one of the bartenders).  I arrived and sat at the bar since I was solo. I am always hesitant especially when I'm not drinking, but Mattie was so personable that anxiety went away.  I told him it was my first time and that I had seen a few items on the menu.   I told him what I was thinking and then he told me some of his favorites. So we settled on a hybrid of opinions. I had the Kale Caesar, the Grilled Chicken Sandwich with a side of the Jo Church's Potatoes. The croutons on the salad were heavenly and the grilled sandwich was fantastic. I am not quite sure how they pulled all of the pieces together (mangoes, jalapeno mayo, tomatoes, onions) but they did. One thing to note was that on a hoagie.. this sandwich was MESSY, but I licked my fingers. As for the potatoes.. I wouldn't order them again.. They are like really decadent cheesy hashbrowns. Too rich for my liking and I *heart* cheese.  A nice touch was that the manager maybe gave me a coupon for a free scoop of ice cream at their sister restaurant. I was like wow! That's pretty cool.  Now let's discuss parking. can you say the PITS. I parked in the neighborhood behind the restaurant, but be sure to read the signs.. No one has time for tickets or tows.  I will totally recommend it to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken with the potatoes

cDA-6oRM_shHLMdMYHX4pQ.text: Often, at least once a week, I'm here having a Pastrami Reuben and an IPA.  Sometimes I'll switch it up and have the Fatoosh Salad w/ Chicken and a side of Fried Okra.  Where else in Phoenix can you find Okra?    I prefer dining on the outside patio to being inside, that's just me.  There've been a number of friends that have visited from Pittsburgh or Denver, this is the spot that I bring each of them.  The Windsor is known for it's local vibe that embraces you the moment that you enter.  Don't let the pub and tavern feel throw you, there is great food here and some fine hand-crafted cocktails as well.  There's also complimentary valet by Desert Parking, hand the guy / girl $2 or $3 dollars, it's worth it.    Windsor Square has strict parking enforcement due to the increased traffic from Upwards Projects restaurants ( Joyride Tacos Central, Federal Pizza, Postino Central, Churn and Windsor.)  I might even go as far as to say that they are re-creating the North-Central business community, in a good way.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jesus began his Easter Sunday with Lamb &amp; a Bloody Mary at Richardson&#39;s.  He was wise enough to end his day at The Windsor.

c3xa9l2n6gsbNV3g76-Z_w.text: I love their patio and bar.  During cooler weather, the doors behind the bar will stay open so you get a bit of fresh air.  Another great place to people watch.  Love the happy hour drink specials before 5pm.  For when you want to play hooky and day drink.  I've had the bacon cheeseburger and ribs.  Yum.  Green chile soup is also delish.  Not something I would order (my friend did) and we all enjoyed it.  Make sure you sign up for the eposse for special deals.

00AYs3e8wOEP4zyHr-Z9TQ.text: Very good food.   They seem to have something for everyone.   They also have some interesting drinks, not just your common cocktails.   The decor is awesome, and the wall of cassette tapes is cool.   Do not forget to visit the ice cream parlor right next door (connected)  It is a little odd, the front door is in the back, and there is not really a hostess, you just kind of walk right into the commotion. They are generally super friendly and someone will greet you, and then someone will seat you.

5FYupujeSiGI-hafiKxh2A.text: We had the Windsor burger and the veggie stack- both were incredible! This might be my new favorite place

LP-u1nYKnc-xuf3TMX1C0w.text: I love locally owned businesses. If I didn't know better, I would swear I was back in Chicago. The atmosphere is casual, warm and inviting. The service is superior and the menu is varied, Pastrami sandwich which is unreal, Hamburgs that are cooked to perfection and homemade potato chips which will make you crave more. Prices are moderate and the only thing i can recommend is get there by 5:30 or you will have quite a wait. There is a patio out back but it was raining tonight so we sat inside.

gVs1bEifE-9OQxo8LBkC3Q.text: Such a fun place to enjoy with friends and family for a casual meal.  The service is amazing, the quality of food and drinks is perfect, and I always leave looking forward to my next visit.  I'm a big fan of their brunch menu on the weekend and love that they open at 9AM so I can beat the crowds!    If you want a delicious meal and a fun time, you need to head to The Windsor!

TmbVTxf_kGgRcCAY07FSQA.text: Not super cheap and the appetizer menu blows but the atmosphere is awesome. I haven't sat outside but it looks like there is a nice outdoor seating area. I noticed a large bike rack and I hear that its popular with bikers in the evening. The service was good so I would recommend it.

u5eUBvVmDVBIjkbyyGOVtA.text: This place is a home run!!!   The food is awesome and seems pretty healthy, with lots of fun choices.  The staff is unbelievably friendly and cool.  The prices are totally fair, especially for kids.   A really fantastic addition to the North Central neighborhood

J0eJ8jUHmi-r3maAzxyIXA.text: Great place! I felt so relaxed and at home. The blood orange margarita was delicious. The ceviche was ok and the kabon plate was so so. Porkwich sandwich and mac n' cheese were to die for!! We loved the non pretentious,  relaxed vibe of this restaurant. Sit outside, the patio is perfect and well equipped for hot or cold weather. The service was perfect and non invasive nor pushy, very cool and competent staff.. Definitely my new go to for dinner and drinks. Great job Windsor!!

H1wYb3OKWYanCfaBpkHtug.text: Judging from one lunch experience, I have to give this place 5 stars. First off, it definitely had a "Postino" vibe...from the outside patio dining to the uni-sex bathrooms with stocked, stamped toilet paper.  The hosts were friendly when I entered the restaurant. That was a good start. Nothing worse than a snotty host who ignores you until you ask for service.  Our server was really sweet and attentive. He won me over right from the start when he complimented my sleeping baby. He was a tall, thin guy with some tattoos, most notably one on his neck that looked like bones. He was very patient and had a sense of humor...something you need to have when waiting on a 10-top of ladies at lunch.  The menu looked incredibly appetizing. A variety of bar snacks, apps, salads and sandwiches and unique sides like fried okra and chilled bean salad. I was going to have the country veggie chopped salad, but then I spied the Porkwich Sandwich and had to have it. This is what was on it: Pulled pork, Tenderbelly braised ham & smoked bacon layered with gold sauce & crunchy coleslaw on a buttermilk bun. How delish is that?! You can add any choice of side, and after inquiring about Jo's Church Potatoes, I had to have those to accompany my indulgent sandwich. They are basically like "cheesy potato casserole." Creamy and rich and filling.   While the other gals who ordered the porkwich used a fork and knife to eat their sandwich, I said "What the hell" and picked it up with my hands and sloppily ate it. Yes, it was messy, but the flavors all came together in each bite and I was in pig out heaven. After half the sandwich was gone, I decided to be a bit more lady-like and ate it with a fork. Not as tasty that way...you can't get all the flavors together in one bite.  We were celebrating my birthday, so I got a cute little ice cream sandwich as dessert. It was two soft red velvet cookies sandwiched between some great french vanilla ice cream. I'm assuming this was a dessert you could get next door at Churn too.   I'm looking forward to going back again soon and trying more on the menu and hoping my opinion of the place stays at 5 stars.

qRPNcHu6UwFqKQdSa10g6w.text: We practically licked our plates, so good! Really good service and our server was very helpful with my gluten free diet.  I had the fresh catch special and hubby had the halibut sandwich which he declared the best sandwich in a long time. They have wine on tap....had a very tasty Palmina Pinot Grigio....yummy night. Will be back.

6x-7OC8Yuy1rkEZBjTaIsQ.text: Unique and interesting menu, although in execution some of the flavors just don't add up.  The whole grain salad, for example, is over-dressed with a potent orange vinaigrette that detracts from the dish.  I also tried the halibut banh mi, but the fish was not fresh, and again the dish just didn't come together.  On the plus side, Windsor has great sides and appetizers, good drink list, excellent service, and always a good crowd.  I'll definitely be back to drink and snack.

KzgnW0btkNWczp1DTi5_IA.text: I have worked with the crew that opened this place for years and they hit it right on with this one! From the classic yet new style menu, to the amazing design and fresh unique signature cocktails you'll love it here. Every time I'm there I feel like I'm somewhere thats badass.

mJyaFnVGGpQf2hC17LBBZQ.text: Returned to Phoenix and thought we'd hit Windsor for dinner. Second time here but first time we actually ordered more than an appetizer.  Sorry to say, it was a disappointment. I ordered the "New Orleans Style Ribs". Spice was not bad but they were cold. It's as if they came straight from the fridge to the plate. I didn't say anything, as I thought, "well, maybe that's what New Orleans style is", but I was wrong. I could maybe forgive the temp but these suckers did not cook long enough. Not as in undercooked raw but rather undercooked tough.  My lady had the scallops which she said were just ok.   It's a cool spot so we might give it another try someday.

Ssxd4INYkRKs1WMKa2J38Q.text: I just wanted to throw an additional compliment Windsor's way because of the way they handled a situation a few weeks ago. I made a reservation for 18 people for a triple birthday party and confirmed several times beforehand. When we arrived, we were split into two tables close to each other but not really close enough to have interaction. Disappointed by the set-up, I spoke with the manager inside. In addition to genuinely apologizing for the situation, he promised to "see what he could do" and get back to me. Sure enough, within minutes, he and his team cleared off a neighboring table and pushed it together with one of ours so we could all sit together and enjoy our delicious food and drinks. They were also very accommodating when we needed to do separate checks at the end of the meal. Ordinarily, I'm all about the food, but when service is this great, I have to say something. Kudos, Windsor!

GmwYeb4z2CIRuhLDKAoc5Q.text: Had the Porkwich the other night, it was outstanding! Also tried the smoked salmon chowder, really good too! The great food was complimented by outstanding service. I will definitely head back to Windsor.

O_XeEyM8YMXeTmq1OwsmtA.text: I wanted to love this place because I love Postino, but my experience here was just "A-OK." Some friends and I met up here for some pre-dinner drinks and a snack. We shared the charcuterie board (insert inside joke with Ben H. here) and we each got one of their signature cocktails. As far as the cheese & charcuterie, you had the usual bunch. It was good, but nothing mind-blowing. The cocktails were in my opinion, what fell a little flat. For $10/drink, I had slightly higher expectations. I probably should had stuck to wine. We had a few hiccups along the lines of service. We were seated in their beautiful back patio and were fairly low-fuss customers, but we had trouble with getting any orders in, getting waters replenished, and with a couple of mixed up beer orders. Other than that, the atmosphere was lovely and I'd like to try this place again. I liked my experience here, but it wasn't quite love.

09ISSLzBRb-if6g_D76n-g.text: With most menus I stick to a few core items, but at Windsor it is a great idea to try a lot of new food. The staff does not seem able to miss when it comes to a single menu item. The vibe and decor is superior. Staff is well trained, polite and informed. This is another win for Central Phoenix. I can finally stop driving far for dining options because Central Phoenix seems to have it all as of the past few years.

Kf5ll9z4HKBZP1K5ouszaw.text: This place was really fun to go eat at plain and simple. It was a lot trendier (in a good way) than I expected prior to going, and not as formal or snobby as I feared it may have been. The interior has the charming brick wall thing going for it and makes for a neat, functionally dimmed dining atmosphere. The music keeps it from being too heavy or intimate though which is ok with me. I thought it was all really great on those all those fronts. The menu was simple, original, and while not cheap, not terribly hard on the wallet either. Think Chili's/Applebee's prices, but for at least 5x's the quality of food. I love that the food is both delicious, pretty healthy, not boring, and grounded in the classics, but with their touch on it, if that makes sense like chicken sandwich, Louisiana ribs, Reuben sandwich, etc., rather than tofu this or vegan that, etc. They seem to have a good working knowledge of how vegetables, dressings/vinaigrettes/sauces, and meat enhance the overall dish without going overboard on any of those things. Case in point: the chopped kale salad with sliced almonds and a fruity vinaigrette to make it healthy as can be with no sacrifice to tasting yummy. I was even surprised to see they had a bar w/ a tv that had the game (game 6 of the nba finals in this case) on in the middle, but it didn't dominate the entire scene somehow and it was really easy to not even notice it if you were seated at a table. The wait staff was awesome too, they did a really good job being patient with my sister who definitely tested them on that night asking lots of questions about the menu and them having to give us more time to decide 3 times. It was pretty humorous and they handled it fantastically. I loved it all and can't wait to go back. Checked out the ice cream parlor connected to it after dinner and it looked great, but we decided to forego it this time, though being just "this close" to going for it. Next time.

_mqZlF8-H7fiTTCFNg3ZtA.text: Never have I been so disrespected; nor treated with such lack of consideration as I was at windsor.  As zero stars is not a possibility; you have the one.

pP5q0QMVX6jCl5EGgdOPKQ.text: I've been to Windsor twice in the week or so that they've been open. Once for food and once just for drinks.  The No. 89 has been getting a lot of mentions but I must say, the No. 1 is first in my book..  a watermelon vodka concoction that is as refreshing and summery as it gets.  I had the fattoush salad, which had pita mixed in with the salad.  It was tasty and filling, as well as inexpensive.  I will definitely be spending quite a few summer evenings on the patio at Windsor!  Welcome to the neighborhood.

490dCnGxbttj1IOVXDGe7A.text: Loved it!  My boyfriend and each had a free bbq rib coupon and they were nice enough to let us use them at the same time.  The ribs were delicious and literally fell off the bone.  The cheddar biscuit was by far the best biscuit I have ever had.  Mac and Cheese was outstanding.  We also got the loaded chips - very different but delicious. We clearly had a very healthy dinner :)    Atmosphere was unique and fun.  Service was great and the valet was complimentary which is always a nice touch.  We will definitely be back!

tAr1qO1KD8AsenrrBI4aWQ.text: This restaurant has a cool atmosphere with nice outdoor seating. Glasses of wine were okay (which is too bad since all the glasses are $9+) but the "pitchas" of beer are a pretty good deal. The food was alright, but the service left A LOT to be desired. Servers were slow and inattentive, and we had to consistently beg for water refills, which is a problem when you're sitting outside in 100+ degree weather. I recommend skipping dinner at this place and just heading next door for ice cream instead!

OZ3NUKR3ntRI6IjflYX9xg.text: The food was delicious!!! The porkwich was divine! The appetizer cheese fondue divine! The waitress could of used a smile and personality, that was the only drawback! Use the valet parking its worth the tip!

QEPXgIyisBAfMNLIJw_84Q.text: Went here several weeks ago. The kale salad is awesome and also the number 1 drink is great. I'll definitely be back with friends and family

N_W6lOmTtnw9qELWGvaLQw.text: Gosh I was hoping for more here. The vibe and happy hour make it a worthwhile stop but the food and drink was disappointing and actually left our stomachs unsettled.  Their house margarita was so bitter and acidic that after one sip I stopped drinking it. A good stir did not help. It also had an off-putting 'refrigerator flavor'. Not a good start. I had the veggie stack which was not a stack at all but more of a pita spread with hummus, and a scattering of very fresh veggies and some  black quinoa,  and (the best part ) green goddess dressing. The pita was like thick piece of cardboard and my first bite had a nascent fishy taste and I swore mustard I tasted mustard which I would have asked them to hold, not a fan of that stuff. I decided to see if it improved but that pita was too much work even with the sharp serrated steak knife provided. The side dish of fried okra, my grandmother used to make this, wasn't worth the calories. It was reminiscent of something you would buy in the frozen section of your grocery store; tough, cold and a bit bitter as well.  The dip was good though. My husband ordered the crab BLT, which the server promised, "the crab cakes were flown in fresh every day."  Should have caught 'crab cakes' because they tasted old and again like something you would get from your grocer's freezer. The side of coleslaw was very good though and a fresh take on the standard gloppy mix.   I'll try again because of the vibe and try to be more selective about what I order. And  I'll stick to wine.....

7LLhEYmPU-6ZgKZO8dIJSg.text: Such a cute, charming place.  Plus, I love the eclectic menu. Who knew that church potatoes paired with kale salad (both@$3 a piece, mind you), would make such a delightful, late dinner meal.  Props to fanny m. for introducing me to this place. I'll definitely be a repeat customer.    P.S. Love the hot tea selection that I've started to order two tea leafs and a bud from their website. Good job, Windsor.  P.P.S. We dined al fresco in the patio area on a such a cool, Feb evening.  Fire pit was warm and inviting.  Such great ambiance.  Good job again, Windsor.  P.P.P.S. I swiped the kids menu. Stuff on there looked good, too.

LGBeA7WzVuwGPkpYfSvs5w.text: The service is great and atmosphere is pretty laid back! I'm planning on going here tonight !

RB-SXOEFGJ5UISDDhgVlOg.text: Oh my... Delicious! Lunch plans with the girls led us to Windsor on a lovely Sunday afternoon. I had the crab cake BLT ... Crab cakes, yum... add bacon? Amazing!  You have your choice of sides and I had Jo's Church Potatoes. This was a really yummy potato casserole.  I was wickedly full and incredibly satisfied leaving Windsor (didn't stop me from getting ice cream next door, but that's another review.)  And like their parent establishments, they have happy hour every day until 5pm. Woohoo!  I highly recommend this for a CenPho lunch or happy hour. Yummmeee!!

9xniYf6tNeTRMQ2Al5fbTA.text: The brains behind Postino strike gold again with Windsor.  My wife and I thank them for introducing us to day drinking a few years ago.  $5 pitchers of craft beer and deep discounts on their wine get us everytime.  Odell IPA is my pitcher of choice and the missus gets whatever red wine that tickles her fancy.  Then the food...awesome.  The burger I had was perfectly prepared, delicious and huge but the "X" factor is the housemade steak sauce...order an extra side to dunk your fries in.  It's that good.  Those pepper things that are kind of like the lottery (there is one super hot one mixed that you can't visually identify but your mouth will let you know) are great and addicting.  Kale salad - top notch.  The building is another great renovation by the owners.  I'm no architect but it has a mid-century look that has been updated.  The outdoor patio is a blast, full of life.  Spend some time with the cassette wall on your way to the restroom, you're bound to find a band from your past.

HANZjYn3Q8OqqIcyQx0BLA.text: Windsor didn't blow my socks off, but it was still solid.  A $5 pitcher of beer before 5:00 is nice. The pitcher turns out to be 3-4 glasses, so you can't go wrong - just get to the Windsor early to take advantage of it. And where its sister restaurant Postino's lacks in hard alcohol, the Windsor makes up for it; they have a nice list of whiskeys and bourbons along with mixed drinks.  The food was good. I really loved the Kale salad (with its dried cherries, crunchy almonds, and tangy dressing, it's hard not to love), and the cheddar fondue was especially sharp and flavorful, but the burger that I ate wasn't anything spectacular.   My friends and I were lucky to arrive early, because after 5:30 pm, it looked like there was a wait time of at least 20+ minutes. This especially surprised me because it was a Tuesday. Although, it didn't help that we stayed at our table for so long. The evening was just too lovely, and the patio too perfect to not stay and chat.

6dEtY-cYUmG5NTmNXCecyw.text: Thursday night dinner for business. Server was spot on and food was perfect, really could you make the Mac and Cheese better? I think not!   Here is where things went classy, during our dinner they sat a table of 8 adults and a 2nd table of 6 children. As parents we understand, but maybe Windsor 7:30 on a Thursday might not be the best environment for the kids, because kids like to run around. Instead of acting like the kids weren't there, the manager brought over another side of Mac and said thank you for understanding. He didn't say anything about the kids, but it was understood and it was classy.  To top it off when we did get our check, we noticed a generous reduction- again it was something that they didn't have to do, but it is something that we will remember.  we will keep going back!

ccYXWDDZB_CfffZQP_ZPfQ.text: We had arrived at 12 pm on a Sunday and found ourselves on a bit of a wait.  The place was packed and the parking lot was as well although we managed to find a spot.   We checked in with a person at the rear entrance and we're told we would have a 20 minute wait.  We decided to go to another concept of theirs a couple feet away called Churn.  It is an ice cream shop.   Very good.  Anyway upon finishing our ice cream they called us in and sat us on the patio.  We were greeted promptly by a nice waitress and ordered. We had a garden vegetable entree and a burger with Mac and Cheese.  Food was wonderful, veggies were delicious.   Burger was devine.  Overall had had a great experience.

e1OHIIypWkTrB1zUcRKUyQ.text: Very Cozy neighborhood bar and restaurant.  Service is always fabulous, atmosphere is always laid back and the food is very consistent.  Currently my favorite burger in town!  Stop in and check out the Windsor if you haven't yet and don't forget to stop at Churn on the way out for a sweet treat!

ZIxdNWgOucm29QRoq0HC0g.text: I had a business trip planned for Phoenix and planned to visit a friend from college while in the area.  When I got off the plane, the text for dinner simply said "fondue?" She knows me well.    Windsor's fondue was delicious with the fresh pretzels and apples. I was in heaven. The beer is also cheap by the pitcher so both are a great combo for an easy night out.  Traveling from the East Coast in the middle of March, their open restaurant feel was extremely inviting and makes for a cozy atmosphere to catch up in.    Only downside was the valet parking but I'm told as an outsider that's normal out there.

qNwsWSExFtjgbIxbn1kbgA.text: Too loud.  Had lunch here a couple times but I will not return because the music was so loud I couldn't even carry on a conversation with my spouse.  This is a shame because otherwise I may have enjoyed the food. I guess some restaurants are doing this to try to turn tables over more quickly, but I find it ruins the dining experience.  I avoid places that do this.

N-wPWB1EYxb3N5nTqEi1JA.text: Great food but a jerk of a waiter. Food and drinks great, the dude just had no customer service skills. He threw our checks to us when we asked for it after he had forgotten about us.

WwhcirKQ3IkBPicjmacEbQ.text: I've been here a few times, mostly when they are offering a deal or two through their email list. The first time, I wasn't impressed. I remember looking at the menu thinking that I could make most of the entree items at home. After tasting, I was even less impressed. There really wasn't anything on the menu that would make we want to come back.   But then we got a coupon for 2 for 1 entrees on Mondays and Tuesdays in October, and since it's right around the corner we decided to give it another try. I was delighted to find they had changed their menu to include some tasty new items, and I wasn't disappointed with our choices at all.   The Mixed Grain Salad was delicious! I would definitely get that again. It is hearty, sweet, and sour, with an amazing blend of textures that make every bite interesting. It reminded me of a Kashi meal, but so much better.   The next thing we got was the Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich. While it's True that it's not a traditional Banh Mi sandwich in several ways, the most obvious of which is the fact that it comes on a soft sandwich roll instead of a baguette, it was absolutely delicious! The fish was cooked perfectly, and it was juicy, fresh, and flavorful. The side of mac n cheese was just ok. I don't know why, but most of the starchy sides at Windsor seem overly salted. I love a good crunchy topping on my baked mac n cheese, but this seemed to be composed entirely of sea salt.   All in all, I'm really glad they offered a deal or I probably wouldn't have returned. I'm glad I did, and will be going back to try the other new menu items.

Iy25aADL6XWQRnpRQnPgzQ.text: This place is awesome.    Great ambiance and even better food.   Definitely try the Russian Roulette Peppers!

UVZwW6BlbHYzOLsir5CjVg.text: The atmosphere is really laid back and relaxing. It's a nice place to have wine and a great meal. Food is on point! Everything that was ordered tasted like perfection.   Brandon was our server and he was AMAZING. His timing was great, always there when we needed him. Everyone there pitched in to serve us, and they did so effortlessly.  I'm coming back, not because the food was so great, but because that was the best customer service experience I have EVER gotten.

lKKJ48kmK3gtNjvhNBaIZg.text: Small broccoli side but tasty. Great kale salad $3 but could lose the craisins (kind of low-class for a place like this) Kale sausage soup good Church potatoes excellent.  Bloody mary bar cute but needs much better restocking/attention.  Many of the jars of ingredients were empty for the whole time we were there.  The green bloody mary is worth skipping.  Pretty flavorless.  Go with the red.  $5 premium cocktails and pitchers of craft beer and $5 wine til 5pm everyday is a great deal.  We'll be back!

cbtlskTQpmCvE43rv8NsFQ.text: Great Food! Try the curried chicken sandwich...yummy! Not a drinker but friends love the choice of drinks. When you're finished try Churn next door for an ice cream topper

DbSlLNvxxAvXGW_T5zoBHw.text: The best burger and pancakes in Phoenix, hands down!  Backyard burger Windsor style is where it's at!    I have never had a bad experience here, it is my go-to whenever I have family in town.  DELICIOUS!

LZQjkDjgUcPWoXu0Ii0WHw.text: Windsor has gotten 190+ reviews (almost ALL good) in the short time that it's been open, so that should already say a whole lot about the place... I can't believe I put off coming here for so long. What can I say that already hasn't been said about this amazing restaurant?! My wife and I met some friends here and sat outside since it was a beautiful day out. The patio is clean and decorated in a simple yet stylish manner. Inside you'll find a beautiful bar and the famous "cassette tape" wall leading to the bathrooms and the creamery Churn.   The food and service are both top notch! We started with the Russian Roulettes which was basically a bowl of sauteed peppers... most were pretty mild, but the dish came with the warning that you may stumble upon a HOT one... (thus the name) The porkwich is probably my new favorite sandwich... seriously. EVER.  The cocktail list here is really impressive, and changes often! However, they are numbered, so if you don't see the one you want on the menu, you can still order it by number and they'll oblige!  I'll just say it, this has got to be my favorite restaurant in Arizona now!

tjK-aCkVQVa1RuZ08vIrLA.text: I wasn't going to write a review for Windsor, since there are already like 80 of them, but I noticed there's been quite a controversy over the mixed grain salad.  Since that salad was pretty much the highlight of my week, I want to add my 2 cents here.    First of all, the components of the salad are listed right on the menu, so if you don't like what's in it, don't order it.  If you like beets, squash, grains, etc., this salad is absolutely the perfect combination of crunchy, hearty, healthy, salty, and a little sweet.  So incredible was this salad that I couldn't even stop eating in time to leave room for ice cream at Churn.  I was very impressed with the vast array of options on the menu here but will probably continue to order the mixed grain salad again and again.  Other stuff about Windsor:  The patio is delightful.  It's not a particularly large patio but it's got a great setup, with plenty of room between tables.  Thank goodness for misters.  I loved that they gave a little bowl of pistachios as soon as we sat down.  The atmosphere inside the restaurant was nothing special (besides the awesome wall of cassette tapes linking Windsor to Churn).

JFQTxh_EfqkLnEtoW2vZwA.text: Windsor is a quirky delight.  The daily fish specials and happy hour drinks are my favorites. The staff complements the hipster buzz and enhances the dining experience.   The mix of people is interesting and everyone is welcome in a well conceived experiment of what new urbansim can offer when done right.

mCn0GuuZ4wCY1Wpy3qLiwg.text: Wonderful experience! The service is on point! We were greeted quickly, sat quickly, and the servers were happy to modify or explain a drink! We were served by Anthony most the evening who made sure we never looked up searching for him. He made sure our food was to our liking a couple bites in and continued to bring drinks and water throughout our stay. Plus they do $5 dollar drinks before 5pm even on weekends! Can't beat that.

lIfgy-rhBu7KFLFouuqcNw.text: Came here from out of town with family and friends.
