It is a rare experience where the waitstaff's exceed your expectation in every way, and your tastebuds are satiated as well as your appetite. This was one of those occasions.   Jesus, Brandon, and Kayla were professional, friendly, attentive, and went out of their way to not only provide us service, but they ensured that when we come back to PHX, we have our GO TO!! The food, wine, and drinks were tremendous, the food perfectly prepared, and the pretense absent!!!   Can not say enough good things about our experience!!!

xbdqOc37hdAC-hzGzgrIAA.text: The reason for the four stars is the price.   My friend and I both ordered the same cocktail - No. 63. Bourbon with an added sweetness - perfect!  I ordered the Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich with a side kale salad. Something I appreciated about this place was what you paid for your sandwich or burger was the same price with the added side. The Banh Mi had a great combination of flavors with the honey glaze and the spicy mayo.   My friend and I went for dinner at night and the atmosphere was darker and intimate. The had a large bar area, and we sat in a comfortable booth while it rained outside (to really create that comforting, intimate mood).  Overall, the food was delicious, the mood inside was warming, the drinks were perfectly balanced, and the staff was nice. The only thing I would change was the price.

4WAus35SdkrrESOfAtpgCw.text: The brunch and service here is amazing. Delicious eggs Benedict, crowd is mostly nicely dressed.

yVkCjHXpBOzNSwBRZW7Gyg.text: I have lots of love for Windsor as I do all Upward Projects restaurants. This is the top spot for day drinking! Awesome, high quality, unique cocktails for $5 before 5pm. What's not to love?  There are lots of choices for my vegetarian self. Windsor has a top-notch veggie burger that I've gotten a few times. One of the servers gave me the helpful suggestion of having it prepared Windsor-style like the regular burgers, and I loved it. They have lots of great sides too. A cup of their daily soup and some creamy mac and cheese made for a great meal during the winter.   Service has been consistently good every time I've visited. I don't get to come here enough since I live in the east valley, but it's always a treat when I do visit.

roafndtvUMMVHEBWYF5PAw.text: This has to be the worst restaurant on Central Ave. As a group of 5, no one in our party had an even decent meal. The Sprite and Coke beverages tasted flat, the ice in the beverages tasted like tap water and the meat wasn't cooked well done as requested. If you can't even serve a coke and ice cubes right, why ya in business??  Caution all, to NOT dine here. Windsor owns the ice cream shop next door, that is your best bet.

aEoHpnSWIlpPhW_U7wsAsw.text: The food is good, nothing particularly extraordinary, but consistent and prepared well.  I had the blackened rainbow trout, not as flaky as I would have liked, but still good.  Mac & Cheese was excellent and I really enjoyed the cornbread.

budPJTFlhAJnS7xX9rMysA.text: I've been to Windsor a couple of times for brunch and late lunch. Both times, the food was amazing! For lunch, I got the Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich. I honestly had no expectations about this order, because I felt the menu was too simple so I thought I settled with this... but boy was I wrong! The pulled chicken, with all the veggies, and the hazelnuts, tasted wonderful all together! (This review is reminding me that I need to go back just for this sandwich...)  For brunch, my friend and I ordered The Simple Life (she was on a diet) and I had the Highroad Sandwich with a side of Grilled Cheddar Potatoes. The Simple Life was just ok, really as simple as breakfast gets that you can easily make at home. The Highroad, on the other hand... amazing! Coupled with the cheddar potatoes, it was definitely a great combo. We also had a cocktail since they were having the $5 until 5PM deal on the Sunday we went. If you go for brunch, GET THE GRILLED CHEDDAR POTATOES!! You won't regret it.  Parking in the front of the building is very minimal, so make sure to drive around as there are more parking on the back, and on the right side. The only thing I wish Windsor would have was a bigger menu both from brunch and lunch/dinner. Other than that, everything I've had has been great so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. More seating in the back patio.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Simple Life &amp; Highroad Sandwich
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IxIz49KvXT0PTbVDU0uAvQ.text: Very hip trendy spot with a variety of craft cocktails all at a decent price.  The cheese appetizer is very good and the church potatoes are bomb. Could make an entire meal of those.    Staff was young and straight up hipster but very nice.  The outdoor seating during nice weather is perfect a

q6mkzgk04tf-ZGLl4ePlJw.text: I've honestly never heard of the gem in the desert until my friend told me of it.  Carlos was very attentive, friendly and gracious.  I should up late at mid meal with my friend.  I love the ambiance the feel, the vibe.  The brown bag was it!  You must have the brown bag.  I some of my friends buttermilk fried chicken!  It was to die for!  On a Monday get the brown bag or the fried chicken.  I observed the staff, you can tell they love working here, they are a True team.  Carlos was not alone is helping us, he had support of everyone!  Thank you Windsor for a great experience!

BdKnZeVlxYKa1kIkrCQMeQ.text: Every time gets better and better.   Called ahead to see about a wait time and the nicest young lady answered the phone. She was so phone friendly and had even better news there was no wait.   Of course can't get away from the loaded chips to start. So very good. Such an amazing combination!  They have a great Arnold Palmer too if you're not drinking.   Tonight I decided on the crab cake blt. Omg. Only thing I forgot was no bun. It's just so much bread. It was so good. A great mix and can taste crab. They have tastey bacon too. As a side I tried the kale salad. Now you should know I think kale is evil but, it is good for you, so...  wow. I think I found a new craving. Was so good I'm not sure kale was in it!  I just can't wait to try the next thing on the menu so I can rave about it as well.   WTG Windsor!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fondue
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken and potatoes

T3bBvqA8XO9RALRuxL6tOQ.text: Oh, man, my mouth is watering just thinking about how awesome their savory food is! You have to come hungry because to miss out on their incredible appetizers before your main meal would be missing out. We started with a fondue cheese plate with apple slices, sausage, and warm soft pretzel pieces and a savory, creamy Mac and cheese topped with bread crumbs--so good! Main dish I got a bacon burger on a gourmet bun and my husband got the fall-off-the-bone ribs. Everything was awesome including the service. We will be making this a-must-return place for next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sC-heFFu8V1OoSyWpblvNg.text: I have so many good things to say about this establishment. Making the reservations was a breeze - I was to get the clear on items like separate checks, ability to add small decorations for my mother's 50th surprise party and ability to bring in an outside cake. These little things make or break that experience. I'm completely satisfied with every aspect of our time here! Food was AMAZING- I ate everything on my plate (the Matador) drinks at a perfect price and the kids menu- EXCEPTIONAL!! They did a tremendous job juggling our huge party and I can't thank you enough. The restaurant is beautiful of course and the patio heaters are just perfect this time of year.

PMM8en95OX6ocktoks468w.text: Cute patio for a nice evening.  We had the Grain Salad and the Picnic Kabobs.  Wow..the meats were cooked perfectly and delicious.  Even the sauces that it came with were fantastic.  And the salad was perfect to have with it.  Will definitely be back to try more.

uqNIfgjtpbhS-2fepli9GQ.text: Yummy little spot.  Great menu selections and just the right vibe. Everything on the menu was scrumptious.

KkVuVplU9cF2oQ9Zk8CgIg.text: Have been here a couple of times over the years but it's been a couple of years since last visit. Never was impressed by any of the food (thus why I haven't returned).   But just moved closer to it and my husband had never been so we thought we would try brunch there.   Both got drinks - my husband's (a Paloma?) was really good and my Bloody Mary with all the fixings was good.   But the food still not good. I got the biscuits  and gravy. Gravy was weirdly sweet and gummy - not good. Sausage killed my stomach.   My husband didn't like his either.   Would be best to go for drinks only, in my opinion.   Far better places for food around there and not as expensive either.

Jq5uvlwKa1AA0s7MYyuC1g.text: So I was not feeling good when I got this restaurant. As soon as I arrived at this restaurant quick service and great food had me feeling better.  I was able to enjoy some of the freshest grilled shrimp and the juiciest okra. Thank you.

Mwk0jsJABF2xy_WMvQwGEg.text: I have been here two times - once for happy hour and once for brunch.  Surprisingly, brunch was not super busy.  Parking was a snap, seating was a snap, and brunch was great and reasonably priced.  Happy hour on a Friday of course is pure craziness.  Service was great on both occasions.  My biggest complaint is actually getting into Windsor (finding the correct door is horrible) and the crazy location of the hostess station.

QPqjP7PJq7LVLwboRTMTAQ.text: Great menu selection and delicious drinks. The No. 22 cocktail was so good. Great overall service.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

H_7Pj7m_eOCmM7EkkKjelw.text: This Is my spot! They have never disappointed with the quality of food or the service. I know when I go to Windsor that I will get quality food! The servers are so friendly and always on top of their game! The ambiance is so quaint and just has such a great vibe. I go here quite frequently and there's not a bad thin I have to say about this place! Thanks Windsor for staying consistent and never disappointing!

PR6AtsKGY_hrpwwn22sPeA.text: I came here with my family on Sunday afternoon for my moms birthday. The restaurant is very cute, with its cool cassette wall and tile floors. There is an inside area to eat and then the bar, and a sliding window opened up to the outside eating area. The outside had greenery, hanging lights, and a fireplace.   I decided to eat the brunch and got the Simple Life plate which was 2 eggs, 2 strips of bacon, an English muffin split in half and toasted, and a side of fruit which mainly consisted of apples, cantaloupe, and honeydew. Everything was really good, especially the thick cut bacon! Also, I asked for butter and jam with my English muffin and the strawberry jam was sooo good I couldn't stop eating it.  My mom ordered the Matador which she absolutely loved and raved about. My dad got the chef's special of the day which was an omelet with chorizo in it, which he also loved, and it was pretty big, too. And my sister got a burger with the Mac and cheese for the side, which she let me try and it was pretty good! Might I add that the staff is very friendly and accommodating, too:)  Overall, it was a great meal and it was definitely worth the 30 minute drive! I can't wait to go back and eat some more!

dc1ka8xAVrx6x7MBHf2icQ.text: I love love the atmosphere and decor.  There is an outside patio and indoor seating is very comfortable.  I love their hummus and chicken kabobs.  It is my second time here so I will critic what I had during my visits.  From the drink menu I've had No. 22, 3 and 17.. Number 3 has been my favorite so far because its made with a touch of lemon, now the other two drinks were not so great 22 was very strong and drink 17 had cucumber flavor, slightly odd.  The staff is very nice and were very attentive with our table.  Seems like great team work since i had at least 5 different people come up my table and take away plates or bring food/drinks to our table.

BKaRMHmw8v9tEHgaAZls0Q.text: The only good thing about this place is the patio/scenery. Their orange juice is trash, the Mac n cheese didn't seem cooked all the way and I got food poisoning from their tuna poke. On top of everything their low quality food is extremely overpriced.

eNgbMhchf2MhEfpehZEX2A.text: Had a late dinner here the ambiance was inviting super cool vibe our waiter was extremely nice and helpful! I ended up getting a veggie stack with a side of fries it was good tasted very earthy and fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie stack side of fries

O4lM9fa_u6whVCouA023eg.text: Just had dinner their last night! Love this place! I had the Kale salad and the Mac n cheese! Loved it! Great service and I will be back! Make sure you stop for dessert that is located next door! Great ice cream!

_OWQmlyUNV6KwXjy1s14pA.text: Windsor is like Postino and Vig had a baby!   Of course we had to start with the corn dog bites. I love these little nuggets of State Fair gold. There were a few pieces of friend pickle chips in the basket (on purpose).... Nice surprise!  The Russian Roulettes are a bowl of Japanese Shishito peppers that are charred and served warm. I like them with a little squeeze of lemon.   Deviled Egg Dip & homemade chips were better than I imagined. I have to figure out how to make this appetizer. I think it would be a big hit with friends.   After all the apps, we were full, so my friend and I ended up splitting the New Orleans baby back rib dinner. The ribs were fall-off-the-bone tender and the flavor was smokey with a hint of sweet and heat. We had it with a side of cole slaw. I'm usually a such a lady at the dinner table, but I HAD to lick my fingers a couple times!!   For desert, don't forget to head next door to Churn for some of the best artesian ice cream in town!   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great Wall of cassette tapes

16yZdk4aA8eD7yjriypumA.text: This eatery was beyond my expectations for our recent foray for Restaurant week spring 2015. yes, it's uber hipster and trendy...lots of tattoos, skinny jeans, big janky beards, and gentleman's haircuts, but the food is really, really, really good!  i started with the ceviche...thick chunks of shrimp and onions and avocado. paired with these delicious crispy tortilla chips, it was off to a great start. the wife had the falling out salad, and the tender greens with the sweet/tart grapes was divine. our entree: sea bass for me (which is normally a no-no for me, considering i try my best for sustainability, and i swear i think this was caribbean sea bass and not chilean) and the veggie stack for the wife. both exquisite. the fish was cooked to tender perfection, but honestly, i liked the textural feel of my wifes dish a little more! plus, her side of mac n cheese was awesome.   for dessert...i had the rhubarb soda float...sour, but with the hit of vanilla ice cream, sweet and savory. she had some sort of parfait, both of which came from next door i think..their sister creamery Churn.   overall, our favorite stop during this season's episode of Restaurant week. hope we venture back!

di582DooXHvr-iqojxfnOw.text: Dropped in to this neighborhood pub before heading to the Orpheum to see YoYo Ma. A little noisy on the back deck,  but enjoyed a delicious crab cake sandwich with sweet potato fries. Must try weekend Bloody Mary bar. Fun and convenient place with great services.

dojwafzwIyJ8TccuCZoxew.text: I actually came here for brunch, but apparently it's only on Sunday's. So just FYI. The lunch menu they were serving seemed somewhat refreshing and very fresh. A huge plus is that they allow dogs on their patio (which is fully covered) and they ALSO have misters that periodically come on to cool you down. It was super helpful today when it was triple digits, ouch!! When I travel across the country with my dog, it's nice to have places like this because I won't leave him in the car.   I started with a no. 22, which is something like a tart blackberry lemonade with vodka as the base. It was absolutely perfect for me because I don't like cocktails very sweet.   My soup & salad combo consisted of wild mushroom soup and a kale/romaine Caesar salad.   Mushroom soup - very dark broth which is perfectly seasoned with a base of mirepoix and vegetable broth I would guess. It had a healthy dose of mushrooms along with carrot chunks and onions. Very light. Perfect for a hot day.  Kale Caesar - romaine lettuce mixed with fresh, crisp kale tossed in a creamy, yet mild, house made Caesar dressing topped with dried capers. They weren't very strong, but they did have a nice salty touch to the dish. I was very pleasantly surprised by the mix actually.   Boyfriend had the 'pork-which' that they almost advertise as their pulled pork sandwich. It came with sweet potato fries that were room temp when we got them, but still good. As for the sandwich, it basically came out like a roast beef sandwich made with pork with burnt bacon on top and tangy mustard. Not a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy pup in the patio.

rYPlMxeHt33WaJH1g-_70A.text: The service was great, we were seated outside but kept warm by their heaters and fire, and the server checked up on us regularly.  The drinks were good--ginger cider and a berry vodka cocktail. The bartender did well with the mix.  But the food was bland. We had the fish and chips, and although crunchy, the fish had no taste (tasted like water...), and the fries were not well seasoned (over salted at the bottom of the basket). I felt overcharged for what was less appetizing than a $5 fish n chips dish, so... Don't order that when you go?

GhFnh--oojWk4tJRn_39lA.text: Came in today for our usual Sunday brunch even though we missed it haha   Our server was very friendly, kinda wish he took care of us throughout the whole meal. I understand some places like to have everyone work together but the only problem with that is they don't know if someone checked on a table... After receiving our main course we had some request but by the time a server showed up we were full... So that was disappointing   FOOD AND DRINKS  My sister and I literally try new places for their bloody Mary's and we gave this 6 out 10 mainly because of the pulp (first time I've ever had a pulpy Bloody Mary) not good BUT $5 drinks til 5pm so that's a plus. For apps we ordered the ceviche which was good but stingy on the seafood, the devil eggs chip dip was good but chips were slightly stale, and popcorn corn dogs weren't anything special. They were a little backed up so our main course took awhile but the cheeseburgers and pastrami was alright.   In the end I would not come here again unless it was for drinks before 5 but I'd still recommend it to friends and family to give it a try

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apps
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulpy Bloody Mary&#39;s

HhTXjkTZngH1lDPoP6R_FA.text: This is one of my favorite places in town for brunch. We frequent the Windsor, several times a month. If you like biscuits and gravy, you'll have a hard time finding one better than here.  The happy hour, which is $5 pitchers, $5 wine, & $5 cocktails, runs daily till 5 PM.   The dinner selections are fantastic, from their burger, to their pork sandwich. This place is great for small groups, and does not disappoint.

wlTtcbN2OXmJum6E3aeTLg.text: The Windsor is my favorite of the Upward Projects restaurants. Their food is very good and reasonably priced for the most part, and they have great cocktails - a lot of them. The atmosphere is very relaxed and I've only ever had wonderful service. The decor is beautiful, and the facilities very clean.  The Monday night Fried Chicken Dinner is a pretty good deal, and the veggie pairing is always on point. The food is standard American fare with good flavors and presentation. But! A warning to the vegetarians, the Windsor's offerings are frustrating. The veggie burger (made of beans and wheat) is more expensive than any of the sandwiches with only one meat, and only a few dollars less than the Crab Cake BLT (made of an animal you pull from the ocean floor with a net and send to Phoenix on a refrigerated airplane hangar; jk it's a freezer patty, but still).   For the price, the salads are probably your best bet, or the soup and salad duo if they happen to have a veggie-friendly soup. The Veggie Stack is tempting, and it's perfectly filling, but it's expensive for what it is (pita, hummus, quinoa, veggies) and feels very much like a labored attempt at vegetarian American food. You can also play it safe getting a smattering of their admittedly great sides.   My final word on the Windsor would be that the french fries are really very good. If you aren't a ketchup fan, they have sriracha you can mix with your ketchup, or order them with a side of sambal mayo.  tl;dr I like this place as a neighborhood happy hour spot or a chill evening over drinks. Their food is not worth it for me. I say that as someone who only rarely eats meat, but I also mean it. The french fries are good. Amen.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s like hogsmeade up in here!

_GuM-CPwLNP-KeD_Z0jw7w.text: Went here for dinner and drinks. We sat on the patio and the patio was beautiful!! Our waiter was a super nice guy, I forgot his name. He moved around a lot, based on the conversation we had with him.:-)   Will for sure be back! :)

dy4RWlP1D3D7q2Fyzaouhg.text: All i can say is the food and service are soooooo good that it may have convinced my girlfriend to buy a house nearby that i liked!  Seriously though, amazing food, amazing service, customers for life!

IhuClhiNYDzSde8QliF_Rw.text: Another tasty fun Upward Projects restaurant!   Location: just north of Camelback and Central near the other Upward Projects restaurants. Parking can be problematic at certain times. Though the lot to the south of Windsor is large, it has been full, and valet also has a max. Sometimes I've parked at AJs and walked up.   Food:  Though salad restaurants are usually yawnnn.., the Windsor salads are vibrant, interesting and flavorful.  I have ordered various salads and am always glad I did.  I enjoyed the pretzel appetizer with cheese and apples. I think it came with sausage but did not eat that.  The drinks have always been delicious and well made.   Service: Similar to the other Upward Projects restaurants, service is excellent.   The servers provide the bill in a timely manner and are helpful and quick.   Ambiance: trendy, hipster, fun.    I like it!

NJAB71jcuWK-m7iawSmdVA.text: I love windsor...but this experience was terrible...forgot to put order in... ordered a pitcher 20 minutes later they say we're out if pitchers. Finally get drinks 30 min later. Chicken was obviously under cooked. Ready to leave they adjusted the check took off 4$. Then our waiter charged us for different tables  check of 80$ ours was 24$. The bar is the only place I'll get service if I go back to what was one of my fav places in phx.

3EbMfoNImK-ICMDF_1AGWA.text: Have not been here in a few years because I moved out of town but I decided to show up today for lunch. This place is the best. The food is amazing and the bartender, Manny is very personable! Keep it up!

P27kULqPXahIgolgklh7Xw.text: I have a bit of a love-hate relationship with Windsor...   There have been good experiences here, there have been not so good... Sometime friends say "Let's go to Windsor!" and I'm like "Blaaahhhhh... I don't like Windsor that much" but sometimes I'm like "Heck yes! Let's go Now!"   It may just be that the mental roller coaster I ride is to blame, but here's the breakdown:  Stopped in for brunch before and it's pretty solid. They have a build your own bloody mary bar which was a favorite among our group. I did not partake because bloody marys are the devil.   I did however get the cinnamon roll which waaaas.... amazing. You can drizzle your own icing so if you don't like too much then it's your choice to make. I'm pretty sure I used all of it because that's how I live my life... All in. No boundaries. (I'm quite boring actually)   The eggs benedict was good as well. I think I had the one with crab cakes and spinach.   So that's brunch.  I've also been to Windsor for dinner a few times. The burger is very good. I remember liking it.   I was disappointed with the popular Brown bag chicken sandwich though... it wasn't "my thing". I know people who like it though... so there's that.   The fried chicken is awesoooome... you can only get it on a certain night though (I can't remember which night) choose mac and cheese as the side and you win dinner. So good. I can't remember having friend chicken that good since leaving The South. Not a restaurant called The South... I'm talking about the Actual South. Florida baby! Represent! *ahem*  moving on...   So that's the food. Mostly very good. I like.   The service has been all over the board. I try to just roll with it...   They have a decent beer selection. Some of the cocktails have been home runs... others have been... whatever the opposite of a home run is...  The atmosphere is trendy but casual. Quite comfortable and unpretentious.  Overall, after writing this, I guess I do like Windsor (at least for today)...   And I leave you with this Pro Tip: Save room for after dinner ice cream at Churn next door. You're Welcome.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #28 Cocktail. It has bourbon in it.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken and Mac &amp; Chz
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the Eggs Benedict -- I think the crab cake one

R-D1tCgjjABqt0Rkpi6ZiQ.text: After reading all the rave reviews, we came here for brunch during a weekend. Luckily, we got seated immediately without having to wait. After going back and forth on a couple of dishes, we finally settled on coffee and crab cake benedicts.  The coffee was bottomless, so that was nice. The crab cake benedicts were disappointing. The crab cakes were thin and small and overall not impressive.

UfNSL1i9DoXCVc13_iWNNg.text: Why I haven't written a review for Windsor earlier I'm not sure as I've been going there since it first opened but it's a good one so I guess better late than never!  The owners of Postino just can't go wrong I'm convinced. I'm a long time fan of both locations and was super excited when they opened up Windsor as they have a full bar and different, numerous options for food.   Let's start with the interior, love it. Modern with some natural elements; very laid back with an awesome patio that I've actually yet to sit on as I'm usually at the bar or one of the comfy booths as soon as you walk in.  The staff is always on point and friendly without being too in your face which I really love being that I am a server and I don't really need the follow up every 4 minutes. I most recently sat at the bar solo on Wednesday or Thursday and I didn't get the bartender's name but he was really nice without being overbearing.   Food wise? Omnomnom is all I have to say. No, the Backyard burger is awesome. I've only gotten it Classic style but it's delicious! The meat is flavorful and the portion is generous to say the least. I'm also a big fan of their fondue and the Brown Bag (??) Chicken sandwich. Everything tastes fresh and you can't go wrong with Churn next door for the dessert...best Butter Pecan I've ever had.  This area has some solid restaurants and Windsor is no different. Definitely a great spot for lunch during the day or a date at night. Check it out!

uuHk8pumg_tR5ach4W6sUQ.text: So, I really want to worship this place, but somehow can only muster 4 stars b/c the service was so poor this past weekend that it took literally at least 30 minutes before our server took our order and so long for our food to come out.  I didn't keep actual track, but it might have been a hour before we got our food from the time we sat down - and it was NOT busy.  There was a nice crowd, but still plenty of open tables, and no wait.    Food also is 4 stars.  I want to love it, but something is just not right.  My summer salad - new on the menu (yes, for summer)  - had too much of the overly acidic dressing.  The pulled pork which I got to-go on my first and prior visit was dry and bland.  I mean, how do you make pulled pork so-so when it's innately delicious?  Overall, still 4 stars b/c the ambience is oh so cool, the wall of audio tapes genius, outdoor patio inviting, and the kid friendly-ness of the place tops everything else.  You'll understand when you get kids...our other options are places like peter piper pizza.

g-jUpMGtJWvm-T27hczDLw.text: I love this place. The atmosphere is great. Has that urban sophisticated feel to it. Dimly lit, perfect ambiance for a date, although usually a bit crowded due to it's sheer popularity. The chicken curry coconut soup is simply delicious, a must try for the more adventurous. They also have a small menu, with a few vegetarian options for those with dietary restrictions. And the waitstaff is very knowledgeable about ingredients and willing to make substitutions! Absolutely wonderful experience!

rxf2BSkFfqlmLtthynDPbA.text: Rustic chic, super cool vibe, incredible food/drinks. Patio that puts all others to shame. So wish we had one in FoCo.

BfSS26WHnbKtQNITTUoacQ.text: I drove by this place 3 times yesterday trying to find it.  They need a much more improved way of advertising there business. I came here yesterday during a working lunch.  My first thoughts while walking through this place was gastropub.  The set up and the decor all suggested my initial thoughts.  After glancing over the menu I decided my decision was conclusive.  We decided to sit outside because let's face it one of the pros of living in Phoenix is that you can have lunch outside in January.  It was a beautiful day.     My counter part ordered the Reuben sandwich, which actually looked pretty darn tasty.  I ordered the Windsor burger, topped with caramelized onions and cheese.  Even though my burger was overdone to my request of rare I still ate it anyways because 1. I don't like to waste food, and 2. it was still pretty darn tasty.  The french fries could definitely use improvement though.  They were just blah.     As far as service goes, my server was a pimp!  Very charming and pleasing.  Although it did go a little overboard with the attentiveness of filling up water glasses constantly, not by my server though.  All around I had a pleasant experience with Windsor and if I'm ever in the area again and want to get a solid bite to eat, I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

KwisHNnrfxF5OyevwXR4Mg.text: Great vibe. After you valet the car (you have to- it's the only option) you walk into an outdoor area very similar to postino Arcadia.  Head inside and be greeted by a lovely hostess.  We sat at the bar with a carafe of wine.  All wine is served in a carafe, ala on tap style.  I like this.  The bar is in the center of the restaurant in a super chic way that you can observe what is going on around you and kinda hideout or be seen- the choice is yours.    We were seated in what I think was the best seats in the house.  It was in a corner booth that was right at the corner of the restaurant.  Once we all slid into our booth seats, we all agreed it was like hunkering down in a basement somewhere on a leather couch.   We were introduced to Dan, the super slim, urban hipster server with a nice face and a witty personality.  When asked if my burger would be better with fries or mac n cheese, he asked me how often I eat burgers with mac n cheese? uhh, so yeah, I ordered the mac n cheese--- GREAT choice!   We started with the Smorgash board that had pita, cheese, the most kale chips and largest kale chips I have ever seen, hummus, some veggies and smoked salmon-- it was interesting enough, but I probably won't be ordering that again.  But since they just opened, I am happy to try anything on the menu!  Entrees included the waldorf salad that was only so-so, it was called "a bit too much" by a friend, the Barley salad was a huge hit as was the corn chowder.  My burger was good, I recommend going easier on the caramelized onions.  I felt like it started to taste more like a dessert before I even got half way through it.  After we ate, relaxed and Dan check on us the perfect amount of time, we walked through and headed next door to Churn for dessert.  We passed the bar, said hello to a few friends we ran into, observed the outdoor seating one more time, and then walked though a hallway decorated in old cassette tapes, that was awesome!   At the end of the hallway was a bathroom marked "ladies and gents"- I absolutely despise shared bathrooms.  So that grossed me out thoroughly.  But as we made the turn, I saw the candies and ice cream that awaited me just around the corner....

3m7SmcdoG3Fi-szU5hR3ow.text: I love this place! Is a totally chill place to grab a bite or drink! Our server last night Joy was amazing she is perfectly named !

a-KyWTt09OvX_Ubkn_Q1og.text: Second time I have been to this place and I LOVE it!  It's a great, cozy atmosphere with friendly service.   We went for Mother's Day brunch at noon and were seated immediately upon arrival.  It was busy just not over packed with people on a wait.    My only complaint was the mimosa I ordered was more juice than sparkling wine.  So, when I requested a second glass I asked for just a splash of oj and they gladly accomodated.    We started with the cheddar cheese fondue.  It was SO good and I love the pretzel bread, apples, and sausage served with it.  For my entree I ordered the Brown Bag Chicken sandwich.  It was phenom!  I am so happy to find a shredded chicken salad that is NOT drenched in mayo.  I wasn't too crazy about the kale salad, it just tasted like, well, kale.    I will be back many times and look forward to exploring the menu! Oh, be sure to check out Churn next door!

B-mxcl04eZ8aineYqLvw2g.text: Love this place.  The environment is fantastic and the employees are very nice. My breakfast was awesome!!  I had the Southern Style Sausage & Gravy.  It was incredibly good and full of flavor.  Love the cassette wall in the hallway.   Found my old Depeche Mode cassettes.  What a fantastic idea!  Can you open one of these in Orange County??  :)

qryZv-dxcbG6N5KNgw0kVw.text: Had the bacon cheeseburger again. As always it was very good. Came here with a large group of friends celebrating a birthday. We were able to find as great spot to accommodate us all. The beer prices are awesome. $5 for a pitcher. Very good deal.

3aqtDgdjYRFpRm-VxAgaUA.text: Words cannot describe how much I love Windsor. It's in my favorite part of town, has an ice cream shop attached and has a wall full of cassette tapes that include gems like "Amy's Workout Jamz". How can you NOT love it? The atmosphere is an absolute home run. I just can't wait for it to cool down so I can experience the expansive patio.   The staff are friendly, fun and helpful, the beer is good, and the food is delicious. On my last visit I had the Banh Mi Sandwich, which was perfect. The sides are interesting and delicious, and items like the mac & cheese and the broccolini should not be missed.   Windsor is one of those places I can't stop talking about, and with good reason. It's the perfect mix of location, good food and fun, quirky atmosphere that really makes it a local gem. Go. Now!

5gAguDfOnFO83koUgqAonw.text: Five of us, including my 11-year-old, went to Windsor for the first time on New Year's Eve. Although we were told there would be at least a 30-minute wait, we were seated after about 12 minutes. The food was very good. The only issue was my friend's meal (the ribs and veggies) were cold. She didn't say anything until later.

SS5Fr2XDRZY4UWBTLCG0Wg.text: Flies, blaring music, and more flies! I've been here a few times before and had an ok experience. Nothing special but have a good selection of salads. So I decide to bring in a couple clients for lunch to talk business and enjoy lunch. Well instead we (5 business professionals in suits) got seated at a round booth fit for a family with children at pizza joint. Music was blasting we could not hear each other talk. We asked 3 times to have the music turned down and they would turn it down 1 notch. When I addressed the manager she stated that it was already much lower than it normally was...but the last 4 or 5 times I've been here the music was no where near this disruptive. We're in Phoenix trying to enjoy a relaxing lunch not in Scottsdale! Majority of the lunch patrons were business professionals from nearby businesses. Music this loud is not relaxing. And I was probably one of the youngest patrons so don't get me wrong I love my share of loud music. But during lunch amidst a busy day is not the time. And if the music was not annoying enough the flies made up for it. We had 5-7 BIG flies swarming our table at any given time. Constant swatting and covering our food...gross. The food is good nothing spectacular but good. Definitely not worth dealing with the music and flies though. This is probably my last visit.

lFHAR2NDDsKqVWtEvxBGCg.text: Walked by this place on Saturday evening and thought, hmmmmm there looks to be a new place open! So, Sunday my gal pal and I walked down for a few beverages and dinner on the patio. Minus a few screaming babies, the atmosphere was good and the place was hoppin'. My only complaint is that I wish the bar was built onto the patio as well. We had a hard time deciding what to eat because many things on the menu looked interesting (in a good way)...we ended up opting for an appetizer and splitting an entree. The fondue platter and the halibut sandwich were pretty good. We approved of the wine on tap as well.  The service was outstanding and the 'water boy' as we were calling him was very informative :) He told us all about the place and the menu (hopefully he will be there if you go)!  Also if you like alt rock, you won't be disappointed with the music and it is quite loud, which I didn't mind...it helped drown out the screaming baby next to us. Another bonus is the neat ice cream shop next door for dessert afterward!  I will be back again for sure.

MHYlD6lmXntsRo9jxqrMJA.text: I LOVEDDD this place!  Went here for a friend's birthday one night and sat on the patio. It was very nice & intimate. The waitress was super nice.  The food was fantastic. The cheese fondue was very fun and the griddle church potatoes...stop it...INCREDIBLE!

agmh2nvFygCAmaLbrTSe2Q.text: A GREAT alternative to Postinos (the crowded, loud, "popular" bar across the street).   Great bar, and knowledgeble, friendly bartenders. This place looks like it was furnished out of a Ralph Lauren catalog... and that's GOOD. And then there is the wall of cassette tapes. It was a pleasure waiting on queue for the loo, because I found several tapes I once had in my first car.  Great prices for happy hour and the food is top rate for the price.

82rfAwCOIz8665EeYf7Wtw.text: I've been hearing a lot of good stuff about Windsor (especially from my biz partner who is OB-SESSED), so finally hit it up for afternoon cocktails and nibblies last week.  Pretty impressed.  Nice selection of beers (with $5 pitchers of Stella on HH!) and tasty munchies.    We shared the Charcuterie platter which was abundant & well worth the $12.  The pickled veggies are delish!  We also split loaded chips (or whatever they call them).   Tasty and filling.    The bathrooms are unisex & shared with the conjoined ice cream parlour.  Whoever designed them needs to come to my house.  I LOVED them!!  The staff was awesome and very easy on the eyes, as well as attentive and friendly.  The outdoor patio is divine and perfect for AZ weather.  I'll be back again soon!

-u0B88XFHbeoivDQkUfwiQ.text: Oh Windsor, how I wanted to love you! With Postino being one of my favorite restaurants ever, I had high hopes for Windsor.   It feels, well, like Postino. But not as good.   The patio is comfortable. It was a PERFECT evening so that made it super nice, and the chairs are cute, but it's kind of plain. Again, like Postino, but without that extra something special. Although the perimeter fence is cool, with the different widths of wood.   For starters we got the fondue, which was good. Just good. The cheese - although piping hot - was kind of gritty (which happens with pure cheddar). Maybe mix something creamier in there?  I got the chicken sandwich with a side of mac n cheese. The mac was yummy. The chicken sandwich was bland. And I love me a chicken sandwich. Even of the plain ole' breast-bun-lettuce-tomato-mayo variety.   Boyfriend and boyfriend's mom got the halibut sammich, which we had heard was bomb. Again, good. Not great. Disappointing for a Postino affiliate. Kale salad was fine. Coleslaw was fine. Nothing knocked our socks off.  Our service was initially really slow. We didn't get noticed for a while, and then our drinks took ages. Everything after that was right on key, and our waitress was well informed and friendly.   My favorite part of the meal was my cocktail - the No. 89. It was the perfect blend of strong and refreshing. I would definitely be back for beverages! I'd really like to try the wines on tap as well.  All in all, it kind of seems like they built Windsor for all the Postino overflow. "Hey, your wait is going to be an hour, but if you go right across the street there is a Postino Jr. consolation prize."  I'll definitely give it another go after they've had some time to get settled, but until then, I'll be back for drinks, and eat elsewhere.

Ex3LtmS_2_-rHhFQHLSLbg.text: Really enjoyed the atmosphere here. Nice and laid back! We enjoyed our food; it was very fresh.  I had the soup. I was told it was a black bean chili, but it seemed to be some sort of a tortilla soup. It was very spicy! I enjoyed it for a bit, but then it ended up being a little spicy for me overall.  The country vegetable chop salad was very good. My favorite part was the breaded brussel sprouts (a nice surprise!).

Fv8mTxE87PGo3Lm71a-j6g.text: One of the best burgers I've ever eaten. My friend says his pastrami Reuben was one of the best he ever had. Friendly, professional wait staff. Definitely a value for the money

9Dnnr7Wnu-cQvkzrEd0FIQ.text: Went for first time today and had an amazing experience! The bar itself was a great place to sit. It was perfect weather and I love how they had an open patio next to the bar. Really gave the place a nice comfy feeling. The food was absolutely tasty, very well done. The best part was the bartender Rob. He was attentive at every step and very friendly. He cared about his guests. Will definitely make this place a regular stop. Loved it!

PuaaqhXvmlJ96swJV8DQXw.text: We're visiting friends/on vacation from the east coast and asked our friend where to go for dinner and he recommended Windsor.  Glad he did.  The Porkwich was so good I haven't stopped talking about it (apparently something I inherited from my grandfather who talks about a meal he ate days, weeks, months, and years later).  This sandwich along with the mac n cheese was so good I couldn't stop eating even though I was full.  The "chips" appetizer was also super yummy though I'm pretty sure I had my limit of fat, calories, and sodium with this one meal.  But damn I'm glad I don't live here cause I'd be a HOUSE.  And the interior is great, service was great, but the best part about the place aside from our meal was the wall of cassette tapes.  Awesome idea.  Would totally visit again.

YxEVli4qf7M2U0NdNZYrQg.text: What I like about Windsor is its unpretentious style. At the same time it has a great style, great decor for a small neighborhood restaurant. I like that they have smaller portions (right portions.. don't be afraid you will leave hungry). Patio is nice and interior is connected with Churn- a place where you get your cookies, ice cream and some fun stuff. I really like the bar area. It is large and old fashion in the good sense of the word. what I would like to see at Windsor is seasonal menu. changing 4 times a year. After eating there 10 times you kind of run out of options.

3Fpkbqn2nejo5HjrXnfY-Q.text: Went there a couple weeks ago on a Saturday night around 7:30, seated right away and had amazing service. Water immediately, drink orders within 30 seconds of being seated and our server was attentive but not annoying. No. 17 cocktail was tasty. Refreshing and not too syrupy sweet like most cocktails. We ordered the cheddar fondue to start. Great idea, poor execution. They lit a tea light at the table to melt the liquid cheddar to warm it but it never really got warm so just thick liquid room temp cheddar was the result. I would imagine maybe they could keep it warm in the kitchen so it's ready upon serving? Zap it even? The pretzel bread that came with it was amazing. For an entree, I got the porkwich. Really good but really salty, I think that's just what you get when you order a sandwich with three types of pork though. I ordered fries as my side so I'm sure that didn't help the salty flavor. My boyfriend ordered ribs and I got a taste, the sauce was very rich with a tiny kick which was unique. Churn is right next door so that's a plus as well. My only disappointment is the limited menu, it's about one page & I like to have options. But still, there were a couple other dishes I will definitely try in the future.

yof_DsxNxJcgCO0ZWJ-dfA.text: We tried Windor on a recommendation of a friend and were not disappointed!  The food was so fresh and exciting.  It is so nice to find a neighborhood type place and not get stuck in the chain rut.    I had a salad that was amazing, I wish I could name everything in it but there was so much!  There were beets in the salad which I was very skeptical...I was so suprised at how delicious it was!    We enjoyed the Happy Hour prices for the mini pitchers, what a great deal!    Our 3 year old was with us so we popped in next door for some ice cream afterward and it also did not disappoint!!

RvKusEHmXHYcGCCeHF0udw.text: Wanted to love it...and I did!   First and foremost, love the decor, love the vibe. Mid century vintage lighting, paired with an entire wall treatment made out of old cassette tapes...whats not to love? Killer music.  We started with two ice cold no.89's and they hit the spot, very smooth, mild pear taste, perfect cocktail for a summer night. We also chose to sit inside.  Our first item was the double dip, very good! I hate eggs, but I liked the Cobb dip anyway, it was that good. The posole salsa was delicious and my fave of the two, paired with the kettle chips it hit the spot.  For our entrees we selected the mixed grain salad (excellent vegetarian option) and it was light, but substantial enough to be a meal. The orange basil dressing is fabulous without being too sweet. I also order a side of the house smoked salmon which was incredible, best I've had, my only complaint would be the portion size, very small, but maybe my opinion is skewed because I enjoyed it so much I wanted more... We also ordered the Porkwich which was very generously portioned! Holy smokes it was large, wasn't sure how it could be maneuvered to get a bite, but we managed and thoroughly enjoyed it! Here's a tip: once you have picked up the Porkwich, don't put it down! You wont be able to arrange it properly again :) Also opted for a side of mac & cheese, it was good, and a nice departure from typical "side" offerings. Great staff from host to server! The only element missing from this picture are fabulous deserts...coming soon I hope?  All and all great new spot, next time, and there will be a next time soon, we're sitting on the patio it looks fab :)

ahktsu2POBRhBq2ZNuHILQ.text: What a pleasant surprise!  From a relaxing, eye-pleasing decor, to misted outdoor seating, to a cute little ice cream shoppe in the same building, to the clever "wall of cassettes", this place has lots of charm without overdoing the kitsch. Servers are topnotch, friendly and attentive. But the food is what won me over... these guys are onto something. In two visits my two sandwiches were both wows.. the Burger, Windsor style, is amazing with caramelized onions, a garlic aioli and cheddar on an artisan roll. There are lots of places that smother sandwiches in lots of ingredients, but they don't always work out... this one does. Today, tried the Porkwich.... was almost brought to tears by the "Tenderbelly" bacon over two other kinds of pork, cole slaw and "gold sauce" (no idea what's in the sauce but I liked it and you will too). Got mac and cheese as the side dish and it was really special, creamy and flavorful.  I will be back... again and again!

bqEngv13r-qX18Apak8rWw.text: This place has a nice vibe, but I wasn't loving my reuben sandwich that I ordered.  I would like to try it again.

L1Q3Otiih4Kq6DnrIV2KAQ.text: If your a meat eater, the Porkwhich is for you. It is the perfect blend of BBQ and burger. By far the best thing I ate while in Phoenix.

yynPAPx08tYOstRYD4tJHw.text: Overall, I had a good experience at Windsor, but it wasn't my favorite.  I love the patio.  My friend and I were there on a Sunday later afternoon, and it was pretty packed.  After I arrived, it was at least 10 minutes until the server came to get my drink order, so that kind of irked me.  Our server did get a little more attentive as the meal progressed, thankfully.  We had the corn dog appetizer to start with.  I wish the batter had been cooked just a tad bit more so that they were more crunchy, but they were still pretty good.  They also came with fried pickles, which I love.  I requested a side of ranch to use for dipping instead of the yellow mustard that came with the appetizer.  For me entree, I had the shortribs.  If shortribs are on a menu, I will almost always order that.  With this dish, the meat was cooked very well and was tasty, but there was something I didn't love about the accompaniments.  They were too earthy or something, I can't put my finger on it.  So, it was good, but not as good as I was hoping for.  I've only heard good things about Windsor from friends, so I would go back for a second time, but it's not somewhere that I'm going to put on the top of my restaurant list.

QnI-VWQg-AHLJt2Bb3m0jg.text: LOVED the Multigrain Salad (without the cheese) and my husband was blown away by the Bahn Mi. The service was speedy and kind, the iced tea is tasty, the decor was nice. We would absolutely go there again! The only draw back was how loud it was so it is not the place for an intimate meal but I suppose you can't knock them for being popular.

dVBBPT-6BzNcqC62e-M_4g.text: This is an elderly gentleman's backyard grill and resort casual cocktail party.  We got the double dip appetiser - nice, but not stunningly memorable - and I had the burger. It, too, was nice, but I cannot recall anything about it that stood out. Like a Delux burger except with decent meat was a thought that raced through my head.   Note on the menu: it's simple, focussing on salads, burgers, mac & cheese, etc. Again, elderly gentleman's backyard grill. I felt left wanting for something a tad more creative outside the appetiser section.  Service is where the ding comes - wait staff was excellent, but I was ignored for a good amount of time while waiting to be noticed to be seated, this being after I was told where to wait to be put on a list to wait to be seated (no gripes about the wait - was quick and we were offered drinks to pass the time).  The best part is by far Churn, the ice-cream shop next door (owned by the same owner). Wouldn't object to coming back, but wouldn't suggest it either.

0_45FEzt7HMA_BFURO-bEg.text: First time I went to Windsor, I wasn't impressed.  I thought the menu was kind of weird and drinks were expensive.  Ended up sharing the Smorgasbord.  It was kind of small.  The house smoked salmon was among the best smoked salmon I've had, although kale was totally burnt and there wasn't enough cheese.    Based on my love of Postino, I went back again, and mostly changed my tune.  Porkwich and crab cake blt are SO good, and you have to get the church potatoes, they're unreal.  Drinks are delicious but still expensive.  Plus the space is hip, the bathrooms are cool, the wall of tapes is super rad, and the ice cream next door at Churn is amazing.  Salted caramel please!  Parking can be tight. Also... come on Windsor (and Postinos) - who can make it to Happy Hour before 5pm???  Please push to 6pm!!!

QeBDf9HkDe0iVAdTdayWWw.text: The reviews accurately convey the general vibe and food at Windsor. There was a small, but lively bar area and both indoor and outdoor seating for diners. It's dark inside...that seemed a bit extreme after sunset. The fondue is great. I loved the pretzel bread that came with it. The side street (Central Ave) sneaks up on you...so be on the lookout--especially if you are going there after dark!

kYKFuoLuB7jkoAAjK49sfA.text: Dined here this past Friday night... We showed up a little past 8pm and were seated right away, and as if that weren't lucky enough we got a great table on their charming lil patio. I had high expectations for this place as the owners here are the same as my beloved Postino's. The food was great and did not disappoint. Their wine menu contained great options and the food menu contained alot of unique dishes, which I dig. I chose the mixed grain salad which was perfect, seasonally fresh items which all blended very nicely. The boyfriend had their burger and mac and cheese which I could tell he genuinely enjoyed, which is not easily accomplished. We passed on dessert this time, but I've had a Churn red-velvet ice cream sandwich before and it was uhhhmazing! We will definitely be returning here soon! (:

C1clKr0ehKg5SZn2EYO3gQ.text: This restaraunt is Postinos cousin, and seeing as how I love Postinos I went in with high hopes. The staff is nice and attractive, just like at Postinos, but the food lacks a central theme and left a lot to be desired. The music was an odd compliation and at times I thought someone might be playing a 'mixed tape' from the early 90's. The volume of the music was adjusted up and down all evening. The full bar is appreciated but the wine is all 'on tap'- so the red wine comes out cold. Also there is not a pinot grigio on the wine list simply a white 'blend' (no thanks!) The prices of food and drink at the Windsor were higher than those at Postino, and I think next time I head out I will just travel a little further South on Central and go to Postinos.

cK91MG1hAFnxlDqDZQQLbw.text: Get the ribs and go home fat and happy! Also, the atmosphere is top notch and the server was attentive and fun during our dinner, which always adds to the experience. I will certainly be back and perhaps will pick up some treats from church , which is located next door.

PZ1FNhfTRkGw_WrVLg7BLg.text: First visit was a few weeks back. I was highly impressed with the space but than again Postino family does me no wrong.  We ordered a watermelon cocktail - It was eh. ($9) and the loaded potatoes as an app. They had bleu cheese, onions, and bacon on them and were handmade cut potato chips. Huge portion! got stuffed and decided to share a burger with the hubby. The burger was juicy and med-rare just how I wanted it. We got a side of church potatoes which were creamy delicious potatoes almost like a gratin. I had a glass of wine which they are all on tap here. It was okay..Definately wanna go back and try some other food options such as the Crabcake BLT and halibut Banh Mi.

ai9-iM4eT4HCpwBu9C9ZJw.text: Had brunch here and I was impressed. Service was attentive and efficient and the food was excellent. We will be back!

3BdFwh0l7O7Npo0UqrYnSw.text: The restaurant was loud - difficult to hear and speak with your guests.  Service was not very good - had to ask multiple times for a beer.  Food was over salted.  Kale chips were atrocious.  But the decor was nice and would probably be a good place for a glass of wine.  We did not try the salads so we can't weigh in but our overall experience was disappointing.

An1bFoAcwdTIOEcB25Anrg.text: We eat out several times a week. The Windsor has fresh, delicious food, the service is fast, the wait staff knowledgeable. Our last visit, I had a bunless chicken sandwich and kale salad, my husband, the eggs Benedict. Everything was excellent, but the egg dish was cold. When asked how everything was, the server took the price of the egg dish off our bill-very good customer relations, that will keep us coming back. The place blasts music way too loudly, but there is a quiet patio out back.

POvxi64uEaM-uAk8sLDRQQ.text: Friends and I had lunch at Windsor last week and were wow'd by the delish food! ...but let's talk drinks first! $5 pitchers (roughly 2.5 beers) from 11-5 - HECK YES! Ok now onto food. I had a burger windsor style - soooooo tasty and the burger was cooked perfectly. For my side I had mac and cheese which was a nice original version with more of a white cheddar base and bread crumbs - also yum! Everyone enjoyed their food and the ambience was nothing sort of trendy/hipster - a great place to catch up with friends! I'd highly recommend Windsor :)

lRGGP07ObByn6DFqI-NWNQ.text: One of the best burgers in town by far, make sure you get tender belly bacon on it though!  church potatoes are easily the best side, ask for them off the griddle!  and always walk next door to churn and get some ice cream.  great place for kids.  and if you go you must you must order the cheddar fondue with pretzels, they are ridiculous good.

T4RSpY4W3xiVxKBrVMmIqg.text: I was excited to try Windsor since I'm such a huge fan of Postino, and didn't know what to expect. I ordered the corn dog poppers as an appetizer and the burger as my entree. The sandwich was satisfying and what I expected, and I am looking forward to getting one of Windsor's signature cocktails when I go back. They have a nice open patio I plan on enjoying this summer with bigger groups of people, and Churn next door looks amazing.

caoAXXtCTTSLHnduT3i-Ew.text: We tried this place out after receiving a free appetizer coupon.  The restaurant is bigger than I thought.  We were seated promptly after arriving at 4:30 and learned that it was happy hour until 5:00 with $5.00 drinks, wine and beer.  We ordered two appetizers, ( I cannot remember the name of the appetizer) cheese/meat/veggie and also the pretzel fondue, which included pretzels, apples and kielbasa.  Both were excellent and filling - I had the cucumber drink and my husband had the watermelon drink (very refreshing!).  Excellent service and food - the only negative for some may be that it is very loud!  - Not a place for a romantic meal - if that is something you are looking for try - Aiello's across the street.

riuGkKBrOU_ErsG0qvxeng.text: Brown bag chicken sammich, mac n cheese, fried okra, and the bourbon drink.  Nuff said.

LYNI8FG1ddQIp9VDobkRNw.text: Windsor is one of my favorite happy hour places. The drinks are great! I love the #89! So yummy! The foods good, too. Nothing super fancy, amazing kale salad.

IvRCQ4GJ8cNiTViN3BdkoQ.text: Best Mac-n-cheese I've ever had. Plus, they have shorty's of draft beer for lightweights like me.

IgtnYxBj83UXgvnZjKYxLA.text: I met a friend here for brunch and it was absolutely delicious.  I highly recommend the Matador.  Things I would never have thought of to combine but it was absolutely delicious.  They also have a great bloody mary bar for only $5.  I would highly highly recommend this place. You can sit indoors or out.  They have misters so even in the heat it didn't feel that bad.  The servers were attentive but not in your face so we were able to sit and talk without feeling like we were being pushed out.    Parking is difficult but they do have a free valet.

0vuwCM9Fuo4rAC9TXjWKWg.text: My fiance stopped in at Windsor last night for a little happy hour and a snack. $5 wine, beer and cocktails for happy hour, so it's a good deal. Friendly service and I loved the ambiance, especially the old cassette tapes glued to the back wall. I had the chicken sandwich and kale salad. Tasty. My fiance had the pork sandwich with the fried okra. Superb! We will definitely be back!

wZbPgT_Ez5u_II-6W4TWeA.text: Another great time at Windsor.  Sat at the bar since there was a wait for a table.  All the bartenders were friendly and helpful.  The menu items are all unique.  You could easily create a great tapas style meal with their appetizers alone.  But their salad and reuben always get me.

ohukUWeeukU1J1SSR8Y-mg.text: Thank you LGO! Not only do I have Postino Central but now the Windsor and Churn in CenPho! Not much in variety for vegetarians/vegans but the food and drink are great. I really love how they have transformed the space/architecture and I understand that they are going to have a rotating menu... The fried okra is delish! More of a bar than a restaurant, expect a long wait on Friday nights for a table, but that's as to be expected anywhere. Love The Windsor. "Drinking wine at lunch is not a crime" and I completely agree ;) Become an e-posee member and you will get coupon specials emailed to you!

No2UF3XZxRrvfh8koLMJcQ.text: This place never disappoints me.  My sister introduced me to this spot, and she usually has the best advice.  I normally get the Veggie Stack with a kale salad and french fries.  Mmmmmmm.  So yummy.  The menu is a lil eclectic...from fried okra (when was the last time you saw fried okra on the menu and you weren't in the south) to a modified version of banh mi (vietnamese sandwich).  I have tried both, the banh mi is just okay.  Love love love this place though.

gqeo6EiNFzpB-w4CIeXEdw.text: Love the location (not the parking but thats a lot of places in phoenix). Yummy cocktails and the fattoush salad was a delight. Snuck a bite of my friend's side mac and cheese and it tasted like something I would want to eat every day for the rest of my life. Great service, cool atmosphere.

CnpWgWW_hgAWS9ovKxKApA.text: I really like this place!!!!  For a number of reasons, friendly service, excellent ambience with a trendy, comfortable feel, good food and a great bar to sit and just be friendly.  We ordered the Greek appetizer, which is very common in many places, but the presentation of this one, made it quite different from the rest.  On the bottom was hummus, topped with traditional Greek style cucumber, tomato with light olive oil dressing, and a side of Tzazitki and pita.  Unique and quite good.  More pita would have been nice.  For lunch we ordered the Porkwich, recommended by the waitress and a side of the Mac and Cheese. The sandwich was delcious, but the Mac and cheese lacked "punch" and I was not wowed by it.  I'll save that for the Tuck Shop next time.  We also ordered the ribs and they were tender, tasty and really had a nice unique flavor.  We had a side of the potatoes and OMG, they were delicious.  I really wanted to try the Crab Cake BLT and will definitely do that next time.  The best part...CHURN.  I love how it is connected to the restaurant and you can get an entirely different experience at the same location.  We had a pricey "create your own" sundae and enjoyed it on the beautiful patio with misters outside.  It was very nice to be able to leave the restaurant, but not and enjoy an outdoor experience with ice cream in 105 degrees and feel very comfortable.   Enjoy!

7lvE8KhoMVZekomcuonE7w.text: From the get go service was exceptional. We were offered drinks while waiting for our table. Once seated, our drink orders were taken and someone came by to make sure that we were able to get our orders in. Servers were friendly and quick with the beer! Very nice, rustic ambiance. One of our party ordered short ribs and a sandwich came instead. The waitress apologized for putting the order in wrong and let us keep the sandwich! I ordered the apple brandy cocktail and it was amazing! Not too sweet. For dinner we ordered the white fish bon mi and brown bag chicken sandwich with Mac and cheese and sweet potato fries. The fries were sweet and salty, with what seems to be house made ketchup. The Mac and cheese needed pepper. The bon mi has refreshing. Not served on a French roll, but definitely something I would get again. The chicken sandwich is a cold sandwich, filled with nuts and fruit... Delicious. I was blown away when I went to the restroom and there was a line... The employees in line let me cut ahead! The music played was hip/alternative; added to the environment. We don't give 5 stars often, but this place deserved it! We wish we had come before 5pm... 5$ cocktails, wine, and beer pitchers.

nzb4faI7-A71ccatfGU_uA.text: 85 reviews in three months...not surprised as this place is teh bomb.    Only been once (so will need to update again when I try more of the food) but loved the BLT crab cake sandwich and side of mac and cheese.  I love crab cakes and mac & cheese and both were just the right balance.  Mac & Cheese was not greasy, not overly breaded, just the right blend of cheesy with the crispy toping.  Crab cake were cooked juuuuuust right, not too much breading, just the right ratio.  Both of these items are good when done well, and dissapointing when not.  Windsor did them perfectly  Everything on the menu sounded good.  The bartenders and hosts were super friendly/accomodating and not in an annoying way.

F6lcf5YnCxMzLbG6MOuNuw.text: I really enjoy the atmosphere and the food here. 2 problems with lunch today - flies were extremely prevalent and on numerous occasions our waitress forgot requests (lemons for water, straw for water, box for leftovers). Granted they were busy and the food was outstanding (kale caesar with chicken + grille dchicken sandwich), but I felt like the cleanliness couldve been kept up better and the attention to detail for the service was lacking. With that being said... i'll probably be back.

OwL6HZf5R9Zmk8HlkzLngg.text: Windsor, the newest addition to the Demarco list of hip places in the Valley (until Gilbert Postino opens next to Liberty Market).   Not that I know anything about classic cocktails, but I've begun to dive into this new revival of old school, classic beverages. Winsdor has a great take on this new trend, and does the "pub food" to match. I've been to Windsor a handful of times, had every cocktail on the menu and I've also tried a few of the beers and wines. My favorite cocktail is the No. 35. The combination of scotch, St. Germain and lemon has an incredible balance and is an easy and strong drink. The wines at Windsor are all on tap (a new trend in New York and California). I am a fan of the wines on tap, for the price, quality and the amount of waste (nearly zero) that the restaurant has on such a drink. The food at Windsor is a little more than elevated bar food. My fiancee and I love getting the Russian Roulettes for a bar snack, which consists of roasted green peppers. Most are mild, but you'll get that one that has a bite! For a little heftier of a plate we will share the Smorgasbord which has a house cured salmon, white bean dip, cheese, nuts, etc. Those two are perfect for an afternoon of cocktails and snacks.  Like Postino, they offer glasses of wine, pitchers of beer and specialty cocktails for only $5 before 5pm.   Some people like the vibe and decor, others seem to think it's a little too cliche. I think the decor and design is excellent. Small aspects remind me of Postino and stick with the Demarco way of restaurant design. However, some of the themes are reminiscent of the vintage cocktail revival and reminds me of the craft cocktail bar, Craft & Commerce in souther California.  Overall, this is a great place for a casual and quiet afternoon snack and libation. If it wasn't 35 miles from my house you could probably find me there a couple of times a week.  Nice job Craig, and staff. Keep up the great work and I look forward to seeing Postino Gilbert open in the beginning of the year.

-0YjUps3lRK5zcyMULk4cA.text: Love this place! Went here later in the evening with some friends. Had great service, AMAZING pulled pork sandwich, cool wine on tap and a neat decoration of cassette tapes on the wall. Looking forward to going back to try the little ice cream restaurant connected to Windsor.

KHsQYYko9SrkQAL-NJCuZQ.text: Stopped by for lunch over the weekend with some friends visiting from out of town. Pitchers of craft beer for $7 and tasty fried pickles as appetizers. My friends ordered the "Porkwich" and they could not stop raving on the quality of sandwich. I ordered the Pastrami Reuben and was impressed by the quality of the meat, the fresh ingredients and delicious roll. I would definitely go back and try more of the menu.

_PLTq-q6eFhSNxxGI_eCrg.text: Great atmosphere n delicious food. We sat outside under heaters on a cool 50* Sunday afternoon. I had the brown bag chicken salad sandwich which was very good and the best Mac n cheese ever - thin layer creamy inside with great crusted top - I'd go back just for that!  Hubby had big n delicious cheese burger with yummy Carmalized onions. All 5 of us cleared our plates n shared pastrami sand, Windsor burger n sweet potato fries n salmon salad - all thoroughly enjoyed. Tops on our list.

K9dXdIuURAjvNHzLQG7tCA.text: Was there recently with a friend from out of town. Great place, except for the waitress who kept bending over at tables and making the several older couples sitting near us super uncomfortable with next to nothing on under her super short dress. I felt bad for the couples. It was super awkward. One couple made comments out loud and left because it continued. Was disappointing.

fo4xTQS_0_taQXDpATpuOA.text: Another one of my favorite spots in Central Phoenix! Windsor is close to my sister's place so she took us here a while back. We have since been back many times after that! Windsor is super classy and has great food for a great price. I have to say they have one of the best fries, cut skinny and made super crispy. I'm a big lover of french fries so that says a lot! I usually share a Backyard Burger with the hubs and we've had it both the classic style and windsor style and both are worth ordering! You really can't beat $5 pitchers for their happy hour, but if it's not happy hour they're still only like $7! I always go for the hoegaarden but they have a great selection.The mac and cheese is crazy good too, I would recommend giving it a try! On a side note, they have great coffee and the ambiance is freakin romantic. Great date night spot!

lPhqUms5gvsNKCVP5GObcA.text: Moving from LA to PHX, I was hoping I'd be able to find some great restaurants here that would help me miss the food of LA a little less.  I heard Windsor and Churn were opening up and I always love to check out a new place, especially when it is owned by someone with a good track record. When we pulled up I knew I was in love.  It's the ambiance and atmosphere of a restaurant that gives you a certain feel, a certain experience. Between the friendly and stylish staff, the people, the stung lights on the patio, and the wooden benches surrounded by catci pots they nailed it. The wall of cassette tapes and the saying son the walls were also a great touch. Our wait on a Fri night was surprisingly short and we had a cocktail waitress take care of us in the meantime. The drinks are kind of expensive but the No. 11 was tasty enough to warrant the price tag.  My boyfriend and I got a great seat on the patio. Privacy. We shared a kale caesar salad. Usually won cannot be all too wowed by a salad but damn was this good. What a long way a clever idea like cheddar croutons can go. Then we split a the brown bag chicken sandwich with friend okra. Tasty. A perfect amount of food for a meal, you know the portions everywhere but American serves? lol.  Everything was great and going next door to eat Banana ice cream from Churn was the cherry on top. Cheers to your success.

SFaK7GOHcsqCOlnBRe1giw.text: North Central Phoenix is filled with lots of mom and pop type eclectic type restaurants and since I am not a fan of any chain style restaurants I always love to check out new places that I haven't been.  This place is great, indoor/outdoor patio, healthy menu, nice wine and beer list, reasonable prices and superb service.  I had the kale and quinoa salad and it was outstanding!

PN9nPzcOfCwm7zf0ioS_LA.text: Visited Windsor last night for the 1st time.  Excellent!  LOVE THIS PLACE!  It's got a good urban bistro atmosphere.  Seating inside or out.  It was Friday a little after 5:00 p.m. and the place was packed.  The wait for a table wasn't long and both the bartender and server were very good.  Our beers (Stella Artois on draft) were cold and refreshing.  We started with the loaded chips with bacon and they were so darn tasty!  I had the brown bag chicken sandwich since someone here on Yelp recommended it (thanks Jessica W.).  Sandwich was large and the chicken was so tender.  My side was kale salad (never had kale salad before but now I'm hooked).  Husband had the crab cake sandwich.  He said it was excellent and his cole slaw was the best!  I CAN'T WAIT to go back!  Good job Windsor . . . see you soon.  Did I mention you can eat at the bar?  Good place for people watching and you can also see the chefs hustling back in the kitchen.

-eQXleri5ivOtdodpNum-g.text: Birthday brunch with Mom. Was absolutely fantastic. Toasted with a cava and aperol spritzer. Mom had crab cakes eggs benedict, which I had to beg for a bite of...super yummy. For me (and was even gluten free) the "Matador" two eggs over easy stacked with super crispy tortillas and cheesy potatoes, smothered with salsa verde...delicious!! Service was great, weather was beautiful and even ran into two of my favorite friends. Great experience all around.

iyBFLbWZ426Xa7XZzVZE4w.text: Food is good not amazing. But the customer service there is awesome. I don't go here often but when i do the bartenders always remember what I drink. That kind of service makes up for the kinda plain food.

zrVj_xzPgQlD40DZ2lvBYA.text: This is the second time we've been here and this experience was a bit better than the first. The first time we went, both of our dishes were mediocre. This time, I got the crab cake BLT and the boyfriend got the burger. Both tasted really good (especially the burger) but the crab cake BLT left my stomach feeling a bit uneasy for the rest of the night.  The side roasted veggies were also tasty, but the fries could be better.  They were a little too hard for our taste.   The atmosphere is great and the staff friendly. Maybe we'll try again sometime and get the burger again.

uDmhcQ_EdBSTujax7-uPHw.text: Windsor is a fun, lively bar/restaurant with a great vibe and good food, all at a reasonable price.  We started out with drinks at the bar while we waited for a table.  Our bartender was great though the drink options were limited.  Frankly I found the cocktail listing confusing with some odd numbered nomenclature instead of standard drink names.    we started out with the kale chips that seem to be popular.  They were just ok.  Kale doesn't exactly make a good chip so it seems like a misnomer.  There wasn't a whole lot of flavor - just a papery texture and salt.  They were worth a try, but I'm more interested in some of their other appetizers next time.   My date and I both had difficulty narrowing our dinner selections because so many sound so good.  He got the halibut sandwich with fried okra while I got the country vegetable chopped salad.  Both were fantastic.  We both appreciated the use of fresh, local ingredients and the attention paid to flavor without overdoing it.  The halibut sandwich had the perfect balance of cilantro and a spicy sambol mayo to make it not your ordinary fish sandwich.    We loved the decor - cozy, not too loud, unpretentious.  Service from the hostess to bar to table service was attentive, friendly, and fast.  The music was fun, and we had a good time trying to figure out how old we were when some songs came on - a nice walk down memory lane.  Definitely will be back to Windsor to experiment with their menu.

geIlw4a6SbLsNgZ5VKHLZg.text: Sammy G!!!! Best service eveeeeeeerrrrrrrr!  Great atmosphere, better food, and the friendliest people. Also, the cocktail list never fails and nor do the daily vegetables.  See you all again soon :-)

lXTEbLIr5ovSQkLp2cE0ug.text: Fantastic patio. Spacious with private tables and beautiful mixture of brick and foliage. True to all Upward Project creations, the decor and overall vibe are top-notch. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They apparently do some sort of team serving (or at least that's how I was treated during a weekday happy hour). This is fine because we never had to wait to order another round or anything like that, but at the same time, I was never sure who to flag down, or who the tip was going to, etc.  The fondue pretzel appetizer is pretty good, but not spectacular. It's served with apple and sausage which is a bonus. Great fondue is simply hard to come by. The kale Caesar salad and veggie stack sandwich, however, were absolutely to die for. Delicious.   The biggest issue: I felt pressured into ordering a second drink. And by pressured I mean the waitress told me she had rang in another drink for me before happy hour was over... Typically this wouldn't be a big deal but 1. I hadn't asked, and 2. I explicitly said I didn't want to drink because I had work to do that night...so it put me off a bit. Aside from that, the experience was great and I'll definitely be back.

AYSp43aZKk6bSj9ckhx5zA.text: Windsor is as good as it gets. Great design, great atmosphere, great service and great food.   The place is very cool. It has a square, horseshoe style bar in the center of the restaurant. These are always the best designed bars. Great for comfort, for conversation and people watching.  One of their walls is full of old cassette tapes. Very cool idea.   The owners of Postino own Windsor. They obviously know a lot about the business, because they did an amazing job with Postinos. And one of the best things about Windsor is it is nothing at all like Postino, yet another amazing job.   I love the healthy menu. Lots of vegitarian choices, and salads.  I have tried the Kale salad, Grain Salad, the Vegitarian Stack.  All great, fresh ingredients.  I also love that they offer some small bar snacks. These are great salty items, that are good to offer people while sitting at the bar.  Another thing I love is they have wine by the glass on tap. This is great for a glass of wine, if your not sharing a bottle. And it helps the environment.   The staff is  very friendly, and well trained. They have remembered me the few times I have been there. Which always makes me feel welcome. Windsor is by far one of my new favorite hot spots in the neighborhood.

cvyo7lD6jlLpRcM6sx_VWQ.text: Across the street from Postino, next-door to Churn - downtown's answer to ice cream after many years without (been talking about this forever!).  Saturday's happy hour included $5 draft pitchers of craft beers, including seasonals from across the country - this pleased me.  Happy hour had no food specials, but no real complaints there, honestly.  Loaded chips are seriously loaded with taste.
