Chicken sandwich looked delicious, and I was happy to see a fresh made bun/roll that WASN'T egg washed - sheesh.  Tons of seating, in or out, or at the bar.  Hip music the entire visit, as with servers / staff.  Valet in the back, as with bike parking/racks.  This place says, "Phoenix *is* a food city.  Recognize us!".

_lYkNoseFxWHuZde2DT2oA.text: Decent food but the drinks are yummy. Only before 5pm because the prices rise sharply afterwards.

OZflxF2YazjAu8y1hUUocQ.text: Great ambiance and good beers on draft  that are reasonably price, which has made me want to like this place. Went the first time and tried the loaded chips, which were pretty good.  Second time we had cebiche and a fish and chips sandwich, and I thought that they were very basic..nothing good about them.  My friend had some other plate that he didn't think very highly off either.    I thought of not going back to Windsor (as much as I love that cassette wall)  when I got their email with the free ribs offer during August and decided to try those.  I finally found what I need to eat when I go there.  Those ribs were delicious...some of the best I've ever had.  The mac and cheese, which I got as a side, was very good as well.   So, the ambiance and beers make this place good. The food, other than the ribs, is not much to write home about...at least from what we've tried.

jh4mkEK9ORqDCA4ohMtOog.text: I wanted to love Windsor because we love Postino. But, there's a different vibe even though it's right across the street.  Service is more flippant and dismissive, the seating options are either too sunny (and hot) outside or too dark (and freezing) inside.  blueberry lemonade is a great concept, but strain the blueberry skins out....nothing like a straw-full to keep you from enjoying your drink. loaded chip app with caramelized onions, bacon and blue cheese could have been amazing, if chips weren't greasy and overdone. the pastrami reuben was good (wet, but good) but not anything out of the ordinary.  chicken salad sandwich was a unique mix of chicken, avocado, nuts and sundried tomatoes but it just seemed like it was trying to hard.  odd service...went from friendly waitress to unfriendly waitress to other food and drink deliverers who had no idea who ordered what.

yuPGcZ4s6kTqSvv6Ehguuw.text: Great, fun, local place.  We went with a party of four on a Saturday night, and the wait wasn't too long.  It was a bit hard to find a parking spot, and you definitely have to watch the signs on the local streets to make sure you're parking in an unrestricted spot.    The bar was great fun, with a good selection of craft beers, reasonably priced.  After about 30 minutes, we were seated in a cozy, corner booth.  The service was amazing, with several people consistently stopping by to make sure everything was attended to.  We ordered: Backyard Burger with Fried Okra Bacon Cheeseburger with Kale Salad Crab Cake BLT with Mac & Cheese Pastrami Reuben with Jo's Church Potatoes  Everything was delicious and prepared as ordered.  The burgers were booth cooked perfectly and they got the bacon nice and crispy which is always a plus in my book.  The fried okra (one of my favorite sides) was awesome.  Nice and crunchy and not so salty like a lot of places like to serve it. We will definitely be going back to this one.

h6GLxJyTD8R1fDOiRFjEnA.text: This place was very comfortable with some great food and wine.  The food we had was delicious, and service was always prompt.  Don't think my water glass ever got under half full as many times as someone would walk by and top things good.  The appetizer menu of various dressed chips is well worth an order.  Anything else on the menu for a entree is probably going to be a good choice.

zgaYnEZccQA79C8miG7ePQ.text: Place was phenomenal! Really liked the vibe here.. really chill.. with great 90s hip hop. Dim lighting which was good for a date lol.. the outdoor section was so amazing.. really like the decor.  Now the food, me oh my.. we all had sandwiches.. and I must say we were pleasantly satisfied! The brown paper bag grilled chicken salad sandwich was really good but the chicken was cold which is understandable.. but I didn't like that part too much.. however, the goat cheese and avocado in it was everything and it made the sandwich! My husband had the bacon cheddar burger, and the bacon was a nice thick cut and crisp, really yummy! Also, I really love French fries (I know.. nobody usually comments on fries lol) but their fries were perfect! Thin cut, crispy and just the right amount of salt! Lol. The mac and cheese was "alright" but I've had better. Overall.. I'd def come back, but will be sure to have a full wallet.. it's kinda pricey..

smjNK2bI6_LrjO_y8vujCA.text: Oh my goodness, the food here in incredible! Not to mention their fabulous, dog friendly patio!! My boyfriend and I wanted to soak up our beautiful AZ weather with the pooch and hadn't been here so we gave it a shot! I ordered the brown bag chicken salad sandwich and it was phenomenal! Different than your average chicken salad sandwich, in a good way! Avocado, goat cheese and hazelnuts? Yes, please! I got a side salad with it that was tossed in an amazing mustard-y vinaigrette! We also shared a side of their house made chips which are a must! My boyfriend got the pastrami reuben and holy heaven, it was MASSIVE! But amazing. From 11 AM - 5 PM everyday, they have $5 pitchers of beer (not just any beer, GOOD beer!), cocktails & wine! If you have guests in town, this would be the perfect place to take them!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $5 pitchers of beer until 5 PM everyday!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami Reuben
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House made chips!

SHzztkfUBDlQj-ER3rPxwA.text: Loved this place!  There's a nice hip vibe here.  The grilled chicken sandwich was loaded with flavor.  The buttermilk bun was not too much bun, the jalapeno mayo was not overpowering, there were chunks of mango, and the chicken was juicy and delicious!  I had the macaroni and cheese as my side - it was nice and crispy on the top, it had a nice bake and a nice white cheese, it left me wanting more.  Our waitress was awesome - I loved how she sat down next to me to take my order - it was a personal touch!  The blackberry lemonade was not too sweet - it was all pretty perfect, and I loved the atmosphere outside on the patio - lots of coverage from the sun, it felt great!  I want to try the iced cream place next door next time - Churn.

xCuUef4BdHoWdYN7NyoNCQ.text: The Moscow Mule was tasty! Food was good but not memorable. Nice location, friendly young adult atmosphere.

1W3QZhTPlLCQix9Libs50g.text: Highly reccommend.  Very friendly service and great atmosphere.  They do have outdoor seating as well.  Plenty of parking and prompt service.  Very fair prices as well and some nice drink specials.   I had their Bacon Burger.  Made perfectly and crispy strips of bacon.  Good solid 1/2 patty.  Had their Mac and Cheese and it was great!  Highly recommend for lunch!

IzXdwnY8MVCDv3oEC5a1oQ.text: Tried Windsor for the first time and will definitely be back. Great food and service and can't beat the $5 cocktails. Our waitress was very helpful.

o5JcHUI60tdDQCeIHEgOlA.text: The food and ambiance here is unmatched. Fun, inviting, well put together menus, and brunch is amazing. Our food was fresh and fast and tasty. The drinks are different and fun and the service is courteous and knowledgeable.  Jacob is the best in the server biz, welcoming and charming. He makes this place worth coming back to.  Thanks for a great start to my Sunday. Five stars.

SPOcftd1qKoySUzv8j9rPQ.text: Seriously delicious food & cute atmosphere!! However, the menu is pretty limited. The surrounding area is great. Churn is right next store for some delicious treats after your meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bacon cheeseburger. Yum!

-RvO-saAqh-o7RAnUt0lXg.text: Atmosphere is nice. Sat inside, patio was full. Low light romantic atmosphere. Had loaded chips wasn't bad not spectacular. Had a burger. It was ok. I asked the others with us to help on this rating. My personal would be a 3.5 they stated 4. My wife liked her meal, well it was a starter the Ahi poke.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interesting decor. Wall of cassette tapes.

PYfeqjuVLA86UkUR3e1ZeA.text: I had some friends visit and we decided to check this place out for dinner. The atmosphere was great and the service was good. I got the veggie stack and it was excellent - huge portions too, I couldn't finish it. One friend ordered sweet potato fries and the other got the porkwich and they both loved their meals. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Stack

NemuQLUvN8mpLR7CVvKIEQ.text: The staff was very friendly and patient with my parents and I. It was our first time coming here on a week night so we had a lot of questions.  I ordered the Crab Cake BLT because they were out of the fresh fish of the day. Bummer. The crab cake BLT came with jumbo lump crab cakes with Tender Belly bacon, lettuce, tomato & whole grain mustard remoulade. It was pretty good but the crab was a very small amount. I eat a lot lol I ordered the mac and cheese as my side. It was decent.   My dad ordered the Picnic Kebobs which came with hicken, pork, shrimp, & mixed veggie with spicy pepper dip, gold sauce & grilled pita. He said it was a perfect amount of food for him since he eats light meals. He enjoyed it.  My mom ordered the Backyard Burger Classic Style which came with sharp cheddar, lettuce, tomato, onion & pickle and she got a side of french fries. Her meal was AMAZING! The burger was juice and full of flavor. The fries were nice and crispy.  I like the atmosphere of Windsor, the decorations, and the staff. The food had a pretty nice variety but not my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab cake BLT with Mac and cheese
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kabobs!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Backyard burger with fries!

t_GgSEGxVM2XX5lURKL2FA.text: I have not been to a spot this cool in a minute. The decor, customer service and attentiveness of the staff, the very delicious food and theeee perfect cup of coffee makes this place the perfect neighborhood hot spot for good food and conversation. I'd love to see this in North Mesa. I will definitely be back and highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FLlOMT-W6yl6z44bQ8zPrA.text: Cute restaurant with a great patio and awesome ice cream shop right next door. The food is a little pricey, but once you dig in, it's worth every penny. Fantastic happy hour every day till 5pm - $5 signature cocktails and pitchers of draft beer (which serve two pint glasses). They had me at pet friendly. So many lovely dogs out on the patio. It's nice to find a place that allows your well behaved fur baby, great happy hour and yummy food!

2bgSXa2EQA0h9j_Uu1MMlQ.text: Windsor is always banging food wise and banging musically with their selection of tunes . Great drinks and happy hour drink specials.Been coming here since they opened and haven't stopped its my family's go to neighborhood spot. Its my daughters birthday tonight! Renae and the whole staff are super awesome make you feel welcomed to be their. One of he best local spots in Phoenix and visit churn Ice cream next door.

fRjVkJFDPdF2a_teEjC5TQ.text: Drove by last month so decided to try it out. All I can say is Amazing!!! Service was also amazing, great atmosphere. Looks to be in an historic building. All food was great flavor and well worth the price. We also had cheeseburger, hamburger and fish sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab cake sandwich and kale salad

xeY4x1YR9-6dWGLhw7FwdQ.text: Went with a group for brunch. Service was fast, friendly and fun! Food and drinks were amazing. We shared beignets and cinnamon rolls at the table - cinnamon roll is HUGE and one of the best I've ever had - not too doughy or cakey, very rich and decadent, soooo delish. The beignets were incredible and could certainly stand up to a plate from Cafe Dumonde - and their salted caramel dipping sauce?? Omg... I had the egg man sandwich which was sooo tasty as well - really great siraccha aioli on a delicious brioche bun with egg, bacon, tomato, spinach and sprouts and these cheddar potatoes that were out of this world. Several others in our group had the biscuits and gravy which they loved and a few others had eggs Benedict that they chewed down on as well. Cocktails were fabulous to boot! I had the number 02 which was a perfect blend of all of the flavors as described and not too sweet. The number 45 was a hit at our table too along with the Bloody Mary bar. Wowza. This place rocks!!! Wish I lived here so I could go back regularly!!

iHsB98mcAwZT-7PIt0FVPA.text: I wish I could give 0 stars.  Came back for happy hour again and this time the service was god awful! Someone sent me a "compliment" saying the pull their tips together bunny I'm a server and I know how that works but you'd think 3 servers and 2 hostesses would be able to get me water without having to wait 10 mins bf the another 20 before I ever see the server again. NEVER COMING BACK!

qKQV-0WoFDLJqI9aIisnHw.text: I'm not a hipster and I don't drink alcohol, but I still like this place.  It's a favorite for meeting friends for lunch.  Service is SUPER friendly and competent.  Food is good!  I not a stickler for all rules, but I did see something during my last visit that was of concern.  A patron sat on the (dog friendly) patio.  She and her dog shared a bench seat and, with the dog, took up two tables.  The dog owner enjoyed her cocktail and lunch while her K9 companion (I don't think it was a "service dog") cuddled and were admired by the staff.   According to Maricopa County Health Code, a "Dog Friendly" patio is allowed, but the dog must stay on a leash, on the ground, not on the seating, in the lap, or near the table top containing food and reusable serving ware.  I suggest the management of Windsor familiarize themselves and their staff of these Health Code rules.  Thanks!

7a1dgXJQlLDumZyX4EZXgA.text: Visited on a Friday with a friend. We started with the hummus, which was the best I've ever tasted. I had a salad and my friend had the kabobs..both delicious.  The drinks were tasty. We got there right before happy hour ended so our waitress (Hills)put a couple drinks "on hold" at the happy hour price for us which was cool. This place is one of my new faves!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delish salad..can&#39;t remember the name of it

Q6zk5XpSLGYM46k2VISQvg.text: This place is amazing! The atmosphere is fantastic and the food is incredible. Great service, couldn't have asked for a better experience! I would highly recommend this restaurant. If I could give 10 stars I would!

FxpZ2Gby7BXpIv5kT96Meg.text: Really very disappointed. I travel for work, and I'm always looking for good places to put on my regular list. Windsor will not be one of those places.   Went on a Monday night. Parking is easy. I entered from the back of the restaurant, which is a poorly designed entry. It's dark, and you can't really see the painted logo on the door. When I get in, there's no hostess area that I can find. A waiter stopped me and found me a table. Definitely more of a bar, not a restaurant.   I came here specifically for the fried chicken. Im a sucker for good fried chicken!  I ordered a hard cider (they only have one, and none on tap), fried chicken, mac and cheese. The cider was fine, a little dry for my taste. The fried chicken appears to be skin on, which is a plus. Unfortunately, the flavor was lacking at best. I think they're brining the chicken, because the meat was juicy and had a good flavor, but the breading was flavorless. It also seems like they fried it too hot, because there was a definite burnt flavor. The mac and cheese was also very disappointing. It tasted like just mac, almost no cheese. Maybe it was just a very mild cheese?  Zero creaminess. The biscuit was fine, but again, lacking flavor.   The service was good, so not a one star review.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burnt fried chicken with no flavor. Mac and cheese tastes like just plain mac. Not awesome.

o2-y6PUM82P8HJzL0gZyYQ.text: We came back to give this place another try. We've been coming here for years and my experience here seems to get worse Every time! We came in just for cocktails and this time around I had several pieces of long hair in my cocktail. The Windsor is  just not the same any more.

3Xd0Z20slShYyqGEZClM5w.text: Loved this place when it first opened ..... But stopped for breakfast this morning and was underwhelmed with the taste of everything   Bloody Mary was watered down and aweful   Bacon was cold , overcooked and lacked any flavor   The Sausage Gravy was bland no pizazz w chedder biscuits that were over powered w the sharp cheddar cheese    Service was Good , Atomsphere was nice ....Food was disappointing and overpriced for what it delivered .....

QbYDTtpOBzRcfBYikiTbEw.text: This is our all time favorite neighborhood restaurant/bar. The service is great and the food is delicious! Oh and the patio is pet friendly and misted/cool in the summer!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio rose and a fattoush salad with my husband on Father&#39;s Day!

Ghq5Tvs6PzVOVLj5lBuDZA.text: Turns out this place is minutes from my home.  I didn't catch this but The breakfast food is on weekends only.  No worries.  The wait staff was all over us.  Excellent.  The food itself didn't take too long to get to us.  Basically we ordered two cheesburgers, their chips and two cofee's.  $60.00 with tip.  Good damn burgers rhough.  I will try again on the weekend to sample those biscuits and gravy.  Looks good.

BlPqhQeq03yTlEkbINJY8g.text: Great drink specials for happy hour. Good bar food. Really friendly staff. Indoor and outdoor dining. Got everything you want.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hIOlLc9a0G4xZ0IZHSa6lA.text: I just love Windsor. My boyfriend and I always come here when we are hungry, in the mood for a great drink, but we just CAN'T decide on a place! Windsor never lets us down as our go-to.   Granted, we mainly come here on weeknights when it's not crowded. On weekends it can be a little too busy and loud for our liking. Something to keep in mind if you prefer a quiet dinner!   Burgers are my absolute favorite food, and I am a self-proclaimed burger connoisseur. I believe Windsor makes one of the best hamburgers in the U.S. - hands down! Be sure to get it "Windsor style". You won't regret it.

ITpFn36rAbsBnw-7TJfWpw.text: One Word, Excellent!! Met our family here and our waiter Benny took care of our group with ease, the food was fantastic and plentiful. Lots of choices on their menu. Nice outdoor dog friendly patio and misters which helped because it was a warm day. We got the Hummus and chicken salad sandwich.

3LRtskN7oq8TIOBa4hqX8Q.text: Okay so many feelings about this place I'm going to wrap it up into one word that best describes it: love.    I am so obsessed with Windsor. Everything from the ambiance to the drinks to the food to the people! I've never met a friendlier, cooler staff. I've never had such great service CONSISTENTLY every time I've visited a restaurant. The menu is small, but perfect. There isn't an item I've tried I didn't like.   You don't have to be super cool to eat here, but you will feel super cool if you do eat here!   Here's three pictures I've taken of the loaded chips, the best loaded chips of any restaurant I've ever had. I posted three of the probably 5 million times I've eaten it just to engrain it in your brain.   You wild if you don't try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0qlSU1lb25QXSsSW_n36pw.text: The Windsor has fantastic pub style food with some pizzazz.  The service is excellent,  the entire staff is focused in the customers. $5 cocktails and small pitchers of beer til 5 pm, weekend bloody Mary bar. They have seating outside with a very nice patio for evening meals or if you are there during the hot day the misters are running.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

le42sRT3dDQfY6mLm-NMzw.text: This place is like a bourbon blanket ! The staff the food the ambiance is like having sex with a supermodel! Lol

icPVdacd54V7qIKdzRH3iw.text: Sorry to be the buzz kill, but went back to the Windsor last Friday night as I haven't been there in a few years.    It's not as good as it used to be or it was an off night?  I'm a big fan of Joyride, Federal pizza and Postino but The Windsor isn't on par in my opinion.  It was great at one time though.  For one, they got rid of the blood orange cocktail that I loved.  Second: The crab cake BLT was mushy and a mayonnaise tasting mess!  It used to be really crispy and well contained but now it's meh.  Third: We we're halfway through the poke appetizer ( really good ), when they brought out the entrees.  Very amateurish in terms of dinning.  That's restaurant basics 101 right?  Fourth: my wife's $11 cocktail tasted like it had zero alcohol, weak!  Fifth: The main server we got, had the personality of someone that isn't quite ready for prime time, zero personality!  Thank god the other female server checked on us!  We won't be back, too many great places to eat at now Windsor!!!  You've lost your edge!

pF3NcuwOxsrOHRIB42Ub2A.text: Love the craft cocktail options. Food is always amazing and service is good as well. Only complaint would be parking when it's busy, but it's nothing that would change my rating!

9BYyaGviS_CidYvhuOE3mg.text: Super cool modern-chic vibe with consistently good food and drinks. The Brownbag Chicken Sandwich is a must-try but the Pastrami Reuben is also a family favorite. I am deducting a star because I feel like I'm only ever drawn to (the above) two entrees; very few other menu items intrigue me so I'm stuck on a somewhat stagnant rotation of meals. However, that's definitely my bias and the food I have had has been excellent. Definitely a would recommend for a date night out overall.

69VPHFJ0jhOZiH1F4nNYMg.text: Great beer selection. So come here for the awesome assortment of craft brews they have.   But don't come here for the food. Everything on the menu can be found in the frozen section at Costco. Nothing special here. Move along.

zVu8ThclFO9oGwTLzFJvzg.text: This place was so good! Had dinner with a co worker and decided to get two dishes and each eat half. I get the crab cake BLT and don't want to share cause it's so delicious. Finally have a bite or the pastrami sandwich and OMG it was soooo good.  Had Mac n cheese and vegetables on the side and it was so good as well.  Drinks were great and not over priced.  Great establishment and awesome environment. Connected to an ice cream shop that was equally delicious and super cute. The hallway was decorated in tapes with old school music on it. It was great walking around through it and going back in time with memories.  Would recommend and go back when back in town.

ZepkUJW9kn84UVk0Zf2FSA.text: My mother n law would always mention this place for happy hour. I finally made up a lie and told my boss I had to leave early "my kid was sick". Let me just say I had so much fun. The bartender was hot and super attentive. Great service and he mix the drinks oh so well. The drinks were so tatsy, I downed like 5 within an hour (don't judge!). I ready to go again! Whose with me ?

sFgD02E_J4rwb1-LxBHHjA.text: What a nice little find with this place!! Or should I say "strip of places" to go that are owned by the same owners.  They have several restaurants next to each other including an ice cream shop with everything made in house. Windsor smelled incredible, the ambience was cool with tartan plaid on the back of the bar stools & the wait staff friendly, knowledgeable & attentive. The food was creative & delicious including the sauces that accompanied the items & how can you go wrong with a $10 pitcher of beer for yourself! We will be back for sure!

A78GWRRUaRugJwRbcKZ9Kw.text: Fantastic. I ordered the mixed grain salad with veggies and goat cheese in it. It was wonderful--not over dressed like some grain bowls are. It tasted delicate and earthy and like good home cooking. No higher compliment!  My dining partner had the Banh Mi Whitefish sandwich and loved it. He got an IPA and I had Chardonnay. The service was great, really very attentive and friendly. I like the atmosphere here and at Postino a lot. Great restaurants. Very fun and hip.

LryXaf1khqyhXlKrjHRv6g.text: This spot is a great little find! It's got plenty of drink options with a fun selection of interesting cocktails. It has both indoor and outdoor seating but I strongly prefer the outdoor. It has dim lighting in and out with candles providing some light at night. It's not one of those overly loud places but can get busy (esp. with the ice cream shop next door). Prices are pretty reasonable and standard. There parking lot can be a little tight but I have always found parking. This is me and my friends go to place when we want to get a little away from things and have a fun, relaxing night.

sJqlefzwOY36qsON7WYurw.text: Best Bloody Mary Bar.  The Oyster Po Boy is excellent.  The Matador breakfast is also quite tasty.  Great drink selection, love the ambiance.

GKoiDASMDk1BqHvbRkKpsQ.text: I came here on a food tour event and from what I saw, they have a ranging menu.  Personally, we were served a chowder, fondue, and a salad.  The chowder, well, the chowder was weird. It wasn't traditional, and I'm a sucker for a chowder. This was smokey and I tasted beef broth or something.  I didn't care for it. The fondue platter was great. Who doesn't like dipping things in cheese? The pretzels were amazing.

ScC_rr-5K7rAPbSBogezEg.text: I've now eaten at Windsor twice. I love the building and I love what Upward Project is doing with the Central corridor uptown.  I love that they use fresh ingredients. I love their concepts and menu.   But the food is okay, not spectacular....it is just "good". What I think bothers me about their food is just a lack of flavor....I think they just need to kick it up a notch.  I've had the Kale Salad and the Mixed Grain Salad. Both are good. The fresh veggies they use are snappy and great. But I think the dressings are a bit bland - if they were just a bit more flavorful, I'd like them a lot more.  Today I had the Porkwich Sandwich - and with the ingredients, I thought it would be spectacular. But it was just good.  And I had the Kale salad, which was good...but again, could have been more flavorful...really just a bit more lemon juice or zest would have kicked it up a notch and made it great.     I honestly think the Executive Chef needs to beef up the flavors (herbs, spices, etc.) & he'd have a fabulous menu.  For instance, on the Porkwich....it has pork and pork belly with a coleslaw & a sweet sauce on it. If the pork had been grilled with a nice flavorful rub, that would have given it just a bit more kick and flavor and it would have been incredible.

6NYIhCixATBbEjXWL1MGjw.text: I love the design, layout, lighting, etc. The ambiance is truly stellar. It's always packed with people every time I go, which makes this feel like a real city eatery and social drinking depot. The drinks - well prepared. No. 63 was lip smackin' good. The food - pleasantly passable. It somewhat flirts with the palate and does just the trick to soak up a sip or two of bourbon. I wish I had no more to say...  [She bites her knuckles and hesitates] Boy does it pain me to knock off stars for service. Mistake me not, this feedback isn't impulsive retribution after one sour puss waiter. Time after time, I leave thinking "why couldn't they just be nicer?" I don't need to be spoon fed, have my napkin tucked under my chin or showered with compliments I wasn't fishing for. I also don't mind if you are cooler, more hipster or read more Kerouac than me.  I just don't want to feel like I'm inconveniencing someone for a meal that comes out of my wallet in the end. Inattentive and unresponsive. Regardless of the other positive traits Windsor has going for it, there is still something very unsatisfying when you leave feeling like you were just another annoyance in a sea of demanding diners.

gmntFOx-fo2Dmq6kOstdhA.text: I really enjoyed Windsor! Very cool, urban atmosphere with indoor, outdoor, and bar seating options. I love the cassette tape wall in the hallway to the bathroom (fun to reminisce while you wait since there are only two unisex bathrooms). They're labled as a "gastropub", fancy-speak for high-end bar food.   I was curious to try the controversial (some have loved, some have not) mixed grain salad. I was eyeing the porkwich, but I also appreciate a healthy meal (I love home-made kale chips, if that gives you a good idea of my tolerance for healthy stuff), so my friend and I decided to split a couple dishes. While I was hoping for a little more (in terms of flavor maybe), I did enjoy the mixed grain salad. Luckily we were splitting another dish because while feeling healthy, I did not feel full.  For the second dish, we had the veggie stack. It wasn't quite what I pictured (not really a "stack"), but it was very tasty. The hummus and green goddess dressing gave it some good flavors.  Definitely excited to go back!

QC4pwAnfU6ErSky_U5iaDw.text: I am waiting for the day Windsor decides to have their brunch on more days. Their flapjacks are perfection-- they started my love affair with marscapone. If you want something savory to balance it out, order cheesy potatoes on the side. Just the right amount of crispy to cheesy.  Drinks here are fantastic. You can get a mini pitcher of Pimm's cup (enough for 2 servings and then some) for only $5! I haven't tried their bloody mary bar yet, but the presentation makes me have to try it-- this girl has never had a bloody mary besides the mixed stuff you buy at the grocery store.  Service is simple and quick-- just my kind of style, I truly hate being smothered by waiters.  Why a 4? Only because I have had their dinner and their fare is just not as impressive.

x5axYnTYMcYRYMmL5QTu3A.text: Went here last night with a party of six.  They don't take reservations for parties less than 8 so we had to wait about 20 minutes.  It was pretty busy for 8pm on a Sunday night.  The one standout thing about this place is the service.  All the workers are friendly and go out of their way to help you.  Also, the manager (I think) was just walking around and noticed that the steak of one person in my party had been undercooked (not raw, just not they way it was ordered).  The person didn't have a problem with it and didn't say anything but the manager somehow noticed out of the corner of his eye and offered to remake it then took it off the bill.  It really was outstanding service.  All the food that I had was very good.  Its not phenomenal food but is very good nonetheless.  Burgers, salads, sandwiches, etc.  It's just basic bar food stepped up a notch.  I just wish I lived closer to this place so I don't know when I'll be able to make it back.  However, if I'm ever in the area again I know you really can't miss with this place with it's great atmosphere, excellent service, and solid food selections.

atZTv7SheLnkNja1rDPekA.text: My third trip there in past 3 years and this time a bit underwhelming...not bad, mind you...just not quite as good.  Atmosphere is great...staff and service are good...cocktails were good too.  But the food missed the mark in most areas; tomato-basil soup was ok but very acid - unripe tomatoes...cooked too short of time...too little cream?  Dining companion had the brown - bag chicken and said it was ok...also just didn't rise to being a great dish.  I had the crab cake BLT...it was big and served on a very good hoagie type bun...the tomato was ripe and there was a nice amount of it...the bacon was crispy (but crumbled?) and the lettuce was shredded.  It was tasty but slightly fishy - enough so that my dining companion could smell it.  It was served with the kale salad which was actually the best dish of the night.  I will go again...it's a fun place...just a little tweaking required!

0EhL0CZXKkB5bCVOQGeESw.text: Excallent service and food despite being busy.  Fondue was a treat.  Would definitely come back

61zyvTgmsM4_gIWqTlQC_g.text: I scored a date a few nights ago with a really fine looking woman and I knew I needed to take her somewhere special. I was out of ideas for good food so I asked my sister in law and she recommended this place, so i rolled the dice and took her to Windsor, it did not disappoint. The atmosphere was just right for a date, not awkwardly silent, but not too loud to have a nice conversation. The menu was manageable, yet still had something for everyone. She had the veggie stack, which sounds terrible to me and loved it. I got the loaded chips, a hot dog, and macaroni and cheese (I felt like eating like a 9 year old... an overweight 9 year old).  It was delicious. The service was great too, not one thing to complain about. I give the credit for this successful date to Windsor. Needless to say I have already locked in another date. I will be going back.

Fff1EmzmruDtjFJO6gtUdw.text: I stopped by here to check it out because I loved Postinos.  The wait staff is unfriendly and rude. They can't make a good martini to save their life.  There are much better places to go in that area that are a ton better.   If you are thinking of going here move on.

6MDvHHMZqDNsKfjWzavoJA.text: Is it possible to be in love with a fish sandwich?  I highly recommend the Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich paired with the chopped kale salad. If I could give this place 10 stars I would. My husband got the porkwich. I guess if you're gonna get pork then go all out with this one. It was good, but it was no Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich.  Go next door to Churn when you're done and support local businesses.  The only cons I have is the parking situation and the loud music. There are so few parking spots and they go quickly. I assume staff takes most of the spots which leaves valet. I have no problem paying for parking, but I don't feel like I have a choice.

tvG3lPcGQ8MI4L56Q1f-4w.text: I finally got to experience what everyone has been talking about.  Windsor is certainly one of the rather trendy spot at the moment on Central road.  I had the Pastrami Reuben sandwich, which was really salty.  I couldn't even finish it.  However, the Porkwich with kale salad was mighty tasty.  Highly recommend this.  The atmosphere was very laid back and friendly.  The cassette wall was a genius way to recycle old cassettes.

FX3P34Av1H2Ul8ewMIYW9g.text: Good drinks, attentive waitstaff, killer food, and a perfect back patio to enjoy it all!  What else do you need? Two of my friends and I went to a late dinner on a Friday night and got in under 20 minutes.  I adored my brown bag chicken sandwich and grilled veggies and picked off my friend's church potatoes (potatoes au gratin) when she started raving about it. It's a little pricy, but quality usually is, and I'm of the opinion that it's worth it. Awesome experience and I'm sooooo going back.

N3ohzzeGQtCP7YjXTk2IUg.text: Wow! That's the best way to describe this experience.  And yes, it was one very enjoyable experience.  The friendly (also cute) waiter along with the really polite staff and really just world class service completely impressed me in so many ways.  The food was amazing, drinks perfect and environment very comfortable.  Want a great place for weekend brunch? Believe me, this is it.  Check it out, I promise you will not be disappointed in any way at all.  They really know how to make you feel like a very important person from start till finish.

HIwoh4n4hjgAfW_PqAE2Sw.text: This place is very cool! I went here after work with a sorority sister for drinks on a Friday night. Ended up staying for like 3.5 hours.  Fantastic atmosphere with outdoor and indoor seating. Lighting is dim and intimate indoors with rustic seating areas and large booth perfect for groups getting drinks together. The outdoor patio is sectioned off in a covered area with tables and smaller seats while an uncovered area hosted seating for peeps who rode their bikes in.  The drinks are pretty yummy. If you're into fruity, girly cocktails there isn't much to choose from, but for a more mature, grown-u beverage, you're in luck. Hit the happy hour (which sadly ends at 5pm).  It gets a tad loud and it difficult to tell the wait staff apart from the customers because they're all in street clothes but they're very attentive and sweet. We ordered the fondu plate and it was great. Pretzels, sausage, apples and the cheese... perfect for sobering up a bit from those yummy cocktails.

e_7CHOSfCW_DYmNRzVvF0A.text: I had the bacon cheeseburger here with sweet potato fries. Awesome burger, they actually cooked it medium rare, which is hard to find. They could use a better selection of beers, their only weakness, but definitely worth the drive for the food.

Apf-6usfcHRMlpOdgk9jKg.text: -1 star for price  Had the Porkwich, which was amazing, and messy.  The mac and cheese could use more cheese flavor.  Great atmosphere, great location.

ADXntKm6dyDcijEqfy1eKA.text: I could eat their corn dogs all day every day! I love the atmosphere as well! And it's attached to churn!!

mhxaXpXNSgCyjaeLDIHBlw.text: My manager at work says its one of her favorite go-to places so I  decided to finally give it a try. I ordered a blackberry lemonade and their Crab Cake BLT which came with a side of your choosing ( I got the mac 'n cheese).  The crab cake was decent. It would have been better if it were tad crunchier, but the overall taste was good. The mac 'n cheese was perfect! My friend ordered the special of the day which happened to be their fried chicken. I had a piece and it was nice and juicy. The service there is impeccable. They actually accidentally served our order of chicken to another table and apologized in advance. We didn't even realize because it didn't seem like we were waiting very long before we got our food. When we got the check we realized they had comped us for that meal.

6ojsZad6ICneYBFEJ2t2hg.text: Love this place!  Had the loaded chips appetizer -ah-mazing!  Sounds kinda mundane. We didn't know what we were getting and the first taste of the chips w/ the toppings was a party in my mouth. The potato chips are thick and cooked to perfection. The chips are topped with blue cheese, caramelized onions, bacon, chipotle sauce.  Layers of flavor!  One of the best things I've eaten in a while!  The pulled pork sandwiches are sooo good. "Different" type of bbq sauce. Not sweet. Rather it had more of a mustardy, savory flavor.   My family feels that they could have omitted the ham on the sandwich.  The mac and cheese was good. Not great, but good.  The wild salmon was good as was the side of veggies.  Overall, great meal. Great atmosphere. We sat out back.  Love the trees, the lighting, and the comfy chairs! oh....service there is amazing!  The servers know what they're doing. Everyone has a job and about 4 of them wait on you.  Check it out!

2mEVd2M9vaFKl--3C6iTpA.text: Really impressive place! I'm usually very skeptical of trendy joints like this, as they don't generally live up to the hype. However, I've been here several times and always impressed with the chef...the brown bag chicken sandwich is perfectly balanced. Wait staff is polite, and their mixed drink menu is also excellent. Would come here a lot more often if it wasn't a victim of its own success with the wait time always long!

7xEF8hvq29blxFEjAW_xtQ.text: love this place. great atmosphere, casual enough, and great food.  great place for a date or just friends get together. loved the salad with crunchy okra!

ZZr1-id6LTn3OU3maXBxYA.text: Liked the feel of the place and its hipster vibe. Food was good and patio was really friendly

vDZxx_y62fe_GOlL1UQACA.text: The food and drinks were excellent. The crab cake BLT was off the chain. The service was slow at first but once the server acknowledged us things went much better.

mzw4_BoiltYnLjthyB2r2g.text: This place is a True gem! My husband and I try and head here for brunch at least twice a month. Excellent prices, especially on their gourmet cocktails! The atmosphere is very fun and everything we have ever tried has been delicious. We are constantly bringing new friends and family from out of town here.

6vRcsyqlJK78rgtesJfeeA.text: LOVE the fondue & pulled chicken sandwich! Such a cute place, park across central down the side road if you can't park in their tiny parking lot!

5WmunxXqyjNSEzK6vflw7A.text: Saturday afternoon happy hour!!  The atmosphere is great.  The food is fun and delicious and did I mention great drinks!  The is diffinitely a spot to check out.  After you do, I am sure you will go again and again

zmuG8Z-Z51qFxNH2AH1dxQ.text: I was so excited to try this place out!  It's always busy when I drive by, and seems like the cool new place to be at.  However, I was somewhat disappointed with the menu options.  I didn't get much time to check out the outside area, but it looks like a great patio to enjoy some drinks once the weather cools down.  It's definitely a hipster scene, and they nailed it with the neighborhood bar atmosphere.  After being seated, I attempted to read the menu.  I'm all about mood lighting, but it was a tad TOO dark in here.  As I struggled to read the menu in the dim lighting I looked up, and happened to notice two other customers who had whipped out their cell phones to use as flashlights in an effort to see the menu.  As I skimmed through the menu I quickly realized mine and my boyfriend's menu options were VERY limited.  *Quick Tip* If you don't eat pork, your menu options are limited by close to half!   They do serve a Veggie Stack sandwich, but that just didn't fit my mood that day.  I've never ordered a salad as a main dish, but settled on the Country Vegetable Chop with an extra boiled egg and my boyfriend ordered the Backyard Burger (Windsor Style).  I'll admit, my salad was pretty tasty.  I loved the addition of crispy okra on top of the salad, served with the perfect amount of ranch dressing.  The Backyard Burger's carmelized onions make the burger, and pairs well with the garlic aioli.  I was tempted to get an order of the mac and cheese after I saw it at the table next to me, but decided I would save this for another trip in an effort to give this place another try, maybe with the Veggie Stack as my main dish.  Also, the waiter recommended a side of ranch with the fried okra, and I have to agree it was pretty tasty this way, especially for a saucy girl like myself.  I love dipping sauces!  With a very attentive waiter on a busy Saturday night service was great.  Don't forget to head towards the unisex restrooms and sneak a peek at the wall made of cassette tapes!  I'll wait to try this place again once the weather cools off so I can enjoy the outside seating!

mUXPGPPDaX1LO9d7GefB2w.text: Finally had the opportunity to experience Windsor after hearing about it from a good friend. My husband and I went for lunch and sat at the bar which is without a doubt the best seat in the house, thanks to bar tenders Roman and Matt and the open wall between the bar and patio, which essentially gave us outside seating on a beautiful winter afternoon in Phoenix. I have been on a quest for the best pastrami sandwich in the valley and found it here. If you are looking for quantity, go to Chompies, but if you are looking for a reasonably sized sandwich full of flavor, then Windsors should be on your list of places to go. There is a nice list of sides that are included with your entree.   As a side I had the macaroni and cheese. It was good, but I make my own mac and cheese from scratch and would be willing to make an arrangement with Windsor and share the recipe!  My husband had the Windsor burger with bacon and a side of french fries and had no complaints. Happy hour until 5:00 includes $5 pitchers of a small but good collection of beer, a glass of wine, or unique cocktails, which we were given small samples of as they were made (I told you... the bar has the best seats!)  We do not live close to the central corridor but will definitely make it back to Windsor soon  so that we can experience the good company of Matt and Roman and their palatial delights!

WoCN8RwtJIwXK4bExY168A.text: What a place!  I recently hosted a 25-person family party there, and both the food and service were impeccable.  The staff were all very friendly and accommodating, even with the dozen children we had in the group.  Leslie was the manager and she paid attention to every last detail, helping me to plan the menu and gauge food quantities for that many people.  The restaurant itself was spotless, from the outside patio down to the restrooms.  Thanks for making our family event such a wonderful success.  Everyone left full and happy.  We will definitely be back!!

qraifnPRooWECo5sQwOv6Q.text: Went there for the first time. I shared a crab cake sandwich, which was ok, and a Reuben sandwich, which was very good. Also shared a side of okra and mac and cheese, which I couldn't get enough of. The atmosphere is very chicago-like, and our waitress was a doll

Cme2mjAL30ycPDnXnEhzEg.text: Great atmosphere both inside and on the outdoor patio ... food, drink, music & service - all top notch.  And with a homemade ice cream store/coffee shop next door - Highly recommend!

mEB064lmKXbw9B44zHNZjg.text: First, they're open late!  They stop serving at 11pm during the week.  I am often rather inquisitive about the menu.  Despite some specific questions by me and the friend I was with, the waitress was super-fantastic.  The food was really quite good and I was pleased with everything that I ordered.  The dining was definitely worth the price...and, hey, the prices are really decent.  I will definitely go back to Windsor.

zBbHuJjdoltvwz6bcbp6oQ.text: Hard to find because signage is inadequate.  The house pinot noir was so good that I easily drank a bottle solo.  Great wine special before 5pm. Odd selection of appetizers served with potato chips.  The ceviche was served with potato chips and tasted better [minus chips] eating with a fork. The brown bag pulled chicken sandwich was great!  I was disappointed by the side dishes.  Couple friends ate hamburgers-- yummy!  I don't recommend the mac n' cheese or the hash brown casserole; fried okra was best.  We devoured our main dishes but not the sides. Interior lighting was too dark but nice ambiance.  The owners have a more impressive restaurant called Postino's.

g1GJ1HpJJXXoxDBWtcR7EA.text: Great local eatery, service is good. well thought out etc. the drink menu is very interesting, great selection of scotch and bourbon. I just wish they would change the menu although the food is good, the menu is very limited wihich is ok i just dont want to eat a pastrami sandwich for dinner. with a little change easily a four or five star.

fyDljFX4Y11euLt798NRDQ.text: A great new addition to the DeMarco family of ventures.  This was a pre-opening tasting, so they're still working on all of the fine points.  Nonetheless, it is a terrific spot.  The structure itself is very appealing, as they restored a 1940's-era building and exposed its beautiful brickwork, which is complimented with a stained concrete floor.  The bar is a proper one with a wide array of liquors and fairly ample seating for the size of the space.  The patio definitely will be the preferred seating choice so long as the weather cooperates.  We tried macaroni and cheese as well as the cole slaw starters; for $3 each, you could make a delicious, reasonably-priced meal from a collection of the starters.  The double dip starter (cobb dip and posole salsa with chips) was very good, though I almost preferred the dip and salsa without the chips because they're so flavorful.  The mixed grain salad was a good choice, too, though I might try to find something other than the orange vinagrette to put on it.  The wine on tap was tasty, and they'll also have a small list of about 8 bottles.  Again, the official opening isn't until the 25th, so they're still honing the fine edges.  In any event, we'll be there far too often for our own good!

WncXIg3_B6I8HE7oKStBOQ.text: Go here, get the fish sandwich. All the wines on tap are very good.  Stay away from the female bartender with the tattoos she is rude! ps do the pepper roulette.

zMP1Y5rCxBGFvDBEesya_A.text: some of the best cocktails in phoenix. food is delicious but not intimidating.

-11Cg2UpDvPfRP5Wi_syyw.text: My dear love and I arrived just as the sun was going down for a quick bite after the Arizona State Fair. I was prepared to be frightened and off put by a to young too hip crowd but I was more than pleasantly surprised. Windsor is a delightful venue, comfortable and spacious and pretty with an interesting menu. We had a specialty cocktail featuring orange water, rum and marmalade and it was de-lish-es.  We also had a nice brown pag chicken sandwich and a side of mac and cheese which is almost always too ironic for me but it was very tasty. All in all an excellent experience. Parking was a hassle and an annoyance-valet parking is probably the only bad thing that the owners of this place inflict on the customers (here and at the other stores they own). That said, despite the parking annoyance we will be back. I enjoyed the entire experience and my dear love was very happy. Just remember no day but today.

oGEQgImE6B5VB5Pf2SKnNQ.text: Great food. The burgers are incredible, the chicken kabobs are off the charts. Great happy hour too.

Bk6lgg8uAO7pp5sT6Z09eQ.text: love love LOVE Windsor!!  It's fun to do all 4 Upward Projects properties...  Postino, Federal Pizza, JoyRide and Windsor...  all next to each other makes for a great little crawl!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #63 Kentucky Bourbon, Fresh Grapefruit and Honey Syrup = lovely!!

Q-sxvi8ZwE9D4NKD-9-D4w.text: Another treasure to be revisited again and again.  Came here for a social evening with new friend.  Our salads were delicious and healthy, the service was perfect and the music was noticeable but not too loud to carry on a conversation.  Great ambience!

YSDITfEbatNNS0NKyIZJhA.text: Can't beat the $5 pitchers, cocktails, wine before 5pm. Start with the Russian roulettes! Don't be afraid of getting anything super hot because it rarely happens. The fatoush salad is my favorite on the menu. Today I had the white fish sand which which happen to be yellowtail this particular night and it was fantastic. Had a hint of spice to it that went well with the garnish on top of the fish. Definitely worth a try if you like a flavorful grilled fish. Service is always great here and the ambience is hip and cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Russian roulettes, my favorite app.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Sandwich with fried okra side. Delicious!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SCnlGqdDrrmaocR_I4icqg.text: Awesome place. The ambiance is great. Cocktails are fantastic and only $5 before 5. The service and the food were just perfect. Our waiter, Jacob, was so attentive, friendly and accommodating with our babies! Austin was awesome too-- totally on top of it.   Here's what we ordered: Cheese fondue: delicious. The cheese was great and pretzel was so good.  Grain salad: really unique but excellent. Had a slight curry taste. Not very much lettuce but so good Chicken pot pie: probably my favorite. Not too heavy but a very flavorful sauce and great crust. The veggies were perfectly done too.  Cocktails: you can't go wrong! We tried the blackberry lemonade, the cucumber one, and the watermelon one. All were really terrific. Very smooth. Not overly sweet.   I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackberry lemonade cocktail
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese fondue -- almost finished! And pretzel bread

ye20yDvNKS_7WQiYFQLjsA.text: Great atmosphere,  great food, great location and good friends.  The Zim Zam was delish and the drinks are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #22

0bYBPjdw6tKNkVCixsxnQg.text: Went for breakfast on Father's Day we beat the rush which was fortunate. The food was good, the bacon was great. They kept our glasses full and the staff was very attentive. Didn't feel rushed and we enjoyed our food just wasn't spectacular. I might try it for another meal but not a place that is at the top of my list.

B3WcrH-usJ6ZYxexoo3CZg.text: Love this place!  Eric behind the bar is great and super friendly.  This and their Postino have the best beer all-day Happy Hours with good selections.

qujbdeJ8iabSWF6qOVh_NA.text: This restaurant was very quaint and also hipster-ish. Love the decor and atmosphere. Service at first was a little iffy but once they acknowledged us, it went pretty smooth. Great cocktails! Got the Devil Egg dip with Chips, White Fish Banh Mi, Crab Cake BLT and side of mac and cheese. lAll were great and portions were pretty big. Can't wait to come back and try more stuff and come for the $5 happy hour!

Ntf9U1R2lA2c1rgo-zwBcQ.text: Great little neighborhood place. My go-to for fantastic bar food. The brown bag chicken is my fav, but their salads are great and their ahi poke is fantastic

hBYFDkw_7btFpErbfN1eng.text: Glad I found this place.  Looked at the menu online and was already amped about my visit.  Parking was easy. Sat down right away and within a minute had waters and someone explaining the menu. Staff is top notch. Environment is very nice and has a nice set up with the bar in the middle. It's AZ so I clearly sat inside.   Ordered the Windsor eggs Benedict  Crab cakes & spinach with hollandaise   My son had eggs & bacon with pancakes   He gave it a thumbs up. And wanted more   Eggs Benedict were great. Crab cakes were delicious and filling.   Great local place. Highly recommended. Stop by and try it out. I'm already planning my next visit to try out the lunch menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wall of cassette tapes

cA_0b0YfZ1DhcU7j_UuAOA.text: I like the team service concept here.  The bartender picked up my plate when I finished since he just happened to walk by.  I LOVE that!    I had the brown bag chicken sandwich...SO DELICIOUS...how can you go wrong with avocado, goat cheese and huge chunks of chicken on your bun?  Be sure to add Cholula to the Mac and Cheese...YUM!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum

qJVfZe8KagmdC-zqPT5BYA.text: Windsor is one of my go to spots for many reasons. The food is great, the service is fantastic, and I love the vibe. The cassettes on the wall are always great for a photo opp. The last time I went in the bartender made me a bourbon concoction, not on the menu, and it was divine. My ahi poke starter was also extremely delicious, and I shared a burger with my sister. Our group started with the loaded chips, which are so fattening but totally worth it. Definitely check this place out!

EffkX2P9YnWzJOoUY3Kh_g.text: What a fantastic place for a weekend brunch!    This establishment seems to combine all the great things from all the great restaurants in phoenix.  It has excellent decor with great looking walls and art all over.  It's a very modern hipster look.  The feel is very laid back.  They have both indoor and outdoor seating and the whole place feels very open and flows well in and out.    The food is straight up fantastic!  It is prepared with care and with quality fresh ingredients.  It is plated well and is not only appealing on the eyes but very much so on the stomach.  Every bite was a wave of deliciousness.    The drinks that they make are wonderful as well!  They have a $5 till 5 deal which is amazing and well worth it!  They have a lot of good cocktails and there are several choice beers on tap.    The staff is what really put this place over the top.  They seemed to all work so well in harmony that they really were a well oiled machine!  We had a very short wait but we're found outside and asked for drink orders.  When seated we had a waitress that was for our table but anytime someone passed buy and saw we needed something we were taken care of.  Hands up applause!  Great job!  Keep up the great work!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating area
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KO02xYFLTnZxI9j-2Prprw.text: Holy smokes! I may have been disappointed in the service I received during my visit, but geez did Upward Projects ever step up to the plate! Someone saw my prior review and emailed me asking for my contact information. The next day the nicest lady ever, Brittany called me and thanked me for my sincere feedback,and apologized that I felt rushed/ignored. She was so kind and genuine. On top of that, I got an invitation in the mail to come back in for an improved experience.   Talk about amazing service!

wsyIXREVUAg7fnGvSzs4Pw.text: OMG....I can't believe it took me three years (how long I have been back in Phx) to eat at this place.  I have heard the amazing reviews but just never made the attempt to go until today.  It was a friends birthday and he suggested going here so off we went.  What a CHARMING atmosphere and ever so friendly staff!    There were three of us and we had a slight wait for a table at brunch time but it was very pleasant outside.  We got our table and Hills came over and took our drink order and checked on us and then our waitress Sarah came over to check on us too.  We ordered the $5 Bloody Mary and helped ourselves to the BM condiment bar.  The Bloody Mary was a good size and a bonus was being able to put your own condiments in it!  We ordered our lunch from the very ample menu and I immediately had my eyes on the Cheddar Biscuits with Sausage Gravy!  Being from TX I am a SNOB about biscuits and gravy!  Let me tell you these were TO DIE FOR!  I am sold and will be back over and over!!  My one friend ordered a hamburger and I don't remember what my other friend ordered but all three of us really enjoyed our meal.  Hills came over and checked on us a number of times and I mentioned we were celebrating my friends birthday and the next thing you know she appeared with a ice cream sunday topped with whipped cream and fudge sauce and three spoons!  How totally nice of her!    We enjoyed our brunch and conversation and our special bonding with Sarah and Hills!  We all said we would definitely come back again!  Thank you Windsor, Sarah and Hills for making my friends birthday lunch such a special occasion!

yavE809kQZVsXPatJS_J4Q.text: Great spot in uptown Phoenix to grab a bite to eat. Great variety of choices for food. It's average for cost with other places in the area but the portion sizes are very big. Same owners as Joy Ride and Postinos so you know it's going to be good. It's also connected to Churn so you can walk right next door for dessert. Everything we had was delicious. The loaded chips, bacon burger, porkwich, and garden chop salad with smoked salmon. The bacon on the burger was insanely good and perfectly cooked. Burger ordered medium rare and came out cooked to perfection. The chop salad isn't a traditional chop salad, it has their own little flare and style to it making it unique and good. Even the side macaroni and cheese was delicious. They should consider making it an entree. The servers were very attentive and made sure water and drinks were never empty. Great ambience inside at the bar and a nice patio to enjoy the weather.

BGHa_rAL8ZlSrwT_tm2M-g.text: While the atmosphere at Windsor is stellar, the food was not good and we think it actually gave us food poisoning... We were both sick within a few hours of leaving. We visited last weekend and shared the Windsor burger and the crab cake sandwich. The burger was ordered medium, came well done, and tasted like a frozen burger patty. The crab cake sandwich also was really not great. The food was also really pricey for the terrible quality. Would NOT it recommend Windsor for its food, would 10/10 recommend the ice cream next door at churn.

xehb6cRU5ZmTLCZ4tyCDtg.text: I love this place!! The food is amazing and so are their drinks!! The atmosphere is cool for a casual meet up with friends or a date night! I got the Windsor burger and it was amazing! I will definitely be back! Our waiter was amazing and the appetizers & food came out super fast despite it being a very busy night!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SD_gFNPW3ChqSQwpbFgJuA.text: Mind boggling....let me tell you why.  This is a cute hipster area to be!  The wait time was half an hour - expected. It's attached to Churn. So we checked out the place while waiting...very cute! I couldn't wait to try the ice cream.  So we got seated and ordered. Since we were sharing the soup of the day (coconut curry chicken), I asked if they could just simply bring an extra bowl. "Umm sorry, but I can bring an extra spoon." Weird. Fine. Maybe they're just out of bowls???  The soup and "the Falling Out" salad came out along with the "Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich." "Here's an extra plate in case" she says. We already have 2 plates. We didn't need a third. An extra bowl would've been appropriate. The soup had a spicy kick. I thought it was alright. The salad I loved because it was fresh and tasty from the various fruits and goat cheese combination with just enough red wine herb vinegarette. The sandwich was also wonderful with the toasted hazelnut and tender chicken.   My friends enjoyed the oyster po boy sandwich over the lobsta sandwich. 3 different people asked if we (4 people) were done eating. It seemed like they were trying to collect plates as fast as we were eating it. Kinda surprised they didn't ask for our one bowl. Were they low on dishes?? Again, an extra bowl would've been nice. And that's why one less star from me.  I'll be back to try the other entrees!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brown bag chicken sandwich
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Falling Out salad with apples, pomegranate seeds, and more

raNVPCKBA1lvJFH8V1jbGw.text: Love this place. The cocktails are delicious as well as the food.  Soooo sad they decided to take the Greek goddess off the menu. That was our favorite appetizer :(  still a great place to catch up with friends or have a date night.  Totally recommend

OlUi0DD7g2Pof_CxykpAvw.text: *****UPDATED REVIEW************ Chris Loftis the General Manager at Windsor reached out to us regarding the previous review. He was professional, friendly, apologetic and sounded genuinely concerned about our experience. He extended an invitation to us and we accepted. Our second visit was nothing like the first one. We did see Morgan and she seated us at a table, she was nice and friendly. We were greeted by the server (I wish I could remember her name) she offered drink food & recommendations. My fiance had the New Orleans Style Pork Ribs-Slow roasted baby back ribs with house BBQ sauce, cheddar biscuit and "surprise" side, I had the Ahi Tuna Salad & a glass of wine. The food was absolutely delicious! My salad was fresh and the Ahi Tuna had the perfect texture & flavor. My fiance loved the ribs tender & juicy! Everything during our second time visit was perfect! I am excited to visit them again during our weekly date night and trying other items. Thank you Chris for reaching out, we had no intention of going back after our first visit but you helped us changed our mind.

tcW7KWsywr4_b7F76wLinQ.text: This bacon burger. Holy hell. Amazing.  I'm a Windsor fan in general. The drinks are great, the food is solid, and Churn being next door is a plus.  However, how I've passed up on the bacon burger the last, I don't know, 10 times I've been here, is mind boggling. All I want to eat is that burger. Forever.  Put me on an island with that burger. Turn the ocean into steak sauce. I'll grow onions, age cheddar, have a drift of pigs, a kine of cows. My wife and kid will be okay with it. I promise.

DS792_01IS7gs2OtW3-Mhw.text: I almost wanted to give this spot five Stars simply for the hand crafted cocktails but that wouldn't be fair so let's just say the cocktails get 5 stars. They are all very good, very unique including a coconut bourbon cocktail that I love AND the best part...wait for it...they are $5 until 5 pm daily. This is one of my fav day drinking spots if that's where my mood lies. I usually order a side of the Mac and cheese which is baked and pretty decent or sweet potato fries. I can comment too much on the w trees here because even though I've been a bunch of times I usually stick to the bar food and sit at the bar. I don't usually stay long as the music isn't always my cup of tea but the bartenders are always cool and it's got that central Phoenix vibe so this place stays on the list. It's a convenient lo and has its own parking lots plus it's across the street from 3 other great bars. It's a must hit.

WGdIZYHr7zmYpmx1yHpAsw.text: Still a 5 star review from my husband and I!!!  We come quite often and know a couple of people who work there. Jason, the bartender is amazing!!!! We love you Jason! Super friendly and always fast service. We enjoy conversation with him. Mike with the bun and tattooed arm is also someone I know and he's always pleasant and fast!  Food is always delicious. We have never had something we didn't like. My favorites are the Reuben, the Windsor style burger, fattoush salad with salmon, hummus for an app, and cheddar fondue for an app. I also love the Number 4 cocktail. They have $5 drinks until 5pm! That also includes beer and wine by the glass.   Very welcoming spot and everyone works very well together to make sure service is fast and efficient. You will not be disappointed!

xwsUNvmwzKLoPzJNwU9CGQ.text: One of the best patios around. Killer dirty martini!  Fun wall of cassette tapes on the way to the bathroom. Been 100 times and always enjoy! The food is good, if a tiny bit unadventurous...  Never dissatisfied though.  Try it, and pop into Churn next door afterwards.

DszGeo6BfAUr3XQyp9S1RQ.text: I give this place an A++++++ The atmosphere is great they have so many seating options whether you want it to feel like you're on a dinner date, a lunch gathering, or if you want a bar feeling it has it all. Not to mention their drink deal is awesome $5 drinks everyday before 5? You can't beat that! They're good drinks too and the food was delicious as well. The service was quite unique it was like we had three waiters because a different person came to us every time to make sure we were okay which I thought was so cool! I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken kabobs and both sauces were so good!

q7UC4d978EOTNpSXl8qZ2Q.text: Nothing great here. Service is friendly. Drinks are okay. Food is basic, nothing special. Menu is your usual, trendy, bar food. Would come back because of the service, but doubtful.

sAuWx5IcY864N7U9ZOc2lA.text: I love all of the report project restaurants. They have a wonderful happy hour if you can get there before five and the people are always outstanding. The winter is the one it's easy to forget to go to, but you're making a mistake if that is the case. They have a full bar and wonderful food options. The staff as always is excellent. Today Robert is on his game

y9JWE9_UAxuMTJ2v7f3aeg.text: Digable lil joint...wasnt too impressed with the food...just ok. Wifey was slightly more impressed...

f3-P7VI97NhDnbLRIegWbw.text: Great place to go for an excellent cocktail. The beers they handle are excellent too. Great selection of interesting appetizers and entrees. Really enjoy the ambience there, it has a great feel and the staff are very friendly as well. Great place to take your family and then go next-door for an ice cream at churn. This is our neighborhood spot.

pfcF56aRfuYHYt1gZZO1yw.text: This is our favourite neighborhood restaurant. Breakfast/brunch is fantastic as is lunch and dinner. Their menu isn't  huge but pretty much everything on it is super solid.

scZpo0iO39C_dB_tlEhibw.text: Great patio. Food was good but not amazing. Pickled vegetables weren't very good but pulled pork was good and side vegetable was seasoned well( spinach) I would try it for happy hour next time.

wChXY8tFi3FZHoO4TgtaNQ.text: Not to be confused with the women's Wiccan? Clothing store, Windsor, located in the arts district of Phoenix is my new go to if I'm ever in Phoenix again, they do fried Cora the way it should be and I had the best cAesar salad one could have for breakfast. They also mix drinks really well I had a berry lemonade? And a Bloody Mary, I wanted to eat brunch here everyday. The bartenders are really great and can help with a suggestion if you don't know what to get

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h0rZM4B7hXrEofRlPNtmdw.text: Loved the patio here! My veggie burger was amazing the sweet potato fries were delicious! If you eat meat my friends recommend the Matador& the brown bag chicken! I will definitely be back to the Windsor for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CEca5CBxpegVCvmi8N8USg.text: Love the $5 drinks before 5 pm every day! I really enjoy meeting friends here for a bite to eat and conversation. It's relaxed, great service, delicious food, yummy drinks. I also love the cassette tape wall on the way to the gender neutral restrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cassette tape wall!!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. These beverages are so delish!

usrTgE5NEJWVSyWkIZKV_w.text: Windsor is a charming restaurant. We came in on fourth of July and we were so pleased they were open. It was too hot to sit in their outside patio so we sat inside.   I ordered the Crab Cake BLT. The crab cake itself was delicious. It was the perfect crispiness on the outside and delicious lemony crab goodness on the inside. It reminded me of New Orleans crab cakes. I could eat it by itself. My only complaint about this sandwich was there was too much bread. I ended up taking out the top half of the bread. It came with a salad which was pretty good. My boyfriend ordered the kebabs and he thought it was just okay. I ordered a couple of margaritas and they were great - not too sweet and had the perfect amount of tequila. Our server was excellent and a couple of the other servers kept on checking in on us. I will probably be back to try out their brunch!

aFRUDdxzL18wwHfN7WA2vA.text: Had my 60th birthday dinner last night at this restaurant and as usual it's a culinary delight their staff is wonderful their food is really good or should I say exceptional and they made by 60th birthday very pleasant thank you so much

PqSWDmEqHjT9bveZFWr-9g.text: Had a nice breakfast last Sunday with the Hub and the Dog. Yummy waffle for me and biscuits and gravy for the Man. Clyde the dog was given water and his fave - ice cubes.   So imagine our surprise when we looked at our bank account and the charge was for over $100! I found the receipt copy, and the actual amount was for $35ish.  Called the restaurant EARLY and asked for the manager. Adam, who answered the phone WAS the manager. I explained what happened and he took the check info, and was totally sympathetic and said he would refund the overcharge. I told him I always round up to the dollar, and always tip 20% so we figured out the total would have been about $43.  Not only was Adam polite, professional, and apologetic - he immediately offered to send a $25 gift certificate for my "trouble." WOW. I used to work in the restaurant industry - and he handled this textbook, old-school, PERFECTLY. (He also gave me his personal cell # in case I needed it.)  And then he followed up with a call 10 minutes later, said he found the transaction, and yes, the server "fat-fingered" the tip amount (added a zero) and apologized profusely AGAIN, assuring me that they run "an honest operation" and that he would follow up in a staff meeting, stressing that this situation could have been way more dire (if it had overdrawn my account), etc.  And yes, I believe it was an honest mistake. Upward Projects - you should be proud of Adam and congratulate yourselves on hiring well. THIS is what the customer experience SHOULD be. To quote Adam, "It's not only how we handle our mistake, it's what we do to make it better for you AFTERWARDS."  Well done, Adam!

aDFPgm__HlZsu_oJyuj05Q.text: Great all day happy hour beer and cocktail deals. Drinks are very good, dig the ice cubes. Wish they had appetizer specials, though.   Food is solid from what I've had. Great burger, love the corn dog poppers and wings, fried chicken is very good, too. This place is usually the most packed of any of the spots nearby, so they must be doing something right.   Service CAN be good, though our last visit was kind of shitty. Try to sit at the bar. I have never seen the same bartenders or servers twice here, and I go once a month.

2d4jgNJhPo5Ml5Abz3lTfg.text: have to give another shoutout for Windsor - bloody Mary's and the bloody mary bar are the best and this morning's frittata was excellent but its the staff who rock the house.  Claire is the High Priestess of the bar, Jacob has an excellent smile and great demeanor, and Olivia is a totally unique person...love her style.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. brunch frittata - excellent !

WWs-f8ndeaphDsDo5hRoFg.text: Sometime long, long ago, I had a wonderful brunch at Windsor.  I remember it fondly.  A No 2 cocktail (vodka, peach puree, prosecco) times 2.  An amazing bloody mary bar, too bad I don't like bloody marys.  Warm donut holes with mascarpone and jam.  A fantastic breakfast burrito with Schreiner's sausage.  And more than one bite of my husband's strawberry pancakes.  Wouldn't have changed a thing, especially when the bill came and it was far less than I would have expected.  Big hug to Shannon M (and an unnamed former Yelper) for introducing us to this gem.

CpVYzDsO59iZzmY_tx-i5w.text: A solid 4 star review on my first visit and I'm eager to come back and check out more items on the menu!  We were seated on the patio which is a large, spacious area. It was chilly last night but the patio was warm and inviting. The only draw-back is that it's...dark. Very dark. Had a hard time reading the menu much less seeing what they placed in front of us but the taste of the food was inviting enough for me to come back in the day-light to get the full effect.  We had the loaded chips to start. They are FANTASTIC. The housemade chips are perfectly crunchy and not greasy or oily at all. The carmelized onion, bacon, blue cheese, were all terrific. I am not sure if the chipotle crema was on there, I didn't taste it and had it been served in a better lit area, I'd know better if it was on there or not.  What I will say is that the loaded chips are a MUST HAVE appetizer because they were phenomenal.   My boy had the crab cake BLT for his main. It was very tasty, served on a roll with perfect fresh veggies. The crab cake was perfectly done...not too moist, not too bready. The french fries that he chose for the side dish were not anything special at all. They were typical shoestring fries that I'm pretty sure were frozen and weren't well seasoned at all. They had salt, but for a place that prides itself with fresh house-made food, I was surprised by the lack of creativity with the fries.  I had the soup and salad combo. The soup was a loaded potato soup which was pretty nice. The broth was nice. Nothing special, but had a nice velvety finish which I like. The bacon was yum but I think it might have been missing cheese or something. It just tasted like something was missing. I wish I could say what. I added pepper but that wasn't it. It was salty from the bacon but not overly so. The salad was the chopped salad which was tasty. The hard boiled egg was way way too salty though. The ranch dressing was nice though and the avocado was fresh and firm.   Our server was thorough but not terribly engaging. It's always been kind of hit or miss with the trendy servers at Postinos so I didn't expect Windsor to be much different. The decor is fun and I loved the wall of cassette tapes. Awesome conversation piece. Bathrooms are very similar to Postinos But unlike it's cousin, Windsor is not yet a 5-star place. It's got potential but it's not quite there. I'll definitely be back because they had a lot of very intriguing menu choices and those loaded chips are worth the price of admission all on its own.   Oh and one other note...like it's cousin, parking at Windsor is also a pain in the ass. Keep this in mind and definitely do the valet. It'll save you a lot of aggravation.

WVLUbR3iGc9t98ix50Vqfg.text: It's about time I update this review. I am here on a regular basis and am quite the Windsor fan. Unique, delicious food with consistent, excellent service.   I highly recommend finding a spot at the bar and hanging out for a while. I've witnessed all kinds of entertaining moments including a man leaving his sloppy, drunken wife. Good times.   The cheddar fondue (with pretzels only) is one of my favorite snacks during the colder months. Try it out...you won't be disappointed.

2bn4uf2IEMYRIfwLUnp0Mg.text: Really great place that I'm glad my friend found.  I love the out seating area, there was plenty of heating so even though it was cold out we sat out there.    Beer Selection - Hop Knot Food Ceviche Beef stroganoff - This was really excellent, I cant wait to make it on a night they have the lobster sandwich.

SIpqdcYiVhpYDlhr0M4GCg.text: The Rueben.   Seriously. If you like Reubens.... Let me say this. This sandwich is like sex in your mouth. And not just regular sex. GREAT sex. Seriously.   The cassette tapes are cool as well. Like taking a walk down musical memory lane every time I need to pee.

8PQeYfbapXtYalb9tdYYbw.text: This place is cool and quirky.  If you like the vibe of Arrogant Butcher, but think their food isn't great -- this is the place for you.  This place doesn't sacrifice atmosphere for good food.  I ordered the porkwich, which came with three kinds of pork with barbeque sauce.  It was tasty and the BBQ sauce wasn't too sweet, which I appreciated.  The kale side salad wasn't my favorite, but it wasn't bad.

7Q3NMJ7FdKQLUvAxQHoNuA.text: Any restaurant that can get kale to taste so delicious has to be amazing. The kale salad was delicious, on the side of the Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich.  So much flavor and so unique! I tried my husband's Windsor style burger and I thought it was great...and so huge! He only thought it was okay.
