We had the cheese fondue as a starter and the cheese was to die for! I could have used softer pretzels, but that cheese sauce just made me so happy. I enjoyed the ambiance and entire atmosphere very much. I'm happy :)

qgbfh6exiXScEHGl5HHW-w.text: My apologies! I thought I wrote this review weeks ago...  Windsor is great! The words "Best meal we have had in a long time" came out of my mouth before we were even finished with brunch.   The boy and I met mom and dad at Windsor for brunch a few weeks ago. It was hot out, but we braved the patio, their misting system is awesome! So we were comfortable. Oh before I forget we got a drink at the bar before sitting down and the menu is great! several things for $5, I got a pitcher of some great concoction for $5, it was like 4 drinks in one, needless to say I got myself a little tipsy before noon. Mom and the boy partook in the bloody mary bar they offer, they seemed to like it. Something interesting I saw, they offer a green bloody mary, I think it's spicier than normal. Hmmm?  Once we sat down we decided on a few appetizers, the deviled egg dip and corn dog popers. The dip was fab! I want to figure out how to make this shit at home and eat is on the reg! The popers were good, nothing to write home about, but the fried pickles they snuck in there really made me happy!  We all got something different, me the Eggs Benedict and they were great, eggs were perfectly cooked and there was a heaping of ham on top, I tried my hardest to finish it all. The boy got the Homemade Biscuts and Gravy, they put cheddar cheese in their biscuits, pretty much amazing! and it came with Schriener's sausage double win! Dad got grilled chicken sandwich (which I will be having next time we stop in, so obviously it was good) and he got a side of fried okra and mac'n'cheese. I stool more than a few bites of each because they were just that good. And finally mom had the Pastrami Reuben, mmmmmm yum maybe that is what I will have next time, I cant decide.   The service was great, everything was just awesome! I wish I was able to go right now! I'm hungry!

MDBO41cCx5wugKePM_ragw.text: Went for lunch today with my parents. Waited only 15 minutes around 1:00 for a table outside. I've been only once before for drinks and was seated at exact same table, against the brick wall. I could hardly hear my parents. Between the extra loud music and bad acoustics, we had to yell to have a conversation. :(  mind you I'm a club person and love music, just not while I'm eating and trying to enjoy others company.  I shared the pulled pork sandwich and kale salad, both awesome. But the sandwich was drowning in honey mustard sauce. The service was not the greatest and the waiter was not friendly at all. Only asked my dad how his burger was, which he said was good.  The food and drinks are really great. But not sure I'll be going again soon unless its off peak time and sit inside.

5Jjq_pUnTrYI6y5So4qpzQ.text: Came in for lunch today. Ordered the split pea soup with ham. Didn't realize it had called in sick today. Meh. Also, they sell fly strips at the Ace Hardware - it's about a mile from your restaurant.

AgBqaHpQevdAS1Wx-8kG5g.text: I loved the casual feel of this restaurant. They have a comfortable patio area for outside dining. The service was prompt and attentive. I ordered the Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich and it was excellent! I also ordered the Church Potatoes - they were amazing! Great comfort food - highly recommend!

dHkuuOyGxWv1msHKWtR5zw.text: I like supporting local businesses, and the food is good, so it's definitely worth going.  The menu is fairly small, but I like to think this is because they carefully choose and source their ingredients and prepare well thought-out dishes (I don't know if this is True or not, but it seems likely).  The reason it only gets 3 stars is because I was slightly put off by the trying-too-hard-to-be-hipster vibe, and although the food was good, it wasn't knock-my-socks-off good.  But definitely a solid choice for lunch or happy hour.

lh5z31Tb_cvUh21lD7MRmw.text: Love the ambience. the inside has a "loft" feel to it and the patio is very inviting. great place for a casual date.   They serve soups, salads, and sandwiches. The brown Bag sandwich is phenomenal.

WVG35IvWmgmBA_6_zqF8eA.text: More lackluster service at Upwards Projects.  I have been to Windsor half a dozen times, and every time I wonder why my friends rave about it.  I, personally, don't like their burgers.  Too wet.  The bun is soaked with juice and "medium" is mostly pink and red in the middle.  For a burger, that is undercooked.    This last time our family of 4 went in.  My kids are teenagers.  The waitress was a little surly.  After we sat down a cute young couple got seated in the table next to us.  They got their drinks AND their appetizers before we got our drinks.  They were halfway done through dinner before our meals even got served.  The waitress checked on them 10 times, and would either ignore us or peek over from afar and say "Are you all good?"  Joke is on her - the couple calculated the tip to the penny.  We probably would have left a better percentage on a higher tab, if she hadn't played the snob game with us.  I am sorry I am not a 28 year old hipster.  Upward are you trying to drive people like me away?

ich-IXMP1klKfOC-56jBOA.text: This review is brutal honesty... so take it for what you will.  Their menu is small.  I mean, almost uncomfortably small.  Probably 2/3 the size of Postino's menu, which is already a small (side note:  AMAZING) menu.    I was told to go here by everyone in creation because of the owners (meaning, the other places in town they own), and because the food is supposedly amazing.  What was amazing:  The staff.  The restaurant itself.  The location.  What was not amazing:  Parking.  The food.  I don't actually eat burgers, so it was my fault for ordering one.  That said, there are NOT a ton of choices for non-lovers of meat... so I ordered a burger because I sometimes get a hankering for one.  ... Medium well was pretty seriously pink.  The meat... was not my favorite flavor.  The bun... well, I love bread and I didn't love this bun.  My co-diner, however, loved her food.  Why four stars?  1.  The staff really is amazing.  2.  I know that any normal burger eater would have probably devoured my burger.  3.  I do love this location.  Don't not go here on my account - UNLESS you do not love meat.  Then just go to Postino.

LAwb4fn2mEEUzIapMmsoQg.text: Good food and very attentive service.  Music was a bit loud to have a conversion, but otherwise we loved it and will definitely go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A whole wall of cassettes!   Awesome!!

fB0jakGKe9RKaEaQaYbe4w.text: Windsor has become my staple place to take people when I need a "good place" off the top of my head. The food is good, the ambiance is great, and the service is dependable. It's got credibility with all the cool kids ("Oh I've heard of that place!") and the drink menu (and execution) is always a great conversation starter.

TvF-rBfa3anVHglCYC9Nzw.text: Oh Windsor, only happy memories. I came here for the first time for lunch with my Mom for her birthday. She just happened to be in town so we decided to try out this cool restaurant I'd heard about. The food was great and the ambience was fabulous. The servers are all so nice and even the valet people were super friendly. We were seated out on their patio in the sunshine. Perfect!   What I really want to comment on is how they helped make my Mom's day really special. Our server or one of the managers (I forget who) told me I could go to over the Churn (their sister, an ice cream shop) and pick out whatever I wanted for her! I was thrilled and they even put a candle in the lemon bar and ice cream I'd selected. Needless to say the friendly folks at Windsor and Churn made my mom's birthday lunch a really nice affair and I can't wait to go back!

aBmq9nHPPUukxtOkxJbakQ.text: This was a very adorable environment and the staff was great. But, if I'm being honest the food was a little bland and there wasn't a whole lot of options that didn't involve a TON of carbs. I'll definitely hangout and revisit but it will never be a place I crave.

e3So7ZVAvtU-E_nQ8kwMGg.text: Food was really good, loved the space and hipster/British pub vibe, but what really made the experience stand out was the service. We were there today during busy Sunday brunch with our 3 year old (which could have been awful) and had such a good experience. Every staff member, server and bartender was just so nice. The servers genuinely seemed to like working with each other and helped with each other's table. Loved this place.

rqBeg49wLCej071NQiQzqQ.text: I have been here a few times since my previous review for both dinner and breakfast. I will say, I am always satisfied, even though the BF doesn't always love it. When I went for breakfast, I had the matador which was delicious potatoes with chile verde and eggs on a crispy tortilla...it was pretty fantastic. Also, I have had their delicious multi grain salad and their really tasty chicken and corn chowder. Anyway, this place continues to be a satisfying place to eat...no, it's not the best food in town....but I never leave feeling sad that I came.  For your viewing pleasure, my original review: I can pretty much sum this place up in one word.......mmmmmm.  Ok, not really a word, and, of course, I can't really leave a review at one noise, but seriously....mmmmm. I could eat this food all the time...except then I would be super fat, so I won't, but the point is that I could!  I went here on Monday night for my sister in law's birthday/anniversary party. We had a large group of at least ten people. Our waiter, Rodger, was great! He was very attentive, kept our waters full, and even remembered everyone's order correctly without writing it down...pretty impressive stuff.  I ordered the steak frites, but because we were such a large group, I got to try a bunch of menu items. We started with the fondue (soooo good....I wanted to eat it straight with a fork), the loaded chips (?), also very tasty, and the mini corndogs, good, but not as good as the other two. My steak was delicious, it had an herb butter on top and was cooked perfectly. The fries were crispy and perfect. The BF got the burger with church potatoes. The burger was a pretty standard burger....not something I would come here for specifically, but the church potatoes were pretty good. I tried someone else's ribs.....EXCELLENT! The bbq sauce was spicy and sweet...the meat fell off the bone...this is something I would definitely recommend. I think our table had (possibly) one of each entree and everyone raved about the food. I would definitely come back here again.

tTTeGj29l-TnCdnc0zzc8g.text: I love how this place has great tasting food and a pleasant atmosphere. There is TV and WIFI in the place and the service is great.

QVM_pjj5H9UkvZW4d2qeWA.text: Came here for brunch on a beautiful Sunday. Their patio is lovely, plants abloom, giving you a feeling of privacy even while others are right next to you.   My entree, the matador, was incredible! The potatoes under the egg/ tortillas were my favorite, and the sauce they used was tangy and unique. My friend got the omelet and said it was also delicious. The wonderful drink specials definitely don't hurt ($5 mimosas, bloodies, cocktails, pitchers of beer, etc.)  I can't wait to come back!

9PLc7TALTkIyAHiJWmx5Qw.text: DELICIOUS!  This is only my second Yelp review, but I was so impressed with the food and service we received this weekend that I had to submit one.  Super yummy food, and all of our servers were very knowledgeable and friendly.  One of my new favorite restaurants!

4hpvOWlZIMCBXL9EQBr7gw.text: Neat place. We really enjoyed the atmosphere. Food was good. Not great, but still good. Fondue was a little grainy and fries were limp. Pork sandwich was really good. Husband had the Ruben which he liked but thought it needed more sauerkraut.  Expected more from reading the reviews prior to going.  All in all it was nice but nothing special.

tdlhwiGxqqopl3tgONpOVg.text: One of my favorite spots in the whole valley. I was just thinking of how to put this place into words and I saw Natalie D's first line, I concur. I believe it to be a little more hipster than even the Vig... well, maybe just as hipster... but either way its a good change from Scottsdale so make the trip.   I have done three dinners and a brunch here and somehow liked it more than the last time each visit. I have since moved out of Scottsdale, haven't been in the Windsor for a while, and for some reason I can't view their menu, so I won't be getting into too man specifics about the food but you can trust that is excellent.   Brunch: get the doughnut holes as an appetizer, I don't think that was the intention but it works out gloriously. Everything else is awesome, the pancakes are amazing and they have this cream on them that words cannot explain. I personally ordered the sausage and gravy, if you can handle some weight early on in the day, give them a try but make sure someone at the table orders the pancakes and is willing to share a little (good luck with that btw).   Dinner: Come in enough to try just about everything.   If you live in the area this should be you're go-to spot. Period.

z9KwWThWOsxvjLJ2-WouUA.text: Went to The Windsor for the first time on a Thursday evening in the course of entertaining out-of-town guests.  Nice job on the overall design of the restaurant (great patio) and the staff is very friendly and attentive.  The place is obviously popular and was very crowded; parking was difficult.  We were seated in a reasonable amount of time.    Appetizers (Ceviche and the Loaded Chips) were very good.  Kale Caesar with salmon was poor, but all parties agreed that the New Orleans Style Pork Ribs were excellent.  Aside from the Kale Caesar, the only other negatives were that the table was too small for 4 people and the place was very loud.  Will probably not go back for dinner (too crowded and noisy), but will likely try the brunch.

tZa1drDR6xhY8R8uhFTQzg.text: When we move from the high desert (Vistancia), this restaurant will be in our backyard!!! Definitely the place to meet and greet....booze and schmooze Excellent service and awesome patio tunes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chillaxen
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch on the patio!

XeymdOfB1m8hEaKvlQ4qhA.text: Exceeded expectations. Sat at the bar on a Saturday before 5pm and the bar tenders were amazingly attentive and knowledgeable. Between me and my husband, we tried every cocktail on the menu (only $5 each!) Our favorites were No. 04, 08, 17, 63. Loaded chips were good. I would have preferred for the chips to be less done, but the toppings were spot on. The pastrami Reuben and Mac and cheese were amazing! Can't wait until next Saturday before five when we will sample their wine menu. Normally I like to try out different restaurants, but I can't wait to come back here.

xBD8818xoPg3uV8KNTkNvA.text: Love this place. $5 cocktails before 5pm every day. Fantastic atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious food. I always get the brown bag chicken. Plus, they are attached to Churn which serves some of the best ice cream in Phoenix!

ZAVxGMqWO0sdGjNImzUL4A.text: Love this place! Food and service is amazing and they have the best dog friendly patio!

XQafFiP1GbxmVeUgs_xm7Q.text: Such a great patio - fantastic even in the July heat with a cold drink. It can be a long wait sometimes but so worth it! I have had some not so great dishes - stay away from the veggie burger - it was pretty sad, falling apart, and undercooked, but the fries made up for it! Amazing sweet potato fries and great salads. Kids meals are fantastic and the service is phenomenal.

S73ZJg53dWHoAfIi94h8LA.text: Food is great! Whether I want to be healthy and have the Veggie Stack or pig out the Porkwich and Mac & Cheese, I can always find something I'm in the mood for. Happy hour from 11am to 5pm offers $5 pitchers, wine, and cocktails. And although there is no food on happy hour, all of the appetizers are perfect for sharing over a drink.  I also love brunch on the weekends. I'm not a pancake person, but the pancakes here are amazing! Happy hour also starts at brunch on the weekends so you can have a beer with your pancakes just the way God intended. The only thing I'm not to fond of at brunch is the basic 2 egg breakfast. It's supposed to come with a side of fruit, and I don't consider 2 strawberries a "side."  My only complaints with Windsor are the service. The valet is incredibly slow, and I feel like the waitstaff is never consistent. I've had really great service some nights, and not so great service on others. Still, you can't spell Windsor without "win." I'm so clever.

m5YrfuAe3soOGywfb0eSCQ.text: Came here one Sunday morning with my boyfriend and we were amazed that we had never seen or heard of this place before. Their Bloody Mary bar was so much fun! They offer so many ingredients that allow you to get creative with your Mary. It was such a cool dinning experience. They also have amaaaaazing $5 cocktails before 5pm and the food was superb. I had the summer salad (trying to watch my figure) and every bite was surprisingly enjoyable. Probably one of the best salads I've ever had! Can't wait to go back again.

neDVbJCRbV4QBdpxWALVWw.text: While traveling from LA the good luck gnome popped up and showed us to this little gem.  Love the ambiance service and food.  I had the porkwich with sweet potato. Others had kabobs. Salad soup and others. Not one bad dish. To boot we were there during a $5 pitcher hour so even better.  Great server. What else? Go. You'll love it!

tF3CAzdZzdkdHJGFDwSRlQ.text: Awesome, awesome food. The service is very sub par though. I know it's busy, but the same request doesn't have to be ignored multiple times. But let's talk about what will make me return to this place, the food. I had the omelet at brunch and boy was it delicious. The ingredients were super fresh and it was cooked perfectly. That's  saying a lot for someone who doesn't particularly enjoy omelets that much. I will definitely be back here to try stuff on their normal menu as it looked equally as delicious and the drinks are super reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

N4dXSV_If4vO06f_1cd6wg.text: The menu sounded good, but food was unremarkable.  Chicken sandwich was dry. The veggi burger sounded amazing but was flavorless. The barely put any sauce on any of their sandwiches. Fries were half done and no seasoning.

BzPe5N_9VjRxKYW_G-G6pQ.text: It came a time when I finally tried Windsor for dinner.  My hubby and I went here for dinner last with some friends.  The atmosphere is pretty cool.  They had patio seating and indoor seating.    So, the food was amazing. First we started with Russian Roulettes that we really good.  Then I had the porkwich that I got recommend from my friend (Reese). Wow, that is was by far the best pork sandwich I have ever had.  It had pulled pork; Tender Belly braised ham & smoked bacon layered with gold sauce & crunchy coleslaw on a buttermilk bun. My husband had the Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich that is pretty amazing too.  Our friends had the Windsor burger and the bacon burger.    All I can say is, if you have not been to Windsor you are missing out.  You should check it out if you are ever in mid-town Phoenix.

ss5hVwKE5X1-TT7UXPJ8zQ.text: I have tried this place a few times. The food is ok, same concept as Postinos and the Vig. I can't really comment too much on the food because I mostly go there for drinks. I've tried the pork sandwich with coleslaw and it was pretty good, I had to be a lady so I had a small salad before the sandwich, which was the Fattoush Salad. Everything was tasty, but I am not going to say OMG it was the best thing I've ever had. The stuff in the menu are things you can easily find somewhere else. The place is nice, low lights, obviously gets a little loud during happy hours, it's a cool little trendy place.   On the personal side, I think the place is cursed!! Why?? Well, I've had 2 first dates there for happy hour and .... sadly...there were first and last. =( Totally heart broken, especially from the cute blue eyed attorney, they were both an awesome catch, but apparently I wasn't =( boooooo... gotta break the pattern though! next first date will be anywhere else but Windsor. =)  Enjoy !!

6h6Czkgmc8KrRu5BbgITpA.text: From the atmosphere to the food, Windsor is an awesome experience. The staff was very nice, our food came out very quick and we always felt like we were taken care of. Everyone at our table loved their food, this place is great for a two person date for drinks or to bring the whole family. So excited to come back.

qrD521Vy3JYQBTdFlfcnfg.text: The backyard burger Windsor style and deviled egg is to die for! Great ambiance, music, and patio area! Also churn is next door for that after dinner sweet tooth!

KcIWgAk7Pk1B30hDyKekGg.text: The Windsor is as classy as the knot that preceded it. The atmosphere is casual and hip all at the same time. Great selection of fresh good including a great ahi tuna salad. It's a great place to have an office happy hour. MAKE you pop in next door at Churn to have some of the best ice cream in the state, possibly the country.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna salad
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wall of cassette tapes. Classic!

L9EZ8Utovo_ZpZgESdT11g.text: We showed up at prime dinner time (Saturday @ 7pm) with a party of seven. We were told the wait may be about 30-40 minutes, but it was more like 3-4 minutes as they were able to accommodate us right away.   We sat outside on their patio which had a very "comfortable" feel to it. The lighting and decor just made it feel like you were relaxing on the back porch with some close friends.   Everyone enjoyed their food as we all ordered various items from the menu. My personal favorites were the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and Jo's Church Potatoes.   I will definitely be back. Great for a group or a one on one date in my opinion.

sCtlDSTP5aPtk2qO_Md2iA.text: This is my 1st visit to Windsor for an early Sunday dinner. When I scored a self parking space close to the entrance I knew I was going to be good time here. I had the same luck at Postino's the week prior...so weird...anyways.... Ambiance (4*) - Kinda like an English pub inside a 1940's building with, dark booths, brick walls, exposed ceiling. I was surprise to see a kiddies menu here. They even have "Kids Rule" written on top +1*. Though there were only 3 main entrees to choose from (grilled ck on stick, mini corn dog, & twin cheeseburger sliders), the choose of sides were pretty good (veggie of the day, fries, mac&cheese, fruit, or chips). Porkwich (4*) w/ chopped Kale Salad (5*) - Lots of things going on in this Porkwich....pulled pork, ham & bacon jammed into btw buttermilk bun. But it's the chopped kale salad that I chose as my side dish that became the star on my plate. I didn't even know I like kale but I hope they let me order this as a main dish yelp.com/biz_photos/cTJj... Drinks - Their hard liquor selection is pretty impressive. Since I'm a light weight, the $2.50 shorty Hoegaarden fit me perfectly. there's also the $5 pitchers for wine, draft or cocktail seems like a great deal if you come before 5 pm. yelp.com/biz_photos/cTJj... Service (5*) I did take couple bites of my sister's Pastrami Ruben, which was way too salty. Other than that, I can't wait to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2011 - patio area
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2011 - patio area 2
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2011 - porkwich w/ chopped kale salad

O0rkMnJfIfqfR4BEGmPwVQ.text: Great food, scenery and ambience for lunch or dinner.  Veggie burger is delicious and the fish sandwich has a great kick!

FrPMofovueO8hdavHAPK4A.text: Amazing. Delicious. Awesome. Stupendous? Lol I can go on and on! The Windsor is a great place, with a great atmosphere and tasty food. I really love the Mac and cheese! And the ice cream next door is very convenient for dessert! I am a huge fan of the environment, great for chit chatting with friends, or even celebrating a birthday with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Written on the floor by the bathrooms

QPIXlI0a0eesdTeFYnelmw.text: This is place is simply Awesome! They are owned by Upwards project which has pretty much by themselves revitalized the Camelback/central area, by opening up 5 restaurants!   This place has wonderful food, the Porkwich with a side of church potatoes being my favorite! Went here for my birthday and ordered the ribs. Aside from a little to much sauce, they were really good. The grilled chicken sandwich is defiantly one of the best you can get.   Customer service has always been one of my favorite things about eating here. Everyone is super friendly. The wait staff do not have assigned tables, instead everyone helps everyone else. No more waiting to get your glass filled, or get the check! I wish every place was this easy to get service at.  I would highly recommend them!

3bMCCyYYa7x8y8PQNVvYoQ.text: OH MY GOD ! I love this place .. Yummy food . We had the Russian Roulette peppers , the Kabobs and the Pork Sandwich , it was amazing .. Our waiter , who was awesome with a mohawk  , didnt catch his name , gave us high fives .. This whole evening made me more aware of why I want to move to that neighborhood . Great food and so much fun !

7gr7Cguyz1xm4SxKq1kOnw.text: I regular here twice a week! The food is phenomenal, ambiance is great, prices are amazing for what you are getting, and they play excellent music. The staff is trendy and very helpful and your food comes out fast. I recommend here for lunch or dinner any day of the week!

UpoJijxeoPTHHJYT6kXttw.text: I have LOVED every bite I've eaten here.   The Bahn Mi ($13) sandwich, is filled with grilled halibut that is tender and light on your palate. You can pick up on the sweet flavor of the honey-soy glaze, although the bread is a little overwhelming (I suggest skipping it or going "open faced").   My new favorite, though, is the brown bag chicken sandwich ($10). This time, I skipped the bread.  The cold, pulled chicken was moist and robustly flavored. The textures between the tender chicken, the crunch of hazelnuts and the chewy tomato kept it interesting. I went with the fresh vegetable which was broccolini and it was cooked perfectly -- still crunchy!  $5 drinks at Happy Hour include the aptly named "No. 1": Tito's Handmade Vodka, Watermelon Agua Fresca, Vanilla-Mint Syrup and Orange Bitters. You can taste every single flavor note in the description. It's a great concoction!  I'm definitely a big fan of Windsor! Looking forward to future visits...

Bp0x6eyf1wunuz1tR-wIFw.text: Amazing! Food and service was great. Fun music and dimmed light theme. I got the Bacon burger and sweet potato fries. Everything was so fresh. They also gave us a great insight when to get in line for Churn the desert place next door.

oWQzPepDxw8G1Q2ofVzZYQ.text: Dropped in solo to the bar for a late dinner and a drink. The bartender was prompt and friendly, I really enjoyed this place. If you're fortunate to come in on the weekend, the confit chicken wings are a must. Confit. Chicken. Wings. Read it again. Really enjoyed the No. 4 cocktail, as well; gin, cardamom, grapefruit, hops bitters. Like the cocktail version of a really complex, refreshing pale ale. I'll definitely come back here when I return to Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Confit chicken wings, cocktail #4.

eFfS1axe0hzWNKUQXsjcIQ.text: If you're going for brunch, skip it. Cool atmosphere, but the food wasn't impressive. Bloody Mary's were weak as well.

uCkbhgYgWfJl4MYmOAgNVw.text: We're big fans of Churn and Federal Pizza.  I also like Postinos, but not as much as the other two.  Windsor has been a bit of a let down.  We did dinner with friends here a few weeks ago, particularly this restaurant for the kids menu and our friends had 3 kids under 10.  Good idea? Yes.  Dinner for 8 was good and affordable.  I purposefully ordered a slightly bland meal due to preparing for a half marathon later that week.  Cocktails are good.  Apps are yummy.  But goodness me, do not come here when it's actually busy.  We had a group of 8 so we were able to get a reservation for dinner.  All of that was fine and we finished with ice cream at Churn.  It was a good night.  Brunch.  NO.  We arrived at 12:15.  We're post church brunchers.  We waited for 45 minutes to finally sit down, order a pitcher of pimms, and there was NO PIMMS in the pimms.  It tasted like lemon juice.  We asked to switch it out for a pitcher of beer (bad idea for this girl who doesn't really tolerate gluten).  Then we ordered.  Loaded chips, frittata for me, matador for husband, donuts to share.  No donuts.  How do you run out of donuts?  Seriously?  He comes back, no matador.  So, we have bad pimms, no donuts, and no matador.  All the food my husband was looking forward to, was a disappointment or unavailable.    My frittata was decent, husband's basic breakfast unappealing (I make a better basic than that) and the fruit cup saddening.  It's summer -- where were the berries!  Neither one of us was in the mood for beer so that didn't life our spirits.    Our lesson: don't go to brunch here.  The most depressing thing was that we tried it because we enjoyed our last experience.  And this experience we did not enjoy.  We know of other places where it may not be as gourmet, but we're in and out quickly and always leave happy.  What makes me really sad is that we probably won't return or recommend this restaurant.  I can't really go back now that I had that experience.  There are other places that haven't let me down, time after time.

KsDgoQlBL19d2XAo2MUU4w.text: Amazing Brunch, especially the quinoa oatmeal or the bacon burger!

G87K6hOStkpG0xXjgbFA4A.text: Just got back from dinner so this is fresh as can be.  I will make this review quick and simple  Bartending rocked. Even though it was super busy she made time to make sure we were being taken care of (good job Claire!).  The Porkwich was sexy and delish. I neverrrrrrrrrrrr like coleslaw but dang... perfect combo with the combined ingredients of my entree.  Pork belly corndogs... highly recommended for a bar snack!  Soup of the day was chicken tortilla... Love the heat in the soup but Salad portion could have been a bit more balanced with the soup but maybe that is asking a bit much for $10? Still enjoyed thoroughly! Also why the massive crouton? lol....  Go there if you haven't, definitely my favorite upward projects restaurant for sure! (maybe a close tie with postino)  Amazing vibe and architecture to add***

AbuN7i6KnEQeMeE95k3DvA.text: They pay attention to detail: The service is attentive without being intrusive. The food is delicious: Freshly made for each person - you would think this is a new concept, but apparently it is rare these days Decor is hip: Even my wife loves it -- Think of this place when you want a great breakfast Think of this place when you want a salad - and get one of theres Think of this place if you want a cocktail (and get a designated driver). Its a great place - put it on your list

0i_JOsRh-osQ65HmLmhBhA.text: All three stars go to the food and none to the service. I ordered the (vegetarian) salad I referred to in my previous review and what do they bring me? A caesar salad with salmon on top. They took it back and brought me a non-animal salad. I actually didn't know it was Caesar at first, I just thought wow they really have changed this salad since I last had it. But I started to really wonder where my beets and butternut squash were. I just thought they really gypped me with the toppings. I soon found out that my husband ordered a Caesar salad with salmon but he thought it didn't taste like Caesar and there were a lot more non-Caesar-like things in there, like quinoa and goat cheese and farrow. That's where MY salad went all along! But it had salmon all over it so what could I do at that point but be totally depressed with a weak and boring and very mediocre Caesar salad. So maybe my three stars should be two. But the roasted peppers in oil and salt are just so awesome.   If we had ONE waitress/waiter and not FIVE, it might have gone better for us. And maybe they could like, I don't know, use a notepad to write down the order so they really can get it right?   Also I think the dress code is very slack for the waitstaff. One of them looked like he was trying to be homeless.   They covered up that tree hazard though!!! Enough people must have gotten hurt there. They also have an actual business sign out front now. And a parking lot next door! Still no place to wait but luckily we got seated quickly.

OhPT336H4QeC6DbvS2d3JQ.text: I had the chance to enjoy lunch at the bar. Manny, the bartender is very friendly and attentive. I ordered the ceviche which turned out to be too spicy for me (yes, I'm a wimp when it comes to spice) and he had the manager comp my wine. What a sweet gesture. I'll be back for their On The Block buttermilk fried chicken which is only served after 4 pm. Their happy hour rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bat

foLTOQl6Ue76EC1Wzdmfwg.text: Great spot.   The windsor style backyard burger and the white fish banh mi were awesome.   The spicy mayo on the banh mi gave the perfect kick, and the backyard burger was prepared very well and went great with the garlic aioli.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Windsor style backyard burger
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich

oIW53uczT3lVAriSXgc3gA.text: Best fish & chips I've had in Phoenix! AMAZING!!! Their drinks are good too! I had their No 30 and graveyard mash - the Halloween special were really good. The grilled chicken sandwich was very good too. Will definitely be back here for fish & chips and happy hour drinks! The best thing is their happy hour is everyday, even weekends, until 5pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Mick&#39;s &amp; chips in Phoenix!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Graveyard mash
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich

BgagEPcXyGmerYfgG9a-vQ.text: I've been to Windsor a half dozen times now and every time I stop by I am continually impressed. The $5 before 5PM cocktail selection is ALWAYS on point - I tried a coconut burbon old fashioned today that was totally unique and delicious.   The egg salad dip is rockin and the eggs benedict options I've tried have all been excellent. I just noticed they have chicken wings on the weekends and I'll definitely be trying them next time I drop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0RUeEdFnRhGDjERcrRnGuw.text: Always a great fun place!! Happy Hour the best!  Great cocktails and appetizers!! Have been for lunch too. The sandwiches are fabulous. Sides too notch.  Fun to sit on patio with the misters going. Great music playing always. Great for young and Old!!  My favorites are the Russian Roulettes! Shisheto peppers with sea salt and a roasted red pepper sauce. ( some are hot some are not)  The fondue is so good. Comes with Apple and pretzel bread and sausage.  Banh Mi fish sandwich for lunch is my favorite.  Come enjoy a fun place with great food!!  The wall of cassette tapes is cool to view as well!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love upward projects concept.  $5 cocktails and wine and beer until 5

vPox5ZbBT42ex1lb3gr9bQ.text: I have to say I wasn't disappointed.  Started with the loaded chips. This stole the show I was in love with this appetizer. It was beyond awesome I was in the middle of eating my sandwich and I would stop to eat more of the loaded chip. So to just say it the best item of the night I will return just for the loaded chips.   The next best thing was the service, glasses always full. Someone always there to check on us so attentive.   The country vegetable chop was stellar fresh good flavor and the portions were on point added the grilled chicken and it was a filling meal and couldn't be happier.   The last two things were the Ruben and classic burger. They were decent it's hard to mess it up and they didn't nice seasoning, and quality meat.    I will return here just for the loaded chips. Everyone needs to try these. It will change you.

Ok-EjgnCuVPg5hzw2fRT0g.text: Came here on a Friday night. Packed as I would expect an upward projects concept to be.   I ordered the windor's wings with a habanero sambal sauce. While the sauce was tasty and the perfect amount of spice, the wings were absolutely disgusting and slimy. Not crispy at all and the skin felt like jelly in my mouth. I unfortunately could not eat them because of the awful texture and taste of the chicken. I had to resort to eating off of my fiance's plate for the rest of the night.  My fiance ordered the grilled chicken sand which, which I thought tasted pretty good. He ordered it with a side of sweet potato fries (my fave) and the meal paired well together. Although the chicken was a little dry, the overall sandwich was good.   There honestly wasn't many things on the menu that appealed to me. However, if you like backyard barbecue type food, this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

O6QJQGr_O-Kw_73f7pgWxA.text: Love this place! Cozy with good vibes.  Happy hour until 5 - $5 pitcher of beer, wine & cocktails.  I had a side of kale salad and cheesy potatoes; $4 each. Husband had chicken sandwich. Everything delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wall covered with cassette tapes.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ‼
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. She&#39;s camping out. Lol!

QlEWkxy8GAjsVu-osZX9og.text: Got the chicken sandwich with the side of sweet potato and it was pretty good. I like the greens on top of chicken as well as dressing. And the sweet potato fries was really good. Seemed like they make the ketchup in house and it tastes great. My fiance got the chicken wings and she didn't really like it. She was expecting the wings to be crispy but she was disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OcusFageJeebbvr9V66t-A.text: I loved this place when first opened , The Deviled Egg Dip was amazing and the service was top notch   Stopped by today due to craving the Bacon Deviled Egg Dip , was very disappointed and underwhelmed ....  Not sure if they changed the recipe or someone just got it wrong ... the blue cheese or Goat Cheese over-powered the dip ....  not the same , and not good ... Hope they go back to original recipe or he person who knows how to make it ... Service was still good and vibe was awesome ...

XxWGIBSfCGXPqYn_BtyFSQ.text: I love this place! The times I have dined here have been nothing but phenomenal! Food and drinks are amazing, and their service is stellar! This is the place I wouldn't mind waiting a few minutes to get a table and sit down, because it is that good! Definitely recommend!!

0oeClkSxe112DbfPSJOPkg.text: This place had an amazing vibe with outdoor seating, misters, and room for dogs. The food all looked good, however my dietary restrictions left me with about two options on the menu, (gluten free and vegetarian) I saw the description as vegetarian so I was excited but the options were low. The fries and peppers were good though! Coke was not good, but staff was friendly and quick. Dog friendly patio and I had no issue which is great. If I ate meat and gluten I could rate it higher

V1MjBDY6nNETXoVyrRMf5A.text: Went to Windsor on a Sunday and it was GREAT! They have the best specials on drinks! We each had a pitcher of beer and, to eat, we had the biscuits and gravy with sausage and a porkwich with sweet potato fries. Soooooo delicious!! We sat at the bar and had really great service. It was very busy that morning but no one missed a beat. Great location, great food, and great service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar view!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy with sausage
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Porkwich with sweet potato fries

IEcAWgix3hkMFVbW_3UAKg.text: Love the atmosphere and the people but the staff is what brings me back.   Rob is great and entertaining.   Great side show with brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rob is the best!

podSSXsimloYoBH4VpHpIQ.text: This is the first and only place I've ever been that has had a bloody mary bar. What! Hello, this is a brilliant idea! How come no one else has thought of it.   Now the dish I ordered was a bit mediocre, but this place is getting four stars because of the uniqueness of the bloody mary bar. Sheer genius and a must try if you enjoy the opportunity to make your bloody your own.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chef&#39;s special, chicken omelet. Meh!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody mary bar, bloody genius!

rSbROMhhKPFSCw6H7Sp2dw.text: This is a unique restaurant with patio seating and a full bar. This is one of the places a few of my gym friends meet up after Saturday morning workout .  This morning I ordered a simple breakfast that includes delicious bacon which came cold and fruit which look like they had pre-made it in the refrigerator yesterday. They were very sweet and brought me more cold bacon and a fresher bowl of fruit. I will need to try something else next time.

SKrrKYva6dF8stQcEcwnNg.text: Great cocktails, food and atmosphere. Great playlist. Wish it was closer to home. Great service too!!!

Db9qr6bFjXVnnJ98JGWB6A.text: Met my boyfriend for lunch one day here. The entrance to the restaurant was a little confusing but besides that the food was really good!

If5vXZi-sYJwqFwSPnXz0g.text: We came here last weekend to take advantage of what could possibly be the last pleasant summer day in Phoenix for the season. Naturally, we chose to sit on the patio. It's a nice little space outside with misters everywhere. We got seated in one of the corner booths and decided to get started with a couple of drinks. We ordered the No. 57 and Pitcha of Pimms. The drinks were refreshing without tasting overly sweet, which was a nice break from the monotony of sugary cocktails. The prices were kind of unbelievable. I mean $5 for an entire pitcher of Pimms? Pretty fantastic! They even have pitchers of beer for 5 bucks. What a bargain!   For food, we decided to order The Matador and Southern Style Sausage and Gravy. The former was my order and although the taste was pretty great, the portion size was relatively small for brunch. I tasted the biscuits and gravy and it also did not disappoint. Flavors were on point and so was the service. It was a pleasant experience overall and surprisingly did not break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southern Style Sausage and Gravy
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Matador

ULl4YSq0kobtSFmCpdRyaw.text: This place has bad service. Unsure of what exactly was going on but went there with my sister we had to seat ourself and then they gave us our menues and we ordered our foods. They seem to have forgot about us since the couple of girls next to us got served already with there food. Will not be going back again. Worst experience ever. Unacceptable. I do not recommend coming here. We ended up walking out to eat at Federal next door which I highly recommend going to they have terrific customer service and made us feel like home.

qXhzX6gJZC1ic0eC0BfqIw.text: Windsor reached out to me, and asked me to give them another try. I'm very happy I did, because the service & food were great!  I ordered a burger medium rare, and it was perfect! The fries were  perfectly seasoned & came out hot.   There is parking both in front & back, but lot's of room in the back lot.

vLJXsTGwwn0mR-sexOdNsw.text: This was my first time here and I went for brunch. There was no wait when I got there at 10:45 but a line did form after we were seated. Service was honestly FREAKY fast. I got eggs Benedict and a mimosa and it was delicious. And I am picky about my eggs Benedict. Very cute vibe and awesome patio. Will definitely be returning.

fd-SgpTZD7tPf1YyvelYYQ.text: First of all, the staff is VERY friendly! When I wasn't happy with my drink (#95 - I like very fruity drinks) they adjusted it to my liking with no hesitation! I got the pastrami burger with sweet potato fries. It tasted soooo good but it was huge so I couldn't finish it. I love the ambiance and just for the good service alone - I'd return.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

L0XEG-VrOHQYIKFG2j4Dfw.text: Crap cake, burgers, and brunch menu, it all looked so good but I went with the crap cakes, yummmmm.  Sitting outside eating and visiting, I love dinning out in Phoenix.  Anyway I can fit some of this in my carry on and take it back to Wisconsin?  Counting the years before we move out here permanently.

2FafJPHAOnF0Mfqhjd9y5Q.text: Went there for Sunday brunch --- but wound up eating just apps. Saw others eating breakfast food --- looked awesome. Huge cinnamon rolls, biscuits and gravy... Bloody Mary bar was ok, not as elaborate as Hash. But ok. We had the fondue and tuna poke appetizers. Both were excellent. Nice vibe too. Patio was packed - looked like it would phenomenal when the weather is below 100. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fondue and a Bloody Mary

VUWcnt8uHkD5jrTEo9GmRw.text: My family and I stopped in for brunch. The staff were super friendly. They were always refilling our drinks. The brunch menu was not large, but the items were well thought out. I ordered the corn meal waffle with seasonal fruit, which happened to be raspberry compote and cream, and a side order of bacon. Both were delicious. The bacon was thick and cooked perfectly. My cousin loved the hash brown dish with her breakfast sandwich. Overall, it was a delightful meal.

JzvmisAoGrhSNnGrNNJjKA.text: My first time there... I really enjoy the ambience. Good food and good service. My only complaint/disappointment is the Eggs Benny doesn't come with a side so you have to pay extra and paying $18 for eggs benny is a bit much.

ww2Klk4rGhyDZ3IocRxAjg.text: Came here for brunch w/ a friend of mine. When we walked up the entrance looked more like it was the back of the building. Weird. Is there two entrances? lol. There was a line outside the door. I wasn't sure if people were just waiting for their names to be called or it was an actual line. Apparently there was no one there to help any of us. This is already a bad first impression for me.   We got seated on the patio. 2nd negative was we got there at 1:10 and missed their brunch menu by ten minutes! Darn it! They need to extend their brunch menu. For drinks I ordered the No. 14. Anything watermelon I just have to try. This drink has Silver Rum, Pressed Watermelon, Habanero-Ginger Syrup, Smoked Chile Rim.There was definitely a kick to it. lol  I ordered the brown bag chicken sandwich with a side of mac and cheese. It was good but not great. I really liked the mac and cheese. My friend got a side of the potatoes which I got to try. I think I liked their sides better than the entrees. lol.   I was a bit disappointed in the customer service here. Our server was not personable, sociable or friendly at all. It was just straight business. What would you like to drink, are you ready to order? Done deal.   I might come back to try their brunch menu next time, but other then that, don't think it was worth the drive for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 14
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brown bag chicken sandwich w/ mac &amp; cheese

2Rf7jugtVpEF0eEFz4oT3Q.text: Great food and drinks. Server was really nice, the only thing I didn't like was the restrooms, they have them men and women together.

IdN4ofXLp_L3iR1TcplwkA.text: This is our new favorite go to place for brunch. Amazing from arrival to departure. Great Staff, great good and great original drinks! A must for all!. We will see you soon. A+++++++

_8QeybW_az2YLelZM5ur7A.text: Found this place and Yelp and I am glad I did.   The atmosphere is very cool and laid back. We came at around 2pm on a Saturday and this place was packed.   My buddy got some sort of burger and I jammed on the chicken sandwich. Chicken sandwich was ridiculously good. It had some sort of mayo type sauce with what i think were mangos diced up. We both grubbed on a side of mac and cheese.   Patio out back was hot but it was better than waiting 30 min for inside to open up.   My only grip was there was this horrible noise on the back patio that was really loud. Hope they fix that!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sign out front

tYL2GlPESVFaLWOT_HRYxQ.text: The pictures of the design looks a lot classier than it is. The brunch menu was small but very good. I had the biscuits, gravy and sausage. The gravy was very rich with large chunks of sausage in it. The biscuit is more of a cheesy crusty scone with a soft inside.  My friend had the crab cake eggs benedict. I'm usually not a big fan of hollandaise sauce but it was very complimentary here. The crab cake itself was incredibly good. Lots of real crab pieces you could see.

fSL5qYj4KvIoSDaGvWEr-Q.text: Windsor was recommended to me by a local. I enjoyed the food and the craft cocktails. The fatousch salad was amazing. It tasted fresh and the dressing was light. My dining companion had the fish and chips which was also good. Our waiter let us sit at the table while we ate dessert from next door. The outdoor area looked good, although we sat inside. Service was good.

k_CRFbchnJtbILww6X5arQ.text: Brunch menu seemed a bit limited. The food was delicious, but I think the drinks might be even better. Very nice atmosphere and the staff.

3T_I9MIO9o77kiqUOW4plQ.text: Came here for a brunch date and was surprised by the menu selections.  I think we caught it for a lunch setup rather than a brunch setup on a Saturday afternoon but nonetheless everything was delicious.  The vibe was good though the music was a bit too loud that sitting across from my date that I couldn't even hear her speaking right across from me.  Our Server Jacob, ON POINT!!!!!  Loved everything about his descriptions, suggestions and his execution.  His team that was helping him out made sure we never ran out of water and overall the experience was great.  I'll be back to check it out but maybe more drinks less talk.

fGFDTYEZCUyV1FyKdI5yxQ.text: Great place, great drinks, and food. Kinda wish there was a little more variety on the menu.

Zku0SbSpfLVYGHkK4FOh1A.text: I love (love love) the Windsor-Federal-Joyride block for taking out of town guests out to dinner in Phoenix. It shows folks (no matter what they're in the mood for) why Phoenix is getting that foodie-city reputation without breaking the bank.   Windsor is the comfort/bar food option and I will happily get fat off their mac and cheese or that killer crab cake BLT. But they also have good beers, sharp servers, and that dark comfy bar atmosphere (or on a nice day, that airy garden patio vibe) that sometimes hits the spot. Plus you can order Churn delivered to your table. I mean, come on.  Why not five stars? Because when its crowded, IT'S CROWDED. That means everything feels rushed and claustrophobic. So, I can't ever recommend this place on a Friday or Saturday night.   PRO-TIP: Join their e-posse. They email great coupons and freebies.

lOX6iXb6V4gMKS3sDQRzGg.text: I love this place!  The menue is limited though they are always happy to make substitutions.  I love love the bloody mary bar.  You can even get a virgin bloody mary and stock up at the bar.    Super stack with cheese potatoes- sandwhich was awesome but the cheese potatoes were salty and tasted processed.    The little potatoes are tender and yummy.

668hWxtGnPy7WrBgphTjHQ.text: The food here was very excellent!  I ordered the best veggie burger I have had in a long time. Even though we were quoted an hour for wait time we only had to wait about 15 minutes which was a huge plus!  Will be coming back!

0wEXC5wmj5vY3OPFjdfQvw.text: We are big Upward Projects fans. Came for brunch and $5 Bloody Marys- 1st ever brunch at Windsor.  We normally brunch at Postinos. I completely struck out here on every dish and drink. The Bloody Mary was way too spicy and horse radish-y. I asked for something toned down. Nothing available- they use a mix. I ordered eggs, bacon and sausage and specifically asked for cracked eggs bc of a food allergy. The sausage was ok....but had a weird flavor. Husband agreed. Bacon was inedible- it had obviously been cooked ahead and was a floppy, greasy cold mess. Eggs were from a carton, not cracked. My entire meal was wrong and bad. I ordered a latte. It was burned, tasted bitter and watery. How could this be?! We had 4 different servers in 45 minutes. All nice folks, but disorganized. My husband had a "meh" experience with the chefs dish of the day. I was so excited to bunch here when we arrived. After today, I'm totally surprised at the low level of quality and experience at an Upward restaurant. We've never experienced a fail like this at other Upward Projects restaurants. Totally unexpected. Two stars for friendly staff and nicely decorated, clean interior. We will not return, and will stick to Postino for brunch.

9dSI37eC6-gwbR6nosAi0Q.text: Absolutely love this place - we come here often for drinks, lunch and dinner. Always great food and service - the bartender (a girl from Chandler)  is always so sweet and friendly. We love to go to Churn on our way out - just a fun place to hang out!!! Sit on the patio if it's nice out!!!

NIvesS3TZrZ0XamSMzSkgQ.text: I had a fantastic meal at Windsor and cannot wait to go back!!  The problem is, they do not have very many vegetarian entree options.  I think their only entree is what I ordered - a veggie filled pita.  It was amazingly delicious, but I wish I had more options than that....or a salad.  I appreciate that this restaurant uses lots of kale and quinoa in many of their dishes - they are two of my favorite foods and are highly underused!!  The No. 89 is one of the smoothest cocktails I have ever had and would visit this place just for cocktails.  They also have wine on tap - which is supposed to be more environmentally friendly.  The music was too loud inside and the waiter could have been more attentive - but it was their opening week so I will let that slide.

wm8oFbnRk4UwdyvpJttqMQ.text: We absolutely love this place. We came here for lunch during the week. They have amazing beer specials and the food was delicious. They have a pretty large patio with a fireplace and plenty of heaters. Will definitely be back!

Tqq5sx6xjfTwTdndY6XeSw.text: Cool little local place. Ate healthly and not that happy about it. Not because it wasn't good, the ahi tuna salad was delicious. When fried chicken, burgers, sweet potato fries and a bunch more are on the menu, I want the bad stuff. Looking forward to coming back.

e1hD6eaNRlXv-e1qvfqi5w.text: Probably the best "neighborhood" restaurant in Phoenix......and worth the drive or ride (plenty of bicycle parking) if you don't live in the area.  Amazing specialty cocktails, great selection of beers and wines.....and a happy hour that runs from 11:00 am to 5:00 EVERY day.  Super friendly staff treats you like family....only better.  Not a miss on the menu, everything is top notch....mac and cheese or the church potatoes are both great choices for sides.    Did I mention bicycle parking, well riding your bike may be a good idea because Windsor is attached to Churn.  Churn has some of the best ice cream in town and usually some very unique flavor offerings.  In addition they have "old school" candy, rice crispy treats, and cookies (in case you want to make an ice cream sandwich).  Windsor is crown jewel from the folks that brought you Postino.

ZTMXAZMlNbuTdY5AmNnZXg.text: Why, oh why, can't someone put any cool restaurants like the Windsor in North Scottsdale? If it wasn't a 40 minute drive away, I would be living at this place. Seriously. Maybe I should just ask them to let me throw a cot on the patio, get them to promise to leave the misters on during the summer, and I'll pay their rent.   Where to start? The restaurant is housed in an old 1940s (I think) building that they remodeled to - get this - look like a restaurant that has been there since the 1940s. This is not to say that it feels old, just worked in and comfortable like a catchers mitt from little league. I have no idea how they accomplished that feeling while working with new materials. The bar is a horseshoe in the middle of the restaurant with a mahogany top and a "floating" box for liquor storage. Although I have not had a chance to sit in the booths, they are black leather and look inviting and cozy.   The patio is unreal. A wall of windows next to the bar collapses and the entire restaurant has an inside-outside vibe. There are plants everywhere and I truly felt like I was hanging out in a friend's backyard - sans pool. Once we saw the patio my date and I immediately decided to wait for a table out there. We stepped aside and servers were immediately asking us if they could get us a drink while we waited (which was very nice) and we each ordered one of their custom cocktails. I had the No.5 which was tequila based and the date ordered one with watermelon and Tito's vodka (I can't remember the number). Both were incredible and helped set the stage for a wonderful night. Our table opened up in about 10 minutes, well within the time quoted.   I ordered the corn dog poppers (I really am just a big child) and the pork sandwich. Both were out of this world good. The poppers were just the right size and I am still craving that mustard. The porkwich was as billed, three different kinds of pork topped with slaw and gold sauce on a fresh bun. I think I overheard someone say that they were thinking about calling it the "pork threeway" - too funny. My date ordered the mixed grain salad and let me snag a quick bite before she scarfed it down. I can't remember everything that was in the salad, but the quinoa and zucchini went perfectly with the dressing. That salad was an all star, and I never eat salads. To wash it all down we each had a couple of glasses of the wine on tap (a very cool idea).   Service - the service was great - not overbearing but always available when we needed them. Our server Morgan was very attentive and It looked like they operated on a team service model. It is nice to not have to search for your server if you need help.   In all, this place is amazing. You won't be disappointed.

0C1M9A2T3lCAG3Wgt1tuQQ.text: I can't say enough about my experience at Windsor. I went there with a large group for  dinner after a long day of meetings. Not only was the service spectacular, the food was amazing. All 16 of us loved our meals. We started with some apps to share... the Nachos were outstanding and I'm seriously obsessed with the Deviled Egg dip thing! If you're in the are, this is a must try. Next time I'm out that way I plan to go and sit on the back patio, which is equipped with heat lamps and a fireplace.   Enjoy!!

QHWAkuc2WJeSzTiqCAp3aA.text: Good food, reasonably priced, great vibe--what more can one say --other than so glad you are in the neighborhood!  lots of folks biking or walking over for dinner--outside patio is terrific--we got there at six--lots of families--by the time we left at 7:30 transitioning to more adults.  I hope to be a regular.

HYd8RvchW7FqpVjR-Wn_Zw.text: This is my favorite place to come for cocktails! Especially for $5 Happy Hour. I honestly go there just for the No. 17 which is a mix of cucumber vodka and green tea and mint. It is simply amazing. It is so refreshing in the summer and it tastes like you aren't drinking alcohol. I assure you, there is definitely a good portion of vodka in there!  I also like the Backyard Burger. It is so juicy and the garlic aioli adds so much flavor. The service is awesome. Everyone is so friendly and they genuinely seem to enjoy their job.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 17

e8OvMLFMpEzQiUE3SJdILw.text: Short Version:     Food - Better than good but not quite great  (4-)    Service - Our Waitress was stellar  (5)    Ambiance - Decent although felt somewhat crowded and loud  (Low 3)  All in all, this place deserved better than a 3 star rating but I don't think it is one of the better 4 star places.  Longer Version: We tried this place out on our last trip to Phoenix to add something a little different to the mix of seafood and southwestern places we tend to frequent on our trips to the desert.  We went to Windsor after a day and the Desert Botanical Gardens so wound up getting there shortly after sunset.  It took us a few passes to find the place as signage is small and not very visible.  Parking is in back (where the main door is) but the only wide handicap spots are in front (by the back door).  This little bit a confusion left us entering the back side after multiple trips up and down the street.  Not a great way to start the evening but we were willing to give it a try.  Since it was too hot for us outside, we chose to sit indoors.  The AC was not very efficient.  The floors were basic hard floors and the walls were mostly flat brick.  The overall visual effect was not bad but then again not particularly good either.  However; this made the auditory effect quite LOUD.  All sounds were echoed and amplified making a small place with few actual people quite noisy.  Add to this that there seemed to be too many tables in the small area and the table we were seated at was actually in what should have been a walk way made the overall ambiance a little on the negative side.  Oh did I mention that it was dark?  It was dark too.  A little too dark for our eyes to read the menu.    Well enough on the weaknesses of the place.  Time for some positives (as there were more to rave about than to complain about).  The service was better than great!  Our server was wonderful - fast, efficient, friendly and helpful.  All the things you want in a server.  She greeted us quickly, offered advice on the menu and fixed my problems right away.  The problem with the overall service was that the host staff didn't seem to care about us at all.  We came in from the street side which is there back door and had to wonder through the restaurant to find the host desk.  When we finally did they did not greet us for a while and actually did not offer to seat us or even put us on the wait list. Oh well bad hostesses are trumped by excellent waitress.  Now for the reason to dine out: The Food! We started out with a couple orders of the corn dog popper.  Since Big D does not like hot dogs he refused to try them but the rest of us enjoyed them.  We were glad to have them, but at 7 bucks an order I would not get them again.  For dinner I tried the Crab Cake BLT.  The mustard sauce was way too strong.  I had to send it back and get one without the sauce.  Our waitress was very accommodating in this regard.  Once the sandwich came back with a side of mayo it turned out to be very good.  I would very much like to try it again but the $16 price tag is a bit high for what you actually get.  Big D had a salad and a side of mac and cheese.  He raved about the mac and cheese but almost regretted the getting a salad instead of a more filling entree.  Big D loves his mac and cheese and for him to rave about it means it must be more than excellent and the fact that he didn't offer any tastes to the rest of us really drives that point home.  J and L had the Picnic Kebobs and the Pork Ribs respectively.  Both ladies enjoyed their meals.  The kebobs seemed to be the better choice.  For sides the ladies had Coles Slaw - which they shared and loved as it was sweet and fresh - and the Market Vegetable - which they say was a mistake as there weren't enough for the meal.  I had the fries which were crisp delicious and plentiful.   Overall, the food is better than good but not quite great.  For most items the price is a few bucks over reasonable, entree portions are good and the sides were decent.  We all agreed that the food was too good to be called a 3 but was not equal to other 4 stars.  This place was too good to be rated with only 3 stars but 4 stars almost seemed to be generous.  It was more like 3 and 5/8ths.

7jcTXYbBBSFrkj6tsfJJvA.text: Great happy hour with excellent cocktails. Food is always great and service is super friendly at the bar. Perfect neighborhood bar and restaurant.

qIaior-klUJvhntie5pxXw.text: Loved it for lunch. Had the picnic kabobs and they were great.  Also loved the happy hour special for a pitcher of beer for $5.

0Xh8lJGiIgrndfZ7eJTJkg.text: My new favorite place!! Just love the ambiance, dark pub feel, great bar and big booths to talk or watch the game. awesome menu. I highly recommend the Reuben. Ask your server or bartender for the special drink concoction of the night. Always have hit it out of the park!!

cO-lX-5NAmxDdE4yNl5mjg.text: Great Happy Hour!!!! Food was decent. --- need to eat before to many drinks so I will review again.

32Zbjh1dpsqRF4CCBnxOGQ.text: El Diablo dish for brunch is amaaazing. Great atmosphere! Try the pims carafe.  The only negative content I have is,  that if you go by yourself they won't seat you. .. They'll tell you to go to the bar even if there's no spots open.I found that to be a bit weird, but it was busy, so maybe that was the reason.

-561VigYlDyN4-f-_T4YhQ.text: We had the Windsor burger which was perfectly cooked, juicy and plenty of flavor. The fiance complained that the caramelized onions were too sweet, but I found it dee-vine. The mac and cheese was also tasty and I loved the crispy topping. We also got a side of veg which was spinach and I wish we had ordered two. It was yummy. Their winter ale on tap (forget the exact name) was surprisingly good.   This place is fantastic...except for one thing. It's a teensy bit over priced. Just a buck or two on each item overpriced. I'm going to need to find the email/text/yelp deals in order to return as much as I might like...or I could just take up extreme couponing so I can go there every week.

C8AIBVZKIBCmWstu8DSMdQ.text: Awesome! I highly recommend this place! Incredible atmosphere inside and out, the bar design is superb and the patio is the perfect spot for relaxing and enjoying drinks with friends. I went for the second time recently and have to give this place a stellar review. The menu is innovative and fresh! The mixed drinks are killer and the wine on tap was an extremely pleasant surprise. Plus, you can't beat their happy hour seven days a week!    I have had the crab cake BLT and the halibut sandwich, which were both out of this world! Everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked amazing and I can't wait to go back and try all the others.  The servers were great and knowledgeable about their menu which is always a big plus! As a parent, I love that this place is a perfect day/night out spot for a date or hanging with friends but also a family oriented neighborhood joint where I can bring my kiddo along! Love that Churn is right next door to get some yummy dessert after an incredible meal!  The design is spot on for this area! Great job!

PWXTA6aBa92R_nZzVGfyPg.text: This place is a neat, small and fun restaurant. Very good staff that are very accommodating. Best of all the food is amazing, fresh and fast. On a nice warm day enjoying lunch on the patio at this place is such a nice relaxing time in the middle of central phoenix.

qqICcFKFMwjcHCF2PXtw4g.text: Has a good atmosphere, but the food was not good.  Had a bacon cheeseburger with mac n cheese.  The burger was soggy and over cooked.  the mac n cheese was not good either.  Also had a bloody mary, which was less then average.  We do love Postino's, but they dropped the ball at Windsor.

OVI1_ne5rwWooeQhJyluaQ.text: Great food, bar, service, prices, atmosphere. Waiters will bring over ice cream from next door. One time, they gave us cookies that they haven't sold for the day. The food is great comfort food. The macaroni and cheese or ruben sandwiches are both amazing with a delicious draft beer.  It's a great date spot because of the slight conversational noise (but it's not annoyingly loud) and the 80s and 90s music they play is always interesting to listen to.  I'll come back again and again.

G_lc76WVdkfu_LIt5-h9iw.text: I am not even to close fan of this place. I read the reviews and was super excited to try something new. This place was super super loud. The music was so load that people were practically yelling to hear eachother. I didn't feel like I could even talk to my partner while here.   I did get seated pretty fast. I ordered the deviled egg dip that was so over salted, I had to send it back. We also order the cheese fondue that is what made me give this place some stars. As the main dish, I ordered the Windsor Burger that was just okay. Nothing really to get excited about. It wasn't and isn't something to even remember.  Definitely not coming back or suggesting this place to any friends.

DnLS4y078h8MG4h1Xpz2cw.text: I went to Windsor for the first time last night with my girlfreind and was very impressed with the service and food. We had the loaded chips for appetizer witch were amazing highly recommended!! I had the fish sandwich witch was great! And we just loved the ambiance and vibe of the place very cool! I had mixed cocktial no 22 very good made with a lot of love! overall a great dining experince service was top notch Manny the bartender was on top of his game for sure !!!

sRxt9PaQI7sF9WgYWUF5ig.text: Sunday morning post-half marathon $5 microbrew "pitchas"...deal-o-rama, cheers to day drinking in style :)

N1dMnSrhcAeGXJQ_AnKEWQ.text: first of all... happy hour every day. how could you go wrong with that? especially when they have a great selection of beers (domestic and craft from the area) that come in pitchers for just $5. awesome.  service was outstanding. everyone was extremely friendly and i was impressed that the manager was so involved in the operations. he was extremely nice and helped us get settled in to the restaurant (we apparently came in the wrong door) and even sent us over a complimentary pitcher because he felt bad that we were wandering around for a minute or two trying to find the entry kiosk. so unnecessary but totally nice and really just impressed the boyfriend and me.   food was freaking delicious! i had the burger and it had to be one of the best i've had since moving to AZ. it was cooked perfectly (medium rare) and came on a bun that was just the right size to contain all the juicy deliciousness. the fries were also outstanding... extra crispy on the outside but soft and happy on the inside. we also had the deviled egg dip for a starter. it was like a picnic in my mouth.   another great thing about this place is Churn next door. how could you go wrong ice cream? i can't wait to come back here and try out the amazing patio for a Sunday Funday.

6S92RLKXkYMLC2Q1UZKkQg.text: Great cocktails. Good beer excellent food. The venue is very casual and hip. Fun place with fun people working there.

xdI7eSCVxlDkKpLcz48EPQ.text: The newest Craig DeMarco (Postino) creation is here. I made the mistake of eating elsewhere before arriving so only had the No. 29 cocktail which is Gin, celery bitters, celery soda, and lime. It's got a lot going on but is very refreshing to drink, I highly recommend this if you're not looking for a sweet drink.   The red velvet cookies at Churn make a fantastic ice cream sandwich.   Windsor is a lot like Postino but for liquor and beer but of course with much more depth to the menu. The atmosphere is similar to that of Postino with exposed brick, dim lighting, and a swanky yet casual feel not to mention their wall of cassette tapes, very cool.

nwbnV1DhUj6hnTc1J1LZYw.text: I love the vibe at Windsor.  The breakfast options are yummy and different. The latte was beautiful and delicious. But I had a burger for dinner the other day and it was too greasy to finish. Juicy is good but too drippy to eat without several napkins...yuck. I wanted to take a bathe afterward.

lQtzyx0VDqm1tE9w6lqjIA.text: The Windsor drips with attitude and atmosphere. Imagine a really cool gastro pub with high quality (and deliciously savory) food items, surrounded in plaid patterns, retro-chic (male heavy) influenced art design, and a kick-ass patio area. The bar inside offers just about anything your alcoholic heart might desire- with a killer happy hour of $5 beer pitchers (great selection of brews to boot), glasses of wine from the tap (yes I said tapped wine but it's really good stuff), and other delicacies. The staff is extremely friendly- they know when to check in and when to just let your group hang out and enjoy the Windsor. If you're not hung up on meat, please try the burger Windsor style- it doesn't get any better for the $11 price- and includes one of their indulgent sides (mac n cheese for the win). Expect a crowd because the establishment is top notch- the owners know a thing or two about creating an "experience" as they also manage the Postino chain (one of the 3 locations is basically across the street from Windsor). If you're in the mood for a really incredible place to hang out, have a few drinks, indulge in some delicious food, and really just enjoy a laid back dining experience then the Windsor should be at the top of your "must try" list. Afterwards, walk next door to Churn and order up some homemade ice cream or purchase a few throwback candy items. It's all a part of the experience anyway, right? Enjoy!

qKLivDrnY4C1aayjVXgxjg.text: The menu is trendy, and delicious. You can go, share a few appetizers with friends (I loved the Russian Roulettes, very delicious, very fun...) and get an excellent drink. I thought they were a bit on the expensive side, but that said, they were well served and very creative.   The decor is great, the outside area is lovely. The only thing I hated about the place is that they leave the doors open and the AC blasting. WTF? So wasteful. But if that is my only qualm, it can't be that bad...   I'll be going back to AZ next month, a stop at Windsor is in order!

jjoL2McSUEG-g03pxwXqhA.text: I love the pretzel dippers.  I normally order the brown bag chicken salad because it is great and not made with mayo which is great.  The kale salad is great.  My recommendation would be to try everything.  and get there before 5pm for the pitchers .  But it is a little pricey.

6312e9vPnP1PvSAE5s0HFA.text: Great place! We just discovered it and we are such big fans!! We love locally owned places that have great food and this place is exactly that! Right next door they have a cute ice cream shop called the Churn which is amazing! It's such a great hip place and great for date night!!

2uFeEDFpLOwf3GkE5uTwVg.text: Awesome experience here at Brunch today. This place was recommended by a friend, and lived up to all expectations. We had the eggs benedict with crab cakes and hollandaise; and the el matador- wow! The food was exceptionally good. I really liked the decor inside too- especially the cassette tapes on the wall leading to the lavatories. No negatives here!

DqnvC_EIoH6_gG1TnFCLYA.text: I like this place quite a bit. It is clean and full of character. It's cool but not pretentious. Happy hour is good and the menu is great too!  They are connected to Churn so you can get your coffee and ice-cream fix as well!  Just be careful not to be seated by the window facing Central at the end of the day. The sun on your back will make you want to die.

vYSA_CDwhwQjIJ73ZcCAGg.text: Visited Windsor for the second and last time. We were seated pretty quickly even though it was a busy Friday evening. The young lady at the front door was very friendly and nice, but that is where the pleasantries end. The music was so loud; my party of three couldn't hear each other talking very loudly. The waiters couldn't hear each other and they were yelling. What is it with all the super loud music at restaurants these days? I have decided to start a one-woman campaign to end crazy loud music in restaurants. No wonder the art of conversation has been lost. People can't hear each other over the loud music in restaurants. Music should be the background, not the foreground. Next, our waiter must have been angry that he stayed out in the sun too long earlier in the day. He looked sunburned. He was so angry. First throwing plates on the table and then throwing water across the table and not wiping it up or acknowledging he toss everything at us. I get a refill of water and this time he throws ice and water across the table. Never wipes any of it up. He had the worst attitude of any waiter I have ever seen. The food is ok, but doesn't taste too good when you get nasty service.

1h7wwh1_GJ_ENn8d9Mz0JA.text: This place has awesome atmosphere and great food! I have been for both lunch and dinner. I prefer lunch however the cocktails are probably the best part!! you must try them all!!

s--9ylePC4i0Zfa12Le7zA.text: Menu isn't the same 'ol.  Healthy, tasty options and unhealthy indulgences.  Modern, casual atmosphere. Valet parking is pretty much a must, but they're nice and quick.  Still can't figure out where the main entrance is, and what to do to get a table other than wander until someone there makes me stop.  Cool place.

1bVq0Q_z-g_7sfGyl0WwAA.text: We showed up at about 4:55pm on a Friday, so the place was already getting busy.  What made us love The Windsor was everything that happened next.  It stated with the Hostess.  Tatted up and all CenPho, she was outstanding.  Not only exceptionally nice to us, but incredibly sweet to our 3YO daughter.  Even while busily trying to get people seated, she made time to to bring a small ice water outside to Charlie. While waiting for our table (about 20 min), she offered to get us some drinks as there were only a few minutes left in Happy Hour.  And then every single employee, server manager, whoever, smiled and said Hi on their way by.  Busy as hell, and still cool. Now for the food, we got some sliders for Charlie, and Sarah and I both had the Crab Cake BLT.  We ate everything.  Happily.  Not "the best thing I ever ate", but still wonderful.  Our super-hostess came by and brought Charlie a treat from Churn next door as a thank you for being such a good girl the whole time.  Again, so thoughtful. Bottom line is that we are thrilled to have more and more awesome restaurants in our 'hood.  We will be back again and again, and show our friends.

fs0wOJ2Gh6Z-mx3PoLUWsg.text: First trip to Windsor after driving by countless times and it did not disappoint.
