I had the brown bag chicken sandwich with a side of mac'n cheese and it was absolutely delicious. The service was fantastic which is a big factor for me in my star rating. We were only there for a bite but it's definitely the kind of place I could hang out for a few drinks. It looks like they have some pretty reasonable drink specials before 5:30 on weekdays. Also attached is a candy/ice-cream shop so guys, if you're looking for a great date spot, Windsor will impress...guaranteed.

f0Ggo-OJoT6lYJ5FbNJ0bQ.text: So this was my first time here and I must say that it is a very cute establishment.   I went with Ashley, as I do to most restaurants, and we had a coupon for a free appetizer.  We decided to get the cheese fondue.  The pretzel bread was delicious and the apples were crisp and juicy Ashley enjoyed the sausage so I will take her word for it.  I got the Kale Caesar salad with the butternut squash bisque.  The soup warmed me to the bone and was perfectly smooth and delicious.  The salad was full of flavor, minus the avacodo stupid allergies, which was interesting since it was all greens with the cheesy biscuit croutons.  Ashley got the porkwich minus the bacon, yes she is weird, and was only able to eat about half of it.  She got Jo's Church Potatoes as her side and they were fantastic.   The menu doesn't have a huge selection but it looks like they want quality not quantity.  My glass was empty for large periods of time so that is why there are only 4 stars.  All in all I think I will have to go back again.

oIiludCc0PyEJegsSLBWlQ.text: We had a bad experience last night.  We arrived about 6.00pm.  Party of 12.  I'll mak e this short and sweet and bullet point my review.  1)  Food,:  Ok  2)  Drinks: OK 3)  SERIVCE:OK .  With a few exceptions.  Our server felt it required to resight the establishments policy in regard to split checks in a very rude and corrective manner.  In short,  we where treated like children.  One statement she made rings in my ears..." OK, Well thats not the way we roll,  we dont do that.  I'll make an exception for this one gut...but thats it.!"  " Is there anyone else ?"  As she was ovbviousley very disturbed and put out!  I sat there and was shocked at her tone and delivery.  Then a few others at my table requested separate checks because they were leaving early.  I had just arrived and everyone had just been served.   I saw no reason not to get a separate check.  She then became very upset and said,  "OK,  we dont roll this way.  In the future we cant do this, I'm just saying.  OK?  She was tototally out of line.  From there it was a disaster....DOWN HILL.  When accepting large parties and establishment needs to state policy in writing or verbally on the phone or at the beginning of presentation.  I am willing to give WINDSOR  another try because another server saved the day in the end...but it was very embarrasing for all involved.   And yes that finally split the check after we were scollded.  Thanks

lbAyT0vL7quls1MsIqqylA.text: After a few trips to Churn, I decided it was time to try Windsor. I'd gotten a few tips from friends on what to order and everyone really enjoyed their food. Kammie K was my lunch partner. When I got there, she had a bowl of pistachios in front of her. In. The. Shell. I love that! Good food always takes a little work, right? As we munched on the nuts (hahaha I am a nut muncher!) I saw something on the menu I'd been wanting to try for a couple months: kale chips. The chips came with a ranch dipping sauce, but I only tried a little of it. They were perfect on their own! Garlic hunks and sea salt peppered each leaf perfectly. I can't wait to learn how to make them at home! I also had bite-sized corn dogs. They were pretty good & came with a side of mustard, but some of the batter didn't cook all the way on a couple of the pieces. The patio here is awesome. The misters really keep the temperature down, though I will have to really judge that in July.   They have the BEST soundtrack playing, too. It's a mix of awesome 80s music. Oh, and their wall is covered in cassette tapes. Some of them are mixed tapes. FTW!!! (Bring $5 for the valet. There is street parking, but it's hard to come by.)

yAFXATlkBNANh79NX6EKSg.text: I feel so terrible writing a bad review for a place I've been coming to and have loved for several years, but this has to be said.   Windsor has GOT to do SOMETHING about their fly problem. I have experienced this issue before here but today was by far the worst ever. We could hardly eat our food and found it very difficult to even carry on a conversation with all the flies attacking our table - and we were sitting INSIDE. Instead of ordering another drink we had to quickly finish our food and get the heck outta there. It was very very gross.  That being said - Windsor has been a staple for us for several years. We usually love the atmosphere, food, drink specials AND service.   Even today when we asked "What's up with the flies today?" Our server was very gracious and said it's something we've been dealing with because the doors are left open for brunch - and during the summers this leads to flies.   Unfortunately not even great service can overcome this issue. This has gotten SO BAD we WILL NOT be back to eat here during the summer months...whick makes me sad because I crave it often. Something has to be done. This is not ok. Oh and on that same note - maybe turnong up the AC would help? It was very toasty in there.

-ez_SIMt4fl6U0w_UgJp8Q.text: Ow she's a Brick-house, She's mighty mighty, Just lettin' it all hang out.  Sat at a solid full bar for a late brunch. My Windsor neighbor was super sweet allowing me to sit next to her before her wify showed. I ordered up a small pitcher of Stella Artois $5., a 75 point, 5.00% ABV,  very light golden brew. Crisp, sweet pale malts aroma and finishes up a bit dry. It's refreshing and easy to drink.  This will be my first shot at a Crab Benedict since La Jolla. It's going to be a tough act to follow here in the desert. It was indeed rich and creamy, bright with lemon, this classic brunch dish was traditional with no twists except the crab are crabcakes and I believe straight up cooked crab on the bread is better.$14.50.  Windsor is one of my favorite dinner houses. Even took a few pics of my rock bands from the past that hang in the cassette hall of flame.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

feQj_Up6h2xPgLlWxZjMvQ.text: This place is pretty awesome!  We were looking for a brunch place in PHX and were recommended this spot. The food is delicious, drinks are great,  and service is some of the best I've ever had!  All of the servers are great but Jacob was my favorite! He's a total rock star! Glad we came here!

b2QUyZz-8T3NKS5kqSqS3Q.text: Honestly blown away by the atmosphere of this place. I walked in, on an early Friday evening, and of course it was busy. I spotted a seat at the bar and proceeded to order their seasonal tap. Great beer but even better recommendation from the bartender. I had just missed the $5 everyday pitchers but worth it at regular 6 dollar price. Yaayo! Also the wings were delicious.. A spicy yet sweet flavor. I loved how saucy they were and the crushed pepper I could see and taste. I would almost call it a spicy mole flavor. At the end another bartender noticed I was done and anticipated my sticky fingers offering me a warm steamed towel to wipe it off. Wow that's some service. It has a very interesting menu. Enjoy!

zdNJ9m1E5gylb_PJScO9zQ.text: I've been here numerous times.  Brunch on Sundays is totally fabulous.  They have a Bloody Mary bar that looks amazing.  The ambience is super chill, but definitely inviting.   They have a fantastic affordable kids menu which is fantastic for people like us with 2 littles in tow.   I was here last night and had their crab cake BLT which was served on an MJ roll with sweet potato fries...it was fresh and yummy.  My daughter had the mini hotdogs which we at the table all took a bite of they were stellar especially for a kids option!    Staff was super helpful and friendly.  Took my stroller base away to clear the area and immediately brought it back at the end of the meal.    We loved hitting up Churn the ice cream and sweet shop attached to Windsor.  Vietnamese coffee ice cream is sooo amazing!!! I took a pint to go!   All in all super pleased and highly recommended to others!

iN_5GHtNPGugn3sNpz11CA.text: Dear foodies,  I recently visited Windsor for the first time with a guy friend who is also a big foodie. He and I were really excited thinking that their happy hour would end at least by 6 pm like most places, but it ends Very early at 5 pm. That is something that does not make sense to me especially since most people's work days do not end until 5 pm.   Moving on...  We were seated on the patio, which at first was awesome and beautiful and comfortable since they had the misters on. Then as the sun started to disappear, the mosquitos started to appear. I was badly eaten up around my ankles and on the top of my feet by the mosquitos on the patio. My guy friend had to request that they bring over one of the citronella candles; that helped a little but it was already too late.  Now the food...  The beers that they have on tap were delicious and I truly enjoyed them. I had the Windsor Style Backyard burger without the bun, wrapped in lettuce. It was perfectly prepared and the toppings complimented the flavor of the burger. I had their Mac-Cheese as a side and was pleasantly surprised. When I think of Mac-n-Cheese, I think of only getting this dish as soul food restaurants normally when I am back East or down south, but they actually did a very good job with the flavors. :)  My friend ordered the Ahi Tuna salad, which on the other hand was not as culinary pleasing as my dish. The salad lacked flavor, dressing, and excitement. The Ahi tuna was prepared very well, but the salad portion lacked on various levels. He told one of the servers about his lack of culinary orgasms with the salad and the manager Lisa came out and talked to us and also removed it from our bill. We were not expecting that, but it was a pleasant surprise and I appreciate a customer service driven and involved establishment. Lisa was adorable, professional, and a great listener.   With that, I will be back. I am overall impressed with their establishment and the service.  Next time I will sit inside and arrive prior to 5 pm to enjoy their happy hour as well.

VTGWYdDBM974BleMtwlxHA.text: They have a great happy hour the mac and cheese is probably the best mac and cheese I have ever had the breakfast is also very good if you haven't tried this place out ITS A MUST !!! Great food

tDagADGE6EV5tbKc-5fE1Q.text: If you love pickles, olives, and hot peppers like I do then you need to check out their Bloody Mary bar during Sunday brunch.  It...is...glorious...!  I Love the gourmet (but not pretentious) take on comfort food. Corn dog bites? Yes please.  They are definitely going for a bit of a hip vibe and I think they actually pull it off well.  I usually always sit outside though so there's that.  Happy Hour prices until 5pm everyday are quite reasonable and all of their signature cocktails I have tried have been delicious.  I've never had bad service here (although there has been some variance between great and just average).

aiROTj4tNKY_yOft12BEgQ.text: LOUD   LOUD    LOUD.   LOUD    LOUD  I chose this restaurant for my birthday lunch today. There were 9 of us and I have not seen most of these people for a while and was really looking forward to talking and catching up.  There was no talking, it was only screaming to the person next to you. I have no idea if others enjoyed their meal because I would not have been able to hear their answer if I asked.  There was nothing unusual or wonderful about my Falling Out salad. It was plain and I have made plenty of better salads at home.  This restaurant has a lot going for it particularly now that the parking issue has been resolved. The outside seating is very nice and the weather was perfect.  I asked THREE times for the music to be turned down. The last time I was told that the problem is, if they turn down our speakers, they would have to turn down the entire restaurant's speakers. And the problem with doing that was.....??? My only guess is, these young folks must have already lost much of their hearing if they think having music on so loud that you can't even talk to those sitting close to you is OK. Or perhaps others enjoy sitting and texting the person next to them.  If the music had been MUCH lower, the event would have been a delight regardless of what the food was like.   I will say, the dessert from Churn was fabulous!!  I really had high expectations as this restaurant is right around the corner from my home and I could easily walk, but why bother????

fn5ezrzynX1SGxhcdjJ9KA.text: I had a lovely dinner with my best friend a few nights ago and there was some confusion with the bill.  The manager, Adam, corrected everything and went above and beyond!  Proof that  great food and excellent customer service still exist in the world.  Can't wait to go back!

iMT-hhP1-DnkV20xCIvOcQ.text: My first visit to this joint was an unexpected delight.  The space is comfy and tastefully hip. My favorite part is the cassette tape lined wall leading into the hall to Churn and the shared unisex bathrooms.  This place is very much a come as you are yet slightly fancy mix of fine dining flare and gastro pub in terms of decor and menu.  We ordered the Windsor Burger, Roulette Peppers and the Kale Caesar.  The burger was delicious (medium rare) and one of the best I've had. It was moist and flavorful; very well done on a soft pretzel style bun.  The sweet potato fries were okay; a bit on the soggy side and I would have preferred some more salt.  The salad was excellent and was not over dressed. The croutons were cheesy and they added avocado and celery which was unique and added something special. The only thing I'd do differently is to slice the celery thinner as it was awkward to get a small enough bite with the other ingredients.   The peppers were also fantastic and were done in some lemon juice olive oil and the right amount of salt.  I'm excited to come back for brunch!

7Pk3NRQANOASmcQBO3rMPw.text: Ok I have eaten here atleast ten times and had their classic burger 9/10 times it is amazing so is chicken sandwich. Customer service 5 *.  Ambiance , good food, good service , reasonable price what more can you ask for!

jpWNCLimDfZSV0QV0_mXgg.text: Let me start by saying that I am partial to staying in CenPho for food. This place is right up the street from me so that I love.   Its got an amazing hipster ambiance. And little touches of pizazz like the cassette tape wall and the boom box wall paper in the bathroom.   The patio is comfy at night or in the cooler months, and probably better for a larger group.    Yes, yes, I'm getting to the food. I have been here with friends, with a dude, with my kid, by myself, cuz that is how I roll, and I have tried a lot of the menu. Burger=BOMB. pork was amazing, mac n cheese to die for, dang! I can't remember what else I've eaten here but I have yet to have a bad experience. Let me know what you think when you go!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Odell IPA

z1c2w_OvJ-eLcnlBDYgW8w.text: Came here when I was visiting Phoenix to get some drinks and burgers. Everyone at my table ordered a slightly different burger, but we were all happy with what we ordered! I ordered the sweet potato fries with my burger, which were also great. The portions were so big that halfway through eating, i took the bun off so that I could finish eating the perfectly cooked meat. Overall, I am a fan and would visits restaurant again!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OJYk7PpxSV-ttub0ByXFVg.text: Windsor is a quintessential Central Phoenix restaurant. The staff is always checking-in, filling water and making sure we have everything we need. The quality of the food is amazing, especially for the price! It's a tremendous value. The management team, let by GM Adam is professional and makes sure each guest experience is positive. We love Windsor and always look forward to spending a lazy Sunday afternoon inside when hot and outside the rest of the year. This is also THE BEST kid's menu in town. For $5, our son gets home cooked and delicious food that comes with a drink and a little bit of fruit and veggies. A MUST visit if you're in town.

JVzEyz5slUl78hAfCNXYsQ.text: The brunch menu has several options ranging from gravy & biscuits to a breakfast sandwich to a nice crab cake Benedict. The verde Bloody Mary is weird and not good at all. Even if you try to doctor it up using the complimentary spice bar it is hard to get past the inherent bad taste of the cucumber and tomatillo blend.  The English muffin however if fantastic and definitely worth a try.

UDHN_e9hwEpGbiKvEhtCrg.text: Ok we have been coming here for years and the last couple of times it hasn't been great by decided to give it another try.  Once again this was by far the worst! On top of that my husbands food had a nice sized black hair in his el matador plate, waitress gave us the wrong order and the ceviche was bad smelled like lake water.  It's a nice place to sit outside and have a drink but if you are looking for good food and a clean place, don't stop here.  We won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. When we took this pic we didn&#39;t know there was a hair in it  gross
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smelly fish

wGw009PzaLBS3Z93HPQg5A.text: I love coming here for brunch. The patio is dog friendly so we like to bring our dogs on the weekends. Service is great here and the wait staff are extremely nice and will always make sure your coffee cup is filled.   Favorite dishes to get here during brunch: Windsor Eggs Benedict with crab cakes and spinach, the Matador (MY PERSONAL FAVORITE), Homemade Donut Holes, and the Golden Flapjacks.

cWcKdejkM4aL9xGRvmSpVA.text: I don't know what I could say that hasn't already been said, but this is one of my 3 go to places for brunch on the weekends.  I totally love it here and the staff always makes you feel so welcome!  The drinks alone are fantastic.  (Can I have the NO.2, please!) and they have great deals for brunch on the weekends.  Their Bloody Mary bar is the best with a great variety to mix in (and who really needs to eat after all of those olives!)  If you go for brunch, it is a MUST to experience their zucchini bread.  My friends tried mine yesterday, and they ended up stealing the whole thing from me!  HA!  And I also decided not to get the rest of the brunch yesterday and actually get a burger.  I got the Windsor style, and I have to say it was one of the best burgers I ever had!  I was totally impressed!  So do yourself a favor, even if you have to travel a bit to get there, and experience the wonderness of the Windsor! :)

iDL_UqwPnVBrjS74wIdwXA.text: I came here on a business dinner and fell in love.  The decor was tasteful and the set up flows nicely.  The food was amazing (You must get the Kale Caesar Salad!)  and the waitstaff were extremely attentive.  I was drinking iced tea and not only did they refill it every time I got to the half way mark, they even brought me extra ice for the table in case I wanted to add more!    The only downside, when we were there they had a large party (I'd say probably around 15-20 people) and we were seated near them.  Because of this it was pretty loud and at times hard to hear the people we were with.  That being said, I think if there wasn't such a large party it would have been average noise levels, so I may update my rating after I go back..... and with the food they serve I will be going back!!!

ZaHGrYPx7NmBRI5WzHjf9Q.text: Umm, This place is off the hook like a telephone. I went right before with Jayme, we got a charcuterie (spelling?), she got the porkwich with kale salad, I got the BLT crab cake sandwich with mac and cheese... I love my cheese, and this was from what I could taste, several 'spensive ones. I definitely will be back for Churn...  But just one question I forgot to ask the server. "Where do you get your bacon?"

hnTPI2cZdEC-HBtksvAJ2Q.text: Customer service was excellent tonight... The atmosphere and ambience works equally as exceptional. I had the pastrami sandwich which had a delicious flavor. All is well at the Windsor.

I20t8FPbQBRRs7BvLKIj9w.text: The Good:  - The service was excellent, and the real stand out was the hostess.  She was friendly, patient, and took good care of us.  - The patio is awesome!  - the specialty drinks are delicious.  Not too sweet, and unique.  The menu is limited, which can be both a good or bad thing.  Frankly, I prefer a menu that isn't pages and pages long.  It makes me wonder about the freshness about the food when there are 500 dishes.  I tried the potato chips with blue cheese.  They were a-amazing!  My only suggestion was to be sure to split these with at least two other people.    The Not-So-Good: I didn't care for the skewers.  I found the spices to be bitter, and the spicy chili side bland.  I also found the beef to be especially tough and gristly.    Overall, I would go back with friends, and possibly bring a dog or two, have some tasty drinks, and split some chips.  Another good social restaurant from the people that brought you postino.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gettin it on mix tape.  Thats right.

1coKZW1YN-04wdTYKYD47A.text: I'm a huge fan of all the Upward Projects restaurants, and Windsor is no exception. The food is always amazing and they rock the team service! The $5 happy hour cocktails are a great deal, especially since they use made-from-scratch ingredients in them. We try a new one every time. Definitely recommend!

gpq3QY04IgC92mQPnbz5rg.text: This place is hipsterville but the food is delish!   Food: 1. Deviled egg dip was tasty. I like my deviled eggs tangy but I know that it is not the norm so I won't complain. The chips were wonderful and we destroyed  it like it was our job. 2. Kids slider with fries and fruit: best kid dish ever. Spoiled kids. 3. The Reuben is incredible. The rye bread is fresh baked down the street. House made dressing is a wonderful touch.  4. Kabob plate was cooked to perfection. The only thing that makes it better is ordering a side of hummus.    Ambiance: great music, nice seating, subtle but effective decor.  Service: everyone seems to work together, very attentive.  The only criticism I have is there needs to be some seating while you're waiting for a table.

B0yJzlnUrIgOw5e_tYtbGg.text: Huge fan of Upward Projects! Windsor is one of my favorite go to spots in midtown for happy hour  (5.00 pitchers and cocktails-hello!), lunch,dinner, and brunch. Neat atmosphere both inside and outside, and friendly staff. Their food is quality and fresh and worth the price you pay. I'm always beyond satisfied with their vegetarian options. My go to menu options are the Grain salad or the Berkeley veggie burger. My meat lover friends rave about the burgers and crab cake BLT. For brunch they always offer a chef omelette special and my friends are a fan of their biscuits and gravy. If you're visiting Phx or want to try something new that is comforting and quality-you must eat at Windsor!

_H_bSxP7Jxl7cjsE1Mz_Tg.text: Perfect spot to meet a friend or two for after work HH/dinner. Parking sucks (hence the seemingly odd valet)...or you can just park street-side in the neighborhood while you dine on some elevated American food.   I had the Cheddar Fondue and Porkwich, both of which were reasonably priced and succulent! I'm not a huge eater at one sitting, so there was definitely a large enough portion to take home for a midnight snack.   Just the right amount of menu items means I'm enticed to return and try their other entrees. The Country Vegetable Chopped salad sounds pretty dang tasty!

wTYgQqwcGqq9K0tpuwjvSw.text: Service:  Slow. This place is usually pretty busy so the service can lag a bit, the real problems start when servers forget about you. This has happened to us twice. Otherwise, the staff is pretty accommodating.   Food:  Not a fan. I've been three times and tried a different dish each time. They try to put a spin on everything that would be considered a "classic" dish, but they fall short. For example, their mac-n-cheese, they add in all these rich cheeses, but douse the top with too much crunchiness. Most of their dishes that I've sampled have something that is just off the mark just like the mac-n-cheese.  Drinks:  Creative. They have unique cocktails. Their cocktails are also strong, you WILL taste the alcoholic kick in each drink. I'm a fan of the bloody mary, but the bloody mary bar is over-hyped. It's essentially a little nook in the bar where you can add more Tabasco or various other ingredients. A nice concept that is not practical if the place gets busy (this bloody mary "bar" is situated behind an 8 person table so if its busy you'll have a tough time getting to it).  This place is over-hyped, but I guess all the trendy "hipsters" need somewhere to go. I'd rather spend money at one of the nearby establishments (Postinos or St. Francis).

54xGsauQ2zjqU0shgnksxg.text: Delicious food and great atmosphere! My wife and I went for dinner and their food did not disappoint; very good, local, fresh food, but is a little pricey Other time we have come for happy hour, which had good beer drink specials (but no food specials) Overall, a great and fun place to go.

DGbyJ2-XqnYY_5eKc8F9yg.text: Love the location and atmosphere.  We had brunch here last weekend and sat out on the patio when it was going to be 109 degrees.  We got there at 10am and with the misters and some cold water we were perfectly comfortable.    I had the Eggs Benedict w/ avocado and and a slice of tomato.  They made the switch with the regular toppings with no problem.  The server even complimented my selection.  Well!  Tip of my hat to you too little lady!  The egg whites were undercooked a bit on the inside but I find this to be a common issue with this dish.  I just scraped them to the side with my knife and dug in - very delicious.  The coffee was good.  The cheesy hash browns I stole off my husbands plate were life changing.    One last note on parking.  I know they have a valet but I always park on the side street directly behind the restaurant.  It's free and just a very short 1 minute walk.

crU9irSCn0WFPdATxmP_2g.text: I like to dog pile on the other great reviews about windsor.  Something about the ambiance of this place made me feel like we were not in Phoenix any more.  It's like I clicked my heels and we were in the 90's.  I know I went from physical change to a time space continuum one, weird right.  But that's how I felt and I have a right to my feelings.    Anyways, check it out, good food and really nice place.

YU8ZRZ6od8ImbtAD3YKC_w.text: Wow!!! Love love this place!! I have always love having brunch here food is always delicious and each and everyone of our server have always been great, but today was exceptional. We had lunch there with my friend and my daughter. I was on our way in a rush to pick up my son from pre-school and with my luck my car did not start due to a dead battery. In crunching for time instead of calling triple A I decided to walk back in an ask for help from one of the worker. The person was beyond helpful he had offered to figure a way to help me. After getting my car started by a couple of customer who help jump start my car the worker came back out with a card to thank the couple for helping me with my car. Now to me this was way above and beyond service. I later called to find out that the worker name is Larry. Thank you Windsor for employing not just good severs but also great management team as well. I will continue to bring my hungry self to your location not just for food but definitely now for the great caring from your staff. Thank you!

YtMwQU9J8EDsPKBR_AgMDw.text: How can you not like this place?  I always sit outside, it is so comfy and cozy!  $5.00 wine, can't beat that... My husband and I enjoy the cheese fondue, but my personal favorite is the deviled egg dip, a must try!  We have been here numerous times now and the service is always great too. Best of all, Churn is next door. Get some ice cream with the kiddos after.

SiiQhmdgMt-9NZgk5TQSRA.text: Hello heaven...   I love this place - the vibe is great, the decor is cool, the casette tape wall is radical, and they don't scoff at you if you ask to turn on a patio heater. The staff is prompt, my drink was never empty (wine ... oh, the wine!), and the fondue was delicious.   I can't wait to go back!   Until we meet again ...

ar5eUd6BSkvc3mGWseSx5g.text: The nice thing about Phoenix restaurants is patio dining and free valet parking. Windsor's patio is huge, with great music, misters, and ambient lighting.  Will definitely keeping coming back for drinks and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. brown bag chicken sandwich with mac n&#39; cheese
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 89 cocktail and pistachios

l47ShvEXOgZzwIYzRvVd8A.text: Terrible service. We had to wait over 20 minutes just to get drinks and don't even get me started on how long it took to get food. I have an idea lets have more than 1 waiter working on a Saturday night. Food was underwhelming to say the least. We ordered the "jumbo" crab cakes and they were the size of a quarter.

AxKsxKTqgmIHz8DFWF6eqw.text: After visiting Postinos quite a few times, I had really high expectations of this place. The food and service at Postinos is fantastic.  ...then there's Windsor. My wife and I ate here for dinner. We had the Corn Dog Poppers appetizer. The dough was very dry and would fall off from around the hot dog (sliced as thinly as two quarters stacked on top of each other). They did not look burned, but had a strong burnt taste.  I had the Porkwich sandwich. The BBQ sauce I was not a fan of myself, and the pork was dry. The coleslaw on the sandwich overpowered the pork and sauce.  My wife had the Backyard Burger which was just "OK".   As for the service, it was "meh". Not attentive, definitely do not seem to really care. He took our appetizer order, then our entree order, after that we had to waive someone down just to get my wife some water.  The service was below average, the food was average. Overall the price does not justify the quality or the service. I will personally never come back to Windsor. I truly do not see what the fuss is about. It's dark, it's loud, and the service is poor.  Also, the valet drivers need to learn how to drive, and pay attention when they are exiting the parking lot near the residential street. Often times as I drive through there they pull out of the parking like fast and don't appear to have even looked, otherwise they would have seen my coming about 20 feet from the driveway!  As a side note, the owners of Windsor opened up a pizza place that is pretty good!  A for Postinos A for their pizza place D- for Windsor

kOQqGn2wlx99dERL1dXvsw.text: The food and service were excellent. The pot pie is freakin fabulous! Even more memorable than that though was how well they catered to my 10 year old daughter. Although they have a bar and a trendy ambiance, they do a great job serving kids and families. We were having a daddy/daughter night out, and it was so nice to see a kids menu that offers more than mac & cheese and chicken tenders. My daughter got a pulled pork slider and fried okra. It was delicious and came out on a little tray with separate compartments. We had about three servers checking in with us regularly and they were all really nice and very attentive to my daughter. It's great to have places like this in our neighborhood. This will be a regular spot for my family. Great job Windsor team!

JAZ7t0X0TzZraMNC5Nna6A.text: One of my favorite spots in phoenix. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, amazing food! St. Louis style ribs and porkwhich are like high quality meth.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This guy was particularly useful.

6yCWP5spsDCvrrzFyzajgQ.text: I really like this place. The service staff is friendly and sincere, the prices are great, and they have a lovely patio area. They only lose one star for uber frustrating parking and tight indoor seating.   Things here I have had, were ALL sooo good: Fondue Kale Salad Mac N Cheese Lots of beer selections  I love that you can order smaller portions of beer here. They have some many good ones from which to choose that it allows you to have a lil' variety!

uAk4ZfYSmz_DuoNyaDZq5Q.text: Had to follow man vs food and come in here, initial impression were actually good. The bathrooms were CLEAN, tables we all cleared and it looks like they have expanded recently, the service is perfect and everything came out hot. I of course got the el Rey which has everything and the kitchen sink in it...awesome idea but everything lacked flavor inside :(. Overall a good experience and I would come back Andy try something else.

GASfGrOccsObVAfkA4MoEQ.text: There is not much I don't like about Windsor. The decor hooked me immediately, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the vibe is just a good one.  I have had the cheddar fondue twice and I love the pretzel bread. The porkwich is amazing. The mac and cheese is ok, not the best, but better than most, and the church potatoes are a nice change of pace.  The fact that you can round out your experience with a trip to Churn makes this a regular on my list of favorites in mid town.

H4oT-FlxNB3cHmC9v0Ta6Q.text: I have become a Windsor addict. I love the complimentary valet (but seriously, still leave a tip for the guys!) and the decor is effortlessly cool. The atmosphere is hip and trendy, but the True star is still the food. I love their fondue appetizer and their burgers are phenomenal! Their drinks look amazing and I'll be back to try them once I'm not pregnant anymore! Windsor is my go to place to take out of town guests, no one has been disappointed yet.

UhwV6hsgl6esJOR5K1cI2g.text: Anyone who doesn't give this place 5 stars is a criminal. I was in the restaurant business for years when I was younger so have a keen eye for service. This place is phenomenal. On any given visit you will probably encounter 4-6 employees as they are ALL there to help you. Great ambiance and the food menu is straight and to the point. No Cheesecake Factory where you have to read a book to find what you want to eat. Good cocktails and a small, yet good beer selection.

iESKbeoDJFvHk4bRjnP1BA.text: Love Windsor! Food is delicious, awesome beers and cocktails, and great service! I especially love the Happy Hour drink specials... only wish they went later than 5pm, but hey they are seven days a week which is a huge plus!  I have had a few things there now and everything has been so good (both chicken sandwiches, burger, mac and cheese, pickled vegetables)! Went with a group of four last weekend and everyone loved their meals and awesome beer specials. It seems like an ideal day drinking spot.  If only I could day drink more often...

8rOUqRfMZVP_W4LWyQgqfA.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants in Phoenix.  We were ecstatic to hear of this opening as we were frequent diners at Postinos.  Everything we have ordered has been fabulous.  Their specialty cocktails are a perfect blend.  They always have different beer selection that is wonder.  Their service is top notch!    If you are looking for some home cooking and great service give Windsor a try!

yWbRDNfxVJRwV0y_w8jK3Q.text: Two bathrooms are shared for men and women (yuck!).  And, it gets worse when a female sits on the toilet in the bathroom where a urinal shares the room and you look across to the mens urinal and see an inch think of urine collecting in the corners floor. It makes you want to puke!! And in addition, the urine from the urinal has splashed onto the glass case that stores the toilet paper. There are NO seat covers so you end up wiping down the toilet seat yourself, gross!!!    And after I spoke with the Manager , Leslie, she mentioned to me that the other restroom has no urinal....so make that one the Women's bathroom and save women from the view of the urinal and the urine on the floor and wiping down the toilet seat. In addition, Seat covers would be a plus for sure!!!!!  I was really enjoying the ambiance, food, drinks and that good ol local feeling till I saw the urinal collection in such a nice neighborhood hot spot.  Leslie....you really need to clean those bathrooms more ofter before a health code violation comes your way, NO JOKE!!!  Clean up your act!!!!  I will not be returning back, bummer. But (and that is a big "IF" I would prefer to go into a women's ONLY bathroom!!  Postinos (right across the street) should re-think their bathroom situation as well.

sgO805xrgWSJb_rsziDxfA.text: I can't say enough good about Windsor.  We went early on a Saturday evening (5:30 PM).  We were greeted within a couple of minutes of walking to the entrance, which is behind the building which faces Central Avenue.  Within a minute or two of being seated, our server came by to ask us for a drink order and someone else came by to deliver water.  As others have noted, service is excellent and team-based.  No less than 4 folks came to help us during dinner.  As if the service weren't enough, the food was really exceptional.  I'd call it elevated bar food.  We shared the "Russian Roulette" - shishito peppers sauteed in olive oil and lemon juice - and the tuna tartare.  Neither my wife nor I could decide which we liked batter, but there wasn't a crumb left on either plate when they were cleared away.  For dinner, I had the short rib, which was flavorful and fork tender.  My wife had the Ahi Tuna salad, which we agreed may have had the best prepared seared tuna we had ever had.  The food menu is complemented by a moderately small, but outstanding drink list, including wines by the glass and bottle (including some, like Bedrock Old Vine Zinfandel, which is produced in pretty small amounts!), beers on draught and bottle (I had a Milk Stout that was awesome), excellent call liquors (I recognized some pretty good single malt scotches) and creative mixed drinks.  If I had any complaint it's that the restaurant is very loud.  Note that this doesn't diminish my view of the restaurant - it is exactly what it advertises itself to be.  We were warned that Friday and Saturday nights after 6 PM get crazy - up to an hour wait - but we'll definitely be back.  This is one restaurant that I think may actually be worth that kind of wait!

JyfAeWG3p9f49Ak9_vMAkQ.text: I go to Windsor for the cocktails. I could care less about the food. I had a salad once. It was fine. But the cocktails. Oh my. Yes please. Their happy hour prices are great. If I lived next door, I'd be drunk all the time. I'm partial to the No. 6, which is comprised of gin, housemade strawberry syrup, strega, and-wait for iiiiit-apple cider vinegar. Yeah. You heard that right. It's not for everyone, but it's definitely for me. It's one of the best drinks I've ever had.   The service is excellent. The atmosphere is wonderful. The fact that I can get amazing coffee ice cream and homemade salted caramels next door helps. I always feel fancy having my car valet parked. I always feel less fancy when I realize it's full of empty coffee cups and granola bar wrappers. Don't forget to bring cash to tip the valet folks!

jcPa7yYP51yAYBT95Oifvw.text: Great restaurant...fair prices..nice ambiance and right in the middle of Central Phoenix.  Service was excellent and a lot of fun!

B58fEGCdXxB-w7N7zYkunw.text: I love the atmosphere of sitting outside or inside here, but their cocktails specifically no. 6 is a big fashion NO NO. Seriously it was nasty. The house made chips are delish.

b59pfWnRwtWXaaJ_bE0k0Q.text: Everything was a wonderful experience from the valet that received my car to the ice cream lady at Churn. Service was friendly, prompt and professional.  The atmosphere was warm and inviting and it just has a great vibe.   Now to top it all off the Reuben was the best that I have ever had. Kind of funny when you think about it. How good or classy can a Reuben be? This Rueben takes you beyond the typical greasy low quality experience. The pastrami is some of the best that I have ever tasted, The sandwich was elequently done.   I would highly recommend this place for a lunch with really good friends. It just adds to the experience of being with the ones that you love.

ZoqNXXWddgPPckzCjy5l6Q.text: Windsor has a great atmosphere, and good food.   But, the best part about Windsor, is the service - which for me, can make or break my experience. Everyone working makes sure that you are having a great time. If the water is empty anyone will fill it - not just the person helping you. They seem to work as a team to make sure everything is perfect. I can't think of another establishment that operates under this philosophy. Most are only concerned with their tables, trying for the biggest tips. Not at Windsor!   I am giving it a "4" because the food isn't "out of this world", but it is good. And, Sean Minor is on the wine list - which is always a plus!

gzeALeE7OVvirT9eTWBheA.text: Had the soup/salad duo and a side of mac & cheese.  AMAZING! Everything was delicious.  Great service and prices were very reasonable considering the quality of food/service. Ambiance was also very inviting. There is a lush patio in back, and inside tables and booths surround the bar.  If I lived in Phoenix, I would be a regular here!

bnOODM9pnHqTlt_BlZn6zg.text: This is a very cool place. The food is good, and the vibe is fun. I really enjoyed the Banh Mi Halibut Sandwich. I will save room next time to try ice cream at Churn next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waldorf Chicken Salad
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banh Mi Halibut Sandwich with Mac &amp; Cheese

bcuDhMBWz8VZVuumj3kh0w.text: This is one of those places that I wish you son of a bitches did not know about! Just kidding, that is what makes this place is the cool peeps (unless I cannot get a table)! When we arrived, did not want to valet, so we drove to colter and walked over. Cardio complete.   Had the honor on a Sunday for brunch with a homey. OK, this is what Sunday Funday really is! $5 pitchers of beer (good stuff - get at least 2.5 beers outta one)!!! The Bloody Mary Bar was in full effect and so here is what we ate...  Apps - Gotta have the Corn Dog Poppers, I mean your drinking beer! They were excellent!   Main Meal - Backyard Burger Windsor Style, Buddy had the Picnic Kebobs - Chicken, pork, shrimp, & mixed veggie with spicy pepper dip. All really tasty! I mean really good! All the food looked really good and my neighbors at the bar were nice enough to give us their favorites list for our next trip.   Look forward to a patio table next time and a chance at the Ceviche!

GIlhaQS1m7ufNyIGujWL1g.text: I made my way back the other day while in the area to try the grain salad I have heard a lot about.  I love salads, and I loved this salad.  It had so many wonderful flavors. I really loved when I would get a burst of basil from the dressing.  The roasted tomatoes were amazing, I came home and made a salad with roasted tomatoes because they were so good.  I ordered some church potatoes to go for my Sis to eat after surgery to cheer her up, and ohhhh boy did they.  Man those potatoes are FREAKING AMAZE SAUCE!!!

Aij0KTRX8amos67KoFaA2w.text: Took Mom to Windsor for Mothers Day. Overall a great time. Good burgers (beware of the Windsor sauce and ask for it on the side), $5 pitchers of beer and cocktails. Good customer service too :)

NTp5SEdyGrsyNvNqwrkQwg.text: Well I must have really missed something here. My husband and I ate here tonight and arrived excited and hungry. Neither of us left happy, nonetheless full, of what I am not sure, sodium perhaps. Oh I forgot, my ahi salad had no flavor and my husbands crab cake sandwich apparently received the entire salt shaker. Tried the egg salad dip. I can live the rest of my life without this again. Bland egg salad topped with super salty bacon and blue cheese. Never again. Btw, we paid 14 dollars for the salty sandwich and 16 dollars for the salad a two year old could have put  together. This of course would have been a three star review if maybe the server didn't feel as to put us last on his list. We waited after finishing our dinner, obviously done, for at least fifteen minutes before he removed the plates and we had the opportunity to ask for the check. Something on our faces must have clued him in not to ask any questions, just told us we could go next door if interested in dessert. I am thinking the cocktails must be good, we do not drink,  but think it is definitely important to drink here.

jwNTou1me9uqFTfismoNmg.text: Was a family meeting place for the holidays until last night. Waitors/waitresses were too much in a hurry to serve you. Ordered a Windsor Burger well done no pink. What I got was rare undercooked burger.  I sent it back and received a burger that was really burnt on one side as if the cook was trying to make a statement. Any good experienced cook would have taken his time to make sure it doesn't burn and would have used a thermometer to make sure the meet was fully cooked before removing from the grill. If you can't fulfill a customers burger preference then the waiter shouldn't ask how you want it cooked.

pE8UNrQIYtsBTwz--g1Olw.text: Comfortable and stylish, Winsor is brought to you by the same folks who run Postino's and it shows. Although I did not see a brushetta in sight, the restaurant has the same open feel to it and also the same valet parking set up. Our 3 person party's visit was on a busy Saturday night but fortunately we only had a short 5 minute wait.   After being seated at a corner booth, we started our meal with their Cheddar Fondue, $11. It featured pulled pork, apple slices, caraway bread, sausage and a white cheddar for dipping, yes it was a good as it sounds. For our main dishes we ordered the Porkwitch $12, pulled pork ham & smoked bacon with coleslaw, A country Vegetable Chop Salad $9, with greens, Kale, brussel sprouts, corn, snap peas with a ranch dressing and a Banh Mi Halibut Sandwich $13, with grilled halibut with honey soy glaze. All were tasty but the Bahn Mi Sandwich was the best of the three. It has the perfect spiciness and crunch from carrot and cucumber.   If you enjoy comfort food, you will like this place, and don't miss their sweet shop connected to the restaurant that features house made ice cream.

ZN1aMs44eqDF8hstgV-rrg.text: My husband, son and I have decided Windsor is an established go-to for the entire family! Austin (son) loves the Porkwich, while Deane and I travel back and forth between the burgers, fish sandwich and various salads. Sunday brunch here is not to be missed! Also, the bar offers a variety of interesting, original drinks. Best yet, curve right around the corner in the same establishment and you can get freshly made ice cream at Churn (in the same building). GREAT place; come here all the time and would recommend it to anyone who appreciates good food, interesting atmosphere and friendly people.

N49ki0lX2vs_-f_dX7yxDg.text: I went to Windsor w/ a group from work at lunch time.  We were greeted promptly and seated outside on their shady patio.  Our waiter came to our table quickly and took our drink order.  He also answered our menu questions and gave his opinion on a couple of dishes.  The food came out quickly and hot.  All I can say is "AMAZING".  I had the halibut sandwich with mac n' cheese as the side.  Very good taste to the halibut w/ a little kick that was unexpected, but loved.  The only suggestion I can give for this sandwich is to lighten up on the greens and please, please, please, take the stems off of the cilantro!  I am in love w/ the taste of cilantro but the texture of the stems was off putting.  Overall, this was a great restaurant w/ wonderful atmosphere.  Service was good and we left satisfied!  The 4 stars is just b/c the talented chef should consider reducing the amount of greens on the halibut sandwich and make sure to take the stems off the cilantro.  Well done!  Can't wait to go back when I can indulge in some adult beverages!

6xkL-Voe_eQ9cDfTwchwmg.text: Love their egg Benedict. Quality ham, simply delicious. Will go again! Amazing place with friendly waiters

4M1TZI6fo7iKk4RXzWGutA.text: Windsor is AWESOME. The whole environment is just so much fun, the patio is my favorite! The morning drinks are to die for, especially the #91.  This is a great atmosphere for people of all ages!

29j9eR_tifv1Bg9zLgAxMQ.text: Their menu sounded a bit boring (very 'American' burger joint)... but my husband wanted to try their food.  The food blew me away. Easily one of the best 'burger' places I have been to and their cocktails are amazing as well. I can't say enough wonderful things about this place.

bEmClVq_pGj66MukSvrttA.text: I have been to Windsor twice now, once for happy hour/dinner and once for brunch. They were voted best Gastropub in central phoenix... I don't think there's is much gastro or pub deserving qualities. The food is eh. We had the nachos (there listed under a fancier name on the menu) and those were actually very good. The salmon entree I got with the kale salad... not so much. Salmon was overcooked and the kale salad was well, a salad- not deserving of the rave reviews our server gave it. My comrade got the white fish banh mih... Now I am a HUGE fan of Vietnamese food and even futile fusion attempts by 'American' restaurants... Don't call it a banh mih if you're not going to serve it on a demi-french baguette. It was served on the same bun they serve their burgers on... So what you end up getting is a very SOFT sandwich. eh.  The drinks are good though. I would go for happy hour (even though it ends early- 5pm). $9 cocktail for $5 is a steal and they do execute that well.

KuiDen3fMeN9Gs_GCJoV5w.text: Reuben was good, chopped lake salad was to.  Reuben was good, chopped lake salad was to.

HithCQ0zYxwC_ZWYlztjhA.text: I loved the mixed grain salad, I added grilled shrimp to it and it was delicious. My husband had the crabcake sandwich and a side of awesome mac and cheese. Everything was wonderful here and the waitstaff  were great as well. Can't wait to go back.

SWw7ZTH-p2yUhKHr0pAXLA.text: Started out great but has gone down hill. I go regularly for brunch on Sunday and just as regularly have to send back the pancakes for being burned. The matador has also gotten small and pitiful. Friendly staff is always helpful but mgmt. needs to fix some shit fast.

39zimW0Yap7VRD_dOrmgHw.text: WOW! WOW! WOW! Looking for a place to have brunch before heading back out of state. What a treat. My partner and I ordered the crab cake eggs benedict and the Highroad sandwich with the added sausage. What a wonderful experience. Scrumptous food and friendly, smiling staff!

6ib-7jJLHFtjIKCrn09Jkw.text: Obsessed.  Stopped in for lunch for the first time last weekend and I've been thinking about it (and talking about it to anyone who will listen) all week. I'm already a regular at Postino, so I had high hopes and Windsor definitely lived up to, if not exceeded, my expectations.  The restaurant is charming from the minute you walk in...I loved the cool bar surrounded by plaid bar stools, and the nice big booths.  Make sure to take a trip to the bathroom and check out the awesome wall o' cassette tapes - it's a nice touch.  I asked my server about a few different wines and not only was he knowledgeable, but he brought me over pours of three different whites to try.  That's some pretty awesome service.  I went with his suggestion, a Riesling, which was bright and nice for the summer, and wasn't overly sweet like many Rieslings. Plus you gotta love the $5 price tag.  I also followed his suggestion for my lunch and got the halibut sandwich with the kale salad on the side.  The kale salad was light, fresh and interesting, but ohmigod the SANDWICH. I couldn't stop eating it.  Usually I wouldn't be able to finish a big ol' sandwich for lunch but I was seriously in love with this one.  The fish was delicious and flaky, the bun perfectly toasted, the vegetables a nice crisp addition, and there was some awesome creamy sauce with a bit of a kick.   I will definitely be back....there are at least five other items on their menu that I can't wait to try.  The Postino folks have another winner.  Wasn't too busy when I went there, but give it a few months to catch on and I'm sure it'll be mobbed.  Has an adorable outdoor patio that will be beautiful when the weather cools down.   I love you, Windsor!

MZ1YqU_WvgpMXhZY-pctVA.text: Great food, fantastic service! We had the brown bag chicken sandwich and the crab cake BLT. The combination of flavors and taste was fresh and delicious. Better than the food was the service our server Maria provided. I can't wait to go back!

1wweJmYI2JBbGuMOe9kQKw.text: Making myself try something different every time we go, and Have yet to find anything I wouldn't order again and again.    Porkwich - decadant comfort food, and never had a sandwich that I find myself daydreaming about frequently.  Bahn Mi - wow.  Brown Bag Chicken - glad the server told us it was cold, huge flavors, so tasty.  Crab cake sammy - best crab cakes since leaving the east coast.  Can't decide which side is my favorite - okra, mac & cheese, church potatoes....  Deviled egg dip and kettle chips, loaded chips, kabobs - even the apps make me want to go back, now!  Service is awesome - have never seen service in a pooled tips environment be so awesome.  Everyone works together to enusure you are well taken care of, start to finish.  When someone comes to your table mid-way through the meal and knows what you're drinking when all that's there is an empty glass, then knows exactly how to split a check (one of us was on an expense report) without asking how to split it - all I think is 'How do they train this?'  All that and each server still gives personal attention / interaction that makes you want to come back again and again.  Truly conflicted in writing a review - I want this to be 'our little secret' so we don't get locked out by the crowds!  But discovering a great happy hour and super patio - we're happy going early and hanging for a while!  Besides, the timing works perfectly for wrapping up with ice cream from Churn (peanut butter ice cream - who told them that's my secret obsession?) before heading home relaxed, sated and STILL talking about a great meal and wonderful experience....

o2Nr3pxp8XmRLWX6lEiJEw.text: Went here for lunch. Love the valet parking since parking can be tricky. The boiled egg dip is excellent and the fried okra. Friendly staff and stocked bar.

PnlpJ3W3Ku7JqIHUS6oFDw.text: Looking for a great place to take someone on a first date? Bam. Done.  Windsor is the perfect "get to know you" place by offering a great atmosphere that is filled with amazing music, comfy seating, interesting decor and great food.

ZYIVRW8ZtayCC2mVHMCSbA.text: Good food.  Very open environment.  Great service.  Worth trying out. Happy hour specials look great.  Might have to go back for that.  recommend the mac/cheese and church pots.

l68jwnT1XecwyeuvjBj4jw.text: I am so happy that my husband suggested that we try this restaurant. It's a great vibe and the food is really good. He started with the deviled egg appetizer, while I ordered the corn dogs. The egg was delicious- great blend of flavors. The corn dogs were fried a little too long, and they could have used slightly bigger pieces of hot dogs, but the flavor was really good. We then shared a pulled pork sandwich and a side of mac and cheese. Sandwich was delicious, but the mac and cheese was under spiced. The cocktails were well made, and service was attentive. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere. Can't wait to try them out for brunch.

irEmPmPf1nyQHr3qUOpmJw.text: This restaurant is uber cute-reminded me of home. Food was amazing and drinks hit the spot. Only four stars because parking is awful and the location was a bit hard to find.

wzMhZTf9TYrdujJIBddutQ.text: My boyfriend and I went there for a date night, and the food was amazing. I loved the Russian roulettes, however I do wish we encountered a larger amount of peppers that had more spicy to them. I got the crab cake blt with fries, it was so good and you get some much food for the price. My boyfriend got the brown bag chicken sandwich and he are the whole thing. We both ordered wine and some water. Our waters were constantly full however we were never asked if we'd like another glass of wine. We both loved their playlist and the atmosphere. Overall its a good place to for dinner or brunch

9unskp1l3bjGtAVg3Dqk5w.text: I tried the No. 17 at Devour Phoenix & LOVED it! I only kept 2 cards out of the entire food festival & followed up on Windsor first just because of that cocktail. It's soooo freaking good! I tired the deviled egg & chip dip & it's all fresh & all good! Note to self... Must get that again. Then for an entree I had the crab cake BLT & OMG it was seriously crabby & bacony. Too many good things on the menu left to try but I loved everything I had. Can't wait to go back.

rvMXPj1ZPdhDIGeB1YD0Mw.text: Awful, no place to sit, crowded and noisy. Food is not great,'people smoking everywhere, will not recommend, crying babies and kids

yjUskMiEMKRWVTUiYe7djw.text: I'm here with my girlfriend now and I haven't used Yelp in months but I had to dust the old Yelp app off and put it to use to write this place the review it deserves! The atmosphere of this place is perfect! It's so relaxing and chill while still somehow being upbeat and fun. And how can you beat 5 dollar pitchers before 5 every day!?. Everyone is so nice.. especially our server Alexa!! The food was delicious and prompt and the chilled glasses made the draughts even more satisfying! If you are looking for something to eat.. stop looking.. just come here.. like now.. cuz you're hungry now.. and they're open now.. and it's only 4 o'clock... that means 5 til 5.. We'll see you when you get here. haha

FcR_hmrySZIJ9IJSJB_vIg.text: Hey hipsters. Join the lines at Windsor. And they are pretty much worth it.  The wait for 4 on a Friday night was about 30 minutes, not horrible. We were seated in a big booth with plenty of room.  THE FOOD: We ordered the cheese fondue appetizer. The bread and apples were great in it, but we were a bit confused by the pulled pork on the side. Should we stir it in? We ended up putting it on top of the bread after being dipped in the cheese.  I had the Windsor burger. I have read reviews treating it like it was the second coming. I wouldn't go that far, but it was a good burger. Juicy and obviously hand formed, with smoky carmelized onions and the rest of the fixins. The fries were suprisngly tasty, not just a throw-away side dish.  Others at the table had the pastrami sandwich which was proclaimed "interesting", but very tasty.  THE SERVICE: Adequate. Not great, not bad.   THE DECOR: The wall of cassettes is amazing. Look at my pic, that is my favorite. I have become obsessed with what I think might be on that mixed tape.  Will I go back? Sure. But I'm going to wait for the frenzy to die down a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Gettin It On Mixtape

cUZCrGg0q7n1AY6df8PVNg.text: Went in for Happy Hour with a good friend off her sisters recommendation.  $5 cocktails are unbeatable! Cheese fondue...if the waitress didn't take it I would have burnt my tongue trying to lick all the cheese out of the hot cast iron skillet ramikin. And the wheat salad far exceeded my expectations! Can't wait to come back for Fried Chicken or more happy hour. I feel like I won't be able to go wrong here!

s-64XNdEwJ5Uia_zZ91hLw.text: Great food, great service.  Started with the loaded chips, which were a nice balance of sweet and savory with the cheese and caramelized onions.  I ordered the ribs, but there was a misunderstanding with the server and I was brought the pork sandwich.  The server quickly corrected the mistake and I wasn't charged for the ribs, which were very tasty.  Good service, good food, and nice atmosphere here, too.

6UrnMHKS7aKyMnfbQk5yfg.text: My wife and I came here on Thursday night for our 8 year anniversary. (That's a running total including our dating period. We've only been married for a year-and-a-half.)  I was told by a few people that this place was great. They weren't kidding! I love the "new american" cuisine at these trendy kinds of places.   I love the layout of the place. It connects to Churn which is an ice cream shop next door. That place is cool too.   My wife and I ordered the Cheddar Fondue appetizer. That was amazing. You got to have that. I had a total oink fest. It came with warm pretzels, apple slices and sausage. SO GOOD.   My wife had the Porkwhich. That looked totally bomb. So of course I tried it and it was so good. Very flavorful.   I got the New Orleans Style Pork Ribs. It was to die for. The fries that came with it were good. The cheddar biscuit was just okay though.   We went on a night that wasn't very busy, but we've seen this place packed before on Friday and Saturday nights. The service was good too. It's a little pricey, but it's good for a special occasion!  All in all, I'd definitely reccomend this place!

6-gYJ02AAJibDZTkqliz4A.text: Alright people strap in and get ready for flavor explosions, if that not what you are into that Windsor is not the place for you.  like Quintin Terintino I am going to start at the end, and like M. Night Shamalan I am gonna throw in a twist, the dessert!!! in house made ice cream is amazing, ready for the twist?! its not "at" Windsor!!!!! its next door at Churn. Vietnamese Coffee, toasted coconut... these are just two of the flavors that you can get. and the environment at this place makes me feel like smalls from sandlot stepping back into a old school candy shop.  now back to the set up of our cinematic trek through Windsor.   opening credits.... Valet service and a back entrance thought the court yard/patio give the romantic feel of a Minnie driver movie, but at the same time the dim lighting and the fact that you are sneaking in around the back makes you feel like you could be meeting up with The Godfather himself. I am captured before I even hear the lead actor talk.  enter host.... a little hard to tell who is the "good guys" aka working staff wanting to seat you and get you a beer from the central bar, and "bad guys" aka other guests who just want to take your seats. Like John Rambo I dominated the field and got a great seat on the patio.   action picks up... appetizers, I am a sucker for blue cheese and caramelized onions, and just like Jeff Daniels and Jim Carey in dumb and dumber the "loaded potato chips" were an instant hit!!! If that dish was the dumb and dumber of Jim Carey's potato chip appetizer career, then the deviled egg dip is his Ace Ventura... I could eat both every week and never get tired of them.   climax.... pork-which, crab cake BLT, brown bag chicken sand which, burger.... think of these as such movie star greats as, Brad Pitt, Denzel Washington, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Daniel Day Lewis.... now don't get too attached to the love of the charecters/entres when they hit your table. just as in any good movie the hero (your meal) will meet their demise in the end and you will leave the restaurant just as you would leave the theater, in awe of what just happened. "how did I just consume an entire Denzel Washington!?"  this place is great a True academy award winner in my books. I am back at least once a month !!!

HUxL7ImR664aunf2j21GAg.text: Always a favorite. Good food, good beers, good happy hour pricing. The deviled egg dip is awesome

3ZzY24HRiXKAbI8r8C8HLg.text: I ordered the New Orleans ribs which were reasonably priced and yummy but not memorable. My friend ordered the crab cake BLT and HOLY GOD was it good! It was probably the best sandwich I ever tried. But when applying the laws of bacon of course it's going to be awesome (Bacon + anything = awesome). In this case, bacon + (crab cakes and baguette) = bestsandwichever!   The service was mixed. Our server wasn't anything special and was absent a few times when we needed her. My companion noticed her boyfriend sitting in her section (or at least what appeared to be her bf) who seemed to be taking up a considerable amount of her attention. But Windsor is well staffed. They have food and drink runners helping out the servers so nothing is sitting out for long. Also, without telling anyone, one of the employees brought out an umbrella to shield our table from the sun. I was pretty impressed with their attention to detail.   My only real complaint is about the loud table of bros sitting by us. I understand that there's nothing the staff can really do about that. I just don't get why you would come to a restaurant to only drink with 10 of your frat bros. Go to the Mill Ave for that.   The parking is what it is. I think Phoenicians tend to overreact about valets and little parking lots because we are spoiled with lots that take up a city block. If you go to any urbanized city parking is always set up like this; just deal with it folks.   Overall this place is pretty good and gets 4/5 stars. They certainly have the tools and capability to be a 5 star restaurant (by Yelp standards anyway). We'll see how things go next time!

1fiYUnSk-q3_LAFMsE6ghg.text: Amazing staff, atmosphere, great food!  I have a hard time finding healthy options at restaurants known for their culinary art-it was a breeze!

2O6WV1FW0DcbuAhgdApMdw.text: The service and classic cocktails receive a 5 star rating; they were very hospitable and knowledgeable about their alcohol. Dinner fare was limited in choices and the recommended entrees were not tasty which account for the lower overall rating. Enjoyed our dessert at their adjoining ice cream shop, Churn.

YEukSc1-KVj0HtFreHZbHQ.text: Went to Windsor for an early lunch.  This meant there were still a couple of parking places so we did not have to use the free valet service they have.  We both ordered the crabcake blt sandwich.  IT WAS HUGE.  A bit difficult to handle, but tasty.   One annoyance...a variety of staff kept coming by to try and clear our plates while we were still talking and eating.

l1_MuRafg2IMNhXgtM-X4w.text: Best patio in midtown.  My favorite place to get brunch.  If you're in central Phoenix, this is a MUST!  Their staff is amazing, helpful, and works on a team service concept so you never get neglected.   They don't rush you out and let you hang for hours.  Somehow they've accomplished a small-town, neighborhood restaurant feel, right on Central Ave. in Phoenix.  I highly recommend the Quinoa Oatmeal!

3xBzwb4Ergygojb9zWONng.text: I like the Windsor, but am not in love with it. The food at one point might have been considered inventive, but seems more like comfort food these days, which is fine. The menu is very sandwich and salad oriented, which is great for lunch but always makes me feel like I am settling for dinner. The brunch menu is ho-hum.  Windsor shines in its cocktails and appetizers, and, as a result, I usually come here for drinks these days. I only wish that it were open until 2am.

l9aKmjsL1Wxw-s-f8c5tTQ.text: Mmmmm.... Windsor. I've been here several times and always had an excellent experience. They have $5 mini-pitchers of beer (Stella!) during happy hour. My husband and I LOVE the deviled egg dip appetizer... I dream about that stuff! My favorite sandwich is the brown bag chicken, it's a perfect blend of deliciousness that is too much to describe, but seriously, try it! My hubby usually gets the fish sandwich. Both of us get Jo's Church Potatoes as our side (I never said I eat healthy here...).   I've also had brunch here a few times and have loved it. The crab cakes Benedict was perfect and the bloody mary was a great one.   Unless you're lucky enough to find an open spot in the handful they have, expect to valet. It's free but make sure you tip the guys, they're pretty quick!   I'd also like to mention that a gentleman who I'm assuming is a manager that is always running around is one of the BEST managers I've ever seen in a busy restaurant. He's hilarious and always two steps ahead of you in picking up plates, refreshing drinks or offering his advice on what you should eat.

FWWfl4vTmo5b_-FU2RKP4A.text: Such a great restaurant! There drinks are AMAZING and their food is even better. I absolutely love the staff as well. They're always so friendly and accommodating. Ive been coming here for years and take all my friends when they come in town! Check out their cocktail list and beer specials during happy hour! The deviled egg dip is so good and I highly recommend their backyard burger, Windsor style! You won't be disappointed. It's an adorable place with a friendly staff, and amazing food

1YPVPCP2hXmbBnq5S62Zig.text: Go to happy hour spot for get togethers. Great appetizers, atmosphere, service and drinks of the day! Love the outdoor patio!

0FFThV8sj2vfz3b1WMRs3w.text: One of the best fried chicken ? Unfortunately, i purchased it today and it was burnt without seasoning - overpriced lack of flavor and dry like the desert. Not worth $13.75 !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My purchase on 3-15-16

jgCw1qu1UTKSmJ5gRPn02Q.text: Was in town for a wedding and had a great brunch here. Great happy hour deals for their delicious craft cocktails. I had the cocktail with basil in it and it was glorious. So fresh and full of flavor. I ate the crab cake BLT and was really impressed. A tad too much bread for my liking but the flavors were spot on together. I ended up ordering a side of fried okra. It certainly brought me back to my childhood days in Alabama with my grandparents but there wasn't anything super special about it. Would definitely like to try brunch here on our next trip in town.

bq5mOmrU8HyOhJlKJPjY9A.text: Every time I come here I get the crab cake sandwich with kale salad and it never fails. The crab cake is so soft and loaded with crab. The bread is delicious and the bacon on top makes everything that much better.   Service here is great too. Everyone is friendly, nothing to formal, fun atmosphere

dXex2Vtzjc9Z-RP6GOTM-A.text: Met a friend for brunch and about died over how good it was. All you need to know is the following:  1. You can get a pitcher of Pimm's Cup. A pitcher. 2. Best Eggs Benedict since the old El Chorro on Lincoln. No offense to the new El Chorro, I just stopped going after you stomped all over your history with the remodel. 3. Griddled Church Potatoes  I am in LOVE with Windsor. Probably going to eat there so much it gets weird.

wDhqNdj1LyjA6XbbBC2I1Q.text: First timer here! Holy shit does your service suck!  Not only did your idiot server not understand, "double vodka with a shot of olive juice and then add some olives"  Her response, "oh thats like #6939845"  No. I want a double vodka with olive juice and olives. Its like a martini without ice.  What am i served? A martini, by a white jacketed lady, not the forearm two-tatted amoebic idiot who f'd up the order. Ok fine. Not what I wanted but it will do.  What will not do and is not fine- ignoring me as you ask the rest of the table about food, second drinks and taking away empties.   And $13 for ceviche with 3 pieces of fish is robbery. Tasty but wallet rape robbery.  I would have said this but hey, ignored! And ps overenthusiastic douche, glad our 'man' figured out the tab for you-trim your happy by 30% 'cause its annoying as fuck.  Enjoy your measly 18% tip.  Your customer service needs work. Sincerely - a chronic over tipper so your ass really sucks!!

6U0Wrmm1OSvpBWZGbuD_Yw.text: $5 before 5 :) got to love a "pitcha" of brew for that!

gOEvypaFa6U6oYlSbnugmA.text: This is our local watering hole... we live about a mile and a half away.  It's our go-to spot.  Feeling a little hungry?  Head to Windsor.  Got some out of town guests?  Go to Windsor.  Just want a quick drink before heading out for something else?  Try Windsor!  Listen... there's just about nothing bad I can say about this place.  Well, maybe I wish there were dedicated barstools for me and my bff.  But that's about it.  Go here.  Fast.  You'll love it.

5RDjB6E-zo9Xw-rNwEdr7g.text: Not sure why I took so long to review this place. I've had dinner and brunch at Windsor and it's always on point. My recent visit was brunch and  I only went for the Corn meal poppers, their brunch menu is o.k, I like pancakes and didn't see any of that on their menu. I ended up getting the Simple Life ( Two eggs any style with an MJ English muffin, Tender Belly bacon, & seasonal fruit), which you can't really go wrong with eggs and bacon. But those Corn dog poppers, though. OMG, best thing-EVA, crunchy outside, salty inside (that's the hot dog part) and with these fried dill and sweet pickles on the side, I was done, not because I love hot dogs, I mean, I'm an adult, so yea, but more so because those damn fried pickles were a blessing to my soul. Go to Windsor, have a meal, but get those Corn Dog poppers. That's it, now go!

LPN2ptJhgt1hVnnztVFRnw.text: We really wanted to like this place! We visited tonight for the first time, and it was just meh. The decor was decent, very city like, with exposed brick, and a cassette tape wall near the bathrooms. The place was pretty packed, with us arriving at around 730. We were greeted promptly, and seated in the same manner. Thought that we were off to a good start. For a starter we ordered the Corn Dog Poppers, which were presented in a bowl, with fried pickle chips and spears, and a side of mustard. So far so good, they were pretty fun to eat really. I ordered the New Orleans style ribs, with coleslaw,  while my husband ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger (Med. Rare) and a side of mac and cheese. We also ordered ice tea to drink. We were served our ice tea, and were surprised that it was flavored, which I cannot stand!! If it is not advertised as flavored (tropical flavor) then it should not be flavored. I returned mine. I just want normal ice tea people! Shortly out of nowhere another guy (who is not our waiter) walks up and says he is there to take our order...what??? Weird!! Ok, whatever... The food comes and it looks great, but that is where it stops....the ribs were not the greatest, and had a strong taste of vinegar in them....I only ate them because they were 17.00, otherwise I would have not bothered. It does not stop there, with the coleslaw tasting the same...of vinegar and just plain dirt.  My husbands burger was dry, and just blah. The mac and cheese was dry and nasty.  What went wrong here, we are not sure...but it was just WRONG!! The establishment has two bathrooms (both uni-sex) which I thought very inconvenient, for as I walked out of the bathroom, there was a line to use the restroom. Strange!!  Overall, we were not impressed with The Windsor...and unfortunately will not be returning. We are not the kind to try to find fault with places, and we truly love places like Joyride Taco (across the street) and Federal Pizza, and we enjoy trying new places, this just was not the place for us. Bummer....

hQAW08bnJY2X-67qdm4lXQ.text: So today my office order from here for out meeting. I decided to try something new. I got the Windsor chese burger at the recommendation from the girl who took the order over the phone. I added bacon to my burger because bacon is amazing. Well when my manager brought the food back my burger had no bacon but you charged us for it smh. I could even enjoy my food because it's not what I wanted. This is the third time I have tryed this place and I don't think I will be back.

SfgUvfD7eGOyF2cINb26RA.text: Very cool atmosphere. I had the backyard burger and it was amazing. Definitely coming here to fulfill my burger cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese. Simple yet delish :)
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Backyard burger. Delish

off9hhLh4SMPXz2Bwwk-aA.text: Windsor is one of our local favorites.  You can always count on a great meal, with consistent service and food.  Of course, the $5 before 5 is great - $5 pitchers of beer or glasses of wine.  The Windsor style burger is our favorite - caramelized onions and garlic aioili?  Be-still my heart.  And this is one of the only places who's salads are good enough for me to actually order as an entree.  The grilled chicken sandwich is also a common standby.  Updating review to 5 stars. The only thing that makes us think twice before coming is the crowds/wait, but it's always worth it! We've recently discovered their brunch- the mister always gets the eggs, gravy and biscuits. Great mixed drinks and specials. Windsor always wins with great food and service; you'll find us at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $5 pitcher of pimms during brunch!

UqNQfLzVIJcA6syy2uTRsg.text: This place has the greatest salad I've ever had in my life.  I've been here 4 times, and I always get the same salad.  It's the Country Vegetable Chop.  It has corn, brussel sprouts, avocado, egg, fried okra, ranch, and more.  Get it with the grilled chicken, and you will not find a better salad on the planet.  Aside from my obsession with this salad, it's a cool spot on Central north of Camelback.  There's a good size parking lot adjacent to the small strip of businesses.  There is an ice cream spot next door which is really good, too.  They have outdoor seating.  It's a must visit if you want to just enjoy a drink and munch on their food.  I've only been here during lunch hours, so, I can't attest to what it's like at night.

IXrhQasIJ0K-YKSLDr24OA.text: Chose Windsor for a Friday night date night and left full but not overly impressed. The ambiance is very hip and overall the place has a good vibe. However, despite the creative menu and potential the food did not live up to expectations.  We waited for almost a full hour to seated and during that time a hostess served us a cocktail from the menu. I had a bourbon grapefruit cocktail and my boyfriend had an interesting chai flavored whiskey drink. Both were very good. For starters we had the deviled egg dip and chips which I will say was quite good and filling. Where it fell short was with the crab cake sandwich. As a disclaimer having spent some time in the Baltimore/DC area which is notorious for oversized delicious crab cakes I have certain expectations. Unfortunately this sandwich fell far short from those expectations but it was a good try.   The portions are huge, the service was friendly but overall there is lack in taste for what the creative menu claims to offer.

FlsuzQWS7QHZ74PDcTXf8g.text: Great ambiance and love the backyard, patio feel. Windsor seems like such an awesome  and hip place to chill and grab a drink after work. They are able to mesh a bunch of different environments together in a tiny space really well. You can catch a game at the bar, get seated in a romantic table, or enjoy the outdoors with their patio seating. The food is pretty good, and they have a great selection of drinks.
