You're paying for what you get, so it's not on the inexpensive side. My favorite part is the fact that it's connected to Churn!

8lEGL4dDLrjfqnxJ4dT-wQ.text: My girlfriend and I decided to take a bike  ride  through a couple of fun locations filled with  trendy restaurants and shops. We came across this  hip place that seemed quite busy at the time. It was definitely a  fun brunch spot with  GREAT people watching,  which is one of my favorite things to do:)  There's some great patio seating if u come early enough  before the crowd. There's also indoor seating with tables, booths, and bars stools. We chose the bar stools where we could see everyone else:)(  They offered a nice brunch menu with some unique choices of specialty drinks at a very reasonable price!  We both split the Pitcha of Pimms, which was very refreshing and  chose the Simple Life , which included any style eggs, bacon, and an English muffin. My feeling is that if u can't  make the simple stuff everything else more than likely won't be great.  The chef truly did a great job and the food was on point.   The bartender offered us great customer service. He accidentally ordered only one entree for us and when he realized his mistake he quickly apologized and took the second  order of the simple life off the bill.   Overall, we really enjoyed hanging out here and will definitely be back with other friends!

WGc-gGOsVDOYniymj7MU5Q.text: Trendy place with a good vibe.  Staff was friendly and food was fresh. I had the Crab BLT, which was amazing. Good drink specials. Lots of parking!

uDlXphIONZRlLtJOQTPXHQ.text: I have been aching to try new places as often as I can. This is by far my favorite place. Between the open doors, friendly staff, and smashing cocktails it works wonders! Huge fan on the atmosphere and setting , simple, unique, trendy, classy. I truly enjoyed this place as well as the food! I would recommend it for lunch date, brunch with the brother, or even for the Hotttt date! Cocktails are well thought out and crafted with care. Food is unique and hits the spot everytime! Windsor - everything you need and want !

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa Oatmeal.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab Benedict.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chairs are on point, booths are comfy!

8dgMD9kNxADS7G4slqOftQ.text: At the Windsor you will find simple American classic bar food, but with a pleasant twist. My wife and I went in for our first visit on a Monday night for a late dinner. In spite of how busy it appeared we were both sat immediately and received prompt service. The menu includes many American classics but each are fancied up. We ordered a burger and the the fried chicken and both were delicious. To make it even better we were given tickets for free ice cream next store at the end of our meal. I would recommend the Windsor for a casual night out on the town and some good eats.

G7dDq2Ihy7spET6DLznIwQ.text: Went here with a few friends after a day at the pool. I got a cucumber drink and my friends got a gin and watermelon drink, and a vodka blackberry lemonade. They fresh squeeze all their juice and honestly they were refreshing af, highly recommend. As for the food, got the sublime salad. Also delightfully refreshing but hearty enough to fill me up. I will definitely be back here again

8WsncSUj5HlKZDzqWqRXbw.text: Cool spot in Phoenix for brunch and beverages.  Had the crab Benedict which was really good and I would order it again.  Also, got an order of the small donuts with jam for the group and they were eaten in no time. Would return here again and probably try some lunch/dinner options as I've heard those are good.

01TDINTIybnLcIrSAshkaw.text: Excellent! My husband loves trying new places, even over the old sure thing restaurants. This place was a homerun all around. It isn't often that everyone at our table loves their food, in fact, I can't remember a time.  Our table had the eggs benedict with crab and one with sausage, the biscuits and sausage, and the crab blt with okra. Everything was delicious! I absolutely loved the crab blt and the biscuit with sausage.   I highly recommend this place! We'll be back for sure!

JS_syQVfq-PjQYkDBcRwZA.text: This was the first time I'd ever been there. The atmosphere is stuffy and uptight. Going to relax at the bar, which was close to impossible with the extremely little space and seating. Staff was not terribly attentive. Met some extremely rude regular customers, who were generally just pricks. Never planning on returning if that's the demographic they seem to cater to.

le2gGca5QHknbxRUEjxNXA.text: Beautiful patio seating, friendly staff and great food.  I cannot say enough good things about their pork products.  Best bacon ever.  Beer selection rocks.  It's become "the place" we take out of town guests.

IsAjCVJxioOBfOI-dos4yQ.text: I love the $5 drinks and pitchers for happy hour.  The Ceviche is delicious and I like trying something new every time I go.  The patio is relaxing and enjoyable.  I celebrated my birthday there recently and we had a fantastic time!

cHoW5dBjWrQ4iHa2VtirLw.text: I can't say enough good things about Windsor! If I lived up the street I would be a regular twice a day. I decided to show up for brunch this time. They have the coolest Bloody Mary Bar with all the accompaniments from , fresh grated horseradish, horseradish sauce , pickled everything , onions, different hot sauces. You have a choice between Red or Green Bloody Mary drinks. The Red is traditional with a little kick and Green reminds me of Sofrito for some reason. I really wish I knew the best way to garnish the Green Bloody Mary. I had the Eggs Benedict, the sauce ham and poach egg was perfect. I wish the English muffin and a little crisp to it , but it was still really good.

sIBLKuK7zHXggF-zAglChQ.text: Love the mini corn dogs! The best part is the outdoor seating area--nice place to relax and have some drinks.  The cassette wall inside is cool, the ice-cream parlor next door is delish so save room for dessert! Will definitely go back

W-4i_YpzYrWqpZHyvjLOVw.text: First visit...wait staff slow, non-attentive, food not cooked to request, med well hamburger, raw...they did comp the meal. Was by no means fantastic for the price asked $10.00 (too much). Disappointed with Mr DeMarco

tjQJcl_jQYLYf3f3NUWmgQ.text: Some friends and I went here tonight to try this new place.  From the outside, it appeared to be fabulous and I was actually pretty excited about it.  I was really appalled at how many bad things came out of it.  We waited an hour for a table--which can be expected--but add to that the fact that the service was really poor (uncaring, bitchy wait staff) and the food that was terrible, and I can safely say that I will not be returning here.  I had a mixed grain salad with chicken.  It was awful.  I ate maybe five bites and was done with it.  One of the many servers (we had 4 or 5) even agreed that the chicken looked poor.  Also had the corn dog bites for an appetizer and, honestly, I think they were just some frozen deal from Costco.  Save your money, and your time, and avoid this place.

h7ALVYqUjYnwTQrtJqQNFA.text: my favorite brunch in the central phoenix hands down. Awesome drinks for $5, and a small but delicious menu. The Matador is the best egg dish i've ever eaten. And i'm not even an egg person. But the way they do it, it's amazing. Two over easy eggs on top of cheesy, gooey cheddar potatoes, with a crispy tortilla, fresh guacamole, and possibly the best salsa verde in phoenix. To die for. If you haven't brunched here yet, you are missing out.

5qq4dm1FbqVETcJ-3TdTiA.text: One of my top favorite restaurant in Phoenix! It is right across from Postinos and has a much better menu in terms of variety. The greatest thing about Windsor is there sides. They are all $3 and are REALLY tasty! We always get the Fried Okra & Chilled Bean Salad both SO GOOD! My bf loves the Jo's Church Potatoes & Mac & Cheese. These are all $3 so you can try tons of them! Better than apps in my opinion. My next on my list to try is Chopped Kale Salad mmm.  Ok so to the meals, since I'm a veg I always get Mixed Grain Salad (Black quinoa, kamut, pearled barley, roasted butternut squash, oven dried tomatoes, carrots, zucchini, baby beets, currants & ricotta salata with orange basil vinaigrette --- all this for NINE DOLLARS!) My bf LOVES the Porkwich $12 (Pulled pork, Tenderbelly braised ham & smoked bacon layered with gold sauce & crunchy coleslaw on a buttermilk bun). He has tried a few other things but he always says this is the best. They have wine on tap if you don't want a bottle, I usually get a glass or two of Palmina, Pinot Grigio, Santa Barbara - really good even if its "on tap".  Overall GREAT restaurant, staff is always friendly. Usually packed which makes it even funner :)

xBZRHbvo8U4EFqFHtGSLDQ.text: Consistently good food, fun atmosphere and service. The porkwich stands out as one of the best sandwiches I ever had.  There is much attention and love put into the menu. A great place to take visitors from out of town or a date.

NPPH5fBZhWQNJDQ9A6Aoyg.text: Food was great...service...not so much.  It may have just been a bad day for them...will give another chance.

3AT-w_4hMGRVbSaraP9heA.text: yep, i know the owners so shoot me, T.O.S. i can rhyme, unbiased this place, one of the best taverns in the valley hell, let's just say the state Windsor winner, chicken dinner it's burger flippin', great for beer, for a pork belly for wine out of a keg for music and for ambiance don't cost an arm or leg but brace yourselves, the parking and brace yourselves, the hoards of cenFolk, urban hipsters downtowners, all on board with dimarcos' concept whatev, still down with it Windsor won't loose, just sayin' think this joint is the shit

ggroBx47tt-Mly5Q_clPmA.text: Atmosphere is fun, great cocktails, I recommend no. 2.  Veggie options, good service.

SsXX3DrWs6EEUyrIHyaIMw.text: I just love this place.  My favorite is the mixed grain salad.  I get it with shrimp (they are large and so yummy).  All o the food that comes out of the kitchen looks so delicious.  The people I have brought here definitely want to go back. The staff is very nice and helpful when asking questions.

JhBu17K0SDg-x-WmRw1YhA.text: Flies, flies and more flies...when you have to use your menu to keep all the flies at bay you know there is a major problem...the fondue was totally avg. Culinary Dropout's version is way better...Didn't eat anything because of the flies.  The waiter with the bad attitude didn't improve things...have a drink in side at the bar and move on....

ahke8G2UChldMZM8awtkIg.text: Had lunch for the first time here and the chopped salad was great! Fun atmosphere with seating on the outdoor patio and many options inside. Great bar at the center of the room! Recently transplanted from San Francisco-the food was as good as the City and nice casual atmosphere. The wait service was excellent! Will definitely be going back to try some other dishes on the menu!

APLSGvxkmmBRJxTaUuL9pA.text: Definitely a decent brunch spot.  The parking lot is super small, but they offer complimentary valet.  I absolutely loved the verde bloody mary!  So delicious.  I think I'll go back just for that!  The food is good too.  Not amazing, but definitely really good.  I'd happily go back again anytime!

vUO_-kP1EZPXhsfGLbu85g.text: The family visited Windsor for lunch and enjoyed it very much.  It is a cute restaurant with an outdoor patio and a smallish sports bar type area.  The menu had something for everyone from soup to burgers and sandwiches.  Everyone loved their entrees but the highlight was the Russian roulette, roasted peppers of varying heat levels...so tasty and fun AND the Bloody Mary bar so I could make mine just the way I like it.  We will definitely come back when on that side of town.

tz5-lYbEE2I-Jb3Ryi8f3g.text: Awesome food and awesome atmosphere. I Loved the the reuben it was so different and tasted great.  The church potatoes were really good. Will be coming back soon!

W7YeZr0nEX-4TZToYLQzPg.text: I'll give this place 2 stars for the atmosphere and service. I went there with my girlfriend and split a Chicago dog, lentil soup and side of mac and cheese. The hot dog looked amazing but failed to perform. We were suspicious that it was precooked because of how quick we received our order. The lentils were unfortunate looking and tasted worse then their appearance and the macaroni was pale bland pile of mush uncleverly disguised by a meager layer of panko bread crumbs.

DCR5I8VHhOfLe1T09KZ-Dg.text: The best part about this place is the cozy atmosphere. We took our dog with us for dinner, and we were able to sit on the patio. So if you have a four legged family member, this is a nice chill place, with very good service.   I had the Crab Cake BLT, and although it sounds unappealing, it was surprisingly good. My better half had the Windsor Burger, but commented that the burgers at Deluxe are much tastier.   The signature drinks are decent, but definitely on the sweet side. There appeared to be a good wine and beer list, which I will most likely opt for next time.    Bottom Line: I would go back without hesitation.

bzKSt7Khozm8OlcljqG48g.text: Top notch service, great ambiance and exceptionally delicious food. I had the crab cake BLT, which was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had, as well as the side of mac and cheese, which is a MUST. Great place all around!

ORIgMfwpYJltL45dyJIrZA.text: We went to Windsor during the first few weeks they were opened. Thank goodness for the free valet, because the place was packed!! Luckily, we got sat within 5 minutes because they people ahead of us preferred to stay at the bar. We sat in the patio area which was really nice and open.   Our server was really nice and on top of things. We got our drinks in a timely manner, and they weren't too expensive either! They have a pretty decent selection of wine and beer, of all price ranges.   Being that it was right after they opened, delays from the kitchen were to be expected. After waiting a decent amount of time (at least 20-30 min), we had not only our server, but also the manager and another employee, come up to us and apologize genuinely and profusely. I think it was worth the wait! I had the chicken sandwich with mac n cheese, which was absolutely delicious! My dad had the burger with okra, which was also quite yummy!  To top it off, because of the long wait, they comped our food! It was totally unnecessary, but definitely solidified that we'd return! Can't wait to try Churn next time!

9yP-U-J8hk6m6-8Qdqaliw.text: so. good.   i ordered the fish "banh mi" and... it was so freakin' good. whilst i do wish it was in a more traditional banh mi style bread (baguette vs round bun), it had the perfect amount of heat and i totally dug the interpretation. and the kale salad? o.m.gooooooodness. i know the mac and cheese is good and all... but you HAVE to get the kale salad. it is green perfection. and so good for your eyes!  the husband had the burger which was.... uhm, possibly the best burger i've had in arizona??? yeah. it was like that. juicy and perfectly cooked. with a side of church potatoes - what what???? that was like the ultimate comfort food meal right there. ULTIMATE. it was delectable.   bro got the porkwich... that much pig on a piece of bread honestly scares me... but it really truly worked. and i understood why people are fanatical about it. his side of mac and cheese? now THAT, my friends is a good m&c. it was cheeeeeeeeesy up the heezy, and no weird liquidy sauce, the pasta shape didn't put me off. i wanted to swim in that mac and cheese. ok, maybe not because that was a hottttt little dish, but... i really really really really loved it. and wanted to steal it and eat it all. now that i'm revisiting that experience, i dunno how i feel about that kale salad. i'm torn. i choose both.  my dad had the reuben, which to me is a man-which. it was decent, just not my flava.  my mom had either the brown bag chicken or the grilled chicken. i don't remember because my bro's gf had the other one. they were both good and i am not a big chicken sandwich fan. perhaps not phenomenal, but i would venture to say i might at some point be persuaded to order a chicken sandwich from here.   we had the deviled egg dip... the chips were good, but the dip was kinda forgettable.  service was amazing, the ambiance and decor... impeccable.   there are a lot of new pretentious phx area eateries that are similar to this one... all in all, windsor is at the top.  valet is free... or you can park on the street a little further past the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deviled egg dip w chips
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White fish banh mi w chopped kale salad (tasty tasty)
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Windsor burger w church potatoes (droooooool)

JAb7BmXSDEblXiHYd4opcQ.text: I came here about a month ago, just randomly on a weekend, because we were looking for a decent breakfast/brunch place. Luckily, this place was listed in my bookmarks. The food menu is not huge but it covers the ground in terms of variety. Their beverage list actually seemed longer.  Anyways, we ordered the deviled egg dip and chips and Russian roulette for appetizers. The dip was amazing and the mix of peppers in the russian roulette were great. I suggest taking a small bit to test the peppers if you're not sure. For entree, we ordered the Veggie Stack and  Porkwich. Again, another hit and the veggie stack was a pleasant surprised...it was relatively healthy and tasty. We had a few of the sides but the only one I remember is the mac n' cheese. If you come here, GET IT! It is some of the best mac n' cheese I've had in a long time.  For dessert, you can just head next door to Churn with is an old school ice-crean and candy shop.    The prices were on the reasonable/slightly expensive side. For the food and service, I will definitely be making a drive back to downtown PHX soon.

n2L9YLbPkcgrilFb6I77cg.text: If I remember correctly, all my times at the Windsor I would regale with utter pleasing song and dance. This is by far one of the stores I keep in my monthly rotation .   I usually visit during the HH time. Just cause it makes sense, due to there extended HH times it makes it very easy to visit during those time where my scheduled needs to be flexible.      The 5 times I have visited it was enjoyable. I cant say even think of a con worthy of noting.   Well Done Windsor.  NOte: If you are reading  a grip of reviews, I am sure you noticed the parking here is for the diligent and patient. Good luck trying to find a parking spot in the parking lot.  This only adds to the persevered intimacy and inclusiveness.

AYwArOeZ8IO-k8Gxk4O7MA.text: Today was my second Windsor experience - I'm still not impressed. I'm gluten-intolerant so I researched the menu before I my lunch date. I was really bummed that the item I selected based on seeing their menu on their website was no longer on their menu. I was again unimpressed by the server's knowledge of what is/isn't gluten-free on the menu. I ended up getting the mixed grain salad (quinoa only) and it was just ok. I appreciated the ambiance and misters on their patio.

E7xGQvg1H-qihQFQ9OdzFg.text: I brought my husband and sister here for lunch... Food was superb and service was excellent.  Will definitely return.

HN-YxZ3bcAmD7ctQnr_Diw.text: Stopped in on a Saturday last week, I was surprised that there was no valet stand, but still plenty of parking. We walked in and were seated right away.   We both had the Pulled Pork with the Gold Sauce which was really amazing. Our server was very attentive and friendly.  I ordered a hefeweizen to go with the sandwich, and had a small pitcher returned to the table instead. Turns out it was happy hour and it was only $5 for about 3 pints.   Not bad at all. Went next door to churn and got some ice cream afterwards. Very well done experience as usual.

AnvHcIYBaVHosMwyu_Y96Q.text: Not bad....  Think Postino's, Vig, Tuck Shop, and St. Francis in terms of design, ambience, parking, and lighting.  The Windsor's menu is a little different and considerably more sandwich-oriented than the foregoing restaurants, and the servers are a tad more 'edgy' looking, but the Windsor can more or less stand as a lunchtime equal with them.  But I did suffer with a rather serious problem during my visit - strictly related to the food itself.  I ordered the Crab BLT, an intriguing idea on paper, and a very attractive plate once it is set before your eyes.  I selected Jo Church's potatoes as my side dish.  My wife ordered the Schreiner's sausage with cole slaw.  The good:  The Schreiner's sausage was amazingly flavorful and quite well dressed with peppers and the like.  The thick 'Tenderbelly Bacon' crumbled throughout my Crab BLT was perfectly cooked with a slight char.  And the BUNS, oh those delicious toasted, buttered buns!!!  The not-so-good:  They seemed to really just phone-it-in on the side dishes.  The cole slaw my wife ordered seemed right out of a Basha's bag or something in terms of appearance and flavor, and the Jo Church's potatoes (creamy, shredded hash browns) were cold, undercooked, and underseasoned.  Indeed, the potatoes were on the threshold of being simply "bad and bland" which is quite a sad feat considering the taters looked so good.  Also, the music did seem a tad bit on the loud side for a place like this.  The downright FOUL:  I can't help it, I wish I didn't have to say it, but I do....the crab in my crab cakes was absolutely, positively foul.  It was well breaded, well cooked, and well seasoned, so the fault did not lie in the execution, but rather in the senile old grandpa of a crab they used for my cakes.  For such a flaw to be so apparent in what is supposed to be the star of my dish, I must issue the dreaded punitive star rating.  :(   I suspect I will be revising this review in the future, and in an upward direction in terms of stars.  There was quite a bit of good things in the air and on the plate that warrants a second visit, and if I order just right, I suspect I will come away with a very happy, four star experience.

4ZgyoTHMnMuX_cE4yNcz_A.text: Love love love their food! I have gone there twice and had great service and great food. Once we ate there and the second time chose to do take away.  I would recommend them to anyone!

Ccv3xm_uLfJpjUbRVi41_g.text: I love the beer selection, the service is great, and it's a beautiful spot.  On a mild Phoenix day when they have all the sliding doors opened up its a great place to hang out.  The happy hour isn't bad either.  That being said the food just seems "meh" so far.  I just can't really get into it.  I've been there a few times and I'll probably keep going back but I haven't found anything yet that I just can't wait to bite into.

DfQZYL0JRXkscoqRTVDkKQ.text: My husband & I decided to meet for a late lunch at Windsor. After finally deciding on one of several doors to enter the restaurant, the hostess led us into the dining area & told us to sit anywhere so we picked a table & then she immediately asked us to move to a small table in case a larger party were to come in. This was the start of less than stellar service. I had a grain salad which was delicious & my husband had a burger & a side of Mac n cheese that he emphatically declared were both really good. I didn't like the tag team approach for service. I will give it another chance though based on the quality of the food.

3e6xGD78mtKfohAoyEvmcQ.text: One word: Porkwich.  Okay, well, here's some more words, provided courtesy of The Oatmeal, "I will never forget you, porkwich. I will love you until the end of time. You are my oily pigflesh soulmate." Pair that porkwich (ham, bacon, and pulled pork with coleslaw and sauce on a yummy bun) with the perfectly seasoned mac and cheese, and add a $5 pitcher of Dogfish Head Ale (pitchers are $5 until 5 pm, and you get a little more than two full glasses), and you have a recipe for happiness. Or a heart attack.   I'm going with happiness.  I hadn't heard about the "rad" campaign, but it's funny that I used that word specifically to describe the environment. Well, it is pretty rad.  I'll be back!

4TqyWbovqmZl7WZl_WJOFg.text: Thought this place was OK but probably not something I'd rave about. Stopped here for lunch. Ordered the brown bag chicken sandwich - it was only OK, just not what I expected. Husband ordered the pulled pork sandwich which was really yummy.

hmdb_EmNPdeXcSYw9fuIHQ.text: I love Windsor style backyard burger with the side of Mac and cheese! Must have. Cool vibez

R9PvRRrOU-hrAcPpN9vReg.text: They have a large patio which is always welcome in Phoenix.  The food and drinks were decent but PRICE-Y.  I had 1 cocktail, a salad and my bill was around $30.00 (without tip).  Our waitress was rude and not very welcoming...we had a big table so she wouldn't split checks because they were "too busy" at that time of day...maybe that was her way of letting us know she was going to do automatic gratuity...which usually I'm cool with but if the service sux.....anyway..I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here again.  Oh and the happy hour ends REALLY early..like 5pm..don't complain about it because they get really defensive!

6a-RN1vFs4xoy8kaDjHMtw.text: This is THE neigborhood spot!  We love, love, love everything about it.  It's been open a year or so, and we already have those cozy warm feelings like it's our second home.  The cocktails, the fish sandwich, the peanut butter ice cream at Churn -- heaven everytime.  The staff is beautiful, yet unpretentious...a delightful combo!  As a side bonus, I stopped by last week and asked the manager if they might be interested in making a donation to our school's fundraiser.  I'm sure they get a million requests, and I was happy to get a call back 48 hours later that the gift was ready.  A great restaurant that also gives back to the community.  Bonus points!  Go, go, and go again.  If you live within a few miles, hop on a bike and cruise down.  Makes the peanut butter ice cream not so sinful. :)

cTYtOtp1aXi96D0RB6Ec6Q.text: Food as always was good but I got take out & not only did they not ask if I needed silverware, they didn't include anything. I am sitting in a class starving & don't feel like eating salad with my fingers then trying to type notes.

pODaGgfmlNO6k12WzXxnWQ.text: I really enjoyed a casual Sunday afternoon at Windsor.  Don't get downtown too often, but really enjoy their sister restaurant Postino across the street.  Someone finally let us know that Windsor is in the same family.  Specialty cocktails was the perfect way to start the meal.  No 29 for the lady, but No 63 is definitely a gentleman's drink.  Bourbon just warms the soul.   Was really happy with the overall quality of the meal.  The chicken sandwich and the Brown Bag Chicken sandwich were great. Fav sides were the Kale salad and Broccoli with aioli...sprinkled with parmesan cheese.  The interior has an warm cozy feeling...especially since x-mas is right around the corner.  The outdoor patio would be great in warmer weather.  Ordered a 2nd round of drinks and then walked thru the back hallway to grab some cookies from Churn.  Stolled back to the cushy booth to relax with my drink and sweet.  All in all only ran about $50 for 4 drinks and 2 meals.  Wish I lived closer!

DOeNj3fzKcj6sWIILycyAA.text: SERVICE: It was AMAZING! Emily our server was super nice and attentive. She even gave us four free scoops for Churn next door also since they don't serve dessert on the weekdays!  Food: We ordered the BBQ Ribs, Crab Cake Sandwich, and White Fish banh mi. We shared as a family of four and we were very full! Each dish came with a side. We got the Mac and cheese, sweet potato fries, and coleslaw. And I'd recommend getting all three!   A must stop if your from out of town!

mRz2Cl_O5pqT5VZDTR4FHw.text: I've been to Windsor a handful of times and feel like I can give it a fair review now.   Apps- We've ordered the Corn Dog Poppers and they were delicious. Breading to meat ratio were great and the dipping sauces were nice.  Entrees-  Our favorites are the ribs and picnic kebobs. The ribs are some of the best I've had in town. The BBQ sauce is more on the savory/spicy side and fall off the bone. The sides we like are fried Okra (YUM!), Mac N Cheese and French fries. The picnic kebobs are one of the "lighter" dinner options and healthiest. The kebobs come with a few dipping sauces, pita bread, and veggies. Meat is tender and has great flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork ribs, cheddar biscuit and your choice of side (I chose fried okra).

kB_KSH6SUvISbsR0Rndiog.text: First time in, and my wife and I were blown away! The cocktails were superb! I ordered the fresh fish of the day (scallops) and it was heavenly. My wife ordered the ribs and again absolute beauty. The ambiance is wonderful and our server Samantha was very attentive and awesome! She was always present and very friendly!   My only problem is I wish I could eat more and try more of their food!!

OKZoqqrG9LAE4RTnccvQPw.text: I brought a friend here from out of town and she enjoyed it! I love the vibe here -- trendy, hip but also relaxed and not too stuffy.   We ordered the deviled egg dip & chips and those were very tasty, a little rich but that didn't stop me from eating more! I ordered the porkwich with a side of mac n cheese -- definitely recommend them! Ohhh I want it right now just thinking about it. I'm a lightweight, so I prefer drinks on the sweeter side. No.17 is so good, so refreshing. If you love cucumber vodka, this is the move!   The best part about here too is that it's connected to Churn, perfect way to end the meal with ice cream! Great food, great service! Thinking about my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 17
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Porkwich with Mac &amp; Cheese

g_YCL0GmGAZb_GDv4FpfIQ.text: Amazing eggs, cocktails, biscuits and salsa. Cool atmosphere. A great Phoenix spot for sure!!

xeZii4iEi1pw5ZUzl7cLWA.text: Ok. This is not my usual go to place (pub, hamburger joint) but I saw it well reviewed and added it to my "Try These" Yelp bookmark group. I am so glad I did!  At age 60 I have just eaten the best sweet potato fries I have ever had. Crispy and perfectly seasoned. The veggie burger was super on a tall brioche bun. Got there @ 4:57 pm and they promised to give me the up-to-5pm Happy Hour prices. My Pimms cup ended up being a Pimms pitcher (admittedly lots of ice and lots of refreshing non-alcoholic mixers in with the Pimms. Definitely delighted I came!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4PliFZZUp1N2MV2gSRE9kg.text: One of my favorites in central Phoenix. Great place for drinks and brunch. You really can't beat $5 drinks/pitchers! Great atmosphere, slightly "hipster", but food and drinks are always great. Plus you can get dessert next door at Churn! 4 stars because the banh mi fish sandwich is mehh and the bread-to-crab cake ratio is off for the crab cake sandwich. The porkwich and rueben are both really good. You can also never go wrong the church potatoes and mac and cheese.

bYIxcoyl6ktgZmUI2faJYQ.text: A lot of good restaurants in Uptown, but this one is the best. The food is gastropub at its finest, everything is a subtle and unique twist on the classics. Best hamburger in town.  Great atmosphere.

YdSB-y0K6hL4dxGbneZPuQ.text: Finally had a evening at the Windsor.  Right from the start, the staff was very attentive and accommodating. We were told a 30 minute wait, but got seated right after grabbing a drink from the bar. Patio table for two! Excellent! The menu actually had several things we wanted to try, so we  will surely be back for more. Great ambiance, staff and food. My tomato soup was so fresh and flavorful. His pastrami Rueben was delish(so I was told:-) It's was a magical night!

Hg3Jpqxt3SZpM2lAzYWVdg.text: This is my weekend hotspot with all my friends. We love the friendly customer service and to die for tasty cocktails at dirt cheap prices. $5 pitchers of beer or pims and $5 cocktails, mind blowing!  I suggest going for brunch and be ready for a wait of 15-30 mins but worth it.

51J8GxS8nxrBsgJQY2c6YQ.text: A well established restaurant. Have a beer and burger or chicken sandwich? This is the place to be. And nice service too

4qtWKw_vpN4_PU9nnMnlvQ.text: Love love this quant place!! Food is phenomenal! Drinks are amazing!! Have been coming here for years and it never gets old!!! Support Local!

1UNk8dwm7Wc53k--JWDFQQ.text: Came by for brunch this morning. It was pretty busy and pouring rain so there was about a 45 minute wait. The service here was phenomenal. I'm always impressed when a restaurant is slammed and the server is able to keep their cool. The woman who helped us out today was just that. She was quick and efficient but was still able to give us quality attention. We were seated outside and like I said before it was pouring. She made a point to keep checking in on us to make sure we were comfortable and not getting wet.   We ordered the donut holes, simple life breakfast and biscuits and gravy. It was all delicious! The vanilla mascarpone that came with the donut holes was fantastic! My only complaint would be that the scrambled eggs were a bit dry. But I'm pretty picky about eggs. I was also given an Arnold Palmer to go as we were leaving which is a major bonus.   All in all, the restaurant has great parking, ambience, food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple Life, Donut Holes and Biscuits and Gravy
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vDW7ahujJ27idLqApV1_Sg.text: Pretty good we were in a rush, the burger was good and the fries were amazing!! Nice atmosphere and the server was very friendly. Definitely will return!

7paAkbUJGw_6ArFb_-JhfA.text: Food was great and the company I was with was great too.  The waiter we had was super slow and not attentive.  A friend of mine said he had the same waiter a week prior and it was the same.  Hmmmm.  I'd go back, but if it was crappy service three times in a row, I'd be super bummed.

TtzLHg4Qq34RWNOzjMnfbA.text: Great drink deals before 5pm, bartenders make the service and time there worth it. Highly recommend for a good vibe during lunch time

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best deal with the best food! Service at the bar was great! This place has a great vibe with indoor and outdoor seating.

295iEE-AQl4_CM8jxKesmg.text: From the moment you walk in the door and sit down they are on it. They are super nice and extremely attentive. Their main objective is to make sure that you are served and appreciated. The nearest thing I've experienced to this is the Ritz-Carlton

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-FgC4HjsQRN6TCrUazSNDA.text: It was my first time going last night and I will definitely be back sometime soon! It was a great first experience.  We went around 8pm and there was a short wait so we went the bar and had a cocktail. Shortly after we got our drinks and they were awesome. We sat at our table and was quickly greeted. Our server gave us time to look over the menu and we ordered. I had the rueben and it was so good I'll be having it next time. Awesome atmosphere, friendly employees, great food and a good time. I'll definitely be returning. I had a number 22 to drink and I would suggest it to drink. I'll be returning in the near future to try more of their burgers.

TBo3KXmcA1qT3iB6ngfRIw.text: I came here about a year ago for brunch after the Pride half marathon (okay, I only did the 10K, but moving on...) and remember really liking it. I finally made if back for dinner, and loved it!  Both times I was here the patio (which seems to be popular) was packed so the groups I was with sat inside. I don't remember much about the brunch service, but our waiter for dinner was excellent. He was friendly and knew the menu well.   I got the grilled chicken sandwich w/mango relish and it was so good! The chicken was juicy & tender. For a side, I got whatever they call the cheesy hashbrown thing. Again, yummy (if you couldn't tell just by the sound of it). Everyone else I was with seemed happy with there meals as well. I had a couple bites of my mom's Reuben (and I normally don't like Reuben's) and it was delicious. The sauerkraut on it is not slimy & moist (which I find most sauerkrauts to be, which is why I don't like it). It's drier (in a good way) so the bread & meat taste dry (again, in a good way) as well.  I also love the beer HH special that they have here. $5 for a pitcher. It's actually a mini-ish pitcher, but it's for any beer on tap (we're not talking Bud Light) so it's a good deal. They also have an HH deal for wine and cocktails. Again, $5 & it's everyday until 5 pm. I'll be back.

Qu2I4LQoB-WwlnN-XOkL2w.text: Always great food and great atmosphere! Try the bloody Mary bar and you will not regret it! And go next-door to churn for dessert! They have fried okra that is amazing also

gX6aTu3EE8AAnnwzar_dIw.text: I went here on a Saturday for brunch at about 12pm. We had a party of 9 and they seated us within 40 min which was to be expected. They only take reservations 24 hours prior to the requested time so keep this in mind. We started off with a pitcher of beer ($5, approx. 2 1/2 glasses) and it was very good. We got the corn dog poppers and didn't care for those very much. As we waited for our table we sat at the bar and the staff were all very friendly and welcoming. Our lunch was very good. We all got something different and it was all very good. The patio is really nice to sit out on and definitely worth the wait. We will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch

1w8mQEwtZ2Qmbv3laGQC-w.text: This is a great place to eat and drink especially for happy hour! We had several drinks and all were great! We also had loaded chips which were tasty! The service was fantastic- it was a little chilly when we came and they brought out several heaters to keep us warm so we could still sit outside!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ks_a_5DEQlKpxuGgBd4Uzw.text: This place is awesome for lunch! From the hipster servers that do "community serving" to the aesthetics of the friendly "patio" outdoor & indoor feel, you'll enjoy your time at Windsor for both the food and the service. They have excellent mixed drinks and they have a top notch burger.   We enjoyed the cheddar fondue with pretzel, apples & sausage... which was so good. And then i ordered the backyard burger Windsor style with caramalized onions and the #23(? I think) drink - which is a refreshing vodka lemonade with a blackberry puree. Server told me it was a sweet drink but I wanted a cool refreshing lemonade so opted to have light puree in the drink (which they were more than happy to do). My second drink was inspired by the server - I wanted to not order a drink because I wanted to run to Churn for some ice cream but I also wanted to enjoy a bevy so he suggested and convinced me to enjoy a root beer float with a shot of Jameson and a scoop of Churn's bourbon nut ice cream and MAN did I ever enjoy that!!!!! The rootbeer was top shelf and the icrecream complimented by the Jameson was simply delectable.   Do try the Mac & cheese as your side, it will have you licking the plate - as they claim you'll need to do on their website!

6kLtgnV9BeLuvd_loadDKQ.text: Talk about a great experience all around! The service was impeccable from the minute you walk in. A handful of staff came by our table to greet, ask if we had questions, and refill our drinks whenever they looked low. The manager was on top of things as well. While ordering a Pink Gauva  Funk Sour by Prairie Artisan Ales, it was VERY tough to chose our meals. Every dish looks delicious and like a potential next meal. I went for the Crab Cake Sandwich w/ Sweet Potato Fries and the Mixed Green Salad. Phenomenal! Their Happy Hour is quite ridiculous as a Pitcher of Beer goes for $5 and $1 off their drinks throughout the afternoon. Great ambiance, Delicious Food, Personable Staff. A must try in this hip neighborhood in Downtown Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prairie Artisan Ales- Pink Guava Funk
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 22
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed Green Salad

en4oXaUjeDW2uDzdVPWFLw.text: My spot for 5$ signature drinks before 5pm ummm yesss please and thank you... Fried okra amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami yummm

ghwwcVEwj04FdBXMvVq4hw.text: Great place near downtown Phoenix. Waiter was friendly and quick. Menu has great food and drink options. I had a side of fries and wings. The wings are only served Friday through Sunday. They were huge, spicy and tasty. Wife enjoyed her veggie burger and friend enjoyed her ahi tuna dish. Also, there's a huge bar and patio seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried okra
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie burger
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie burger and fries okra

J9U-HhWZwa7r0d19pLqVZQ.text: GREAT STAFF, friendly, help-full.... Great Food - my GF had the "Porkwich" ...she's picky....'very tasty'. I tried the Grilled Chicken Sandwich for first try....great flavor.  Music a bit loud...if you want to have a lunch conversation without straining to be heard....

ToUfwReNBtMhRCJYwH0dSw.text: Went it for my birthday and the food and service was delicious. It's my second time here and this time I ordered the ribs which I really enjoyed. Atmosphere was amazing and I love the vibes.

9KQT5838IwPunVxEPicMrQ.text: Trip 1 was INCREDIBLE... My wife and I dropped in on a whim and were absolutely floored by the vibe and decor of the place. Most importantly, and most impressively, was how much of a team the staff worked as... I honestly had no idea who our actual server was. While this is normally a bad thing, these guys just worked together on everything... drink orders were taken quick, a drink runner dropped them off, I think a manager took an app order... so on and so on... they literally never missed a beat. It was for that reason, along with the great food, that we tipped 50% of our bill.  The Bacon Cheeseburger - 5 stars Cheddar Jalapeno Cornbread - 4 stars Kale Caesar Salad with Salmon - 5 stars Mac n Cheese - 3 stars (good, but nothing exceptional)  As you can read in other posts... they have several craft drinks on the menu... I cannot recall which we had, but they were all quite tasty.  So... on to Trip 2... (literally 7 days later, don't judge) - this visit was also great, but either the staff was having an off night or maybe they were a little busier, it was a little bit later than our first visit. But the teamwork wasn't quite like it was during trip 1. It didn't hurt our view on the place enough to knock it down a star, but I guess it did take the "Windsor" out of my sails a bit (see what I did there? Lol).   Wife got the same Kale Caesar Salmon salad - 5 stars I got the grilled chicken sandwich... a little but of kick, very good - 4 stars Loaded potato skins - 3 stars (good, a little too crisp and inconsistent for my tastes)  We will definitely be back! (Maybe not the very next week this time, lol)

j6RY3oKuoo-pmZXtyb9aCg.text: Hills our server was amazing!!! Friendly, energetic, and great knowledge of the menu! She made our dining experience top notch!!! Her honesty and energy was contagious!!! We loved her!!!

7qukzTX4g5_1lDi4E09vMA.text: My favorite thing about the Windsor is the outdoor patio. It is an open concept and is in the same building as Churn ice cream - total plus. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable of their offerings. I typically enjoy the Berkeley Veggie Burger with a side of Sweet Potato fries...don't forget the ranch or the Veggie Stack did I mention the hummus and pickled beets are to die for?! If you get lucky and dine in on either Wednesday or Thursday you can grab Mick's Fish and Chips...don't skimp on the tartar sauce!  No matter what you will not be disappointed with your meal.

rF-wxBBcD1SzhySjqJcb_A.text: This place is amazing! We came in on Sunday to meet up with a friend for drinks and some snacks.   The decor and patio are beautiful on a nice day, you can easily spend a couple hours eating and drinking away. The $5 drinks are a steal with some really great cocktails.  Service was good, never seemed like we were waiting a long time for drinks or for someone to check on us.   The veggie burger can use some more flavor, the fries are thin and salty and perfect. They are such a big portion for the price!  Pretzel and cheese fondue is a fun/different appetizer, they were nice enough to let us sub pretzels for sausage.   Can't wait to come back and try more drinks. Also the ice cream next door is worth a stop over afterwards!

xJfdgwgk3q9t1rs7hUsWOA.text: What a find!  Honey did a search and it totally paid off!  $5 cocktails, which by the way were worth at least double that if not more!  Quality ingredients going in to their food and cocktails!  You his place is amazing and I'm sure we will be back!  Got the Matsdor for brunch with a few cocktails!  Great experience!  Friendly staff that make you feel at home!  So so stoked

pFtJM3eQdsZJNmHk_4daDw.text: Service is always great, whether dining in or to go everyone is so friendly and I can see works as a team. The food is excellent as well. Also such a nice vibe on the inside, definitely will be returning :)

ouS2LuR_r7eBqVD6dU1UnQ.text: Great happy hour & staff! I would highly recommend no 37 drink  ! Yummy food! I am definitely returning

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The matador ! Great happy hour !

Y9g8lz-_J0uXf945uju5RQ.text: Stopped in here for a quick bite with my wife and son.  My wife and I enjoyed a plate of sweet potato fries and a a couple beers - nice selection of local breweries.  Our son enjoyed the Backyard Burger Windsor Style and the only regret he had was having to share too many bites with me as it was delicious! I'd go back for this burger alone.  Love their menu and the creative selections being offered.

cv6ynMVDxG-5pUVfw77pfA.text: Every time I've gone the service and food has been great. The Seasonal peppers sauteed in lemon, olive oil, parmesan & sesame seeds, served with Harissa aioli, some are hot & some are not! It's called Russian Roulette. It's my favorite appetizer, it's great when you first got started with a couple of drinks during happy hour or if you're just sitting down for a nice meal. "Side note I've never had a super hot pepper". As for cocktails they have a nice selection I like the 17 and the 86, I lean towards the 86 more often because of my love for coconut.  I Didn't even know that coconut bourbon existed, It's delicious. It's a great spot to have brunch or to have that drink after a hard week at work. The outside patio is spacious and covered which is perfect for this time of the year.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 80&#39;s memories

3Q2xRjCzVLGY6xaTLycg-A.text: Ok, one of our favorite places.  Got happy hour pitcher price well after due to some lively banter!  Yay!   Great waitstaff obviously.     The good:   Above  The bad: the loaded chips.   Pedestrian.   (Confession---not a fan of carmalized onions which is the dominant flavor). Go with the fondue instead

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lovely people.  One anyway
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uEtKCZXJTRDD2S13ItH0AQ.text: I saw this place and vowed to give it a try, maybe bring my Daughter and grandkids (there is an affiliated ice cream shop right next door) and I got opportunity last week. The Windsor is as elegant as it's name without being overbearing. Indoor and outdoor seating with a horseshoe bar. Very comfortable, subdued lighting, dark earthy colors, perfect for a date or a business lunch. The airy patio is out back, shielded from the noise of Central Ave and Camelback. Ample parking, very friendly staff, full bar with a nice selection of craft beers. I was with a close friend and restauranteur, we had a lot of stops to make that day so I ordered a Coffee Brown brewed by The Shop Beer Co. It was correct in every sense. Our appetizer was grilled chilies that came with a nice dipping sauce, these were salted, some mild some spicy. I love chilies and this worked for me! We split a Crab Sandwich and the barkeep recommended their, I'm going to say string potatoes in cheddar cheese and sour cream? These were excellent! The crab sandwich had something crunchy in it, walnuts perhaps? Not sure but dang it was good! I'd highly recommend The Windsor and believe you should give it a try! On the east side of Central just north of Camelback, right next to The Churn ice cream shop

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Churn ice cream shop next door
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Chilies

5FZOfY-eLNs2J9Y-mVfbAA.text: So we come to the Windsor a few times a year. The food and atmosphere are always outstanding. Today was no exception.  Today I ordered the Mac n Cheese. Somehow it left the kitchen Luke warm. However, when the waitress checked on us I refused to let her take it from me!!! Even warm, this was the best M&C I've ever had!!!

Fz7AFnhu83wlf0Hw2L0JkQ.text: Huge fan of Windsor and the atmosphere it has created! For happy hour they have $5 pitchers of beer which is a plus for me because I love beer! During Arizona's nice weather they do open the windows and patio doors to let that fresh AZ air come in. The recently opened up the parking lot next door so no more crowded parking or having to park valet.

UGoARXXVCpeCOkr573tQTw.text: After a few more trips to Windsor, I have to say that I am a serious fan. Yes, the ambiance and decor continue to be wonderful. The service is always great. After sampling a few more eats in Phoenix, I had to bump Windsor up to a 5 for a few reasons:  1. Whoever runs the bar is amazing, because the taps are impeccably clean as evidenced by the fact that any beer you have at Windsor tastes better than pretty much anywhere else you get can get the same draft. Definitely makes for a nice dining experience, especially when you're having $5 pitchers during happy hour.  2. Amazing brunch, with a simple but sufficient menu. The Matador is great, and the accompanying salsa verde brings your tastebuds pretty close to heaven. The chef poaches eggs perfectly. And bloody mary bar: need I say more?  3. Anyone who can make kale taste this good is a hero. Mac&cheese is wonderful without feeling too heavy/greasy/depressing. Fries are yummy, too, which isn't always the case at nice restaurants.  4. Wonderful, large, shaded patio with comfortable seating that has large heaters to warm you up during the cool weather.

8WRIrOWt3f-huq9H01y7vQ.text: Parking is a nightmare!!!!! If you can ride a bike or walk, do! That said, the cocktails are very tasty and they have a menu full of interesting bourbons. The place is great for going and sitting with an old friend or a lady for drinks. The patio seating is very cool, lots of fires and festival lights. The food for the price is only okay, i wish it was either better or cheaper by a few bucks (both would be great, but this is the real world). I've had a few decent burgers and sandwiches but they are on the small side and will not "wow" you. The beer selection could be bigger but the beers I've had all very tasty.  Huge bonus: next door to the place is churn! Delicious, possibly life changing ice cream. You should definitely go there afterward.

LIbSdpnZmfco1moGAs9WyA.text: I know everybody loves this place and it does have a nice charm. I really appreciated that in December they were not playing Christmas music during my meal! I have eaten here a few times and while I enjoy my meal for me it's nothing spectacular. Even the loaded chips everyone recommended were only so so to me. The menu does have a variety of unique choices which is worth giving a try and I'm sure I will be back with friends again but this is not someplace that I would pick on my own.

Y_Muxmvki2C0vR3V9AYJyQ.text: Not sure if I'm actually sold on this place, and I really really wanted to be! Had the short rib which itself was pretty good, but the vegetables underneath it were just kind of weird and inconsistent - cubed/chopped and some seemed undercooked. Also had the deviled egg dip (which was yummy and such an awesome concept but could have done with a few more chips for dipping) and the corn dog poppers. Corn dog poppers were not so great, you wanted to bite it in half at least but the casing on the dog was too tough - not the best :(  Service and atmosphere were wicked and the music was AWESOME. We shazamed nearly every song.

kmIfKkZlBcHpNEgYE52JSg.text: Came on a Saturday night. The place is popular but you don't have to wait hours for a table. My wife had a Number 17, and it was refreshing. We ordered the picnic kabob, the classic burger, and the ceviche appetizer.  The ceviche was pretty tasty, and not your usual citrus blend of lime, onions and fish mush. The flavors were balanced and the seafood was fresh.  I had the burger, medium, and it was one of the best burgers I've had in Phoenix. It loses points because of the fries, which reminded me of McDonalds fries. My wife had the kabob, which she enjoyed thoroughly.  The service was attentive and quick, though it bordered on "hurry, eat, and free up the table."  Overall, I'd say this place has good food and a great vibe.

7OiSmoaYKyBnLFiGScGUug.text: Great happy hour, good service. Strangely they ran out of wine glasses on Friday night and took quite awhile to get a clean one. Super kid friendly and the ice cream next door is to die for. Fun place.

zVQMZJXJ8tWw4e-0fh38gg.text: Ah, our first trip to Windsor. Let me tell you it was an exhilarating moment filled with sunshine, rainbows, ponies, and joy.  My boyfriend and I discovered Windsor recently and decided we just had to try their brunch. We enjoyed The Matador (foodgasm) and the Steel Cut Oatmeal. The perfect savory meets sweet meal for two! My taste buds could dance all day. I enjoyed a warm soy latte while my man ordered a cocktail and of course, nothing short of delicious.  It was a Sunday morning so we expected it to be crazy busy but to our surprise it was slower, we didn't have to wait, and our food came out quickly. Not too shabby for our first visit. And the service was just dandy too.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Earl Grey hot tea.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes to Windsor.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I won. Thanks Windsor!

Zob3Fx7UMbmeaeZXlTmnKw.text: While the presentation can be impressive at first sight, the food leaves a lot to be desired.   It was my first time at the Windsor, went in on a Sunday afternoon looking for some respite from the heat. The darkened interior was very inviting and the crowd was lively. We sat in a booth and were quickly asked if we had been helped. Speaking of just the service alone, it was absolutely 5 stars. It's the food that takes the Windsor down a couple pegs.  First we ordered the ceviche. Seemed standard enough, hard to mess something up like a simple ceviche. Somehow, the kitchen brought out a sort of "deconstructed" ceviche, just completely the opposite of what a traditional ceviche would be. If you've ever had Mexican Mariscos, you'll remember that it will sometimes be on the spicier side, completely drowning in Clamato. This ceviche just screamed "Overcomplicated", there's mango in it for fucks sake. Imagine it in layers; mango and some cucumbers on the bottom, shrimp placed on top, jalapeno(or possibly serrano) peppers above that, diced in such a way that instead of getting small bites of pepper, you would get a mouthful of pepper and just torch your taste buds. Then, avocado slices and cilantro meandering on top with no real use. Because the avocado was in slices, it was hard to get any of it in the ceviche, meaning you were eating it SEPERATE from the bite of ceviche. The chips as well were too thin. Crispy yes, just lacking in fortitude.  After that let-down, we split a chicken sandwich. I thought to myself "Spicy chicken sandwich, hard to fuck that up". Boy was I wrong. It was a juicy piece of chicken breast that was grilled instead of fried, that smelled fantastic and yet tasted completely bland. My nose was telling that it should be smokey and spicy yet my tongue was flabbergasted by the complete lack of flavor. It was served on a soft and toasted bun, filled with some fresh greens and I believe some house made mayo. For some reason though, this sandwich was the return of those dreaded mangos. There was a layer at the bottom that also lacked flavor and added nothing to the sandwich. It's not that the flavor was subtle, it was non-existent. I'm not one to suggest a change but I believe that if it was instead done as a crispy chicken breast, with peppers mixed in with the flour and then fried, we would have a much better sandwich. We ordered sweet potato fries as a side and after what I had experienced at that point, they were a pleasant surprise and were crispy and delicious.  Drinks on the other hand were just short of excellent. I had a Moscow Mule that was sweet and tangy, great drink to escape the heat. I just wish the food matched the quality of the drinks and the service. It's a shame because I live just a few blocks away and would love to take my friends there. For now, it looks like we'll go elsewhere for our dinner and drinks.

ESiWKCsIaoIktcqo_suWLw.text: Amazing food, my friend and I went there for brunch yesterday and both ordered the biscuit/gravy/sausage and we raved about it. Everything was good about this meal-the cheddar biscuit with the spicy sausage, runny eggs and perfect gravy. I'm already looking forward to the next time I go there.  Oh, and $5 drinks till 5pm, and also $5 pitcher of beer=amazing.   I loved the atmosphere, the outdoor patio was adorable. Definitely impressed.

DACBSdWs0rlv2hFeVjHtTw.text: We had a great experience at Windsor. Loved the atmosphere and the service was great as well. When trying a place for the first time I like to ask for a recommendation. The bartender suggested the #17 or #76. I really enjoyed the #76 which was similar to a blood orange margarita. He called it a "party drink" and I would have to agree. After 2 I was feeling a little toasty. We also tried a side of macaroni and cheese and a side of fried okra just as a small snack. The Mac n cheese was creamy and also baked with bread crumbs on top. Some of the best I've had in a while. My friend thought she didn't care for okra but found out having it friend was good, of course! It's fried!!! ;) would definitely like to come back for happy hour or a meal to try more items from their unique menu! Me

DUfqyEXYssVMNbsdVANVPA.text: Possibly the most incompetent bar staff in Phoenix. It's as if it's an inconvenience for them to get you another drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This guy was particularly useless....

oje-TdtLGbxriaf939rydg.text: We were seated right away in an awkward table in front of an entrance.  There was loud music, making it difficult to talk and for the waitress to hear me.  The "church potatoes" cheesy hashed brown casserole side definitely had onion it it despite what the server said, and some other things besides potatoes and cheese (I didn't dwell on it and just ate it).  She also didn't know what a hashed brown casserole was, which I found strange.  The potatoes were also cold, which was a big disappointment.  My bacon burger also was not served hot, and you could tell it had been cooking for a while.  It was perfectly cooked and very juicy though!  The sauce (worcestershire-based) was really good, though the bacon was extremely crispy (as in zero moisture left in it - still tasty though).  The bun wasn't that special, and should've been toasted, maybe with a bit of butter to crisp it up.  Dining companion liked his crab cake sandwich.  Our waters were kept full, and besides not knowing the menu as well as she should and getting our food out promptly so it was still hot, the waitress provided good service.  Overall, not bad, but food is served fresh and hot at Ingo's and Zinburger, so they need to step up their game.

dsOVDTVj3e2nggGtkycLMw.text: Went to the Windsor for the first time with some friends and the service, drinks and food were amazing! We had several waitresses that helped us throughout dinner and they all were super friendly. The wall of tapes they have is super cool. Even found a Pearl Jam tape on the wall! Highly recommended spot in central Phoenix!

vVIxId3H4dTIHwoDJR8AWA.text: What's a hungry girl to do after a long night a work?  Most of us in the industry get to the point where we crave variety which makes us venture out into our neighborhoods to see what everyone else is offering.  I found myself on the quirky Windsor patio this past weekend.  It was around 10 pm, we were seated and greeted by our server very promptly.  The patio itself is in the round.  Plush intimate booths surround by what I refer to as "card tables" and plaid backed chairs that remind me a little of 1960's kitsch poker.  Very cute.  Reminds me of my grandmother's basement and I mean this as a whole hearted compliment.  We are brought water.  My glass had a chip on the rim.  No big deal. It was replaced immediately with the right tone and amount of sincerity from our server.  I ordered the lobster roll.  No skimping on the good stuff.  It's mayonnaise based (not too much), hints of tarragon, red bell pepper and the snap of celery and the obligatory shredded lettuce.  Served on a "hot dog" styled bun.  Just the way it should be and as I remember from the east coast.  One suggestion.  The bun is a just a little too thick.    My friend ordered the ribs.  He was very happy.  The bones were spaced well.  Meaning, an abundance of meat. Pork ribs are sometimes dicey.  You're taking a risk ordering them because in the United States, there is no grading system for pork like there is for beef, ie, select, choice and prime.  I wish America would adopt the European pork grading system.  I digress.  These people obviously care about their suppliers and the quality.    I can't wait to come back and try more!  Keep it up, Windsor!

o2id3NAL-Ff-4fu8zt5MXg.text: Great food. TERRIBLE service. Not so busy as couldn't get first beverage after asking 3 times. Ugh. Lucky not in hurry but still...paying customer who likes to tip well when service is good. Not tonight

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cebrating GCU graduation

v7mo-t1FXNlVA8OVJU47rg.text: My go to Central Phoenix hangout, Windsor has not disappointed. I love the decor, the crowd, the super friendly and professional staff and the #17! A cucumber, green tea and mint cocktail. I get one almost every time I visit...and I always try to visit during their half priced happy hours that go until 5pm, even on Saturdays. For a week night, it is kind of an odd ending time for a happy hour...no post work specials if you're working a 9-5.   I've only eaten here a couple times, and the last time I had the mac and cheese side dish. I'm a sucker for mac and cheese when I see it on any moderate to upscale menu. It was heavenly! Creamy, topped with bread crumbs and finished in the oven for a nice 'crust'.   I will continue to be a patron and every time I introduce friends to what Central Phoenix has to offer, Windsor is at the top of the list.

EArgjENTXCAlR3djhrQXxQ.text: I feel like my husband and I are the only ones who don't understand Windsor!? We had super high hopes! We came on a whim one night because we have been wanting to try it and we loveeee Upward Projects, so why not!? I ordered the brown bag chicken salad sandwich, the chicken salad needed salt and the chicken was chewy and dry. The goat cheese overwhelmed the entire thing, I ended up wiping most of it off because to was all that I could taste. My husband ordered the fried chicken which is supposed to be amazing and it tasted like straight oil. The cheddar fondue was good, but I would rather have the fondue from Culinary Dropout or Citizen's Public House. Maybe we just ordered wrong? We will probably give it another shot, but with super low expectations. I will say the staff was amazing! Our waiter was so nice and our glasses were never empty.

LvADPCgoxqycKNM05W6ZPQ.text: So awesome!  Amazing food, creative recipes, great atmosphere good music.  Take server recommendations!

2BgPL-qA_EB6q3qu6oOBbw.text: Amazing drinks made with fresh and unique ingredients. Love the fondue platter--it's the perfect Sunday Funday!!

Lb8HFfilc9oqpYUCl-JtgA.text: Decor: A- Food: A-  Service: B   My friend and I ended up at Windsor after another friend told me about it. You enter through the back patio seating area which is fun, not as crowded as you would think. We were told we would have about a fifteen minute wait, but the wait only ended up being five minutes which we appreciated. It took maybe 5-10 minutes for our waitress to greet us, a bit longer than usual but I didn't find that super distracting. We ordered the deviled egg dip to start- this thing was super cool. They deconstructed devils egg, and served it in a dish as a dip (they topped it with gorgonzola and bacon bits too!), with potato chips to dip in it; I was super impressed with the creativity. For dinner I had the market fish (it was salmon), smothered in a tomato based sauce, with jasmine rice on the side. The fish was cooked very well, buttery on the inside, and nice thick skin. The presentation of the food was average, it didn't add or detract from the meal. My friend had the caesar salad with chicken. She said the salad was average, but the chicken came on skewers almost shaped like shrimp, I thought it was neat.   This place was good, I would definitely recommend it to someone, but I don't know if I would return. Not because it was bad, but because I personally would classify it as a "one and done" type of place.

wfz9Z7F64rBx7gcyKfoZFg.text: I love getting the kabobs but honestly everything here is delicious. It keeps me coming back. The staff is not always friendly and sometimes it can take forever to see them again. I thought it was just because it was a newer place when I first went but it happens often. Regardless, it isn't enough to keep me away, still love this place!

z2suoZQU0A75HOzT1FIDXw.text: Had a nice happy hour at Windsor.  Parking was a cinch, good food and drink specials for happy hour, attentive & friendly service and a cool atmosphere.  I didn't eat anything, but I will definitely be back to try more that Windsor has to offer!

rAW3S_TIo_fnZq_R41BYjw.text: We went to have dinner on Tuesday nights, for their buttermilk fried chicken. It was amazing. We will definitely be going back, I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

62kelu6GkTpyVOguos5O2A.text: The fish sandwich is amazing!  Great cocktails and a good beer selection.

zmigQUDfL3j38rZLVv_llw.text: I was invited here for a birthday get together on a Sunday at 6 PM. They had reserved a long table near the front of the restaurant and there were about 20 of us. Now I know how hard it is on a server to deal with a table with 20 people who don't all arrive at the same time, but it seems that those of us who got there a little late (about 10 or 15 minutes) were pretty much ignored until the first round of drinks were done and they were ordering food. THEN the rest of us ordered our drinks...and food. The food was OK, I had the loaded chips (which had a lot more chips than the 'loaded' part) and a glass of wine. Others in the party had burgers etc that looked pretty good.  We were all told by the host to bring cash as they only would provide one check (which is totally understandable) but I was not prepared for the valet parking, so I needed to break a 20. Oh my gosh, you would think I was asking for the moon....the server was so put out.  The place was full and very very noisy. It was almost impossible to talk to anyone in the party who wasn't sitting right next to you. I think if I went back, I would go with a smaller party and sit in one of the leather booths along the side.

fx0u1Z7Br7tT4-BgkU_qGw.text: Every time we come to Windsor, we leave satisfied.  Good food, good service, great atmosphere.  This place is still the bomb.

tMQnr7fcw3Kk30uWwruogg.text: Have eaten brunch and dinner many times.  Food is good but I think sometime less is more with seasoning and combination of some dishes.  The vibe is great though.

XH_ZI9CgP2C9czMa8DkIxw.text: We had yelped Windsor's and thought we would give them a shot for breakfast.  The food appeared appealing online, but it was only alright.  My son's bacon was charred and my husbands asked for a few more min to order she never came back until everyone else's order was delivered, coffee wasn't refilled until I asked, and there were flies (gross).  We will never go back and never recommend Windsors.

mMP6ycLAI8ZAW7JndXIRug.text: I just ate at Windsor for the first time. I have been going to Churn on the other side for a while and I love it. Wish I could say the same for this place. The ambience is ok. kind of a hipster vibe. The service staff was very friendly. My issue was with the food. I brought my 4 year old during lunch time and we were seated right away. They had a kids menu which was great. Decent choices and great price. She got the corn dogs with mac and cheese and fresh fruit and lemonade. The lemonade was super sour. Not something a kid would enjoy or an adult to be honest. Her mac and cheese tasted really weird/bad and she didnt eat it so it must have been really bad cuz the kid would eat just about any mac n cheese as long as it was made simply. Fancy mac n cheese isnt her thing. She liked the corn dog nuggets and the fruit was pretty basic but tasted good. I got the crab cake blt on a bed of lettuce (no bread). The crab cakes were bland and cold. I also got the kale salad which I didn't like but that may be that I barely tolerate kale on a good day and was forcing myself to eat my daily dose of greens. Overall, I might be persuaded to come back to try something else on the menu but I think I'll just stick with going to Churn or maybe meeting friends at Windsor for happy hour or apps.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn dog nuggets and Mac n cheese side
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab cake blt (no bun) and lake salad

2lUGlkIcJy9QJTtFpp2iEw.text: It is a new lounge. I not impressed by the special drink menu   The food is great and of course the ladies that were eating are Phoenix sexiest.  So if u like food and beautiful people. I would check it out  Sound Propagation gives it's stamp of approval

SDhkauzvseGOM0y6clT45g.text: I came here for my friend's birthday last night. I've actually been here a lot, but I've finally decided it's time to commit to a yelp review. This place is adorable - the wait staff are often dressed like someone plucked them out of the 1920's. Last night I had the Cheddar Fondue: it's a white cheddar with warm pretzel pieces, sausage, and apple slices...it was pretty tasty, I'd definitely recommend it. They also have a cassette tape lined wall near the bathroom (they collected a bunch of cassette tapes from the community when they first opened to make this decoration). It is pretty busy and bustling at night, but if you want a relaxed atmosphere - it's not too crowded and is delightful during the day.

3-yjteZQwrFD4E5-pUvpkQ.text: Be prepared to be WOW'd! Windsor is one of the best spots in Phoenix if you are looking for amazing food, great drinks, awesome atmosphere, and possibly the best staff there is.   It is great for date night, or just getting together with friends! The overall experience for me was one of the best there is.  I had the pork sandwich and it was more than enough food and was so good. My friends both got salads and they absolutely loved them.   I think that one thing that sets Windsor over most other spots in Phoenix is the staff! Like Postino before it, Windsor's staff is awesome and make you feel like part of the family the second you walk in the door!   I have and will continue to send people to Windsor! So far every person I have told to go there has text or called me the next day thanking me because they loved it so much!   Go... you won't regret it!

sW1hQnn3_hShh4gOFvMhMg.text: My new favorite hip spot. You cant get better than Windsor.

LsQlPa3GO-3q1hseZpf2lA.text: They offer weekend brunch now!!!!  Donut holes, eggs benedict, biscuits and gravy.  Life at the Windsor is lovely.

JpwE8-Zpzo-pIwFZguD0zQ.text: Such a cool, cozy place to hang out with friends and have some drinks.  They're food is rather tasty and the staff is super hip with a bit of a 'tude.    We ordered the Loaded Chips as an appetizer and I couldn't pry myself away from them.  They were too die for!  I ordered the Crab Cake BLT with a side of Mac n' Cheese and it did not disappoint.    Someone at the table had a side of Charlie Potatoes and they blew me away.  They are pretty much handmade au grautin cheesey potatoes and they are the tastiest things I have ever had in my life.

qufnYozF06CB-9ItT5lD0A.text: Wow.  I am not a fan of casual bar type restaurants yet this place completely won me over.  From the impeccable service to the fabulous food, all of us had a wonderful time.  I HIGHLY recommend the Mixed Grain Salad.  I was worried it sounded "too healthy" for my tastes but, luckily we had the world's best waitress and she recommended I get the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and to have the Mixed Grain Salad as the side. MMMMMM!  The sandwich was really good but the salad was OMG out of this world!  Next time I will just get the salad.  Everyone loved their meals and the atmosphere was so relaxed.  Fabulous time and will definitely be back!

mSPRo9p94tlJN8x3JaRS6A.text: I eat here often. It's usually pretty good service and has a great patio. We especially like the Ruben, it's possibly the best Ruben in town.  They always have great veggies for a side. The kale salad is awesomely delicious depending on who is back there in the kitchen. The consistency of the food is my only complaint. The fondue appetizer is yummy but I am a sucker for hot pretzels. It's one of my favorite places to go and they have a great happy hour.

7yWIy0hgpMtlRivW12pz3w.text: Since they dropped the bean salad and scallops as well as decreased the sizes of the sandwiches, I've had to drop my review from 5 to 4 stars. Still good food and atmosphere but not as great as the first year it was open. They must have had a kitchen manager change towards the end of last year as that's when these changes took place and the food dropped in quality.

KIoLVX_zOYF7futP8IeJDA.text: Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich!  Thats all I have to say!!

_-mV6qM77c2kDaODi8gwIQ.text: This place is great!  I have eaten here twice and have not been disappointed.  The bbq sandwich with pork belly meat is amazing and the hamburger was juicy.  The service is also awesome.  I love their wall of old school tapes.  Plus, it helps you can get fresh ice cream at Churn next door.

R4sNRRRsotXvi3lTkIIdqQ.text: My hubby took me here for my birthday this year.  We are huge fans of Postino Arcadia and didn't even know this place existed until a friend raved about it.  Decided to eat dinner at the bar, it gave off such a good vibe.  Bar service was excellent and the mojitos were very good.  The portion sizes looked big so we split the Banh Mi whitefish sandwich with a kale salad on the side.  Delicious!  Still hungry so we ordered the fried okra with ranch on the side.  It was just ok.  I did hear the side of mac n cheese is the best so I'll have to try that next time!    Really decadent salted peanut butter ice cream for dessert next door at Churn.  Solid good food in a relaxed, hip atmosphere (check out their wall of cassette tapes...I found Night Ranger and the Flashdance soundtrack).  Can't wait to go back!

sr0SLBUC3IUTVu0VoQJobg.text: I love this place! The atmosphere is beautiful, trendy and comfortable. The food was incredible! I had the crab cake sandwich with the Kale salad as a side. The Blackberry gin drink was amazing. Love the swizzle stick with the blackberrry skirt. Nice detail. There are many healthy offerings like a grain salad and fun sides for $3. The service was also wonderful. The waitress was very attentive during a busy lunch and moved the sun shade on the patio to make sure we were comfortable without even asking her to do so. I can't wait to go back and try more wonderful items and just relax in the fun atmosphere.

BfgV6Ntg1ThABVqd0ZyLOg.text: I've been here several times over the last year or more. I tend to order the ka-bobs or basically chicken and veggies on a stick meal. Once I find something great I tend to stick with it. I always order my favorite drink here. Most bars don't even know what a Tom Collins is let alone get the 150 year old long drink right, but they seem to get it spot on every time. Burgers are great and the outdoor patio is nice even during the summer. The inside of the building is cool, too, with the stained concrete floors, brick, exposed joists, etc. And check out the wall of cassette tapes on your way to the bathroom.

4Nx-T6qv_wdxszhkPdHE3Q.text: If you ever want a weekend brunch with good company, Windsor is the way to go. They have great Bloody Mary bars on the weekend and their food options are so reasonably priced! During the week, they have a great happy hour ($5 pitchers and cocktails). Their deviled egg dip is phenomenal and their pulled pork sandwich is a favorite.. I love the atmosphere this place provides and when you're finished with your amazing meal/drinks they have Churn right next door with lots of options for your sweet tooth!

xgjDddM99zCAIijyfyOwgQ.text: I have found a new place close to downtown to eat.  Great place to enjoy lunch and the $5 pitchers are a great enticer. If that does not get you down here maybe the great patio will get you here or the spacious bar.  I could see myself eating at the bar or one of the super comfortable booths. As for the eats....The backyard burger, Windsor style is on my list of must eat again, porkwich is a must eat all the time, and the mac and cheese is a great side.  I can't cook mac and cheese like that at home, nice crisp top of melted cheese and uber yummy cheese and pasta under neath.   The Windsor burger and piggy burger were great.  Just ask for extra napkins since you will look like a Carl's Jr commercial trying to scarf either burger down.  They are both messy, but I could not let the sauce and juice go to waste just dip the burger into the left overs on the plate. :)  Let me describe the porkwich please....  Pulled pork, belly braised ham, cold slaw, smoked bacon, and the yummy sweet gold sauce.  All this on a buttermilk bun which is soft and a great absorber of all that sauce and flavor.
