Get you eat on quick so the bun does not go soggy on you.   The backyard burger has a great garlic aioli, caramelized onions, sharp cheddar, and some iceberg shredded up to add some color.  This was a great burger and even though it is a must eat again I am really a fan of the porkwich.   My only downside is parking, really only a hand full of parking and then free valet.  Nothings free, I still gotta tip a guy that has to run down the street to get my car.  That's usually where your car will end up is down a side street adjacent to the restaurant.  I think the valet thing does fix the lack of parking problem and the food is so good it really is not that big of a deal.   If you are ever in the general vicinity of Windsor I suggest you give it a shot, great staff, great food, and great overall restaurant.

rK-RbmzQXR5m1rhaLzb-cA.text: This place is pretty small inside and generally crowded inside because of this.  The patio is GREAT, and I can only recommend Windsor for it's drinks and patio, unfortunately.  My biggest beef is that the service was awful 2 times and very average the other time!!  We had to have the chef (and i think he was the owner) help us the last time.  Our waitress actually disappeared completely.  Before she disappeared, we needed to call her over if she wasn't acting like we were invisible.  Also bad, is that the menu is basically a few sandwiches and burgers, unless you want ribs.  Both the chicken and crab sandwiches I've had are over-priced/ under-sized.  I went specifically for KING fried chicken on the one night they have it, and it was small, and just okay.

zPa6Y-Q1Uz4tHJ931uM77w.text: They did a great job remodeling that old building. The restaurant is built around a rectangular bar with comfy looking booths along the outer wall, and some tables up front. Behind the building is kind of like an open corridor space - across from which is a patio structure. They have a well-stocked full bar with 7 or 8 wines on "tap" and a whole bunch of craft beers. The menu is comprised of a few appetizers, salads and sandwiches, everything priced below $12 or so. Unfortunately for me I try to avoid carbs which means ordering a salad for dinner, not something I do often. I settled for the halibut sandwich - and took off the bun. The fish, fancy mayo and veggies were a perfect blend, fish was cooked perfectly...  BOTTOM LINE: I'll probably make a habit of drinking here and dining elsewhere

X4xMoGHlbM6DT2xZzd5MoQ.text: Zero complaints!  I'm 7 months pregnant and the bartender made me a super-fancy cucumber/ginger concoction so I could feel like I was part of coctail hour - seriously one of the best cocktails I've ever had, liquor or no liquor!  I HIGHLY recommend the brown bag chicken sandwich; the addition of hazelnuts and blue cheese absoultely makes it.  The mixed grain salad definitely lives up to the hype.  And Jo's Church Potatoes (we call these funeral potatoes or Mormon potatoes in Salt Lake) were to die for (haha, get it?  to DIE for?  Funeral potatoes?  never mind).    I can't wait to go back post-baby and try some of the fabulous boozy drinks!

OtCOcKxxojbQ-sm4_rZF-g.text: Another cool little spot to add to the checklist and one more reason that living downtown blows every other part of the valley away. I can successfully ride my cruiser to at least 20 different amazing little spots that have individuality and take pride in there product. Loss of a star due to the exceptionally loud music during lunch, but I was specifically trying to have a rather intimate conversation, so it could have seemed louder than it actually was. Brown bag chicken sammy was great and a great side of roasted veggies to go with. I also like to comment on the service if worthy. The bartender was exceptionally on point and friendly although I didn't catch his name.

vdVVU-lNsoyQUSL4LYFpbg.text: First impressions last, unfortunately for Windsor.   The parking. Yuck. Six cars deep waiting for valet, no thanks. Especially in a lot the size of a fat Circle K.  It was small enough that I didn't even bother trying, I just parked down the street (which I'm sure locals are just in love with already).    Then, while there are indeed like six doors to the place, none seem to be the main entrance. I finally just went in the one that was open, you know, right by the bathrooms. All of the ones along the 'front' are knuckle deep in people's tables so those are awkward.  Now on to trying to get a seat. My friend and I walked up to the bar. The overhead speaker was going to make conversation a pain in the head so we walked over to what looked like a waiter station. And then we stood there. Then we stood some more. I considered at one point calling them and asking if there was somebody who could come over and seat us. At least for my ego, after being seated, I noticed several other people walk up to doors, look in side, and then walk away, to finally wander inside and stand around looking for what to do next.    We were finally asked by a young lady, sitting with friends and food at the first booth, if we needed help. I thought it odd that a customer was asking us if we needed help and I thought maybe I should think of something funny to say because she's kinda cute and I wonder if she's trying to....oh wait, I think she works here?  It turned out it was the hostess who had been letting us stand there, three feet away, gawking like idiots while she hung out with friends, chatting and eating.   After asking if we should just seat ourselves or if there was somebody we were supposed to ask about it or if we were in the wrong place she grabbed us menus and nabbed us a table.   At this point, and I'm only on a passing fancy with snobbery, I was ready to write this place off. The initial experience was a 'if you can't figure us out, then you probably shouldn't be here' kind of thing. Not that it's rocket science but, seriously? If I have to *try* to get a table then next time I'm bringing my top hat and parrot.     Luckily for this place, once seated things got WAY better. Our waitress was happy, friendly, filled with information and suggestions, and made sure that I knew what was going on for happy hour. Win, win, win, thanks, and win. Things were looking up.    The happy hour specials are nice get off early, they don't last long.   The food was good. Not great, not knock your socks off, but a step up from the norm. The Russian Roulette Peppers (only one pepper in a dozen is predisposed for heat!) were a fun app, roasted and oiled.    I'm going to have to give the place another try. I truly did enjoy myself once I was entrenched. Both the experience of actually getting off my feet and the unfortunate too cool for my fixie Postino vibe should have been kept on lock down across the street but here's to hoping it grows on me more than the 'duce has.

a73f2f_tzd5CKU-gF-MC3w.text: I've eaten here three times and had an excellent experience each visit! Great food, nice staff. It's the perfect place to take an out-of-town guest to eat!

_xU8k8rhUQkOiGWjM-zAxQ.text: Always the perfect spot to get a hipster vibe, cool drinks, and an amazing vintage-industrial feel!  Windsor's food is killer and you can go healthy or severely unhealthy... Nice to have a choice in this regard!

CNRUyJEFxQqydFDhc-xFxA.text: The Windsor has very friendly, attentive staff. Very cozy for a date. The dim interior was not to hide any flaws but to enhance the romantic atmosphere . We started with the fondue appetizer which was pretty good - my husband loves his fondue . He ordered a greyhound from the bar and it was one of the best he has had; the grapefruit juice was very fresh. I ordered the pulled chicken sandwich.   It was absolutely delicious - would order it again. The bun was lightly toasted, the seasonings were great, and there were nuts in the mix which added a nice crunch.  My side was the vegetable which was squash in a brown butter sauce which was great. The Reuben sandwich was very creatively done using Emmentaler cheese;  the bun was the perfect accompaniment - lightly toasted, soft texture.  We will definitely visit this place again soon.

udqF1HsGZY0pYLPlg-PyoQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! Good food, Great Service, even better specialty cocktails. I've read several other reviews of Windsor and am SO sick of hearing people complain that "it's not Postino"...um hello, it's not supposed to be. Fun Fact, restaurateur's do occasionally open restaurants with different concepts, this isn't a cheesecake factory people!! The #29 cocktail is totally unexpected and I may have a small addiction going on, and I drool over the Fattoush Salad (ps, I add chicken and Skrimps :), yes Skrimps), and the vibe there is just so fun and laid back. All the servers couldn't be nicer, and my server last time, Lisa, was the best...on top of things, friendly, and FAST.  My new fav hang out, and no, no intervention necessary please!

bxNLJXA0DMTXeQy6qWORIQ.text: Cool restaurant with a great happy hour.  Tried the windsor burger which was cooked well on a delicious bun and a pitcher of beer ($5 during happy hour, ya you heard it right, $5 freaking dollars). Awesome place to hang out and grab a drink. Wish it wasnt valet parking bc i dont like others driving my baby

CssA4zUW-meLiXXjaSRE5Q.text: GREAT food GREAT service! Warm hip environment and comfort food for every taste. The ice cream is made fresh on premises! YUM!

BYvqS6KKtsabkgEvq7dNtQ.text: This place is wonderful -- great drink and food menu. Where to begin, the gin/blackberry drink with the naked lady swizzle stick was both tasty and entertaining (nice added detail with the stick).  The patio is great -- misters were a little heavy, but in a few weeks it won't matter! The crab cake BLT was delicious -- perfect amount of mustard remoulade. We also had the smorgasboard -- perfect amount of salty snacks before our meal -- loved the kale chips!  The laid back atmosphere and comfort food theme worked well for our date night. Would love to take friends for a happy hour soon!  Another hit for Craig DeMarco!

fJoY6zwpXprEUNoUWbFbcg.text: Still great, just wanted to say that if you sit at the bar, Roger makes the best drinks!!!

qwfXLfer47dvYu8xxvJLkw.text: My all time favorite restaurant in phoenix.  You can't go wrong at Windsor.  $5 before 5pm craft cocktails, pitchers of beer, and glasses of wine every day.  The food is top notch and prices are reasonable for the upscale vibe Windsor offers.  I have never encountered less than stellar service from anyone at Windsor.

Qv1oJMov_764HYFD0UEXQg.text: We've been to Windsor previously, but not since I had to go gluten free due to a health issue.  I called the restaurant to inquire about their GF options.  The hostess was very helpful.  When I asked if they had a GF menu, she said no, but if a guest requests a gluten free burger/sandwich, they recommend either bunless or a lettuce wrap.  I asked about their fries, and she informed me they are fried in a designated fryer.  I got the No. 17 (cucumber vodka [made from corn], green tea syrup, and mint).  It was different, but I enjoyed it.  My husband got the No. 63, which is what I really wanted, but couldn't have the HH bourbon they used.  He really enjoyed the drink.  We'll definitely be going back.

jaVkYe0gcA_oy-SImE0nqA.text: Had a pretty good experience here at Windsor. Started off with the corn dog poppers (tasty) and the shishito peppers (not bad).   Their fish and chips were really good as well. Would like to come back and try more things on the menu.

Me0PCg_rM9z2Y56edvvVug.text: Best burger I have ever experienced! Great with the fried okra side. Also a big fan of the $5 glasses of wine until 5pm.

dECwnWUNDeDiAX9WAdF6Vw.text: The Windsor is like, effective hipsterism.  They're the Red Hot Chili Peppers, circa 2006, of trendy restaurants.  Stadium Arcadium.  Been around for a hot minute.  Dress weird, yet alluring.  Not their first go around, and may not even be their best, but you'll explicitly love it.  A delicate dance of I don't care, and I care too much for being in a pool-tipping environment - relax, I'm no narc, I just observe thangs'.  Secrets safe with me...and anyone that reads this, but won't understand this.  Yeah...that random isn't just refilling your water for the eightieth time just to be so very extra, you amateur Yelp reader.  Cocktails?  Number 17 is my jam.  Girlfriend elects for the #04.  The brown bag chicken sandwich is stupid good.  Their burgers are ridiculous.  When I'm trying to pretend I'm even semi healthy, I like to get a good ten minute Tae-bo sweat in and get the kabobs after.  Their sides kill any other restaurants sides.  Between their always creative seasonal veg, their mac n' cheese, fried okra, and Jo's church potatoes?  Preach, and props.  The patio and inside are great, but you can't beat the chill bar-top at night.  Dope ambiance & music, perfectly timed service, consistently good food, and it's dim.  Not like, dark, but a comfortable dim.  Bright enough that you can't eye people all weird and get away with it, but dim enough that you can comfortably enjoy your interaction with whoever is with you and not feel like they can see your fat rolls.  I think this is the perfect balance when it comes to keeping freaks at bay.  Which brings me to my main reason for writing this.  So I'm here on date night with my girlfriend.  It's dim, we're chillin' on the far what I'd like to call the most north-west side of the bar-top.  We look over to the left, and what do we see?  To protect the innocent, we'll say Smelly Shelly.  There's a bit of history with this one, but we'll forego backstories.  Smelly Shelly is a total creeper that loves to prey on the weaker inhibitions of men like a succubus checking off her list as she watches some young frat boy drunkenly pee onto his own car tires.  She's a below the belt, no holds barred, wake up tied to bed posts with a glittery cheerio around your finger designating "until death do you part" kind of gal'.  Do you know how hard it is to keep a conversation entirely to the right of you, especially when you both naturally want to look around and judge everything?  It's horrible.  Developed a crick in my neck.  But, after multiple instances of accidental eye contact with Smelly Shelly via bathrooms trips (the hallway to the bathroom is covered with cassette tapes...beautifully hipster) and hush-hush side conversations with the bartender, Smelly Shelly eventually paid out and left with her next victim.  Turns out she tips bad.  Not surprised.  Shame.  Shame.  Five-star-loyal-A-B-A-B-B-B fatality Mortal Combat move with the 602 all day everyday on the real doe chico.  Shout out CyHi, good album bruh.  Shout out Hillary, great service and hair.  Shout out to that manager that chased us down the street one day to hook us up with dessert cuz' of that industry connect.  We appreciate you in the streets bruh.  Shout out to Lil Peep, rest in peace.  I had no idea who you were until you died, and I'd rather use this shout out for someone else, but as far as I know there weren't any other deaths today other than Charles Manson...and, well.  I'M OUTTY.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dope cocktails, we&#39;re suckers for big ice cubes with things frozen in them.  Grapefruit peels, lavender, embryos - anything.  So fun.

G7Jigge5SsP3M1PWmpLeSw.text: We did enjoy the food here, but I just wanted to give a shoutout to Hills for providing the BEST service!! She was friendly, fun, gave great recommendations, and split our check with no headache. :) Recommend!

-oLrLO3mod37yeprm-7FhA.text: I was excited to try this place due to the positive reviews but unfortunately I was disappointed. I tried the mini corn dogs and those are typically something I enjoy. However, these were fried was too long. I also ordered the country chop salad and that was just mediocre. The waiter was wonderful! I wouldn't return.

cEBdBjMPq6Ocd6Krye6cJw.text: Let me just say how electric and amazing this place is! The atmosphere is perfect whether your gracing on the outside patio or hanging at the bar! You cannot go wrong here. And when entering its like a total throwback of Tapes on the wall! From record your own, the Beatles you name it there's so much music that's there :-)  Ok! Let me just say the staff was great. Everyone was happy to help make our outing better. Everyone's a team player there. Oh and let me just say Anthony was truly amazing. He wasn't our actual waiter , but he definitely went the extra mile for is. From making us feel at home to making sure are order was just right! And that I thank you!   So the drinks were AAMMAaazing!!!!!! They were crafted to perfection and the price of only $5.00 each , you can't go wrong!  I loved all of them!!!!!! Oh and my Little mermaid that I got to take home with me.   INow to the food! Can I just say Perfection. I got the matador which was delicious. All the right mixes of flavors, and for you non egg people, the flavors of this mellow out the egg so I would give it a go!!!! Umm I could stay all day there !!!! They are def doing something right!!!  And the burger which my friend had(Windsor style) was Mmm good! Bon appetite !!! Juicy and so much flavor. And whatever there special sauce was I totally recommend it! I will be coming back for dinner as I Am eager to try out that menu'  A must go tucked away in the city that will leave making you smile! Full and satisfied   Cheers

Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pcItaU7DvVMWy-pHOW4Qww.text: My uncle got our huge party a reservation for brunch on New Year's Day. We were seated in a roomy, comfortable booth/table hybrid and out server met with us almost immediately for drink orders. Bloody Mary's were $5 and included a trip to the extras buffet, which featured marinated olives and spicy pastes. The coffee was pretty "meh," but flowed freely. Our food orders were taken, and the food started coming out before anyone could notice. I adored the Quinoa Oatmeal with vanilla Mascarpone, and my husband enjoyed the Cheddar Biscuits and Country Gravy. We also ordered a side of the pork belly bacon, which may or may not have been dipped in caramel. It was incredible.  Overall, a cozy and modern brunch/lunch spot with delicious food and friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A gorgeous accent wall.

ZJbjR7kgfTMap8TUL1Kf2w.text: Love this place!!!  Always very accommodating and go the extra mile! Bethany may have made an enemy with her kitchen crew but was very sweet in letting us order post brunch time, off the brunch menu.! And Rob is the shit. Impeccable bartender.   #extramilealltheway #comeonin #bestservice #bestpeople

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fVo5lht8cSjyk1yEaEMyhQ.text: As with most Upward Projects concepts, Windsor does not disappoint! The decor and patio are so fun and trendy. Be sure to check out the cassette wall next to the restrooms. Service was equally great. (We had a few laughs because some of the servers carry backpacks to hold menus, straws, etc.... This must be the new hipster thing.)  My coworkers and I came here for my birthday lunch on a Monday. It is such an awesome place and all of the food looked amazing. I ordered the Crab Cake BLT... Yes, it is just as delicious as it sounds. It comes with a side and I got to try fried okra. I highly recommend! It is coated in a batter similar to corn dogs. My only disappointment was that I didn't get to choose my free dessert because the server automatically brought out ice cream with whipped cream. I'm lactose intolerant so I couldn't eat it, but the table enjoyed!   I will definitely be back to sample other menu items and the dinner menu!

Zk8P5GVeEC5Vv4262r5Rbw.text: Babies & Puppies.. Who Knew? Came into town Sept 30-2 to visit our adorable 2 1/2 month Granddaughter & family. Coming from Spokane, it seemed sweltering hot.. My daughter-in-law knew the perfect Saturday Lunch spot for us.. When we arrived, Jet, the aim-to-please manager suggested a perfect outdoor spot.  When the Koala Infant seat holder was brought out I was so astonished I had to take a photo. They was another baby directly opposite us with the same kool car seat holder. Few booths down was a cute shitzu sitting quietly on the booth seat doing his favorite thing.."people-watching." Loved the small individual pitchers of beer, the food, the misters, the amazing service, the overall management & attention to details!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

63WVi2RFy-4iuvdzwNb_GQ.text: If you are looking for the best wings ever and like a bit of zing this is the place! All the food is super! I love the loaded chips. There is an eclectic mix on the menu and your servers are ALL there to make sure you are fed and never dry!  Stop by anytime. Weekend brunches have also been delightful. Really love the atmosphere the people and the food. What more can you ask for!?

IbxMbO3mxkubkCAnC4V7Lg.text: I absolutely love Windsor! Is there anything Upward Projects does wrong? I have been here about a million times and it's amazing every time. I used to live in the neighborhood but even since I have moved I still go out of my way to come here for lunch. My go to lunch is the Fattoush salad with shrimp. This is probably the only salad I crave consistently and I haven't been able to perfect it at home yet. Another favorite menu item of mine is the loaded chips piled high with caramelized onion, bacon, and bleu cheese with chipotle crema, the only reason I don't get these every time is because I'm usually alone. The crab cake BLT and pastrami Reuben are also must haves.   True to the Upward Project motif, Windsor offers happy hour $5 pitchers, cocktails, and glasses of wine until 5pm. I personally am partial to the No. 17 {Cucumber Vodka | Green Tea Syrup | Fresh Cucumber | Mint} served up, this drink is so refreshing and the perfect addition to my solo lunch.   Service here is always great. If I'm not mistaken they have a team approach to service where you have several different people helping you and they pool tips. This can make it harder to find your actual server, but it also means that everyone is there to help with what you need.   I'll be coming here forever!

Dmnr011JsecMWeUVfJmrig.text: Windsor is one of my favorite restaurants! I love the atmosphere and the vibe - patio seating is a must on the cool days and you can even take along your furry family member. The servers are usually welcoming and friendly.   Happy hour includes $5 beer and wines. The crab cake BLT and the included side (I ordered the mac and cheese) was mouthwatering! After, my date and I headed to Churn to get their delicious ice cream!   I highly recommend visiting Windsor - you will love it because I do.

9aXSeoHOSc9Sr_GRCNM0Nw.text: Was having a rough day/night/week, whatever you want to call it and wanted to go somewhere to unwind and just forget about the day, so I suggested to a friend that we do dinner at Windsor, so off we went!  The main reason why I wanted Windsor is because I remembered there Verde Mary, and that's what I wanted, something spicy with a kick! Man was I bummed out to learn that's not on the everyday menu, must be just a brunch thing, even Windsor was kickin me when I was down.  But I got over that soon and went with a black cherry lemonade, which was great tasting, fresh and not too sweet.  After checking out the menu, we started off with Corn Dog Poppers that came with fried pickles and ballpark mustard.  These lil corn dogs were delsih! It was a corn meal crust perfectly cooked, even the pickles were coated in the corn meal, it just was perfect! The pickles even came in quarters and slices, I thought that was pretty cool.  I went with the Grilled Chicken sandwich, it was a spicy curry rubbed chicken breast with a mango jalapeno mayo, red onion, spring greens & tomato on a hoagie roll. I have to say this was perfect! I love when chicken is mixed with fruit, I think mangos & pineapples are the best thing to pair with chicken, so mango jalapeno mayo was on point with me! Loved it!  But I do have to admit at some points I did have plate envy because all around me everything was having these huge beefy burgers, I might have to try one of those next time I am back!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken Sandwich with Jo&#39;s church potatoes
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn Dog Poppers Tender Belly hot dog, crispy pickles &amp; ballpark mustard

fnI9I4kG7aFZ2MAYHXUlig.text: This is a great pub/restaurant setting.  Patio is great.  Had the kabobs; crazy good.  Must check the cassette wall; find and reminisce about your 80's Groove.    Double your food fix; Adjacent to Churn, a gourmet small batch ice cream shop.   Only gripe is the flies.   Constantly swatting them away from the door.

pxb_p3s3taiGvyVSecWoqw.text: My family and I checked out Windsor for brunch this past Sunday while in town visiting family. We arrived right at 11am and it was hopping! There is a large parking lot, just to the south of the restaurant, with ample parking. We checked into the hostess area and were told it would be a 45min to an hour wait. (We were a party of 6, so the wait for smaller groups could have been less). The restaurant uses a version of the No Wait app so I was able to see where we were in line, which is a great feature! We easily bided time by waiting in the beautiful outdoor patio, sipping $5 Bloody Mary's. They were delicious! They had a great Bloody Mary bar set up with lots of olives, pickles and hot sauce to doctor it up just the way you like it. (I believe that all of the cocktails are $5 before 5pm, if I am not mistaken). We were seated right at the hour mark at a big table in the front of the restaurant. The server was patient and very thourough, taking the time to explain different items on the menu with great detail. I ended up ordering the EggMan sandwich off of the brunch menu. Overall the sandwich was very tasy, but a bit too greasy for my liking. I ordered the cheesy potatoes as a side and they were delightful! If you are a fan of the creamy, cheesy potato casserole popular at Midwest get togethers you must order these. The biscuits and gravy were ordered by several in our party and they said they were delicious, but very rich. The pricing was affordable, with the total bill for a party of 6 (including 9 Bloody Mary's) was only $134. Overall, it was a nice meal shared with great people. I would definitely make Windsor's a regular on my brunch rotation if I lived in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. EggMan Sandwich with Cheesy Potatoes on brunch menu. Yum!

RY6l_-2YPFh2UqcqjzQwRA.text: I came here for a brunch date and it was a great choice. Far and away the best thing I had was the bloody mary. Plenty, but not too much spice, that was perfect for a lunchtime cocktail. And the bar they had to doctor it up was awesome. Olives and garnishes galore. And for $5 it can't be beat.   I had the porkwich which was fairly standard fare. It was a little soggy, which is to be expected with pulled pork, and the coleslaw was a nice compliment but none of the flavors jumped out at me. My friend ordered the veggie burger which she thought was pretty good if unremarkable.   The seating itself is a little crowded around the edges of the bar, but you're sure to get great service considering how hard it would be to ignore you.

lCVs9FYf6xzoXsCAoxziEg.text: Come on, whats up with happy hour till 5 ? Boo... that aside the drinks are delicious. Every single one of them is well crafted and heck just thinking about it is makin' me want to go get some ! The food really pales compared to the drinks but it is not bad by any means. I just love the drinks too much to waste the calories on anything else ! True story !

2ROi0q4Z-NOIT2-TuJD2pA.text: Love this place, went in after a hike for brunch and beverage. Service is always great. I had the special of the day, Scottish Egg and it was pretty tasty.. Will go back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scottish Egg

E0GcfV9_46HwWf9zdEKoRw.text: The Old Fashion - wow.  The crew KNOWS how to do this old school whiskey delight!  There is more to this delightful place besides the whiskey.   The food here is excellent with a wonderful though simple varied menu. This casual small neighborhood "cafe" has excellent, attentive & friendly employees that make you feel like you're one of regulars.   It's trendy, it's kinda hip and a bit noisy - that's the territory, it's a small place. But, I had no trouble carrying on a booth conversation.  There was a slight order glitch that was immediately rectified. Things happen everywhere but the True nature of an establishment is how they make things right. They made it right and then some. That made my experience here over the top great!  Living in the east valley, it's a bit of a drive to get here but I'll be coming back soon - it's a wow in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretty unique decorative hallway wall
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9FlPWyBydSAyfVAdsbHLtg.text: Ok, so this meal went a little better. Great food and service...that has never been an issue.  I had the requisite people this time but didn't make the reservation "in time".    I was accommodated when management was asked but there has to be a BETTER way to educate people on how to manage this process.  Twice I got a snarky response in regards to reservation, twice I was wrong...I give up.

uy7a3sk4_444Rr6tMtdn7Q.text: I'm a little mad (at myself) that we didn't try this place sooner.. We've been wanting to try Windsor since we moved to Phoenix a few months ago and we finally stopped in for dinner and drinks last night. We had the best experience! The food does not disappoint, I had the best Old Fashioned I've ever had, and there's a really cool, fun vibe, but you know what is going to bring us back again and again? The service. Our servers (Brandon and Hills) were super personable, friendly and genuine. They were those hard to find kind of people that make you feel like you've been friends forever. We had their full attention when they were at our table, they were very knowledgable about the menu and spent time to give us recommendations. (Hills literally sat down at our booth and went through all of the side options on the menu for my picky husband. She knew every ingredient in each option, describing the coleslaw as having a good celery seed crunch. She ultimately convinced us to get the sweet potato fries and they were delicious!)  We ordered the Grilled Chicken Sandwich (which has a juicy, spicy curry-rubbed grilled chicken breast and mango jalapeno mayo), sweet potato fries on the side and the Seasonal Salad (butternut squash, roasted Brussel sprouts YUM!, kamut, green apple, walnuts and goat cheese).  I would eat that grilled chicken sandwich and salad as my last meal on Earth.. which is saying a lot because it's grilled chicken and salad.  After dinner, we realized that for the first time since we moved from Seattle to Phoenix, we weren't as homesick. Windsor took us both to a place that felt more like "home" and made us feel surrounded by people we know.  I simply can't recommend Windsor more. You won't regret trying this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seasonal salad
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries (split for us)
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. FYI Churn ice cream!

Sw1oySAgOLg4hR9Cusd_Sw.text: Came here for a late lunch with a group of 11. It was in the odd (HAPPY) hours between lunch and dinner so they were able to seat us quick.  They have a mini pitcher on their happy hour menu which was a good deal and a number of us enjoyed, the ones who weren't drinking enjoyed the Blackberry Lemonade which was very delicious and refreshing.  With that we decided to order their Loaded Chips to snack on while we ordered and waited on entrees. For our entrees we for the most part had similar selections the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and Backyard Burger being the most popular selections. I personally had their Backyard Burger (Windsor Style) with sweet potato fries and it was absolutely delicious.   A couple of the people in our group went with the Veggie Stack and Picnic Kebobs both which were good. Only compliant was with the Picnic Kebobs not being as filling as they would seem.   The place price wise was also reasonable for the quality of food and service. Would absolutely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Backyard Burger Windsor Style
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Stack
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken Sandwich

6FUiWYoeQCjAp8KK2zFA6A.text: Windor has a great vibe. As soon as I walked in on a Thursday evening it was just "the place to be". We started off with the pretzels and fondue cheese. They were pretty good but I wish the cheese had been warmer. It's served with apples and sausage as well. I ordered their Berkeley veggie burger which was made with brown rice, pinto beans and bulgar wheat. It had avocado and greens on a brioche bun. It was kinda messy but in a good way because it was delicious. I needed a bit extra sauce (the lime aioli) and then it was even better. They have great fries too! The mac and cheese wasn't too shabby either. To be honest, I completely forgot what my friends ordered but I'll say we all liked our food and the service was attentive and friendly. Afterwards we opted to order Churn which they bring to the table, I did not know that! My only complaint about the icecream is that I ordered it in a cone, they forgot and brought me the cone separately so I had to build it myself. I don't know, it took away from the icecream experience I suppose. Nevertheless, I'd definitely eat at Windsor again! And.....Churn has one of the BEST ICECREAMS in the valley so definitely a must have.

o957Tzl2oVuHUOmCSnRXUw.text: This place is a gem, the staff was all pleasant.  We asked to move outside and they were accommodating. The place is beautiful,  outside is full of greens, comfy seating,  attached to icecream parlor called Churn. I had the fresh market fish, which was walnut basil pesto seared salmon on top of risotto with greens and sun dried tomatoes. Perfectly cooked and full of close your eyes flavor.  My friend had ahi tuna salad,  which was also full of flavor.  This place is definitely a great chill, relax with friends vibe.  Dark atmosphere and best dirty martini I've had in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pan seared salmon with walnut pesto on top of risotto and full of flavor
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi seared tuna salad,  flavorful and perfectly balanced with dressing
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thelma and Louise

vklllMOdVlJvEoJVCRACQw.text: I used to come ever almost every Sunday like clockwork, the past couple of months I have been super busy and haven't kept up my tradition. It was a friend's birthday tonight and the 5 of us in the party decided on coming to Windsor. The service was extremely slow in the dining room and it was not overly busy either. Waiting 10 minutes for our server to get us drinks, my party waited over 10 minutes for their beverages from the bar. I drank an entire glass of water, and then got a refill not noticing my glass was severely chipped. I cut my lip and I am terrified that I swallowed glass with my drink. My glass was not the only one that was chipped as well. The server apologized and said he would bring me another glass but he never did. I am a regular customer, I get the side kale salad frequently. This visit, it was pathetic and roughly 1/3 of the size as usual. My friend got the exact same salad as me and was disappointed as well. To top off the night, my friend was served raw meat and didn't notice until eating a piece of it. I believe she ordered some kabob dish. If she doesn't get sick I'll be surprised, the meat was so raw that my friend couldn't even cut through it.  The only enjoyable part of my experience was the fries that we ordered. Pretty disappointed from what used to be my favorite spot.

M4nYiS1O8C2ck9LY95EO1g.text: Delicious!  After a long St Paddy's party the night before, we needed a good brunch spot. We found it.   The Windsor has been booked marked on my Yelp app since they opened. We were just across the street a couple of weeks ago on another fun adventure and I made my hubby promise that in two weeks we'd be back here. And we did. They have a nice patio and yummy food and drinks.   The menu for brunch was small but it made things easier. We knew what we wanted and the flavor was delicious. I had the classic eggs Benedict with baby Dutch potatoes. Hubby had a classic breakfast.   My mimosa was perfection. It wasn't just a full cup of OJ. Several spots will pour a full glass of juice and barely no bubbly. But this was yummy.   We will certainly return to try the rest of the menu. It's located near everything.

Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg Benedict
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheesy harsh browns

XEenbMORV3qoKBf4Col8sQ.text: Oh my yum!!!! The staff were all gorgeous.  And the food was good too. Lol  But seriously... my sister and I came for a Saturday brunch on a yelp suggestion. I was extremely pleased. Decided to enjoy the beautiful spring weather and sit on the patio. It was peaceful even with dogs being outside.   I ordered the chicken sandwich no tomato. My sister got a bowl of fruit, fried okra, and shrimp skewers.  Sorry there aren't pictures of all of that. Just got enticed by the food. Everything was perfectly seasoned.

Yv7Aq5mDEK3LQ5ofeCGeSQ.text: I love this place... I do. Anyone that knows me knows this is my "go to" joint. They are just that cool. But, just like you... They make mistakes... They are imperfect... They have flaws... They are human. But what I LOVE is that they OWN 'em. They'll swallow any pride, throw out the apology and fully accept responsibility when they blow it. Its not often, but hey... Shit happens.   Tonight it happened... and unfortunately, the customer that had his to-go order mistakenly given to another customer was understandably bummed he'd have to wait a few more minutes while his order was re-made.  In True awesome fashion, management was there to apologize, throw out some comps, and let the customer know that this was not their standard... "We are better than this" was his words. But unfortunately, this customer still had an attitude, and couldn't be kind to another person... one who was apologizing, one who took responsibility and one who tried to make it right.... Of course he took the comp and shook the man's hand... But what would it have cost him just to be kind?! Say "thank you", and just be decent??   Try it... Its soooo much more fun than being a dick.

XUWNVNuRvgrlP0D6GNa8SA.text: Great place with a fun mix of British Pub feel and updated southern comfort food.  Lovely patio and nice pub feel inside. The tufted booths are super comfortable and I liked how they were raised.  Really friendly staff and nice vegetarian options.  They were able to substitute options to accommodate my dietary choices.  I really enjoyed my visit and will certainly come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UnOVlpE3sCGB_IAbeN4DVA.text: All American brunch/food. Very delicious and clean.  The service was really great! The ribs we ordered came out like room temperature? So when we complained the manager kindly apologized and had a new one made for us and it was hot and fresh. She came back to make sure it was fixed and to our liking. Even after that, they treated us kindly. Their Mac and cheese is to die for! I highly recommend getting it as a side for whatever you get. I also got the scallops which was the fresh fish of the day. Cooked to perfection. It wasn't over cooked so it wasn't chewy but it wasn't undercooked either! It's definitely hard to get scallops at restaurants cause some places just can't get it right but it was definitely good here!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Y5sxhzOOSOmhW9XIQRizug.text: Finally made it into Windsor for lunch. They have indoor and outdoor seating and are attached to churn ice cream next door. On Saturday they do brunch till 1pm so we had both a breakfast and lunch/dinner menu to peruse. They also have a pretty extensive drink menu.   The booths are super comfortable. Our waiter came over promptly to get our drink orders. We all stuck with water, but people were around to refill our glasses promptly before they ever got close to empty.   I ordered the porkwich which was pulled pork, ham and bacon with gold sauce and coleslaw. You get to select a side and I went with the sweet potato fries. The flavor of the sandwich was excellent and the fries were awesome! Thinner and crispier than most sweet potato fries... some of the best I've ever had probably.   My girlfriend and friend both got a burger, they tried the Mac n cheese and cornbread as their sides. They said the burger was awesome and one of the best they've had in awhile. The Mac n cheese was decent too. The one total miss was the cornbread though... the only way we could all describe it was tasting like what a shoe store smells like.... yikes. Definitely would avoid ordering that.   Overall it was a pleasant experience, a cool spot and a solid meal. I'd return if in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger and cornbread

JCtShX3uxWq8eNQvLBTcPQ.text: Came in on a busy Saturday morning with my husband for a special occasion. The whole staff was attentive and friendly. If they were stressed, it didn't show. The food (crab cake blt, beignets, bacon, breakfast potatoes) was all so yummy.  We'll be back very soon!

w8I67N_BWFL9sD8M0BuJjg.text: I've been a huge fan of Postino, Federal Pizza and Churn. I'm late to the Windsor party, but finally arrived. Top-notch experience all around with the legendary $5 craft beer pitchers 7 days a week before 5pm. If you like burgers, you can't go wrong for the Backyard Federal style burger. Menu has a wonderful comfort food selection that sets it apart from other Upward Projects restaurants. Check out the below link to learn more about this stellar eatery group serving the Valley. You can never go wrong visiting any of their memorable establishments! upwardprojects.com

Vzo8e3JNCFYBBp0ni16dfA.text: My second visit to the Windsor was a better experience than my first, in large part because the service was prompt, plus my wife and my order came out at the same time. We both tried a few of their different kabobs on sticks, and although very savory with some amazing sauces to go with, we were presented with the info that we could order all-meat, no veggies, but not that doing so would increase the price. Although it was only $3 more per kabob, it still caught us off guard when the bill arrived, and would've been good to know when ordering. Other than that, we had a nice dinner and enjoyed the vibe of the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back to the Windsor.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Kd75jDWJ1rq_u8rCL4gt9A.text: I have been here twice in one week if that says anything lol. Came here with my hubby on a Saturday night. We snagged two seats at the bar and took in the vibe! Great ambience, busy but not overly busy, a bit noisy but nothing more than what you would expect at a popular restaurant during a weekend evening. The back wall of the restaurant was open, creating a very open feel and combining the indoor and outdoor seating. The patio was cute and definitely would be enjoyable during the day when it's warm. The restaurant is also connected to Churn, the ice cream spot next door. Perfect way to end a dinner date!   Our service was excellent. The bartender helped us choose from the menu and gave excellent recommendations. He was super friendly and entertaining. I told him I was thinking of a salad and he recommended the fattoush (his wife's fav). I ordered the fattoush salad, no cheese, dressing on the side, add shrimp + a side order of sweet potato fries. Any one else always want fries with their salad?!  The salad was delicious! I loved the saltiness of the olives and butter beans, paired with the softness of the pita and crunch of the red onion. The shrimp was super flavorful and cooked perfectly. The fries were good too! I was very satisfied. I even came back a week later and got the exact same order. I could eat this salad everyday seriously.  My hubby got the crab cake sandwich and sweet potato fries. He ate the entire thing and really enjoyed it as well stating he would definitely come back. Pricing is reasonable and service was timely. Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fattoush salad with shrimp!

vMNLaHQ9FHUg-a2kUJJ35Q.text: The Crab Cake BLT was absolutely delicious. Loved sitting on the Parkin with the misting fan. I will be back before I leave Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

P6GsU1plZLpP2QK9yslu4w.text: Probably the best spot in Phoenix for a lunch!  That fish and chips, man....it was off the hook, fresh off the hook. Tender flakes of fish and perfectly fried fries coupled with creamy tangy tarter sauce. There's really nothing better. The lunch bag chicken sandwich was also beyond amazing. The side order of "vegan?"Mac and cheese, perfect. On top of all that $5 pitchers! If I ever move to Phoenix, you can expect to find me here daily.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FTC6i_qBO-jIDve23bzvMA.text: I'm Upset (in my Drake voice) that I'm just now getting hip to this magical gem of a restaurant.  My girlfriend and I went always try somewhere new for our monthly brunch and Windsor was this months choice.    Let me start with the SERVICE. From the minute we walked in we genuinely felt welcomed.  This was our first time here but it felt like everyone knew our names :-)  The DRINKS!!!! Ok other than the great drink specials which are reason enough to visit....we tried 5 different cocktails and all of them were delicious. If I had to pick a favorite it would be the one with the strawberry (see menu photo.    Our FOOD was the best part!!! I'm already planning my next out just to try more stuff from the menu.  I haven't had fried okra in years so I was so surprised and excited when i saw it in the menu.  It was deli and any friend okra lovers know it has to be cooked just right and it was!  We LOVED our waiter (shout out to Benny).  He was just great at his job,  making great drink suggestions, telling us the best stuff in the menu, having great conversation & jokes with us that he almost made us late of our 2:30 commitment.  We really could have stayed all day.    We will beck back and if you have never been to Windsor, wait no longer! You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uaNuAl1jFzY70JwiVdf2lQ.text: This place was fantastic a lot of seating, the outdoor patio is fantastic the beer was really good the food was good however I felt that the appetizers were a little overpriced, they have some really great happy hours and happy hour prices but not on appetizer food just the beer.  The staff and the servers were really great I like that they were all dressed very casual and wearing whatever they wanted it seemed it made you feel more at ease.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uomxlnOSTpEYRhUejbkJLQ.text: I've now been here a handful of times and each time I am impressed by the tremendous level of service I receive. The food is always great (who doesn't love fondue?) but the service is the stand-out.  This time I had the pulled porkwich and I have to admit, with all the hype I was prepared to be disappointed. Well just like a good Girl Scout, I was prepared for the worst but luckily experienced the best. It rocked. The mustard sauce, the coleslaw (which normally I scrap off), the bacon....I mean how on earth could they make this any better.  Previous visits I've had the Crabcake BLT (A-mazing), the Burger, Windsor-style, and the Waldorf Salad. All great. Honestly, although this is not exactly a health food stop, you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Rocks!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese Fondue...deeelish!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Manhattan

bFzMNTOzk8W069HsEQIkqA.text: Popped in for a lunch visit the 2nd day they were open. Very cool patio & outdoor area, diverse menu, cool vibe.  I tried the grain salad, which was loaded with tons of tasty grains & veggies and drizzled with a citrus vinaigrette dressing. It was a ton of food and totally filled me up.  We wanted to try one of the other dishes with pita bread, but our waitress informed us that they don't have any vegan bread whatsoever.  Please start offering some vegan bread, Windsor (and more vegan options)!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grain Salad

sqN_qMKzrjAjsYELoYK_LA.text: I had the Backyard Burger, Windsor style! Very tasty and well seasoned... The garlic aioli was not too strong, either. Great ambience and location... And it's local!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor ambience... Super chill!

P3VoQ8Dz6TlJOzxSehFLZg.text: Great spot.  Staff very attentive and personable.  Food is very eclectic and tasty.  Almost a neighborhood feel.  Absolutely fabulous venue with happy hour gravitas and intimate dinner vibes as well.  Only regret is that they don't have more locations around the valley.

iF4XVNugr2yf0mhuYD6HBg.text: I had horrible customer service. The waiter took 15 minutes to comeback and take my order when I told him I need a moment and to finish everyone else's orders in my group. Not only did it take him 15 minutes to come back and ask. My friend had to loudly grab another waiters attention in order for me to have my order taken. The food was good but the customer service is horrible and the cocktails where weak and not worth the cost. Much better concepts and places to go to. I do not and will not recommend this place to anyone I know. Especially when my first review was deleted off of this page.

3PhBmdZwZUansSkKNjkk-A.text: Bahn Mi oh my, what a flavor explosion. Luickly I was seated outside for this blast of flavor.   I visited the Windsor at 8:30 on a weeknight and it was surprisingly busy, but there was no wait.  We opted to sit on the patio, which ot my surprise was nicer than the inside dining area. Wooden booths and tables, padded chairs and corrugated metal shade complete the contemporary urban patio  The menu has salad, and various burger like sandwiches on the menu, which on the surface is nothing interesting, the sides list is quite eclectic, there is the traditional fries, and the less traditional,  Kale chips, fried okra, mac & cheese, sweet cabbage salad and more. at $3 each I think 3-4 may be a fun snack meal.   I went with the Halibut Bahn Mi, ($13) Their take on a Vietnamese favorite. S soft round bun housed a perfectly cooked piece of halibut, an assortment of greens, and a flavored mayo. It was spicy, fresh and hearty, I highly recommend this. With any main dish you also have a choice of side. I went with the fried Okra, which was delicious, crispy, not soggy like Okra can easily be, and the batter had a great flavor. It was in perfect bit sized pieces too.  My table also got a salad ($9) with salmon ($3) note the salmon is smoked. This was good but nothing too special.    A small dish of pistachios is delivered to the table as a complimentary app, it is a nice protein packed treat.  The service was also great, I had just finished a spin class and was drinking water faster than a elephant, however my glass never went lower than 1/3, even after 10 refills. This was even more surprising as usually patios are the black hole of service.

9h1Tpaq5MkIMhXW2Nz9MRA.text: Valet parking is a must or you're hoofing it from parking down the residential street. It's a well maintained nice looking bar/restaurant. Not too hipster that you feel uncomfortable and music is not too loud you can't have a conversation. We were seated quickly and had our drink orders in our hands in less than 5 mins. 90 Schilling on draft and enjoyed every last drop. Our food order was taken fast and I had the crab cake sandwich which was very good but I would've added more sauce so it wasn't so dry. Wifey had pulled pork sandwich and she enjoyed it thoroughly. If it wasn't for the bad attitude on the manager I would've given it another star but we will see next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 90 Schilling on draft

kw62cLdko-5RlEDtWR9bzg.text: Windsor is a solid little date spot in central phoenix at Central & Camelback which you definitely need to take a girl a to. I have been twice now and wanted to share each of my experiences with you.   The first was about 9 months ago, where a lady friend of mine wanted to take me as she lived pretty close to it. We sat in one of the nice leather booths had a couple of cocktails and dinner. All of the patrons were super friendly and everyone kind of feels that because we all know and love this place, we should be awesome to each other. I love businesses that attract these types of people. Dinner was solid, I had a chicken sandwich sans the bun and garden veggies. I knew I would be back.  The second time was for a friends birthday dinner where we took a group of about 10. They surprisingly had room for us and nestled on nice leather couch towards the back. The cocktails again, maybe overpriced, but my Lawd they're delicious. They also have a great price for 3/4 pitchers of beer, so if you're a beer drinker, you're in good hands.   This time I had the PicNic Skewers, which is essentially one skewer of steak, chicken, shrimp, and veggies, served with an amazing mustard sauce and tamitillo salsa. Delicious!  The vibe: On the floor on the left side of the restaurant you will see, "You Should" and on the right side, if you pay attention will see "Question Authority". I love this. Thousands of patrons will come and go and never see this hidden gem of their decor.   The hallway to the restroom is lined with old cassette tapes, giving a great backdrop to a cute little date selfie.   Around the corner from the restaurants is the cutest dessert store ever! Technically, its separate but its not. Its part of the experience. End your date (especially daddy / daughter dates) for the perfect end to a great evening out.   Bottom line: You'll love Windsor!

Vu8XGWDkZSsjO0JkV_uxPg.text: I went to this place because there were so many great reviews... Ordered crispy chicken, and salad. KFC chicken is better than what they gave us and it was even the worse fried chicken ever I've tasted. The salad was a nothing special. Bummer food menu, everyone else seemed to enjoy, that's too bad because they have a nice atmosphere but the menu is limited and not willing to pay again.

JpwpQOpyWD5Ei7pliuOVow.text: Really Phoenix? This is some of the best you got?  Meh. MEH. I'm grumpy cat all over this place.  First of all, the valet situation was poor. I understand that the valets want to control traffic flow during busy hours, but when it's not busy, making me turn around and pull back around front is ridiculous.  Then, to refuse to park my car is flat out dumb. Another reason why I dislike valets and restaurants that use them when there's not a direct need.  So at least my husband got a nice, breezy table outside on the patio while I parked. I'll give them points for atmosphere, but alot of the credit must go to the amazing Arizona spring weather. We started off with the fondue, our usual when out in Arizona, where it oddly is served everywhere. The pretzel was warm and freshly baked, but you'll notice I'm complimenting the dipper, not the dip. The fondue, while creamy, also had the distinctive cornstarch note known to appease all lovers of cheese fondue. MEH. For dinner, I tried out the country vegetable chop. All of the veggies (corn, peas, okra, asparagus, kale, carrots, radishes) were all fresh and light. The homemade buttermilk dressing was remarkably light. Delicious all around, but not enough to to appease me after the random valet issues, mediocre service, and poorly done cheese fondue.

LK-1N9a0l9BT77fkunvhJw.text: The food here always hits the spot! My favorite drink to get is a Bloody Mary, and it's great no matter who makes it!

PoNhcMAWRh3P_SNT5PbYSg.text: As an update... their cocktails are pretty great. My favorite things on the menu are their Russian Roulette peppers (Mainly shisito peppers) and deviled egg dip for appetizers and kale Caeser salad with chicken. They make a great burger too!

kGx7Be6FbnkB85KkiFsTLQ.text: Fatoush salad is great, service is always top notch! Parking is easy!

jgCt4DaSlkfznyxfyZ2R5Q.text: I was visiting phoenix for a few days and found this spot with great reviews. It unfortunately did not life up to the standard set by folks on yelp. I was seated quickly and a waiter came to ask for my drink order as soon as I sat down which didn't give me enough time to look at the drinks menu. I ordered a green Bloody Mary which they claim to be famous for but it was gross ( maybe it's an acquired taste). I ordered eggs Benedict with ham and some roasted potatoes. The eggs themselves were nasty. The hollandaise sauce was more of a tangy mayo with egg than what it's suppose to be. The potatoes were too salty and dry. Getting my servers attention was a real chore and I had to ask separate wait staff to help me close my check. Definitely do not recommend!

zVOD1D9qPyxANqL28qRtnw.text: Celebrating a birthday here and found Windsor to be just the ticket. Service was exemplary, the throw-back cocktails were astounding. Especially loved the #04 - try it, you'll love it. Actually everything we tried was delish. Cocktails, starters, dinners, and ice cream dessert. We shared the mini corn-dogs (yum) and the roulette of roasted peppers (surprisingly yum) pre-dinner. Everybody ordered something different and all was quite good - pork sandwich, tuna tartare, ahi tuna salad, white fish sandwich, and the short ribs - I would have any one of them again. As said before, service was excellent and the place has great music playing with a hip wall to check out as you enter the restroom area. Be forewarned though - the parking lot is TINY.

t3JpYE7t7NZ-wG9P0s3lyg.text: Hi,This place needs to get 6 ****** first delicious food, rich menu,Good service and happy waiters...Good atmosphere and great music. What more could you ask from a restaurant ? highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

G0_ALYvpP2IqTFw3vfos9A.text: Ate here tonight with my hubby. Food was very good, I had the grain salad with shrimp, hubby had the bacon cheeseburger with Mac & cheese and if was tasty!!!! We had the mini corn dogs for app really good and the drenched chips which were so so. Overall great atmosphere , we took our 6 month old baby and will be returning again!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

le5o1S7gsS3Fff503I7o1g.text: Windsor is like young Phoenix's old faithful. This is a wonderful restaraunt that is appropriate for almost any occasion. It is hip, but not TOO hip. It is modern, but not TOO modern.   There is plenty of variety on the menu which is overall pretty casual. This is great for a girls night or a date night. I have not been for lunch or brunch, but i'd imagine that sitting on the patio on a spring day is great.

I6eJhAu4UbLnOA-jvh67QQ.text: Windsor is one of my favorite restaurants because of their entree, the Veggie Stack. I always come back for it. It's healthy and layered with multiple flavors. So good! The ambience is fun with a good energy.

TwGz2c3EDO7V7uPmJmeZ3w.text: I hate to say it, but the Emperor has no clothes (or not that much clothing, at least)! They are frequently out of their specialty drinks, which are usually stuffed with ice and fairly weak. The food is good, but it's not nearly as good as you'd expect for the price and hype. As one example, the ahi tuna salad is sad for the price. Perhaps my perception will change and I've just gone on off nights. Either way, 3 stars for being out of most do your speciality drinks the last few nights I went. I agree with other reviewers that the wait staff could be nicer, especially the bartenders.

gLDh1N126SSGmjYlGEE1Cw.text: This one busy restaurant.  It has so much to look at & see on the walls that the wait flies by.  The food is really good but the drinks are even better.

KGH5z4FEXrmF3Mj6tGMxFQ.text: First visit to this establishment. I will be returning. Very cool atmosphere. Trendy and chic. Love the wood bar and tables. Good was excellent. I got the porkwitch and loved it. I didn't get a cocktail but my friends that frequent this place highly recommend them. I'll be trying one next time. Service was very high for such a reasonably priced restaurant. I'd say the device was on par with places 3-4 times the price. And a perk... Churn ice cream is right next door if you still have room for desert.

a99amGJVxXk8nLkz27rVXw.text: Lunch today was amazing! The food is always great at Windsor but sometimes the service suffers from the scramble to find out who is actually helping. When everything is going great there is always 6 people asking if you're ok but when you need something it is always tough to find help.  The Porkwich and Curry Chicken are delightful.

pH3r_kByWWXXHABCdGxNwg.text: The Windsor is a total package restaurant that offers good food (hello mixed grains salad, I see you) and good drinks. Manny makes my heart sing with his delectable cocktails!

fdpeKEb_V1UHg19hLlfjIg.text: We love this place for a lot of reason. The food is fantastic from Burgers, Salads, Hummus, Egg salad Dip etc etc... The staff is so so fantastic from the moment you enter. The service is fabulous as well... They are all so so happy working there so to me that means that the owners take good care of them. This is a locally owned place which we love to support. The Happy Hour is from 11am-5pm... $5 pitchers of beers, wines, cocktails. Great ambiance as well. Great bar as well. We love the outdoor seating area as well. Yes even in this Phoenix heat, its pretty bearable out there because of so many misters that they have... There weekend brunches are awesome as well...Yes this is one of our go to places!!!!

h8sNoXhnd_x-hVo4pILKmQ.text: I love this freaking place. THey have the singe best brunch in the city. Best food, best unique and delicious cocktails, awesome ambiance. Only two draw backs in my eye, lunch isn't as good as breakfast, and the wait time on the weekends can be outrageous (butttt, this is a credit to their awesome service and food so I don't really count it as a negative) Anywho, $5 beer pitchers for brunch. Is it necessary to say more? I will be back again, and again, and again, and again, and a few more times after that. Thanks guys!

ESoXGkoul00erHGavX-1RQ.text: I've never received bad service here. I love the vibe, the music, and the drinks.   My favorite drink is the No.22. It's my go to. Berry vodka drink with blackberries. Super refreshing.   Everything on the menu is delicious. My favorites include the MAC and cheese, of course, the chicken noodle soup is amazing. Country vegetable chop is my favorite salad. Their soup and salad combo is a good move. Mahi salad. I could go on.   One of my favorite spots uptown. Check it out!

PYE4KDJ4UdEcyyeZCItygA.text: I have been to Windsor many times for lunch, food is always great and service is good. I love the feel of that part of town.   Although, this past week when I went for drinks, I rarely saw our waitress and found a long black hair in the cocktail glass.   Made me question the cleanliness of the bartenders. Probably will go somewhere else next time for happy hour.

6JFQJVUnSLqQO-8wO9aO0w.text: This place has been on my radar for a while now and I was able to meet a girlfriend for dinner there last night.  The patio is fantastic and I look forward to enjoying a cocktail or two out there once the heat subsides.  All of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly.  Shortly after I put my name in for a table, a gentleman brought me an unsolicited glass of ice water.  I love little touches like that!    It is a bit loud inside but it seemed to quiet down a bit after the initial dinner rush.  I had the fatoosh salad which was delightful.  I added the grilled chicken which was cooked and seasoned wonderfully.    A few other reviews complained about the music but I rather enjoyed the eclectic mix.  Nothing like being mid-bite and suddenly remembering high school.    The other reviewers are correct - just do the complimentary valet.  The parking lot is wonky and it's so much easier to part with a same tip.  I should note the valets were also extremely friendly.    All in all, a great experience and I can't wait to go back.

8OJATWiP5NghC_udI1MtDg.text: Went to the Windsor for the first time yesterday!  What a gem!  Had the devilled egg and homemade chip dip and the buttermilk chicken with kale salad.  All were really great.  But the best of all was the amazing customer service!  Everyone who worked there had a smile and was so attentive with everything from filling our water glasses to recommending their best sellers to making sure throughout the time that we were there, that we were having fun!  If you haven't been here yet, we would highly recommend it.  Of course, they are part of the Postinos, Joyride, and Federal Pizza group so they have happy hour every day to 5.00pm.  You can't beat a glass of good Presecco for $5.00!  Thank you to the Windsor team for an excellent experience!  We will be back.

XNakS3GUbLexNC1IqaazTw.text: Wife and I split the crab cake sandwich and the pulled pork sandwich. both of them were excellent but the pulled pork sandwich was out-of-this-world, ham ,belly fat bacon and pulled pork with a golden sauce! fantastic with the sweet potato fries!

y0mJVOsU9ly-wYml4b3Zow.text: I can't believe its taken me so long to write a review on this place. Windsor is an extremely cozy and fun place to hang for a couple of drinks and dinner/apps, whatever you're in the mood for. I love the urban-chic decor and the staff is always friendly. I brought two of my friends here from CA on separate occasions and they both loved it. The reason I keep going back is because I love it even more. The food is delicious and they have a ton of beer selections. There's also a beautiful patio that happens to have the same exact fireplace that is in my living room.   Overall, great food, great drinks, great atmosphere, great service. A+ all around. Fried chicken on Mon and Tues.

WT_Wu4X3vegNilVfXAP7ZQ.text: Go. Ask for a table on the patio when the weather's nice.  No choice but to valet park so bring some folding money with you and don't be put off by all the suits if you come for lunch. The vibe is upper crust but it's casual.  Try the Russian Roulettes, but don't order the Fatoosh salad with the salmon which is smoked on premises unless you never want to eat any other salad again. It's that damn good.  Windsor is also the home of one of the best Arnold Palmers that you'll enjoy at a restaurant in Phoenix.

dUs9FyLFF3QJeTeZ9reKYA.text: Slowly becoming one of my favorite places in PHX. I've been three times and each time has been fantastic. Great food and the waiters aren't trying to hurry you up. I love that.  I thought the fried chicken was the best item on the menu until I had the ribs tonight. They gave traditional BBQ places a run for their money. All the apps are great too. And when they brought me an ice cream from Churn for my BDay - for free - that really sealed the deal for me.  This is my first Yelp review. I usually think reviewing stuff on here is for people who think too much about themselves but I am such a Windsor fan I had to let the yelpers know.

Mh4eQCIXtRVxnMOhJgrDCw.text: This place is pretty unassuming and the actual menu cards are too (laminated).  They have some interesting and unusual dishes. I ordered the salmon, which was excellent. Our server Kelsi was absolutely fabulous, very attentive, courteous, and smiling.  She kept checking in with us throughout the meal.  It was interesting that we were serviced by 4 different people and Kelsi told us that they practice "Team Service."  The prices are very reasonable.  They have Happy Hour when you can get a pitcher of beer for $5.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kGb44pikdZmmMQo1hKK3cw.text: Had ribs, mac & cheese, okra, and slaw.  We licked the plates.  The atmosphere on the patio was exciting and romantic.  Will definitely return.  Just wish the biscuit was larger and moist.

jcFTHqoPIWvTyZl19Oo1rA.text: Met buddy on a Thursday afternoon. Little busy indoors, plenty of seating outside. Bar right in between both dining areas.   Ate at bar, wait was longer than predicted. No biggie, was in no rush.  Appetizer 1 - Ceviche. Fresh but a bit bland. Small bowl as well.  Appetizer 2 - Loaded Chips. Very tasty, plenty to share unless you're greedy. Good amount of crema, caramelized onions and bacon. Can as with or without blue cheese.  Sandwich Porkwich w/side. Pulled pork s'wich wasn't bad, just the right amount of BBQ (gold sauce as they call it). Crunchy coleslaw provided as well. Different tastes for different buds, this bud would have liked to taste a hint of spice. After all, this is the south west.   Bartenders very attentive, not arrogant or pushy. Friend and I were there for a couple of hours. Kudos guys (and gal)!  Need to pee? Walk by the wall of cassettes. Bit of history if you bring your kiddos (please don't take them though, I'll provide some money for your baby sitter fund).

GMJIUuVRNWqgdJy3SnNUOA.text: All I can say is YUM!!!   Went here for happy hour and the deviled egg dip appetizer is amazing! They also have an awesome drink selection.  Came back for lunch and then brunch and LOVED the crab cake eggs Benedict. Hands down the best eggs Benedict in Arizona. Also tried the brown bag chicken sandwich and it was solid too.  Never have had anything here that wasn't outstanding. Give it a try!

pubKS6uwc5pfrtYH0uP00Q.text: Another great addition to Central Phoenix! Stopped in for dinner last weekend with my wife and absolutely loved this place. Pulling up it didn't look the big, but after the valet took our car and we saw the back patio, the bar, and the dining room we were quite impressed. We sat in the front room which is great and you can't even tell that you're right on Central Avenue. I had the Crab Cake BLT and my wife had the Picnic Kebobs. Both of us found our food to be delicious and the service was fast and attentive.   I want to go back again and try the ceviche and some of the specialty cocktails. I can definitely see hanging out at this place when I am home in Phoenix.

GjsMU1qWcodzsETwpb1a9A.text: Always a great meal here!  Love the Wait staff and their bubbly personalities! Pot roast is to die for!  Great ambiance both in and out side.  Very relaxing and definitely a place to visit again soon!

l31Xh_7S2oi-NVGubYH-Cw.text: The Windsor is the  perfect spot to take a group of friends for lunch or dinner -- the food is well-portioned and served quickly. Their salads are top-notch and I highly recommend their chicken sandwich as well. I live in the area, so I wholeheartedly expect to stop by regularly for a quick bite I wish I worked closer to this location to also take advantage of the amazing happy hour deals and refreshing selection of cocktails.

Xil_XGMRW-sow790cnyMfQ.text: I've never had a bad time at the Windsor! I eat a lot of different things there but the porkwhich is stupid good. If you like pork and you like sandwiches and you like a little bit of a mess eat this sandwich because any time you throw a little coleslaw and a little honey mustard on pork I'm in but they got it just right! That was a really long sentence but I had to get it all out. If you really want to have your mind blown maybe add a  number 17 cocktail on the rocks and substitute the fries for Joe's potatoes, just sayin...

mw1obblNh-jn5XXyZ0J1eA.text: Eat at the bar!! We arrived on a typical Saturday night - BUSY with a 45min wait.  So we opted for seats at the bar.  Boy did we kit the jackpot.  The bar staff is top notch, attentive, and very conscience of checking on how we were doing without being over bearing. Loved the food - I guess that's why we keep coming back.   Keep up the good food and cold beers.

asfNl-EvELBbftLc0VtZwQ.text: Being from TN I like to think that I hold BBQ to a decent standard, Windsor's Porkwich definitely met it! This is the first place we went to upon our arrival to Phoenix for lunch! A travel guide had recommended it and it was a great spot for lunch and great prices! Plus who can beat $5 dollar pitchers! Afterward make sure to hit up Churn next door for homemade ice cream!

8Gw8Mt3hF9GK-xTbalo5vw.text: Best breakfast I have had in AZ. Atmosphere is amazing. Food is fantastic. I want to go back RIGHT NOW!

mSjbObN6xftX9CRZfd3M0A.text: Reallly nice place, a small wait time for dinner time but worth waiting for. Food was good and service was spot on. Had a larger group they accommodated for inside after deciding outside was not going to be as comfortable.

0nB-GewXHzl2yrRim7d9qQ.text: This place came highly recommended from a few people.  Great atmosphere, good for groups or a date.  Pretty upbeat younger sophisticated crowd most with a sense of style.  We both ordered the ahi tuna salad.   It was amazing the seared ahi was done just right.  They forgot the avocado so they brought some out on a the side and added some herbs.  The size and portions were perfect especially since i was counting my macros.   They ended up taking some money off the bill for the little mistake.  Overall it a was a great experience, the food was amazing.  I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gJnmD5-vV1ZI1qLuYyUBQA.text: Let me start by saying Central Phoenix are the best, but the Windsor in my mind really stands out. The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable, the food is always on point, and the handcrafted cocktails show the love they have for their craft. Great wine selection (my wife's favorite). We frequent the Windsor at least 2  or 3 times per week and it's always our go to for visiting friends!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RVLJAu3ROXf5xaTe1nZZOA.text: Hi Windsor. Wink. I think I'd like to keep you. This place gets even more wonderful every single time. I've ventured into nearly all of the menu by now, and all of the items I want to try. When there's a lot of different things on the menu that interest my tummy, that's a good thing. Don't lose that part of you.  What's my favorite so far? Probably the fondue for an appetizer and the windsor burger (no tomato) and church potatoes for dinner. That seems to be the popular choice I make 80% of the time.  So.  What about the other 20%? BRUNCH BITCHES. Yes. There's brunch now as if this place couldn't get any better. Lovely, delicious, amazing brunch. Brunch with $5 pitchers of drinks. Brunches with some of the best biscuits I've ever had with my biscuits and gravy. Brunches that left the large group of people I came with amazed and full.   The service is usually right on point. The food is always incredible. The decor I cannot seem to get enough of, and even though I am not a fan of having to valet, you make it complimentary. And the valet people are pretty cool. Is it sad that I'm nearly on a first name basis with them as well?  I beg you to stay, Windsor. And challenge you to deliver brunch to my house.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Windsor&#39;s version of biscuits and gravy.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch at Windsor? Yes please.

iDNsEKzG_jubWmL6E6Qu8A.text: Relaxing atmosphere even when it's hopping. Great tunes always playing. Fantastic food...anything on the menu will wow you. Servers are always gracious and friendly. Can't say enough good things about this place!

5xj7Fq0LYLrdDLN9nx1C3g.text: Great atmosphere! had a lunch date with my amigo. food was tasty! i ordered their brown bag chicken sandwich, very good nothing like my school brown bag lunch. rotisserie chicken water chestnuts goat cheese and other yummy stuff. The best part $5 pitchers till 5pm! say WHAAT!? so yes i stayed for 2 pitchers haha. Staff was very Friendly and they never let your drinks get empty. i am defenitly going back.

LZMOWdgxFBlETcPtLKP9dw.text: I love this place. The drinks for happy hour are really generously poured. Anyone I've taken here has loved the food. The kale salad is my favorite. The mac n cheese is also to die for. Service is great and I've never had much of a weight.

cR4rZru-67NRKzlyOSVJuA.text: This review is mostly due to the absolutely horrible attitude our table was given and the horrible service by the server named Emma.  Why in the world they would have someone so miserable working there is beyond me.  The food won't even get a review. We couldn't get past the fact we wet treated as a huge inconvenience to our server.

F16Lc9FlPg6sUdhvbzr_Cw.text: Better for brunch, than dinner IMO. My least favorite of the 4 restaurants in the area, but the others are sort of amazing.  The atmosphere is nice, but the music selection was really odd. I think they had 'The Humpty Dance' blaring when we came in? The food was fine, but nothing super memorable.   Brunch is a bit better, with some interesting choices, plus a good bloody mary bar.

qDxCfyYuNs47ydT8fCUSaw.text: I met some friends here for brunch which is a recent undertaking for these folks.  I liked the atmosphere.  The service was great.  Maybe a bit pricey but not out of line.  I ordered the crab cake Benedict and it was absolutely delicious!  I wish I had not been going to run machinery afterward as I would have liked to try their Bloody Mary bar.  I did get to try their sausage gravy, ordered by 5 of our party, and did not care for it but those that ordered it loved it.  I also got to sample the pancakes with strawberries and mascarpone and it was tasty but I thought the pancake was a little on the spongy side.  I had heard about the parking problems and parked at the shopping center just a couple of blocks away and walked over.  As it gets better known this will definitely be a hot spot for weekend brunches.

KOX1aCi_O8xEkGqGEIo0Ag.text: I can't WAIT to get back to Phoenix again to explore this little gem a little further.  Fabulous food and cocktails abound.
