LOVE the contemporary indoor-outdoor atmosphere; it almost makes you feel like you're in a REAL urban area.  Plus, the local crowd is a great mix and quite friendly.  Try sitting at the bar to do a little mingling (if you're so inclined).  We tried a couple of different cocktails, which were both simply fantastic.  Further, we tried a mixed grain salad, which was simply fantastic.  It was perfectly balanced and the orange basil vinaigrette was PERFECT.  If only all healthier cuisine tasted that damn good!  I'm sorry that we had already eaten.  Otherwise, I can't wait to sample some of their other culinary creatioions (which all looked fabulous).

APT4eCfGERbf2X2hyQNS6Q.text: Came for late lunch.  Easy parking and quickly seated.  Our server was warm and bubbly and lovely.   She gave great recommendations and highlighted her favorites.   We ordered and the food came quickly.  The soup I had ordered was not offered but a replacement was given.   Server apologized and offered to bring something else.   I kept the soup and it was wonderful.   The salads were crisp and tasty and had great flavor.   It was a great experience and I will come back again.

RbRaxTsNJDfArOvnKbm0eg.text: Straight out Brooklyn, Mission District, or even Austin comes the preferred home of the Phoenix hipster.  A very solid menu, patio and ambiance.  Conversely the parking situation and service leave a little to be desired.

Sv9xyun-ZzIzRP9WAiidPw.text: I've been here a number of times and have never been disappointed.  The food is wonderful, the service spot on, and the ambiance is first rate hipster :)  While I've eaten dinner here a couple of times, my favorite experience was for brunch.  The menu is limited but truly first rate.  I went with three guy friends and we couldn't believe how good the food was.  I had the Biscuits & gravy with sausage and it was the best I've EVER had-hands down (and I've had a lot). The sausage is locally procured from Shriner sausages and it was off-the-hook.  I actually made a pilgrimage to Shriner to buy some to cook at home.  This place is becoming legendary, try it soon, you won't be disappointed!

7kLeXqqDBeE6zrWu0Ky_3w.text: Love that Wayne and Garth are the hosts here! Party on Wayne. The food and drinks are my favorite here in Phoenix. Try the cinnamon roll and cheesy hash browns. $5 dollar pitchers on weekends! Wow. Girls - Leave the heels at home. Grab a beanie.

-9qO6sP55sGzjlhTSOhyMg.text: I love this place! Windsor is everything you want in a dive bar with none of the dirty dive bar characteristics.  Amazing food, delicious drinks, and wonderful drink specials.   While the menu isn't extensive, I would eat anything and everything on there.  I crave the Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich (especially since moving to  Colorado) and the Kale Salad is my favorite side.  Don't forget the Loaded Chips to start!!  The best part, the staff is so easy going when we use the coupons we receive for being in the email list.  Never do they make you feel like a cheapskate for using one and I have never been turned away for only having the email on my phone (not printed).   Dude, you guys rock!    I'll be in Phoenix next week and you better believe this place is on my to-do list!

9YEvpNgk3NHvDqnKVCU7gg.text: Windsor  is a trendy, upscale restaurant. It was crowded and noisy on a Saturday afternoon.  Overall our group of about fifteen people was happy with their lunches, .The menu is varied and interesting, not run of the mill fare. Many expressed a desire to return to Windsor and try some other dishes.  Our server did a  good job, although plates were served in a staggered manner, a kitchen problem probably. At our table a friend had to wait 15  minutes after the rest of us were served, and at another table a friend was not served at all. Waiter made it right and comped his meal (no charge).  My Fatoush salad was pretty good, it was the only salad without kale. Suggest it be served with pita bread on the side not as croutons. A friends hummus appetizer was very tasty but more veggies would make it better.  After the meal we popped into Churn next door for an ice cream cone, the Vietnamese coffee flavor was delicious. Even the cone tasted special, not the usual cones served everywhere else. We enjoyed sitting in the rear at their pleasant shaded patio.  Later learned that Churn and Windsor have the same owner.

qo14-Gto8kMjXwoJyZc-1w.text: Went there Thursday July 7th for lunch. Had a great experience and delicious food. Manny was the bartender and was quick and efficient. Very hospitable and friendly. His great service was reinforced by Jet as well who was very humble and welcoming. Had the fatuche salad and rulette peppers super good! Looking forward to getting the burger next time! Thanks guys-Jeremiah@PK

WQOJtFEe86Y3USGdevqrTA.text: I have been here twice, once for dinner and once for brunch.  I do like the ambience of the place because it provides that great welcome feeling.  The food is pretty good here and I haven't been here enough to try out other things on the menu so am planning on visiting here often.  The parking lot is easy access plus some street parking and I like the fact they are next to an awesome ice cream place when you feel the need for a big dessert.  Going to be at Windsor a little more to try out other things.

c44RE0aMqAO75EG0c59aug.text: Another great restaurant from the Upwards Projects team. I had been to Churn multiple times and always wanted to check out the food and patio next-door over at the Windsor. They have a great patio and happy hour special. The ambience of this place is very relaxing and welcoming. It is a perfect place to come after work with friends or co-workers to grab a beer and chill. They have plenty of beers and mixed drinks to choose from and menu options.  I started with an order of the Russian Roulettes. The menu description reads, "Seasonal peppers sauteed in lemon & olive oil. Some are hot & some are not!" My table loved the appetizer. Delicious peppers with just the right about of seasoning and spice. The rest of the menu consists of sandwiches and burgers. I had The Berkeley black bean burger and it was great.   I cannot wait to come back here again to explore more of the menu and enjoy that beautiful patio.

piiBZVFFjeqs8YkMWOU71w.text: Great vibes and awesome cocktails, but the menu has been lacking lately. I noticed they changed it up and there aren't very many options any more. The sandwiches are great, but who wants to be shoving a massive burger in their face on a date? If you DGAF what your date thinks, get the ruben. You won't look good eating it, but it's freaking good.  Order the fondue appetizer. It's worth it. I usually pass on dessert since they share a wall with Churn.    They just need to add some more variety back for dinner options.

aN9_Kk3pTtie5ShGU-dMuA.text: Their corn dog poppers was bomb.com while I was pregnant! Exactly what my little pregnant self craved. Lol my husband love their ribs. It's sweet but has a little flare to it. Yum yum yum!

dweHcJBeAaYZIU19dcKAjw.text: I only got the soup and salad combo. Water.   So why the four stars?  Ambience.  Oh my lord.  When you enter this place it just automatically makes you feel like one of those trendy, hot, hipster people... I was just a regular asian chick before I walked in.  As soon as I entered, I was one cool cat.  Hahahha, obviously I don't sound like one.   This would be a great place for date night.  If I lived in Arizona...this would definitely be a spot of mines.   Broccoli cheddar soup was thick and full of flavor.  Chop salad was perfect with kale, avocado, and fried okra!  Service is nice and goddamn!  The staff has the sickest sense of style.  It's like they all walked out of a fashion show.   Bonus: their wall made of cassette tapes.  Love.

ufBA2J6qgcXNn6rHI3onFg.text: Very relaxed and cool place for specialty cocktails as well as standard drinks. Apps are large enough to share and pretty unique. Ceviche is fresh and crisp, that's not too fishy. Would recommend to others as well as return for after work drinks.

zcBg-1rTnKH2g7RiS-QJxg.text: My friends and I have been wanting to try this restaurant forever so we finally came to check it out. The restaurant was a little tricky to find. The inside of the restaurant was cozy and I really liked the cassette wall display. We made it for happy hour so all pitchers and drinks were $5. You can't beat that!  I ordered the Bahn Mi halibut sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese & my boyfriend ordered the Crab Cake BLT with a side of their Jo's Church potatoes. Both dishes were amazing and the sides were just as good. I would defiantly recommend the Jo's church potatoes. It tastes like Cracker Barrels hash town casserole but better. My friends got the Porkwich sandwich and Bacon Cheese burger. The pork on the sandwich was juicy with lots of flavor and the sandwich just melted in your mouth. Overall the food and drinks were great and the staff was friendly. Our server made sure our drinks were full every time and I liked that we didn't have to ask for refills. I would defiantly recommend this place and we will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bahn Mi Halibut Sandwich with a side of Mac &amp; Cheese and the Crab Cake BLT with a side of the Jo&#39;s Church Potatoes. Amazing!

J10DI0WfterzxqbrF5RALw.text: Happy hour ENDS at 5pm?  Totally lame.  The food was ok, but nothing really great.  I had the halibut sandwich which sounded amazing and looked great based on the Yelp pics I saw, but it left me disappointed.  Split the kabobs with the table. The shrimp was the best part, the pork was dry and chewy, the chicken just ok.  The mac and cheese, good not great.  The Jo's Church potatoes were not as good as expected based on the pics I saw.  Overall, this place was just ok and way over priced.  I don't have interest in going back here.

mpUI-C86ACK-0IR9E9d47g.text: Everything about this place speak to me as a local neighborhood bar with defined taste. As a random dweller of bars/pubs i always enjoy the setting of this venue it blends in the neighborhood perfectly with its own charm.   As a big plus theres an ice cream shop connecting to the restaurant bar. Definitely recommend to other friends when in town or even local friends.   Way More accessible than some of the restaurants near the area

6IpAOvGvEAVaGyI9htVesA.text: Excellent burgers! $5 happy hour pitchers and specialty drinks as well! Ceviche was really good as well! Yum!

v4bYNxy5zxkE4F3BR7rDvg.text: Yummy burgers!! And amazing service!!! Watching the staff truly take care of everyone here. Such great service that I could not wait to post a review!

AKvE7x7IBtIjRZmnzcescg.text: Mellow Mushroom's newest addition to their empire has kept its gastronomic reputation alive and well!  Enough said on that topic! If you like the sun in your eyes while you enjoy the tasty delights available .. this is the place for You!  Whatever crazy firm was hired to design this building must live in Portland or some other sunless, heatless locale.  The kitchen wall is on the east side and the dining windows and patio are on the west.... And the view? The blazing sun and traffic!  Granted, we have some glorious sunsets, but not this time of year and no one should have to wear sunglasses to eat their dinner.  I hope someone figures a way to correct the situation.

0u6pIbPHD0ArPY7hvYBNBg.text: Tasty food and drinks!  I had a drink from the happy hour menu with cucumber (can't recall the name) that I loved! I also loved the laid back hipster vibe. A great place for  small groups like ladies night out or after work drinks.

UXgam5f3WQ6GYokNx4FW2Q.text: I am really, really loving this new restaurant and must admit I am kinda addicted.  That being said, this review is probably a little altered.    Honestly, I am not sure what I love the most. I have been there three times now, from a weekday to a Happy Hour and I haven't had any issue with parking.  The wait for a seat was minimal, and the patio was inviting as the bar was fun, and the tables are sooo cozy.    The cocktails are GREAT. I am addicted to the one with Ginger, but I can't remember the name of it.  I love the wine being on tap, it's eco-delicious.  I enjoy the company of everyone at the restaurant and I seem to see people I know there most often. The bartenders are a delight, they introduce themselves and talk a lot about the menu and choices, etc.  Even the owner/manager person (whoever she was) came by and asked what we thought of the meals, drinks, atmosphere, etc.    I also love the wall of tapes, and watching families bike in and get ice cream and sit in the floral decor of the comfortable patio with cute kids...very inviting. I could see bringing a date here (alas I am married now, so my date is my hubby), but I would also bring my parents and my son here.    I loved the Halibut, the Kale Salad, the snacks, the Sausage Sandwich and I can't wait to go again and try more.  With the closing of Bomberos/Verde/My Florist, the burning of Richardsons,  the crowds at Postino, the valet only at the Vig, the lack of fresh salads at the Garage, cold (warm) food at Local Breeze and the disappointing service at Arrogant Butcher - this place moved quickly up to a top choice for dinner and drinks.  Move over Hula's, SENS, Hanny's, TMI, Rokerij and CIBO! :-)

be84nyodwbT2UsX3UOvJxw.text: Loved our server in the patio this morning, great drinks! I was able to park my bike. Yay!

tZOx_yMHVLhjG901tMhgPw.text: It's 5 o'clock somewhere but you want to get here before 5 because that's when happy hour ends. I have not tried their food but their atmosphere is undeniably Upward Projects. I just wish they had more beer on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gy-Y1YcNRxCn2V6xJ894EQ.text: Great service, great food, and great ambience! Highly recommend. I got the chicken sandwich with the Mac and cheese and it was superb!

F-932dZj1k4hi3JcXLMJKg.text: What is not to like about Windsor. I love this place. You know that "go-to" place you always go to because it's always good...well I this is it. Impressive. Seriously. The food is spot on. The best,I mean the best, did I mention the best, pulled pork sandwich. The bartenders are soooo tired of me telling them. Annoying or they already know, you decide. Anyway, go here. And check out the old school candy and ice cream shop down the hall. Yes, down the hall. Totally connected yo.

eJdBNuDm6rweNkL3ul-Dfg.text: This place has potential with its location and the ambience that they try to put together but unfortunately the food is just blah and the service is merely ok. I got the Ahi tuna salad which I have ordered at many restaurants before and I have to say if I had to rank the top 10 this one was the worst. Barely edible, Sad face... I sat at the bar and there was no small chitchat from any of the bartenders or servers. Oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Lackluster Ahi Tuna Salad...

8RPHR1yw6aNTR9IuFRgbfQ.text: Great experience! Francesca was awesome. Food was outstanding! Happy hour all day. Get the egg dip! Highly recommend this friendly neighborhood spot.

NAVJ-aFJO67ZGGLyHV5vqg.text: This place not only has amazing food, but amazing atmosphere as well. Great place to have brunch, especially on the patio when it isn't too hot. There's options for all sorts of tastes, and their beignets are a must have for the table whenever my friends and I come. Along with that, this place is very photogenic and there's a great ice-cream place connected to the building. Definitely recommend for anybody looking for good food along with atmosphere.

7N7CxpW4VHEUzRhRIEMQdg.text: Cute little place, had brunch here and they had $5 cocktails .. amazing  I really like the vibe here. Very laid back and I had the crab cake sandwich, very big! Along with some gin and cucumber drink, they're all strong and great

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hU5dtp9iymb5SfqYOLWOyA.text: You got to give it to a place that in Phoenix when it's hot,  has no problem helping out the needy! I really love the food the atmosphere is awesome and the staff is absolutely exceptional

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RD315HxhCtKAQPlIgs5Akg.text: We love the atmosphere, service, food, drink and especially their happy hour. The picnic kebabs was a perfect sharing plate. The pork and chicken were moist and went well with the mustard sauce. The shrimp had a nice flavor. We ate the pita with the spicy peppers. My friends wanted to order more.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Salad
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Market fish: Honey soy glazed salmon with squash, bok choy, pickled cucumber and carrot. Very good.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage veggies soup

LUjXUfHA20KInTKCtNMtoA.text: This is one of my favorite spots for brunch.  Really unique menu.  Great drink specials.  Lovely patio too.

9NuaYbp4tW5kAsOb_zrD-A.text: I cannot sing enough praise for this place. Food was cooked to perfection and the flavors imaculate. The staff is friendly, helpful, and happy. The trendy but approachable atmosphere makes for and all around delightful place to spend a Sunday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3Yw5nE2awXd40tmmtWVLtw.text: The atmosphere is very attractive, and the food I have tried so far has not disappointed. Staff could be a little friendlier and more attentive -- but service wasn't bad!!

8J8RiM4XLJEbzbezUoR6ug.text: What a fun place. Can't believe I never stopped in before. Very busy place. Perfect location for brunch on weekends. Comfort food and great bar staff. Had the egg salad with chips, a great shareable app followed by a burger. Everything was well prepared and presented. Definitely go here for a casual dining or drinking experience. They have an excellent outside area with fireplace as well!

OB8EQhCi7x06VCXEKbXErA.text: The staff was friendly. I sat at the bar. The staff was nice to chat with. Good food and beer. I like the one guys accent.

FMVFbknAZ7ynMZkgvcVpHA.text: What a treat this place was. I brought my extremely picky grandmother here and she had nothing but great things to say. You can tell everything is fresh and house made, as it should be in the restaurant business. Food definitely has a southern comfort flare to it. Enjoy the nice evening outside on their expansive patio.

PCEaypKmL4uE4i4RAHe8dA.text: Had a wonderful brunch with the fam.  The service was great, Jacob and Vanessa were lovely. The food and drinks were good as well.  Definitely will come back and try their dinner options.

QLR5sxvkzSFq_Rjvd-GVSQ.text: Good pub food, a bit better selection than traditional pub food. Really good beer selection and outside space. Cool vibe.

8ortRKFJQ6xqDZyL17WzXA.text: I too Love this place!  I mentioned it to one of the gals sitting next to me.   The staff is hard working & attentive  (excellent!) - but didn't like the veggie burger.  I'll have to try the veggie salad  next time.  Thx Windsor-what a wonderful place!

xKh8HBhFuip3JoTNov7CSQ.text: Really good loaded potato chips. I got it without bacon and it was delicious. Russian roulette peppers don't disappoint either. Highly recommend. Good service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Kqi2tOXV76seHvYcZCf7Yg.text: Oh man. I used to loooooove coming to Windsor. For drinks mostly, but food has always been up to par.. I always had perfect service, enjoyed my time and never complained. But something changed in the last year. I never wanted to write a review because I have always appreciated the staff, but the last few times I came have been very much far from my expectations. Food coming out wrong often, buns dry to the point they taste like a 7 day old croissaint... a bartender once asked me "what do you want me to do" after we got food we did not order... I used to come here a lot, but I think there are many other restaurants to visit in the area instead unfortunately.

iT2cGQw2v2bP6YeGDhC8Bg.text: The prices are steep. Didn't really care for my food, however my husband loved his burger. It was very tasty!   The $5 drinks are super yummy, not strong but a perfect little refresher.

V9gzhvmakflZGTlTNb5WXw.text: First timer. The fondue is PERFECTION! Cocktails...overpriced. Way too loud, dark, crowded and hot for me at 6pm on a Saturday. The staff was friendly enough. Some patrons tonight were rude, not Windsor's fault though. I will give it a try  again in the fall and sit outside...maybe that will help??

x880ryKCB1wEp99D-Xr5_g.text: I have been here a couple times now and it's a new favorite. I figured it would be of course being in the Postino family and I wasn't disappointed. I shared a sample platter of appetizers (best smoked salmon ever) and a burger and each was superb. There also is a delicious cocktail with rum and orange marmalade syrup. Not too sweet, just delicious!

Jn3G3AATkNYl4naQJOk3Gg.text: We had a great experience.  We got a reasonably-priced bottle of good wine and 2 meals for way under what we've seen at other places with less ambiance and less quality.  The staff is attentive, the ambiance is tres-comfortable and we'll look forward to coming back many times in the future.

Imapoz3PXSXtpnHb7Z2ygQ.text: I love this place! Wish there was one in the East Valley. Here's a tip:  Ceviche and the No. 29. Thank me later.   Plus, it's just cool as hell.

MnhUlWsJDoppqD_jbJJ4vQ.text: Came here after attempting to go to the Vig Arcadia (which was way too crowded with a 2 hour wait).  My husband's friend had recommended it.  We were both pleasantly surprised.  We had a 20 or so min wait so we grabbed a couple beers at the bar.  Score! $7.50 for 2 pints of Stella. I don't think we've had a beer that cheap since our college days.  The bartenders were really nice as was the hostess.  We were seated outside which is a very nice patio with misters.  They had a great playlist of background music which added to the candlelit ambience.  I wasn't too hungry so ordered the ceviche for my entree and my husband had the windsor burger with roasted veggies.  Omg. Those roasted veggies were da bomd! I was upset because I usually pick fries off of his plate....but these veggies were exceptionally tasty.  The ceviche was okay.  His burger was cooked perfectly and prob one of the best burgers in phoenix so far (more so than vinburger, smashburger).  Being this place is fairly close to home with a great ambience, fair priced drinks and good food, we will definitley be back!

o3fAPhQng1C63DE36g_HCg.text: I went to Windsor yesterday with a friend. We got there about 3:15 - no problem parking right in front and lots of tables - mid-afternoon great time, of course.  We ordered the Mixed Grain Salad and the Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich with a side of Kale Salad and then split everything. On my own I wouldn't have ordered the sandwich probably, but it was very good. I especially liked the Kale Salad - terrific. The Mixed Grain Salad was very good, my friend liked it better than I. I'm not a big fan of beets - she is.   Service was great - both James and Jamie. Service was friendly, prompt and efficient. My water got refilled quickly and cheerfully - I'm a big drinker.   The atmosphere is pretty hip - too hip for me, but I just ignored that. The music was rather loud. Not sure if there had been more people there if that would have drowned out some of the loudness or just added to it.   Definitely plan to go back. Mid-afternoon is a good time to go.

WnVHSNunV4W0HhlQL1TTjw.text: Service has gone downhill recently.  Our orders have come out wrong the past 2 visits.  Also, the food takes forever to come out and long stretches of time will pass without anyone checking on you.  I don't care for the six-hipster-servers-per-table approach, as most of them look annoyed if you need something and/or ignore you, while your "main" server seems to vanish after taking your order.  They should stick to the traditional method of one (hipster) server to a table.  But I love the food, so I will put up with it.

YhehSH57NS5DOOXsDZ5ElQ.text: Amazing food. Vegetarian hummus pita dish was incredible. I will be coming here again for sure. :)

IH3xRXwygeYH8orFRXfWCQ.text: I'm used to going to brunch after 1pm so I guess you really couldn't call it brunch.  I had just gotten out of church when I received a phone call from my best friend W.  He asked if I want to go eat at Windsor.  I had never been to Windsor and, of course I complained because I didn't think they were going to give me enough food to fill me up.  Remember, I am a fatboy trapped in a skinny mans body.  He promised I wouldn't be disappointed.  As we pulled up to Windsor, my first impression as we walked in the door was WOW.  I feel in love with the way the place was set up.  As we sat down, a friendly waitress came and took our drink and appetizer order.  She brought the drinks but she never brought the appetizers.  Then she came back and took our order.  She brought out our food but never brought out the appetizers.  We asked about the appetizers and she said she was so sorry and brought over her manager.  The manager told us she was sorry for the mishap and would comp our bill $17.00 since they forgot to put in our appetizers.  I couldn't believe this place.  It was like heaven.  Needless to say, my meal left me full and satisfied.  The service was great.  The atmosphere was wonderful, and the staff was amazing.  I think I have found my new spot every Sunday afternoon after church.

3oPKHJpEw2YTMPSK16qJrg.text: I dig this place.  Yes, it's hipster heaven but the servers are about as good as you can get.  I eat lunch here a couple times per month and the bartenders are friendly and on top of things.  I'll normally get the bacon burger, which is fantastic.  I've also had the Fried Chicken and it is excellent as well.  This place has a great vibe going on and when the weather permits, the outside seating is a must.  I guess it doesn't hurt that they have Churn right next door too (Ice Cream shop).  Every first timer must have the deviled egg dip; it's a right of passage.  Come to Windsor, good food + quality staff = epic high five!

N9RdmLqxHQ5OWRRD3X5qxA.text: Mac and cheese was great. Bacon cheese burger was excellent. Windsor sauce was a great addition to the burger. Bacon was thick and crispy. The corn dog poppers and loaded chips were very good. Lobster roll was unsatisfactory and bland. Drinks were excellent. Number 14 to me, was a perfect mix of jalapenos and watermelon. I will most likely go back and explore the menu further.

1w3aKdxUg_GN_E10g1hoyw.text: Great place for burgers, salads and decadent mac and cheese.  Service is outstanding!  Drinks are great especially during happy hour.  A must visit place in the central phoenix area.

be8jzzI_uxRuX2Iey_lKkA.text: We usually hang out at Windsor for appetizers and drinks. I don't love the menu for a full meal; its mostly salads and sandwiches. The kabobs with Gold dipping sauce are fabulous!  The cocktail menu is also awesome. Try the 63 - Bourbon and Grapefruit juice. It changed my life!  P.S. Not sure what Traci A. is talking about - I've never found the facilities to be anything but clean.

bdBY3iIrxs8hHJycLLj-Og.text: This place is fun, filling and delicious!  I like the outdoor/ indoor hybrid sort of space with the fun patio and interesting decor.    Careful ordering - everything is super massive and filling!  I normally get appetizers because I don't eat meat and their vegetarian entree is a little strange for me.  But Windsor's Mac and Cheese is killer as are the other sides I've tried.

nB7_9enHK8FmdI54VH0n8A.text: Always good food and atmosphere! The staff is super chill and friendly...the patio is a great spot to do a little day drinking! Must get the donut holes as an appetizer when going for brunch...

vbvyfJaJ1jlfM-TuI9KiBA.text: Awesome spot. Great beer, great food. $5 pitchers and glasses of wine for happy hour. AND, check this out, best ice cream I've had in Phoenix next door at Churn.

As3BBh7fYIi7wrNX2Dgjgw.text: Great scene. Crowd is a mix of hipster and young professionals. Great outdoor patio. Insanely packed bar and inside area. The drinks and food are great - service is pretty great. I loved that the bus-boy (I hate that term) knew we were waiting to get our check. He brought us our check, ran our credit card, and got us outta there ASAP. It was super busy, and our waiter wasn't able to get it done fast. I love that the bus-boy wasn't like "I'll get your server". He just took care of it. Great place - we'll be back!

ophfpJOtnbbFMCS1pO87Pg.text: The Mixed Grains salad--with their house smoked salmon--was deeee-lish!  The goat cheese is the "icing" on top!  The ferro & quinoa make it filling salad.  Will def do this again!

XNr8ZCDv2LVKybhcIIOIyw.text: It doesn't get much better. Service was great. All the employees serve a purpose in each dinning experience so there's a great flow to the meal. I had side kale salad and was pleasantly surprised. Backyard burger was delish. And the kids menu hits the spot for all parents. Thanks guys!

3XUCUf5mvVGYrf92H870Rg.text: So.Freaken.Tasty.  I FINALLY convinced the hubs that even though the parking situation here is bleak (we earned this from going to Churn a few times) that we should give Windsor a shot. Upon pulling up to the valet we learned it was free (Tips only) Woot!   There were 5 of us and we were starved. We ordered 4 apps! We got the pretzel with the cheese dip, it was pretty nom worthy. We also got the corn dog poppers, they were ok, I wish the breading was more dense like the breading at the fair. We also got the chips, pretty dang tasty oh and also the kabobs which were good, nothing amazing but not terrible either.   Next up the food. A friend and I decided to split two items so we could taste test. I got the pulled pork sandwich and he got the burger with the caramelized onions. Both were great though I favor the burger over the pork.   We also had 5 pitchers of STELLA!!!! Stella on tap is pretty rare! So excited about that!   we will for sure be going back to Windsor!

MzsehzzpYG-EB5iHxbitGw.text: By far the best burgers I have ever had and great atmosphere. Discovered this place over a year ago and I always have to take my guest who are visiting me from out of town.

qFw6n5VYmVhMeO0SytxpwQ.text: Had some great food.  Waiter was nice and met our every needs.  The food was so good, the mac and cheese, cheese tray, pot pie was excellent.   Funny thing, the Arnold Palmer was one of the best.  Will continue to support.

jfnxAiToee6safeJakY56A.text: Came back here again with friends. I kept hearing nothing but good things and my experience was still, "meh". It has a cool atmosphere but the food is really nothing special.

TsUeEketsdxVP9xEc4_nLA.text: Great food & outstanding service. I love, love love the Crab cake sandwich, the Hong Kong and Fattoush salads.  The servers are friendly, helpful & knowledgeable. I am usually fortunate enough to have Lisa as my server, & let me tell you they don't come any better than her.  It has become my go to place!!!

6utlTWSWnHrAfrVvGD78cg.text: I would go just for the raspberry lemonade. Food was decent, service was alright. My only complaint is that the music was too loud. I don't know if  it's normally that loud, but they should lower it early in the evening when the place is full of families.

BZEdvYkVT91bxwUQCzIBXQ.text: OK...hot cheese, pretzels and Shreiner sausage...not a bad start to a scrumptious meal.  Had a delicious fish sandwich with a chopped kale salad.  Who knew that something that is natures scrub brush could taste SO good.  The staff is nice, but not over the top.  I think they're too busy to give that personal touch...but they were attentive.

C1vP0mosMMh1DwJ3enzNCg.text: Another hit for the Upward Projects people.  Friendly staff, delicious menu, great space...this place has it all.  The patio is beautiful for warm AZ nights, and it's dog friendly too.  Check out the pretzel fondue, and the Joe's church potatoes.  Bloody Mary bar for weekend brunch is pretty great too.  Plus, it's next to Churn for your sweet tooth.

h693NBT5O_ddsztYQpEbwA.text: Love this place.  Excellent food, great fast service.  Great atmosphere.  Everything made fresh with love.  Excellent value and I love that happy hour of $5 for ALL cocktails, Wine by the Glass and a Pitcher of Draft Beer, everyday before 5pm.  What a deal!  If you like martinis, you will love the No17 Cucumber Vodka, with fresh Cucumber & Mint, and Green Tea Syrup.  Very refreshing and great tasting.  Yum!!!!!!!  Will keep going back for more.  Manny,  the Bar Tender is excellent!!!

fTXHZudwHSbpfObx7IZLeg.text: Came for the second time and I still can't believe the exceptional service I was offered by our waiter Sammy. He was so friendly and it was a coincidence we had the pleasure to have him. He is so nice and personable. The food was amazing and the drinks again were to die for! We had pulled pork sandwiches  and salads. Both had amazing flavor and the atmosphere of was fun and accepting  to anyone and everyone. I recommend everyone to try it here! And ask for Sammy!!!!

vk0CFhyhjv_uwDVrg_eGjQ.text: Horrific service, mediocre food, great atmosphere.  The waitstaff was simply awful.  After sitting down the waitress came over and asked "are you ok with water?" as if she hoped we didn't order.  The bartender brought our drinks and took our order and was slightly more pleasant.  Someone else delivered our food by dropping the plates in front of us and left so quickly you'd think the place was on fire.  She didn't ask if we needed anything else or if we needed more drinks.  We didn't see anyone until we were done eating (and our drinks were dry) when the waitress ran by and dropped the check off on the table.  The atmosphere was the only thing worth going back for.

MpKWej-bE1p8nncCiL6bLw.text: I visited from Chicago recently for my bachelorette party and we made reservations here. The food was amazing! All my girls raved about what they ordered. I had the backyard burger, Windsor style, and it was delicious! The atmosphere was great, especially if you get patio seating, the service was prompt and courteous and our table was ready right away. The parking is very limited but they do have valet which is nice. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for something hip & not a chain. I will definitely be coming back on my next visit.

73t3eBpmktGnEgj9JcfVxw.text: I do love the food and the servers are wonderful...during the week day, at lunch, the music was so loud that I could hardly hear my guest...the people at the table next to us commented as well....the lunch crowd is not there for cocktails and partying.  The music consisted of a heavy beat and electric guitar..not condusive to a nice lunch background music....went to Switch for lunch instead of Windsor..since the server at Windsor said he 'tried to tell the manager...but...".  Windsor should take a lesson from Switch regarding the background music...love the place and will try again but if the music is as 'heavy and loud', I will make the 'Switch'  and my guests the place for lunch! Please wake up management and turn the music down for the lunch crowd...!!!!

8EeJi-V6GxfOJ88Zox2cTQ.text: This is hip and trendy eating establishment fills up quickly around lunch time. I did not like the fact that the hostess attempted to seat my companion and I all the way in the back of the restaurant, passing up several unserved tables. Nope, not on my watch. We split the fish sandwich and a chicken sandwich. I really really liked the fish sandwich. The flavors were layered and intense. The chopped kale salad was a nice alternative to a traditional garden salad. The chicken sandwich was a little bland. Our waitress was on top of it, I think her name was Lisa. I was not loving the flies buzzing around while we ate, but what can ya do.

s3cuKdE7mWlZODfWIuC5TQ.text: I really like the laid back atmosphere and the patio is great for enjoying some afternoon cocktails. The food menu is pretty solid and the drink menu is really good. An added bonus is the attached ice cream parlor!

yv3yqgyTb6m5CucEnfOlrw.text: I have been here several times and have never had a bad meal - all of there food is simply consistently good.  The mixed-grain salad with chicken is one of my favorites - but I also love the chiken salad sandwich, the burger and the reuban....now I just need to make it there in time for Brunch.  Thank you Windsor many pleasant experiences.

WqbCBbAu9vSY5krysqVf5A.text: Best Burgers and Sandwiches in town! Hip, Trendy and personalized customer service.  Best Happy hour and if you want to sit for desert go to Churn for sweet goodies.  Check it out for yourself!

m0m09u5SoNUO093xSSD3Jw.text: Had lunch today at Windsors. Food was great but the service by far was the worse we have ever had.  Our server checked on us once after our food was delivered and refilled water.  She never checked back or ask if we needed refills.  In fact I had to ask for a refill of tea and she never responded like "Sure" walked away to get our check brought the check back with no refill.  5 minutes later a busser brought the refill.  She was not engaging and never smiled actually came off as having a chip on her shoulder.  We frequent Windsors, Postinos, Federal pizza , and Joy Ride and have never had the experience we did today.   I say if you don't like your job perhaps you should consider a different one.  Disappointed.

z_zXBbzvhUEwll66RRoIsw.text: Deviled Egg Dip with a pint Odell 90 Shilling

Eq3x2angtftjg_AseB_lIQ.text: I've only been to Windsor for brunch, and everything on the menu is delicious. They're donut holes sinfully delicious. The cheddar harsh is mouthwatering greatness in your mouth. The Matidor is the right amount of favor explosions in your mouth.  The pancakes leave you speechless. You will wonder where they've been all your life.

5824uVWTF2WyZU0HmwwtPg.text: I met a friend for happy hour here earlier in the week.  We sat on the patio, which was really nice.  Along with some wine and beer, we shared the fondue.  Very yummy--particularly the pretzel pieces.  But then again, I love anything smothered in cheese sauce.  We didn't try anything else on the menu, but everything going by looked tasty.  The only reason for one fewer star than I would normally give is the parking situation.  It's bad, particularly if you come earlier than 6 pm.  Valet parking/the regular lot was full, so I was directed to park on the residential street behind the restaurant.  There were already about 30 cars parked on the street, and let's just say it's clear the neighbors are hostile about having their once- quiet street turned into a parking lot.  There are garbage cans along the curbs with signs that make it clear that they don't want you parking in front of their houses, and frankly, I don't blame them.  When I parked and got out, one of the homeowners confronted me verbally (while holding a hose and spraying water).  Again, I'm symphathetic.  I wouldn't want a bunch of people driving through my quiet neighborhood, but I also didn't want the smack talk I got after parking.  The Windsor/Churn owners need to resolve this problem before it gets uglier than being threatened with a spray of water.

YU0A7GTKWjlU2z45OxCydw.text: We were so excited to have another choice restaurant in North Central.  It has a great bar and patio, but I found the menu lacking.  I so wanted to love this place.  The hamburger I had was good, not great.  Did enjoy the fried okra, but found the mac and cheese dry and tasteless.   The wait staff was nonchalant and seemed to be more interested in each other than in waiting on tables.  Also, my daughter and her friends went there for a late dinner (they are all 24-26 years old).  They were carded but the waitress didn't believe them.  She sent the manager over who actually sat down at the table and had them each produce three more cards, which I thought was above and beyond.  After they had emptied their wallets, they did get their drinks, but the waitress, having been shown up, was rude to the girls after that.  It is a shame that this group of young women, who are all med students and law students, were subjected to this treatment and all have vowed never to return.

XKlCc_58H9A64D2ssHcybg.text: I had been looking forward to Windsor for a long time and was surprisingly disappointed on my first outing last night. Yes it's got a great vibe and all the cool hip people seem to be gathering there---at least for now. However, waiting 45 minutes for a table at 7? Ok fine, it is Friday afterall so I'll head off to the bar for a nice martini while I wait for a table and my friends. Surprisingly again, it was the WORST martini I've ever had: slightly cold at best and heating up on the 3rd sip. It was basically a semi cold cup of vodka w/ some washed out olive juice. I had to ask a bartender for a cup of ice to get it cold again--- yikes. When my friends met me they ordered wine and the pour was noticeably less than appropriate. Hmmm.... Dinner was ok, service was ok but it did seem like we were doing them a favor. At the end of dinner, a couple of us stayed to have a 3rd glass of wine and couldn't get any one to help us until we flagged down someone who seemed to be in a managerial position. He again gave us a distinct attitude of condescending benevolence to the point that, when he left our table, we all broke out in laughter. I don't know....it seems to me that the saving grace of this place is the crowd that's going there. I wonder how long will that last with the trickle down attitude and message that we were all privileged to receive?

xAOqye1YSk15wVjwHBvegg.text: Ok, super great food and mixologists that are seriously good!  We're always satisfied with our food, drinks and staff there.

iBk3oNo3Us3EluY8IIBlrw.text: Yes. B-day dinner...  It was good. All the sandwiches my table had were delicious. I went with my family so i got to try everyone's food  (thats how we roll). All the sandwiches had delicious and fresh ingredients. I got the porkwich, and that one would say doesn't sound too delicious but i was craving some pulled pork. The pulled pork + ham + sweet honey sauce/gravy they put ontop was so complimentary to each other. It was like going to a concert and hearing an awesome 3 part harmony on your tongue! Then the texture of the fresh coldslaw (which still had crunch) just was the high point.   Mac'n Cheese (MnC)...yess please! that was my side. It was baked...thats the way to go, had good texture with some crunch on top (yes i do like texture). The cheese didn't over power. It was a nice clean mac'n cheese, not sloppy and soaked with cheese. It was a good balance, and very light for being a MnC.  The backyard burger...get it..  the whitefish sandwich...get it.  brown bag chicken sandwich...get it..  Other chicken sandwich...get it..  Rueben....not as good as the others, BUT i loved how the meat was soo smokey that it makes up for it.... get it, but its not like that standard rueben you'd get from a deli, so just know that and don't go in with deli standards.  all in all. I love it and i'd come back..

OovBGxo9yt5yz6pr9goyjw.text: I found this place to be a gem for a Casual Drinker such as myself. I Love The #1! Calmer on a Wednesday after work. And a Joy on Sunday FunDay with the boys.   Brought My Partner's Parents here for a little southern delight and they enjoyed the POTATOES! WooHoo  I totally forgot the CrabCake Sandwich had a kick to it... It was a little too much of a kick for "Moms In Law"... But the wonderful staff was quick to correct with a light sampler of the other items on the menu for her to feel comfortable with. It was a Wonderful Night! Thank You Windsor Staff!  Only one thing I would recommend. More samples of the SWEETS from Churn... Haha the BANANA ice cream was oh so good. The late night run over to just have a scoop are so fun.

mA-UmcsIsm0i2hqfda83mQ.text: Stopped in again on the weekend. The place is busy as usual and service was a little slow, although it looked like the staff was working their butts off. We moved to the bar where we find we get a little faster service. Had some nice cocktails and ordered a sandwich. Just about when we decided that they must have lost our order, a staff member came out and told us we would be "comp" because they lost our order and our sandwich would be right out. WOW, how is that for customer service? We didn't expect to eat free, we could see they were busy and hey s__t happens. We would have been happy enough with were sorry we will get it out. Anyway it was very very nice of them. The sandwich was so good too. YUM, plus I love the chips.  Thanks Windsor you turned that around very nicely.

_gEGgaGcqGTVe8Z1elubyQ.text: really good happy hour specials , Great customer service and the food was amazing everything comes out really fresh with a lot of flavor would definitely recommend this place MUST try the Mac and cheese you will love it

cJnN1RnahfLcP1sqNKww1w.text: I don't know much more to say to add to the other 216 reviews, but this place is pretty epic.  My mom and I decided to try out a new joint for my birthday lunch and I found this place via my Yelp iPhone application (win!). This place is located on Central and Oregon (small side street) that we missed on our first attempt, but thanks to the Circle K reference sign, we found our way into the parking lot and found a spot without needing to use valet.   We ordered an iced tea while we looked at the menu and decided we were going to start with the Cheddar Foundue, I was going to have the Mixed Grain Salad and my mom was going to have the Crab Cake BLT. Our waitress brought back our iced tea, we places our ordered, and then sipped our iced that turned out to be super tastey and was garnished with an orange. We were already off to a good start!  The cheddar fondue came out next with the tea light candle heat keeping the, generous  portioned, cheddar cheese nice a creamy to dip our sausage, apple slices, and delicious scrumptious pretzel bread. Anyone that comes here needs to order this app! The Mixed Grain Salad and the Crab Cake BLT were both equally as enjoyable. The sandwich came with three small crabcakes ontop of a toasted hoagie roll. We chose the roasted veggies, that were doused in oil, but that's want made is so scrumptious! The mixed grain salad was also scrumptious....but on the more healthier side! :)  The restaurant  is decorated in super cute retro style and there is a very large patio, with misters, to enjoy lunch/dinner/happy hour on. From beginning to end, our food (and drink) experiences were amazing and we will both be back really, really, seriously, really, soon!!!

O5-jKXWkuMDLvbPHO2N0YQ.text: $5 cocktails and beers before 5 pm.  Attentive service.  Good music.  Nice decor.  The porkwhich and Joe's church potatoes are delicious.

BkFI4fYNpRrtsa9hsHU9Vw.text: Came in tonight for some light eats and drinks and was not disappointed! We shared the cheese fondue which was awesome to say the least. It came with sausage, pretzel rolls, and 2 kinds of apples. Try this cheese! We had the hummus plate as well and it was also very good. We shared a Ruben which was so great. A nice pile of pastrami and a whole grain mustard and sourkraut to boot on a marble rye roll. Fries were cooked great and came out nice and hot....which we proceeded to dip in the cheese. Yum! The hummus was creamy and came with unusual veggies for hummus like radishes and snap peas and more. Totally worked. The greek yogurt sauce had a smokey flavor to it. Very good. Friends had the church potatoes and some mac n cheese that they both scarfed down so Im assuming they were great as well. I had a cucumber drink that sounded weird but was actually delicious. Other friends had a different drink with blueberries blackberries and lemonade. Both very refreshing but I thought they were kinda pricey. Service was ok. She seemed nice but not real friendly. She seemed to just drop stuff and pick stuff up. No personality. She filled my ICED T with no ice in it. Iced being the operative word here. In the end, She was nice and we had everything we needed. Im already planning a trip back.

94MKja2ttjEOGS0DoxaTxw.text: Always a good experience :) just had the brunch for the first time and it was "SO GOOD!" Had the highroad sandwich with potatoes - great and huge! Husband had the sausage & gravy - delicious! Yum, yum, yum!!

foQWBiMDiSdOFm6QhwMdfA.text: This is everything I have ever wanted in any restaurant. Our server was sweet, attentive, personable and fast.   And the food...Oh baby Jesus, the food.  I am typically no pork fan, but I ordered a pulled pork sandwich (with bacon and ham on it) and my boyfriend ordered the ribs...every bite was splendiferous for both of us. Mac and cheese, church potatoes, chicken tortilla soup...all incredible. Perfect.  The decor is simple, clean, slightly industrial and cute. Very downtowny.  There was also a good mix of clientele and staff.  And you know when there's a good mix of customers, they are there because the food is good not because of 'the scene'.   House music is a slightly odd mix of things (Flaming Lips then Evanescence?) but pretty good. Seating was immensely comfortable and spacious. (pro tip: sit in a booth or against the wall, you will sink right in)  Drink specials are off the hook. A $5 pitcher of Four Peaks Kiltlifter?  I don't think you can even get that at the brewery itself! Wonderful.  But seriously, the food here can best be described as "American comfort food" at it's finest. The portions aren't obscene, but nor are they lacking in any way.   I left stuffed, satisfied, and beyond pleased with every facet of my experience here. And with a little left over.  Also, valet parking is free since the parking lot is so tiny and weird to navigate. I highly suggest you take them up on it and don't forget to tip :)

nKRpNQUM5b2zSvCq-sZMEQ.text: Windsor has everything I want in a restaurant! Fun & Tasty Menu Great cocktails Delish beer selection Outdoor Dining AND and ice cream shop next door! I really love everything about Windsor, namely their ceviche. It has knocked LGOs off the top of my list. I love to go (when its cooler) and sit on the patio for their $5 pitchers. (daily before 5pm).  I just wish I lived closer :-0 Keep it up, Windsor!

1NVK5Mxhj6mZjMUvR-CZGA.text: Came for the first time today with my daughter and sister and have nothing but great things to say. Not only was the food great as I had the oyster po boy (highly recommend) but the service was perfect.  My sisters brown bag chicken sandwich had so much flavor and was not overwhelmed. The prices range between 9 to 15 dollars for a meal which I thought was just right for the food. Our server was such a nice guy and took care of any need prior to me asking and the place was full too.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oyster Po boy

mig3kpHZIkEn8ZBEYhkkbw.text: Cool, hip atmosphere and decent drinks.  Wish it were in a location that was closer (as in, within walking distance) to more fun options, but that's not a huge issue.  I've been here a couple times and it's always been fine, the only thing that kind of bothered me about my last visit was the woman who took over bar-tending / serving us was a little snooty.  I actually thought she might be a manager of some sort, except for the fact that she seemed so put off by having to bother with us.  (I think I may have even caught her rolling her eyes at us..?  Which was strange because we were pretty much minding our own business and just talking / laughing / catching up normally, not being loud or obnoxious in any way.)  If I do go back at some point, I'll make sure to be seated in an area other than hers.

SLN0djt2njpJL23YEDXrWA.text: I recently stumbled in here in the midst of a cross country road trip with my trusty lady sidekick.  We didn't have high hopes for the quality of food in Phoenix but we were pleasantly surprised.  The atmosphere is fairly LA hipster and it had a gorgeous patio to enjoy the lovely desert weather.  I ventured to order the burger with moderate expectations.  I mean I come from the land of Umami and the Oinkster- how could Phoenix have anything on that!?!  Well their bacon cheeseburger definitely made me a believer.  The sauce was excellent and more importantly the burger was cooked to perfection.  To think ordering medium and actually getting a nice slightly bloody burger? Who would have thought.  My companion ordered the ribs and loved them.  The best part of this spot you ask?  A fairly well developed whiskey/scotch/bourbon list.  Being ladies of discerning taste there are few things we love more after a long day that a whiskey- neat.    If I happen to find myself back in Phoenix you can guarantee I will be here posted up with a burger and a glass of Macallum 12 yr.

_ji_UTf4HGdZLMI7p7DK-g.text: Delicious every time! nice variety of cocktails and a compact menu with just enough variety to satisfy everyone. Everything I've had has been fresh and there hasn't been a dish that was wasn't enjoyed.   The cheddar fondue and deviled egg dip with chips are great to start off and share!

PJcYvJvIN7PBo7woMT6X8w.text: Enjoyed the bacon cheesburger. The bacon wasnso yummy! Don't know if its really my scene but...the food was good.

x9cuZPwOKQ-lMzhrrjWm3g.text: Went for dinner with 2 regulars who recommended this gem. The service was terrific and he suggested some dishes which we tried. I had the soup of the day (corn chowder) and the brown bag chicken sandwich. Both were amazing. One of my friends had a salad with the daily special pot pie. He said it was delicious. We had delicious cocktails and enjoyed the night. The restaurant is trendy and comfy with delightful patio seating. I will return and can't wait to take other friends here.

FWgi5qx5enmpLtHoBm6AUg.text: Really good food, great atmosphere! Outstanding customer service. I had their fish, my husband had their baby back ribs and the kiddo had the burger. We returned a few days later to have the same meals because it was that dang good!

pafuXHZlL59BgJDmejmeyQ.text: Came back for brunch a few weeks ago and had a great experience!  The Matador is where it's at...trust me, you'll understand once you try it.

H3b0trxUGG76MNmfsDl5Pg.text: I stopped in here a couple weeks ago for lunch with my husband. $5 cocktails all day!!! Everyone here way beyond friendly, and our server, Melissa, was so knowledgeable and kind. My kale salad was so fresh and tasty.

f_bG1ClCtpEHAyA5ymxP5Q.text: After my previous visit with a group and many things going wrong and writing a Yelp review management reached out to me and invited us again with a great giftcard! We went again and had way better service! Thank you   Good food. We made a reservation for my bday for 8 ppl outside we get there and they stated they had no reservation for us..... Then we sit inside to eat and we get 4 different waiters the last that was helping us kept coming to take plates away and it was just weird. Then when we were done we got the check as a whole because 2 ppl switched chairs me she stated they wouldn't be able to split since we were playing musical chairs. I don't know why she wouldn't just ask us what we got then and go get checks she didn't she brought us the check for 8 ppl and we had to sit there and seperate each thing. Their food was great but not their service it was horrible and we kept getting random drinks wedding order as well.  So disappointed in the service we were provided we prob won't be coming back.

OOWByML4bs4r6mWv27HKcA.text: Great cocktails, comfort food, well trained staff. The Upward folks have four places nearly adjacent to each other  on central, all are packed and all are successful (Postino, Windsor, Joy Ride and Federal Pizza). Hallmarks of all are friendly staff, reasonable prices, consistent food and a fun, casual atmosphere with good music.

axNsMX8Gp1No2jcG6niWXQ.text: After a dozen visits I owe a review. It's hard to do better than the Windsor in Central Phx.   Brunch, day drinking, happy hour, dinner, or post-dinner cocktails: Windsor is my go-to.   Brunch: love their use of Shriner's sausage. Biscuits n gravy is money. Drinking specials a nice treat if you're getting the day started early.  Happy hour specials among the best in town with $5 pitcha's.  Arguably the best burger in town. Love the Windsor burger with the Kale salad- and I don't like Kale salads. Crab Cake BLT is decadent.   Mixed drinks are tight and consistent. Staff works hard.  It's my date spot, a HH fav, random Wed night dinner and after-church-brunch.

NcadoFYrOiPkvchr3jyaTQ.text: Windsor is a great place to go to be at the bar, but I ordered a bacon cheeseburger mr and it was well done. The waiter never came back to check on our food . He sort of just dropped off our check really quickly and never really was concerned about our dining experience... Second time that's happened in a couple of weeks. I like the place, will give it one more try, hope it goes better

LzSI79cxNBsx6iscMhFBqg.text: We gave it another chance and it failed across the board. Not a fan. Slow and clumsy service. Didn't serve us brunch even though we checked in on time served us raw chicken. Food is just not great and uninspiring. Not a fan.

zqvhwmGEFjlR9klUm6OHAQ.text: Yummy Sunday brunch! Great atmosphere. The only weird thing is the hostess station is on the back of the restaurant

VO8mC7oT4-ElXDoRvHXBCA.text: 1/13/17 Update: last few times here had a good time. The staff was very nice, friendly and attentive. They're interaction with our table each time was great. The drinks are stiff and the music is awesome as well. So I am upping to 5 stars. Keep up the great job Windsor! ____________________________________________  Windsor seems to give off a hipster vibe. Drinks and food are ok. The patio is nice to hang with friends and enjoy the music. They're doggie friendly. Love the new parking area.

K-o3V_fRtfetOo5L274VUg.text: FANTASTIC cocktails. These guys are pretty genius. The happy hour is a can't miss at $5 a drink. The food, however, could be better. My crab cake BLT wasn't very crabby nor did it have the crunch I had hoped. Maybe breading it in panko would be a better idea. There was too much bread, so I ended up just eating the crab cake. The mac was solid, and the heirloom tomato salad was refreshing with the mint.  The bartenders were great and service was superb. Definitely stop by the ice cream shop behind the kitchen for some fun toys and awesome desserts.

HniS-37gNJTV9u-yTVIVJA.text: Brunch here has really become my favorite on the weekends. My go-to is the Matador and one of their $5 cocktails. I love it. It is a great place to come with kids, families and friends. Everything I have tried there, I really liked. The green bloody mary my husband had was very unique....tasted like green tomatillo salsa but very interesting. At the end of your meal, the donut holes with mascarpone and jelly are a must!  I seriously hate the valet parking though...

7VfmG9kPOE_vgLbpnbnhJQ.text: My girlfriends and I came here on Saturday for brunch, and I must say, it was hands down one of the best brunches we've ever shared together! The staff is super friendly and accommodating, seating us at a large table by the window. Service was prompt, coffees and cocktails delivered right away (which is a must on a Saturday morning)  Our server was Chris, I have to say, was probably the best server I've ever had! Courteous, funny, and personable, he made the experience so much more enjoyable, we stayed for nearly 2 hours enjoying the food and atmosphere. The Cheddar Biscuits and gravy are to die for, as are the cheddar potatoes, AMAZING. The bloody marys are delicious, and coffee refills flow freely.  If you are looking for a fun, relaxed place to dine with awesome service and even better food, this is your place!

hSm0Tjh3rHgKSzdqWEUniw.text: Great location. Very trendy  restaurant. Large menu. They use a lot of curry in their dishes. The place is always busy  and servers always  friendly. Great burgers. I like their fried chicken  but it only served only  once a week. Bonus it is next to churn ice cream

fYjFr1CQporpzWAdVyIclA.text: I had the best pastrami Reuben sandwich I have ever had here! We were there for happy hour. They also have a great drink menu. Very urban cool place.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Pastrami Reuben sandwich I&#39;ve ever had!!!

8uxPz8YidOczeMUv94dGaQ.text: Went here for a quick lunch break with a Coworker and left fully satisfied.   Even though they were packed we got seated promptly at the bar.  They had an amazing menu and who can beat their $5 drink prices?! We ordered the Corn Dog Poppers to start and they were delicious! We also ordered the #22 drink, it was prefect and sweet.  Wthen ordered our main course, the Porkwich Sandwich. It was finger lickin good!  That gold sauce and bacon really added something spectacular to the sandwich.  I cannot wait to go back and try something new!  (:

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Porkwich with Mac &amp; Cheese

aXLKmbOnX3xsVvlLdMNU7g.text: Love this place! Very friendly and great service!! The food and beverage manager and Jacob is top notch! EVERYBODY NEEDS TO COME HERE!

K96XRa4HDAiFz4b9OmIBuw.text: Got the Windsor burger. It was good but not amazing. What I really loved was the side of church potatoes. They're like cheesy hash browns with crispy edges. Definitely a recipe idea that I'd like to copy at home! I hear from friends that the drink specials are worth checking out so I will be returning soon.

-PRWkoeA8thZjdKzUHb_BA.text: Food was amazing! Service was on point, and atmosphere (as with all of the restaurants around) was great! I had the burger and would definitely order again. Everyone else was very pleased with their meals as well!

042b1kcRQTG5U8FDBQEAVA.text: This is one of my all-time favorite restaurants! I'm not sure if it's the vibe or what but I could eat there everyday and never get tired of it. Some of my favorites are the chicken sandwich, the picnic kabobs, and the pear salad. I don't think you could order anything bad here. It's in an awesome area as well. You an happy hour hop with friends or enjoy a nice meal out in uptown. I'm dying to try their brunch which I've heard amazing things about as well. Keep doing your thing Windsor, you folks are awesome!

sUQE0YL8vbnKSt69TKWQOg.text: I like the patio at Windsor.  I enjoy the music and the food.  I had a spring mix salad and added salmon today for my lunch.  I also had a bowl of a delicious chicken coconut curry soup.  The server was very nice and provided great customer service along with the other staff.  I like the selection of healthy menu options.  Windsor has some great sides to pick from too.  Later, I visited the ice cream parlor next door and  ordered a refreshing natural made desert for a warm afternoon.  See if you can find something you might enjoy to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spring Mix Salad w/ Salmon and Chicken Curry Soup

LuHPXCmBbjaqcsaSzRzEzA.text: Years after this place has opened, the staff is still just as enthusiastic, and the whole experience still just awesome.  Clean and inviting decor, real napkins, and snappy service.  Plenty of menu choices drink choices, and seating, and a staff that is super patient and professional - even when waiting on a bunch of grubby guys. :)  If you go for brunch, DO order a side of the potatoes, and you will be delighted with a plate of cheesy, crispy, culinary goodness!!  Upbeat ambience with loud-ish classic rock playing both inside and outside.  Whether you're up for kale, tasty ribs or dessert, this is the place for a good time.

ebfi-qOEbJ57SxsDy64exA.text: What's not to love about Windsor! I had the brown bag chicken sandwich with a side of mac n cheese. Sat outside on the patio which was quite crowded for lunch during the week but the weather was perfect. Service and food was awesome! I cannot wait to go back again soon!

CWlJK_xKEsMP8o01Vj1WQw.text: Very hip feel to the place. The church fries were great. Kinda a male vibe to the place, but me and my girlfriends felt very comfortable. We will be back!!

zznmLoNpIZqdNjcBxB647A.text: I CAN ONLY SAY ONE THING... YUM!!! Crab cake sandwich makes you feel like you are at the beach.  and the Number 1... Just go in and ask for a Number 1

3r1-F4HBM6KWEnXuCSQ_jg.text: My girlfriend took me to windsor for my birthday last night, I was very impressed.  The look of the restaurant was very clean and modern, the service was incredible.  The food was delicious, I got a pulled pork sandwich.  The cocktails were also very tasty.  I don't usually give a place 5/5 stars, but this place is definitely up there and worth going to over and over.

isUPZcsZIX0nxCOaaTY5iQ.text: You never go wrong with Windsor or Postino. You simply can't beat daily hh till 5pm and good food.

S53WuxoOETZsE43uUCdhDA.text: The bar and patio makes this place ! great atmosphere, host was very nice and professional. Service was okay. Food is good, not great . I would definitely recommend trying it! even if it's just for drinks at the bar.

IW1wjJdbZmIfa8mnzW7bog.text: Only been here once and wasn't impressed. But I have loved Postinos for so long I'll give them another shot someday. I was so excited to order the deviled egg dip but was sadly disappointed when I had it. It was pretty much finely chopped egg whites, almost the consistency of large curd cottage cheese. There was no paprika that I could taste, no yolk, or any spice at all like maybe pepper or tabasco. The chips that came with it were mediocre, seemed like store bought kettle chips. For dinner I had the short ribs with chorizo. Again a let down. The first bite was nice but the spice of the chorizo never got off the ground, didn't build into any kind of heat. Then the short rib on top was just your standard short rib, tender flaky but just kind of a meaty brown au jus taste to it, nothing special. After that we went to the candy/ice cream shop next door. Seemed a little gimmicky but it brought in all the hipster foodie wanna be's. My wife did get something with salted caramel on it that was awesome, otherwise it's just ice cream but I'm not a big dessert fan so don't go by  me. One other note, we seemed to have trouble with our waitress early on attending to our table but once my friend made it clear he wanted to order things faster she was much better.

Ev8Opsy_g950l5tJljDOjw.text: Holy WOW! My husband and I tried Windsor for the first time on a date night this past weekend. We are non-drinkers, so I cannot attest to everyone else's love for the bar vibe, but the FOOD was beyond good. I ordered the Burger, Windsor Style, which was definitely good, but with the side of Mac & Cheese (which by the way is likely one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth). My husband laughed because I ate my entire plate of food (which is something I rarely accomplish). My husband had the pork sandwich which he said was equally just as incredible. Dinner here, then dessert at Churn next door. You can't go wrong! Incredible atmosphere. We'll definitely be back!

rYmknQircLB1z5tngjhSJA.text: We were here a few weeks back. The 2x's we've been here have been a great experience. The service....drinks...food...atmosphere..all fabulous!

ETQOFfHPmuQc6rvCVc_Cqg.text: I am a huge fan of Postino's, it is one of the best places in town for bruschetta and wine! When I found out the owners of Postino's were opening up a new spot I was super excited to try it out. My friend and I decided to check it out this past Monday for lunch and we were not very impressed. We ordered there fondue as an appetizer and it was very dissapointing, the cheese was grainy and cold. They serve it with a heep of barbecue meat, apples, salami, and pretzel bread. I will not order this again! The food was ok, I ordered the ban-mi and my friend had the pulled pork sandwich. We both agreed that both sandwiches were lacking in flavor. The best thing I did have was the side that came with my sandwich which was the fried okra it was delicous. Overall we were dissapointed with this place and will continue to stick with our favorite Postino's.

NOwCacJwBcxpa8Moa55gyQ.text: the food is great but no more steak on the menu. thats why i gave it 3 stars.

eO15a_Ryt4TtbsmHiiXAZQ.text: Of course Windsor is good!  Almost, yes almost, as good as Postino.  My big gripe was the fondue, which was just bleh.  And I'm not the only one who's felt that way.  Our last waitress said they hadn't had complaints about it "lately," so they might have fixed it.  $5 for an awesome cocktail, glass of wine, or 2-pint-pitcher of a decent beer selection has me using Windsor as a starting point fairly often on the weekends.

w4lxQ6c8k3CoHHnL6aNxuQ.text: this place is really cool, loved the Kale Caesar, nice place, good service.

0lpwZrF_JboxLTVliFx_Wg.text: I've been here twice: once for lunch and once for happy hour. Both experiences were wonderful. The menu has a great selection, but the best part is the wait staff.   The servers are cool, laid back, but on top of everything.

17wHdyf3V-XRW_Wqu6VSyA.text: What a nice  way to end my weekend and spend a beautiful Spring AZ afternoon! Arrived at Windsor at 3:pm this past Sunday and the place was quite busy. I see why! 5.00 drinks till 5:00 EVERYDAY and EVERY Cocktail! Pretty good deal! Seating was pretty open we sat on the patio. Service was great! I had 2 glasses of my Sav Blan Wine so I was happy! We started with The Cheddar Fondue, I wanted the Deviled Egg Dip and Chips so next time! It was OK... nothing I would order again, over priced for what they give you. Some cut up apples, sausage, and bread! The bread was the best part, the cheese was luke warm and not great, this whole Fondue thing is so 2012! Not worth your calories! Now the Porkwich I ordered was worth the calories! The pork was tender and hearty! Now think HAM AND BACON added to it! I had the sauce on the side like I always order my sauces, and it was just wonderful! The combo of honey mustard and whatever they put into it was all working its flavors in my mouth!! VERY GOOD! My sister in law and brother both ordered the burger, I don't eat red meat but if I ever decide to go back I am heading here for a Windsor burger! It looked so good! The fries are good as well, thin sliced and the Cole Slaw was great! I just love the music they play as well in this joint! Of course you must check out all the old tapes hanging on the wall! I was excited I found George Michael! :)

Wvr6uW_wqTpLq9xor6CUgA.text: So we decided to come back and give this place another  try and it was  a lot better than our first experience!  We had the fondue first, which was more than enough for 2 people to share.  I had the chicago dog, again and my bf had a hamburger.  The service was awesome and our waitress made sure we had more than enough wine!  Looks like Windsor has been ironing out their kinks and really making it into a cool, fun space to hang out and eat!

NapnuZdogjlU8zAudeJ_xg.text: The vibe was awesome, the design was very cool and the staff was extremely friendly... the only thing I thought that needed a little fine tuning was the overall menu.  My order was solid, it was the fresh fish and it was done perfectly.  I just thought the sides were a little weak but that was forgotten as soon as I walked into the ice cream / candy shop!  The whole evening was great and would highly recommend it.

QE0E_3fDLb7_E2hcbZioxw.text: I had lunch here and thought the staff and food was good! I luv the way its set up and how you can eat outside!

UyvlVyWQhEfziTXFPMu6Xw.text: Yes, this place is a hipster haven. The real cassette tape wall that leads to the bathrooms, the bathrooms with subway tiles, the flannel material on the chairs, the waiters all in flannel shirts,you get the idea. While the hipster atmosphere is a little much, Windsor does get serious when it comes to their menu. I had the chicken sandwich with a mango salsa and the macaroni and cheese as a side. Food was great, service was hit or miss. My dining companion ordered a tea which the waitress confirmed upon request and then she never brought it. Requested again and it was brought about 10 mins later. Was a late lunch and the service should not have been so flaky for such a down time. I would go back, just hope for better service and their menu did leave me wanting to try more things.

CW_8D1oLvH6MSfNfkXcARA.text: Love the atmosphere here. Would be a great date spot, especially if you can nab the corner booth inside. Nice beer list, friendly and attentive staff, good food, cool vibe, everything about this place is great. The only caution is that it's so popular that getting seating where you want is a challenge. Also, I hate having to valet my car, but I'll accept that as the price to pay for having cool venues like this pop up in random, interesting neighborhoods throughout Phoenix (much like the original Postino in Arcadia). There's no space for parking, so whaddya gonna do? Light rail is blocks away so that's only walkable in the winter.

t944p3dFCEtZkVXUJrSXbg.text: I've been here 3 times and it has never faltered once. Great food at great prices, and an exceptional staff. I love the Windsor Burger with the sauteed carrots and Barrenjager on the rocks. What a beautiful mix. I suggest this for anyone on any occasion

liACMFJFVgz25Ak5tkob-w.text: As an NCP local, living walking distance from the Upward Projects, you could say I've been to Windsor a time or two. When I went to dinner last night with my family, I was reminded once again, why our neighborhood is so lucky to have Windsor. When we were seated, we were concerned our waiter was in a bad mood, slightly regretful we were seated in his section. It turned out he was just quiet with an incredibly dry (and hilarious) sense of humor, as he redeemed himself when my dad spilled an entire glass of red wine all over his pants. His quick interjections made the whole thing laughable. The incident suggested a change to white wine, as it is much more "summery" and he wouldn't run the risk of another pant-staining mishap. My parents wanted to order a bottle, which I was totally against, considering the fact that I've never ever found a white wine I liked and my mom's tastes veer toward the terribly sweet picks. Don't ask me how he did it, but he magically found a bottle all three of us enjoyed!   When it came time to order, he accidentally rang up my dad's pot pie as the fish, apologizing like crazy when he realized his mistake. He proceeded to let us know he'd comp the pot pie and make it up to us. I mean, apologies were expected but considering his food came out not even five minutes late, the comp was totally unnecessary but greatly appreciated! When we received our check, our waiter brought out a large handful of coupons for free ice cream from Churn next door - a sweet way to end our delicious meal and enough ice cream to last a week. A night of superb service, mixed with witty banter from a surprisingly passionate waiter and phenomenal food made me fall in love with Windsor all over again! Oh and we even sat comfortably outside on the patio. Anyone who can pull of an enjoyable patio experience in the middle of summer deserves serious props.

ZrNu1HzwTal8VLp4P1X-Eg.text: The cocktails, "shorty" versions of beer on tap, and great happy hour specials make this a great place to chill out mid-day and have a few drinks, especially if you are sitting outside. I've only had one appetizer there, the loaded chips, and they were great-tasting at first, but were a little ambitious with the ingredients--definitely overpowering. There were a few menu items I wanted to try, but on second glance, they also look a little too ambitious, so I have a feeling the taste is going to be too rich. (I cannot eat everything I like as I get older...major bummer!)  The ambience is a happy medium between a place to chill with friends or have a dinner date.  Everyone who's assisted me here has been superior--especially Rob the bartender. They should get 5-stars based on service!

PYpr0kohqO70G5CjVxgMdQ.text: One of my go to spots. Crab cake BLT is great...even with no bacon...5$ pitchers on happy hour which runs til 5..great servers and bartenders. This place knows how to treat guests. Veggie stack is awesome. Kids love brunch. Always a wait for Sunday brunch but its worth it. Go to the Windsor leave happy. Cool vibe. Classy hipster spot.

oQOJrS9EhvMOA2MZ626nAw.text: Service here is always good . Waiters are attentive.   I tried their salad again but held the cheese . Last time I left hungry so I added side order of grilled chicken.  This has a nice flavor but it was a little over cooked.  Also had their deviled eggs which is very good .

fCNy2pI5kf-2qqysGRQw9w.text: Great atmosphere, great beer/drink selection, delicious food. Dark @ table after sunset, hard to see menu.    Churn ice cream/novelty shop connected is a bonus!

oJ0aOQh2zPKRcmsh9Q9sNw.text: Me and the bestie went here for brunch on a Sunday around noon. We sat on the patio even though it was 100 plus degrees outside, the misters and shade kept us comfortable, but for those who can't handle the heat, the wait for inside was only about 15 mins. We used the complimentary valet as parking is scarce, and hey, it was free and worth the $5 tip for the convenience.   I ordered the no. 2 drink (basically a Peach Bellini) and the simple life breakfast (2 eggs, homemade English muffin, fruit, and pork belly bacon). Both were perfect and delicious! The BFF ordered the Matador (Two eggs over easy stacked with griddled cheddar potatoes, a crispy tortilla, salsa verde & avocado relish) which she also said was super yummy.   We also had the No. 91 (Prosecco, House Blackberry Puree, Creme de Mure) and another fruit heaven concoction I don't recall the no. of.   The service was stellar, quick and polite. The drinks were sweet and tangy, cold, and refreshing. During brunch, only $5 bucks. Whoa!  They also have a good looking bloody mary bar which we didn't try but can't imagine could be bad!  I would recommend this place to anyone who will listen (or read). The prices are great for brunch. A must visit in Phoenix!

Onqk8Bd33NjCSxqw5f8ksg.text: Service was great, food was delish', atmosphere great... Patio... LOVED IT!  Went for dinner, looking fwd to trying the brunch on the patio before AZ heats up

moQZuBszFfPmLpDMp7ssqQ.text: One of my favorite of all the upwards spots! There brunch I hear is the best. Can't get enough of the good and all the amazing specials

a_OjZyhQSOWcgHOWB19amQ.text: The Veggie Stack is amazing. Just do it! I had it a few weeks ago, and during the time between then and my return, I had left my vegetarian life behind me. I thought I'd order something meaty, but that veggie stack called my name. I ordered it, and was so happy that I did.  A winner of a meal in my book!

JCQG-RgsClT5LZo7fbHXRA.text: Such a bummer evening experience last night. Usually such great service and atmosphere every time I go. Took our friend for bday drinks there and kicked off the evening with the hostess rolling her eyes at us and then having to ask someone to serve us after sitting for 20 minutes. We were not a loud/rude/obnoxious group and I kept mentioning it was our friends bday in hopes of better service for her sake.
