One guy towards the end stepped in to help and was a ray of sunshine, but the female staff was over the top rude to us. Definitely won't be rushing back anytime soon : (

I5vhFnQIH7u1tWbkhf-eLA.text: Awesome ambiance, and great staff. Food was pretty good, too.   Had the brown bag chicken sandwich (good), and the fried okra (good). Also had the bacon cheeseburger and mac & cheese (both pretty good). Couples next to us ordered a sampler platter of some sort with shrimp - they both raved about it, as well as the custom style drinks.  $5 for a small(er) pitcher of good beers on Sundays - great deal. Lots of unique drinks, worth a try. Servers would awesome with recommendations and making their unique drinks.

jkxOaxDi7r-jhPDUXcsnmQ.text: Good food, great ambiance, good service. Foodies will not be blown away but it's a nice place to go and we will be back. I would love to see them take more risks with their menu and add some creativity.

WhopwoOFkYwgL2hQVz5nCw.text: I've eaten here many times, and the service and food are always amazing. I'm writing for a particular reason however. I have food allergies and needed to heavily modify their menu. The wait staff was kind and patient and worked with me to provide a delicious meal. I ended up with a plain grilled white fish with their sweet potato fries. Our wait person made sure to follow up with me and made sure everything was good. I appreciated being treated with respect and not like someone who is a nusiance, which has happened at other restaurants. I now know I can go and eat there and have an enjoyable experience. Thank you Windsor!

TgH9djgL0p4F2lHIr_HMDQ.text: Just left the restaurant. The food was good, however I can't say the same for the service. Not once did the waitress ask if I needed anything else, including a refill. She took quite a long time to bring me my check and just as long to cash me out. Chances are I won't be back.

IqByrDsrqCMI98VShiIRqw.text: Great spot to get a casual drink and some good food.  Bartenders are friendly and laid back.

Sxc0tI9uTF3KUQdqjkAfKQ.text: This is a beautiful restaurant. I love how the waiters dress. The wall art is cool. This place is all together a great looking restaurant. Super fast service. The chicken is delicious. Nice waiters.

mwg_iHUGgVPl7zL4JRf98g.text: I've been to Windsor enough now to "get it" and to have let them address some of the observations of other customers.   I'll start off by saying that there is nothing fatally flawed in the place, and the concept is quite good. Combined with Churn and DeMarco's I consider it a hipster urbanist interpretation of a  shopping mall food court for the 30-50 demographic. Everything in it speaks in some way to those who were in high school or college in the mid-eighties through mid-nineties. Let me take a moment to gloat: My BROTHERS AND SISTERS! WE ARE IN THE RICH PART OF THE NOSTALGIA CURVE NOW! ENJOY! Anyway, the concept and decor is great and just works.  What's wrong? Well, the food. Everything I have ordered off the appetizer menu is either too salty or not quite there in some way. Portion was too small or was over/underdone. I don't mind the fact that they don't really have any happy hour specials to excite and entice, but  if there's no discount to convince me that I am somehow getting a deal, the food better be terrific. And it isn't. The groups I've been with have left half portions of small plates that should have been wiped clean.  What else? The service was noticeably slow and a bit cold each time I was there. Yes, I get it: You're young, attractive and hip and are probably working on a screenplay that will sensitize all of us to the ecological plight of the pygmy eskimo wombat, and working this mind-numblingly-dull waiter job is such a condescension. Just bring me a beer.  Also, the music is too loud. I didn't like most of that stuff the first time around, but I'll indulge it for nostalgia's sake.   Anyway, not bad but not quite a destination. Needs some work.

_gjDEHMBOgncigqTJBEOVw.text: I've always gone for dinner and I love their food! I have never been disappointed & it's a tradition of mine to always get their mac & cheese- so good! They are pretty trendy but not over the top like some places that you'll find in parts of Phoenix and Tempe. I like going in here to enjoy a cocktail and have decent conversation with their bartenders. I would put this in my top 5 places to eat in Phoenix.

PYOgRkB2RDqFUJzSpH_20w.text: In my best Charlie Sheen, "Windsor. Winner. Windsor. Winner!"  I had the MOST attentive service from our greeting at the door, to our seating in back, to our beverage service...ooops, then a small lapse in service...no biggie I was enjoying the vibe and the ambience.  Ordered the Double Dip...sadly the name reminded me of my buddies in college when they would chew tobacco, sometimes they would "double dip"....gross I know. The concept of this dip is a cobb salad made into a dip served with a chipotle salsa (didn't get much smoky chipotle flavor however...which is fine since my little petite self is sensitive to spicy food...I mean my mom would serve potato chips and ketchup and called it chips and salsa...but I digress). I would order the dip again, but I have to say it really tasted just like egg salad. And fortunately I loves me some egg salad!  My rueben sandwich was OUTSTANDING and I chose a side of mac n cheese which was total bliss (NOT plugging a restaurant downtown btw)....that was the word I said as cheese and a chunk of elbow macaroni slid down my chin. Pleasant, I know. My friend was doing the Meg Ryan orgasm scene as he enjoyed his bbq pulled chicken sandwich.   I'm sure we looked ridiculous. But we were ridiculously happy.   Welcome to the neighborhood Windsor. Let's totally hang out more often!

05xiCDn4GjrH_DsF31gTBA.text: The happy hour specials seem great - but I missed it by an hour.  :(  We munched on the fondue platter.  The pretzels were pretty good, not sure about apples with cheddar, and the sausage was cold and weird tasting...  My friend got the crab cake blt sandwich.  It was a bit greasy.  The fries were almost limp and not salted enough.  The 2 drinks we tried were not the best.  The bitter orange(?) one was actually decent, but wouldn't recommend if you don't like bitter orange.  It muted the alcohol taste which might also be a benefit.  All in all, I won't drag my feet if my friends want to come here again but I probably won't suggest it.

vuLLU5V3DDkyWM9M43pG5Q.text: Greasy, lacks seasoning, and service was delayed. Tried the mac n cheese, Windsor burger, kids burger, veggie burger, and started with mini corn dogs. Party of 4 didn't enjoy any of the dishes. Will not be back.

eGte_CuVXOmwfrBusDUw4g.text: I came here last night with two of my friends for dinner and had a wonderful time.  The menu itself is outstanding, and the food was utterly delicious.  I went with the backyard burger, and it was delicious!  One of my other friends went with the New Orleans ribs and the other one went with the backyard burger like me.  The menu here seems to be pretty solid, and I've heard that there isn't a bad dish to get here, and I believe it.  The service was outstanding, and I really liked how attentive they were with us.  Since we were there during happy hour on the weekend, we all split a pitcher for $5, and it was tasty. I considered having a hard liquor drink, but I figured the beer would have been better.  Am I glad I did!  Definitely a Phoenix gem, and should be on everyone's short list of places to eat at when it town visiting!  Or, if you live here, go more often then I did! (which was never because I never really had the time.) I wish I had come here sooner.  Definitely a bit of a hipster place, but fun to not only people watch, but the food is awesome as well.  Don't get me wrong, there's regular people in here as well, but it's fun to see some of the hipsters stroll in and out from time to time.  Parking is easy since they put in the new lot immediately next door, and it's attached to an ice cream place as well.  the only draw back was the unisex bathrooms.  A line formed, and it's kind of a first come first serve deal. One toilet in each, and I don't know that I liked the idea.  The bathrooms were decorated really cool, so that kind of made it better for me. I just prefer separate bathrooms for men and women, that's all.  Also, I found the volume of the music in here severely annoying.  I thought it was a bit to loud, and felt like I had to talk over it at times.  Plus, the music sucked.  That's my only "real" annoyance, and it almost made me feel like I was in the club.  (ok, not close, I know, but nothing sucks more then having to talk over music!!)

t0qQ4tiQoGQba3w96KXbxw.text: Love it! Cute ice cream parlor. Lots of fun. A kid would be in heaven. I dug into my mind cookie sandwich with cookie mint ice cream too fast. Forgot the picture. It was amazing!!!  I also got me some candy bags for gifts.  Of course, I couldn't leave without getting some Samurai figures. Great place.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Samurai fight!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute candy bags for gifts.

OHdArS2JggTVDxpDCdjFgA.text: Nice vibes, cool backdrops for those instagram selfies (the wall of cassette tapes by the bathroom!), and a solid menu. We went for brunch, got seated quickly, and the server was on top of her game with drinks and food. I liked this place because it has a good beer list for my boyfriend and fun day drinking cocktails for me. (They have stronger drinks on the menu, too.)

c05cvEXzE7akUghe71ODww.text: I absolutely loved Windsor  Their drinks are delish and $5 before 5pm is awesome because after that they're $10 dollars.  I do wish they had better burger skills, I always order protein style and they didn't wrap it in lettuce, it was a patty onions and cheese with the sauce on the side  Other than that though the service was awesome and the food/drinks were tasty

VbkRq13InGGl3pjcvPsn4g.text: Visited during spring training. Had dinner and thoroughly enjoyed sitting outside on a warm spring evening. The craft cocktails are awesome, crab cake BLT, deviled egg dip

1o2AiVAMHNWt8ytEErh0cg.text: Superb place to eat & relax! Their staff is nice & friendly and helpful! I enjoyed my visit. Their burgers were great! I had their veggie burger and it was amazing!!! Their salad is chopped up so they can't do bun-less burgers. Which they should try to do because that's what people will be asking for soon..  Their beef burger was great also took a few nibbles of a date. Kababs were great and their sweet potato fries was amazing!! Drinks are a little weak & needed an extra shot.. Getting whiskey strightup was a little small also. But at the end the staff took care of us.. They popped into the busy ice cream shop to get us a few cups when their line was SUPER long.. And we didn't wait at all to get served! Their interior decor was real fancy.. Have out a feeling of warm & welcoming to their guest!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kool interior decor with cassette tapes
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie burger is to die for!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NMICBvogREfoKcJ_k7FP5A.text: Super friendly staff works together to take good care of you. Great vibe, decor and overall feel of the place.  We started with the donuts with mascarpone and jam. Yummy. We both had the eggs benedict with crab cakes, she subbed her spinach for avocado. Awesome flavor.  The star was the yummy crab cakes. Whoever made these knows how to make crab cakes!  The house cocktail menu was very well planned, great selection of house cocktails that you will love. We tried the #85, a rum based drink. Fantastic. Can't wait to try the others!   Definitely coming back! A winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egss benny with awesome crab cakes!

5JFPPzDbg8LwfloIySQ76g.text: Favorite spot !  We always sit at the bar, great bartenders and the vibe is super comfortable and fun.  The Chef is awesome as well, the food is delicious.  Did I mention happy hour all day until 5!!

fTjhS5RuzyjyXgcu669gMA.text: I wonder if, given a decade or so, we'll look back at this period of rustic architecture and re-purposing of buildings the way we do avocado-green appliances, shag carpeting and fuzzy wall paper.    Regardless, for today and tomorrow, the atmosphere, service and food at Windsor was terrific.  I loved every minute of my time there.  Hell, even the bathrooms (uni-sex and shared with next-door's Churn were pleasing)!  And I LOVE the cassette tape wall.  If you're anti-hipster, this is not the place for you.  If you dig tasty and cool, stop by soon.  We arrived around 9:30 am on Sunday and the main restaurant held a 15 minute wait, we could have been seated at the bar, but even though it was already a hot morning, seeing a couple groups of young women seating on the patio, we discerned that it couldn't be to bad out there.  We were right!  Fans and misters made it very nice to eat on the patio.  I recommend it.  My daughter ordered the Highroad Sandwich, my gf went with the Crab Cakes Benedict, and I opted for the Matador.  Everyone loved their selections and shared them around the table.  A side of biscuits and gravy was ordered also, and it was full of big chunks of awesome, local sausage.    So if you like chili verde, go with the Matador.  Great take on huevos rancheros, served over Windsor's Griddled Cheddar Potatoes.  My only issue was that the tortilla was pretty stiff and difficult to cut, but the flavors were terrific.    The hollandaise on the benedict was a little cheesy for my tastes, but good and freshly made.  In fact, our server (Alex) informed us that pretty much everything on the menu was made fresh on site and locally sourced - both big issues in my book, and thankfully becoming the norm in the new restaurant revolution.  Unfortunately, price follows the revolution, but in the case of the Windsor, it was worth it.  I'll be back to sample the lunch/dinner menu.  Hope to see you there.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Highroad Sandwich and The Matador

gyvo0YzibbJ1UIIgJgdCkQ.text: Cute little hipster brunch spot. Ordered the blackberry lemonade and crab cakes benedict. DELICIOUS! (Could use a little bit more potatoes, but I was full)   The workers are all very nice and did a great job with serving my party of three. The wait time was about 30 minutes on Sunday around 11AM.  I would def come here again on my next visit to Phoenix :)

11nVjgtRt0NpHoXQvJb1ag.text: The hostess here was such a nasty, rude and untrained mess that I'll never know if the food is as good as it smelled. The words "I'm sorry" and "Let me see what I can do" were never uttered. She acted as if the entire dining experience was really a way for her to get attention. The music was too loud, there was a very tight parking lot and there's just no reason to put up with this kind of nonsense with all the offerings in Phoenix for lunch.

QwaNwqkJx764tnruyf4i9Q.text: Mediocre @ best! Host said 15-20 minute wait, 45 minutes later we were finally sat. I understand it was a Friday evening but be honest with wait time information.   You know when you haven't eaten all day, everything taste better than it actually is?   Well this was the contrary. The Ahi Poke Plate was saturated in soy sauce. I'm not one to complain to get a free meal and I was pretty darn hungry so I ate the tuna off the top and kept my opinions to leave on yelp. They must have ran out of avacado because the Poke was avocado-less. My 2 year old loves any type or kind of Mac n Cheese and he had 1 bite and wouldn't touch it again. It was dryer than the Phoenix desert. My wife ordered the basic cheeseburger on the menu and ate 2-3 bites and wouldn't touch it again. And my Rueben was nothing to write home about. My wife did however enjoy the funeral potatoes. Ice had melted in tap water before we were seated and water was warm. Water was gross. Waiter disappeared and I had to catch busser to order a coke. I Was never offered a refill on coke, but busser came by and topped off my wife's water one time. Pretty disappointed overall and doubtful that I'll return. Luckily Churn is next door, so I can go cleanse my palette.

TaNk2X8koxuQi_cmA8-QYQ.text: Best damn service in Phoenix by A LOT. I cannot rave enough about how friendly and attentive the staff was. Orlando was awesome! In terms of food, the burgers, sweet potatoes fries, kale salad and corn dog bites were all excellent. They even have us coupons for a free scoop of ice cream for the ice cream shop next door. Amazing Oreo mint flavor. We will be coming back soon.

WjmRBzloBcY4cSlybIUbow.text: Was here 3 years ago when working in AZ and finally had a chance to return and write a review.   Great parking. Indoor and outdoor seating. Cool decor (cassette wall) Great music. Yummy food. Tasty Cocktails. awesome attentive staff.  I had a tasty cocktail with the coolest garnish toothpick (see photo) The #22.  Banh Mi White Fish Sandwich was flavorful with a little crunch and kick,my side was the Chopped Kale Salad. Took no food photos cause the place was too cool for all that foodporn!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super Cool Cassette Wall!!!!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great cocktails

8aUoeje87QExsb7yuzVdSA.text: Solid place solid food. Shout out to the respectable manager, Renee.  I would definitely recommend what was recommended to me, the porkwich. That along with the mac-n-cheese.  Cheers to my first and not last time here.  Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Signage in the patio area

nT_HPhQ0llIgK1npq-wRcw.text: Awesome patio for weekend brunch. The whole restaurant is done very well but this has become one of our favorite brunch spots. If you're into Bloody Mary bars, this place will be your favorite too. On the weekends they have a cart stocked with all the fanciest Bloody Mary accouterments. Plus, $5 pitchers of beer every day before 5.

NAUtlQygHzkiQ1n84utkZw.text: Not a bad place to hang with friends, creative drinks, good food. Not a fan of the appetizer selection and i was attacked by ants while sitting outside. Fortunately the Lord saw fit to bless me with 2 legs to walk.   Overall, i enjoy the drinks, specials, and food.

EqD2d_nzfGQO0LKpfRAHlQ.text: Appetizers were ok. The main course was excellent. I had the Halibut and my wife had crab cakes. My sons both enjoyed bacon cheese burgers, and another person enjoyed Cesar salad. Got there in time to enjoy happy hour prices on drinks and beer.

l88nFIzQUzcODIG_4RdIxQ.text: Best restaurant in Phoenix! My favorite! The staff are always very friendly and helpful when recommending food & drinks. I personally like sitting at the bar, watching the bartenders make cocktails. The best deal for beer & cocktails, everything $5 before 5pm including their pitchers. Food is also so delicious; from appetizers to entrees, brunch to dinner. The mac'n'cheese side is my fave! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The punch!

QSPWXOjAsOnLwJlavHsPpw.text: we went here after finding that most places had closed at 9! as two 20 year old girls, we were glad that even when we walked in to the bar style setting everyone on the staff was soooo nice! we had several people stop by our table checking on us and really making sure we had a great- and fast- experience. as a vegetarian, i ordered a burger without the meat and they were really accommodating and didn't charge me for the full meat price which i appreciated!   i would definitely go back!

oEKAMh3JzyQxKq4EzwcAGQ.text: The Windsor is a great choice for brunch lunch or dinner, they have a quaint outdoor patio good food and drink options and Churn is right next-door for ice cream!! Service was good too. I

qWPhNSDWixqTD3PznAT6Ig.text: This spot has been a staple for me since I moved to Central PHX, but I gottta say that I'm a little disappointed that they've changed some ingredients in their Orange basil vinaigrette. I noticed it about 2 yrs ago. It's a big deal for me--not a 5-star breaker big deal--but a big enough deal to mention

SpgQY0D8hWGvTaY9nW14fA.text: What a palace.... every time I come here, I leave happy, satisfied and impressed on how nice everyone is.   This is probably my 5th time at the Windsor, between brunch, lunch and dinner. My friend and I came here for early dinner yesterday and we know how good this place was, we just wanted to go mellow during dinner with a couple of drinks. We both decided to share our meals so we got the Greek God appetizer and the Mixed grain salad. Both dishes were fantastic but the mixed grain salad was out of this world. Amazingly prepared grains with bunch of greens and beer roots, could not have asked for anything better. We also got the fried okra side dish and oh man they were tasty. The drinks were good too. Our server Sara was very attentive and friendly. I would definitely come back to the Windsor and recommend to all to pay a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried okra for a side dish. Yummy
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of my favorite salads. The mixed grain salad. A must try.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Greek God appetizer dish

ODXGHUBfWHsGUeQQqCpLLw.text: Visiting from Chicago and found this gem on Yelp.  The service was amazing from start to finish.  Great cocktail menu from fruit forward to boozy.  Kids menu is super reasonable at $5 with lots of selections.  Adult menu was delish.  Ahi Poke for dinner, yummy.  Grilled chicken sami with curry and mango salsa was the bomb digity.  Oh, and there is an ice cream shoppe next door for the kids after dinner.

tYx8-uCeTG5zE4Tlztbn0w.text: Good prices on both food and drinks.  Drinks are $5 til 5pm everyday.  They have pitchers of beer (about 2.5 servings), cocktails and glasses of wine.  Today's special was Fish & Chips - the fish was so fresh and so flaky fried just to perfection.  And if you have a sweet tooth you cant go wrong with the beignets or walk next door to Churn for some ice cream.

N-sRUUYS7iMtQ8BjZxMgbA.text: First of all, don't judge a book by a strip mall cover. Right when we walked in we were greeted by the most friendly staff. Hillary was incredibly helpful and gave us suggestions of the menu.  We ordered the deviled egg dip, which was absolutely delicious. Apparently we were there for happy hour, so we had a couple bottles of some super dry and tasty Rose. The entrees we ordered came out quickly and they did not disappoint. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive the entire time. If we lived in Phoenix we would be regulars. Thank you to Hilary (Hills) for helping out.

9U3uRtqpwx0vsbiR_CeqOQ.text: Great food, calm atmosphere and friendly staff. My girlfriend loves to come for brunch, they have an amazing breakfast menu and the best coffee!

6HQL2Kq0Ooo_AXQhFtLp4Q.text: Food was great! The server was super nice and hospitable. Always kept her eye out on all her tables. Another success for the upward projects. Food is also priced well.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Dmh-ovxfE6CMZQBz3J58kA.text: We have never been to this gastro pub and LOVED the food.  The music was great and the staff was super friendly and supportive. I will definitely be coming back.  This place is excellent.     The wait was reasonable and honestly the staff was super attentive without being annoying.

hBJy1cO6pYudL120Yq1FNg.text: Brandon best server I have had .  friendly patio. Food is always on point. Staff helpful not overbearing but definitely check on you. Deviled egg dip comfort food and on tap seasonal beer tasty. Great place after work to unwind. Thanks again Brandon

IbdNCBCGlf5eub_fDIXgvg.text: Love going here for Sunday brunch. Have never been disappointed. For evening drinks we enjoy having the bartender design a drink for us and the deviled egg appetizer is soo good.

0f4ydn4bKFnqVUDD6E8fag.text: Just had some delicious fish & chips. The fish was light and crispy and the fries are the best. Outstanding service, kudos to Brandon and Rebecca.

_XBo4kaMhgsJcsowjiorQQ.text: Came in for a date night, hostess was nice and patient, since we asked for a table outside and then changed our minds. We sat in the bar and grabbed drinks while we waited for our table, bartender was friendly and gave great recommendations (#49 is delicious)! Then they sat us down, and we were pleased to hear everyone works together, meaning you get great customer service since tips are shared!! I ordered the Seasonal salad, SINFULLY DELICIOUS, I loved everything about it!! My husband ordered the Backyard Burger Windsor style, and the Jo's church potatoes, so good!!  Overall, service was great, food was amazing, ambiance is worth it!

gm86qvu2HHJmcw2HckTZ3g.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat and drink in all of Phoenix. My go-to lunch special is the Kale Caesar w/ Salmon. I'm also a huge fan of the Rueben, but you can't go wrong with anything you order.   But the real reason I keep coming back to Windsor on almost a weekly basis is because of Manny, the best bartender I've ever had the pleasure of ordering from. There's not a better guy that you could meet and let him dream up a new specialty drink for you.   If you're within an hour or two from Windsor, it's WORTH THE VISIT!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Dbs-fLAiezw1wqLQ2WV2Ng.text: Stopped in around 9:30 after some serious roller skate action and boy were we lucky to get Brandon. Aside from having a boyish charm augmented by his cheeky sense of humor and all around general swagger (that's what kids call it these days, right?) he was pretty much psychic. He somehow knew we were gonna order like 8000 apps and came back with impeccable timing to get yet another dish in for us, never once being annoyed that we didn't just order it all at one time. Then, then, THEEEEEENNNNNN he came over to make sure we got the last fried chicken because, well, he read our minds and knew we were already eyeballing it. Just about the only thing he wasn't helpful on was my indecision with a side. He suggested all three of the sides I was torn over which means he's clearly a man of good taste. Is he my soulmate? Maybe. But I supposed we will never know. And I'm sure a long lasting relationship has to be based on something more than having the same favorite side dishes. But I digress. Brandon is the best. Give him a raise. Jk, lol, we all know that's not a thing in the industry. So just tell him he's a great employee and maybe give him a Saturday night or two off.

gU_4ANo7AW7QtsX_jM4fmQ.text: This restaurant along with all the other Upward Project Restaurants is one I probably will not even go to. First of all when you call you get the options to press 1 for the location, and press 2 to make a reservation and to talk to someone awesome.  I assume that nobody makes a reservation as there is nobody awesome to talk to.  All you hear when you choose it is complete silence without anyone ever answering. After many numerous tries, I finally got a male voice on the other end with so much noise I could barely hear him.  The call immediately was disconnected. I tried 2 more times with the same result. I have tried time after time but the same thing all the time.  It is the same for Joyride Tacos, Postinos, and  Federal Pizza. Will never find out how the food and service is at each of them. :)

bEOShnCtcB4eP1KFsB_QxQ.text: Windsor isn't complete without Churn (ice cream and sweets for dessert next door). Overall met expectations, but didn't exceed.  Great happy hour until five: $5 cocktails, beer and wine. We enjoyed the #4, #16, #17 all on-the-rocks to start. All refreshing and I wish it was sunnier out because the drinks were light and refreshing.  Service is "team oriented," so get used to different servers asking to help serve beverages or food. Great service, tho!!  We ordered the cheddar fondue and split the mixed grain salad with Salmon.   Cheddar fondue: Cheese is served in a dish over a flame, and tastes similar to restaurant plain mac and cheese sauce (milky and not too cheddary), both green and red apple slices, sausage is cold/chilled in the center. Pretzel didn't taste original. Okay.  Mixed grain salad with Salmon: Balanced, hearty, and grains gave good texture to the dish. Met expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churn ice cream
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Backyard patio

HLn2fGM978fNIWxxsZRrZA.text: Honestly one of the best restaurant/bar experiences ive ever had in my life. Our waitress was so friendly and attentive. The bar tender was incredible at making cocktails. The music was fabulous the whole time we were there. What a great time!! We will for sure be back and will be telling all of our friends and family to go visit. We went on a Monday at about 3 PM when they still had their cocktail deal going. We got the deviled egg dip for an appetizer which was to die for! The homemade chips were awesome!!! The soup and salad were just as tasty and the burger and fries (windsor style) were superb!! We saw this restaurant when going to churn ice cream next door a few days ago and once i googled the menu i knew we had to visit! Seriously such an incredible experience. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qnqZGRyL6SPE0tfHAtytag.text: Thisis one of my all time favorite places.  I always stop in when I am visiting my sister in Phoenix.  The patio is a great space, even in the heat of the desert.  As always, my need was sausage gravy and biscuits, but alas, I'm not supposed to be eating biscuits.  What is a girl to do?  Ask the server.  He offered up a deconstruction, and I was able to eat my favorite meal and give my biscuits to my sister.  SCORE!  Doesn't hurt that I washed it all down with a Pitcha of Pimms.  This is the BEST place for brunch.  Beyond food, the service is exceptional.  You can't miss this while you're in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deconstructed sausage gravy and biscuits.
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best best best!

8sxA0UUFE1X9fxNnunk-0A.text: Went to the Windsor on a whim the day before Thanksgiving. I had heard the food here was delicious and decided to start with the loaded chips. Oh my gosh. I did not know this combination of ingredients could actually work! Caramelized onions, bacon, blue cheese, and chipotle crema - oh my!  I also ordered a burger, which tasted cheesy with delectable bread, but the loaded chips have seared an imprint on my memory. They have $5 cocktails til 5pm everyday - dangerous because their cocktails taste great. No.17 with the green tea syrup and cucumber mint was especially refreshing. All in all, I want to come back here for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uWm-_9v5WzeJn2Ugetioxw.text: All of us were very happy with the food...pastrami reuben, bacon cheeseburger, half soup half sandwich, smoked salmon chopped salad...food was thoughtfully prepared and delicious.  Selected sides were prepared well also . .mac and cheese side is highly recommended and the sweet potato fries were crisp and flavorful.  Full of urban vibe...we will be back!  Service was excellent though my waiter's name escapes me.

GcjiD6iLW87b_11V0g3mCg.text: While the food looks very tasty, I am a fluids kind of guy. Staff are very busy but always acknowledge you snd are happy to see you again.  Fluids are fluids but more importantly the ambiance and colleagues at the bar up the encounter. Absolutely recommend Windsor for early, midday, or eve stops.

lctFwRJzxkuuBcTDENst8w.text: This place is so awesome! Their entrance is from the back for those of you who may not know. It took me awhile to find it but it was worth the try! The staff here are so friendly! I sat at the bar and the waiter (don't know his name) came over with a very friendly face and offer me something to drink. I got the blackberry drink I think it was No. 22, and it was so good! I love their drinks! Its cheap and worth it! They have happy hour for 5 dollars drink until 5pm everyday!  The atmosphere here is so nice. Its the perfect place to go out on date or catch up with some friend over cheap drinks! Love it!  Food was excellent! My waiter recommended me his favorite which was the grilled chicken with mango chunk. The burger was so good! Who knows mango tasted so well with grilled chicken! I will definitely come back here! I would recommend this place to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside seating area. They also have a very nice outside patio!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar seating. Great waiter but I don&#39;t know his name ):
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken burger.

8N0R8kL1T7mV74wDs8Ge2g.text: The Windsor was totally worth the wait! A friend and I came here for lunch, he got the special fish of the week and I got the fish burger. I was blown away by the flavors in both the meals!! His plate had a great crispy texture to the fish cooked in curry and the fish in my burger was perfectly cooked. The burger had such a great spicy sauce to it which killed any hesitation I had prior to ordering. Staff was super friendly with just the right amount of attentiveness for how busy it was. I will definitely be eating here again! Thank you  it was so so good!

tHHlLSHBMXk6KYnBtqEPNQ.text: One of my favorite brunch spots to go to on the weekends! We like to bike here often. Love getting The Matador and their $5 Bloody Mary where you can pimp out your drink with a variety of fixins from the Bloody Mary cart. My husband's go to brunch entree is the biscuits and gravy...it's yummy. Great place for cheap cocktails and beer!

_k2-uPILiwicajzHy0X-nQ.text: Came in for a drink. Bartenders were really friendly. Made a delicious whiskey sour for $5 on happy hour. Sweet potato fries were tasty. Excited to come back and try a meal!

ojMloXv4XeYrXg9yfV6pUQ.text: Started with a #22 cocktail...really smooth berry infused vodka cocktail.  Next tried the #63...Kentucky Bourbon cocktail..both really good!! Washed it down with a side of cheddar jalepeno bread..all on happy hour!! Really good stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GuRtEOhY35Lo8EtTPveFkA.text: It's just a good vibe!!!! Good food & qualify cocktails that show the owners and employees care. All cocktails are well crafted, make their own syrups/bitters and take pride in what they do. One of my favorite spots, if I only lived closer I would be there 2-3 times a week

f_QrSVe6etxsM0E7R-Z9uA.text: Such a cute spot! It's perfect for your weekend or weekday brunch that's also pet friendly. It was a pretty busy Friday afternoon, but there wasn't a wait for outdoor seating. I noticed that some seating is directly underneath a tree, so be careful 'cause that tree sheds its flowers like a mother. It was raining down petals onto some of its patrons, but they didn't seem to mind. They just nonchalantly placed their napkins over their drinks.  Onto the food...  - Caesar Salad w/ Salmon: dressing was tangy, salmon was well cooked  - Homemade Chips: sooo crunchy and great texture  - Veggie Stack: so bomb diggity! best dish of the day imo  - $5 cocktails? why wouldn't you come here?? (#17 was super refreshing btw)  Overall a great, relaxing brunch outdoors. They even gave our pup a water bowl with ice. It'd make for a reeeal cute, casual date spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Stack - a must!!

G96uYIqgANQcvTsUwT31Jg.text: The food was just okay crab cake was small, more kale salad than anything else but tasty. Drink 22 was watered down.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. crab cake delicious
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese fondue yum

Aw15scPaE8giZgykAWOCcw.text: Great service!  I wasn't hungry but was very tempted by the menu and kabobs.  I was looking around for a place with great margaritas and the bartender did not disappoint.  He made my drink just how I wanted.  Can't wait to go back and try the kabobs.  Nice atmosphere and decor.  Thanks Windsor!

eS_MRHZh8R3gRJu-0uf9rA.text: No review of Windsor after eating here for over a year? What's wrong with me?  Windsor is a great place to eat. That much goes without saying. But it's also a great place to meet. Anchoring Churn and a clothing store, Windsor is an ideal place to grab a bite to eat before heading next door for some tasty ice cream, or some serious shopping next to that.   Breakfast here is my favorite on their menu. The offerings are just the right size, both in portions and available options. Not so many menu items that it's overwhelming, and just the right amount of food to fill you up. When the weather is accommodating, their patio is stellar. [Truth be told, even in the summer it's still pretty much a kickass patio]  It also doesn't hurt that Windsor is exactly 7.5 blocks from my home.

DyZWZx-weCpKUNxSf1Z9vA.text: I didn't pick a standard menu item but went for the fish and this dish was being served for the first time. It was halibut in a kind of ginger and sesame seed crust which was delish but could have been taken off the heat 2 minutes earlier. A bit dry. But for $20 you can't complain. Nice accompaniments but again, a bit too done on the squash. Fun ambience and has a bar and both outdoor and indoor seating. Looks strip mall-ish on the outside but is very cool in the inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7r_7nlpwpnOiDtfMzja4Sw.text: Went to this place on a Sunday for brunch and it was a really cool vibe there. I was also able to bring my dog as long as we ate on the patio. They brought her water. I got a Bloody Mary and the Egg Man to eat and it was really good. My boyfriend got the pulled pork burger and enjoyed it as well.

rHdtCDenGKQTJNY5QkIC5Q.text: My fiancee has been to Windsor on a couple occasions without me so she wanted to go with her to try it. It is owned by the same company as Federal Pizza and Joyride so I knew it would be good. We got to sit outside on the patio on a cool and overcast Saturday evening which was amazing this time of the year. We got the Greek God and the corn dog poppers and both were very tasty! I had a couple beers and we really enjoyed the ambiance of the place while we picked at our appetizers. I decided to order the pastrami Reuben which was very good and the cheesy potato side was AMAZING. My fiancee ordered the brown bag chicken sandwich that she really really enjoyed as well. I would definitely recommend this place, and it will for sure become part of our regular rotation of restaurants, especially since it's so close to our home.

wgmVFi-Gc-r6pIZZ7UFmwg.text: super cute and fun patio. Bar has plenty of seating. great food. always a good vibe!!

TuX1vA59oJ56moNgdfYZYw.text: Our Wednesday evening experience was a mixed bag. Nice place, good service at the bar, but the food was disappointing. It wasn't the execution either. My backyard burger windsor style was hot and cooked properly. What was missing was savory flavor. Everything was sweet with no balance. The burger itself did not taste to be seasoned and all the accoutrements were sweet including the bun. My wife got the crab cake BLT and it was assembled and cooked fine, but it is just a bad design. It comes on a huge chewy hoagie roll that drowns out any crab or bacon flavor and is virtually impossible for humans to put in their mouths. The chopped kale salad was way too tough to eat. A quick blanche of the kale followed by an ice bath would improve this a great deal. The bartender was knowledgeable and fun. The food was awkward. Really should be 2.5 stars instead of three.

I76j2JKokbS-pEspuCm1Ew.text: Windsor is my go-to location for a bite and drink in the Phoenix area. They have an unbeatable brunch menu and their Bloody Mary bar is phenomenal. The service is always fast, friendly and accommodating - even when they are busy, which is most of the time! The patio is a great place to sit and enjoy some Arizona sunshine and some awesome music. The food is always fresh, unique and the menu always has something new to try on it. If your in the area, be sure to stop at Windsor!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoying a Bloody Mary on the patio.

J3l-d8ozq67KyWOAhqZr4Q.text: This is the last of the four Upward Projects restaurants I've gone to in this little corner, and I'm so glad I finally went! I love the atmosphere, and the booths and dining area are super cute. I also love the big windows that provide a lot of light!   As for the food, I had the Backyard Burger, Windsor style, and it was the best burger I've had in a while :) super juicy and the sauce they put on it is delicious. I had fries on the side which were great too, and they have really good ranch lol. I'm picky about ranch, and I loved theirs. I also tried their jalapeno cheddar cornbread, and I would recommend that as well!   For drinks I tried the No. 68, which has coconut water in it, so it was a little watery for my taste but still good. My boyfriend tried the No. 39, which was delicious. It has saffron-infused bourbon, and I don't even like bourbon, but I liked that! I'll definitely be going back here soon! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Backyard Burger, Windsor style :)
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No. 68
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner menu

ulHIwSvgO6p_sgQdo05ZVg.text: The Windsor is hip, swanky, cool, fast paced, LOUD, and serve really, really good damn drinks and food.  By far one of everyone's favorite.  I love the kale salad and the BLT crab cake sandwich!!

YAQzBwLX3ocPAgwhwycG6A.text: Not a fan.  Let me tell you why.  Burger was ordered med and came out well done. The service was terrible, why do you have 4 different severs rotating on our table..no wonder things get messed up. Not a way to run a restaurant.   Only good thing was the beer.  Not sure we will give this place a second chance..too many great places in the nieghborhood that get it right

uLPVcp7GVAcMNd77ELxk5g.text: This is my favorite place to go! The staff is amazing, the drinks are off the charts, and the food is great. It's my favorite spot to go between 11-5:00 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sierras Nevada and Vodka Collins on the tart side
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vodka Collins aka adult fresh squeezed lemon and limeade

pEX1owo_JpVp4WX-B6HXuA.text: Happy hour is awesome with a great selection of drink options.  The food was good too.  I got the veggie burger and it was delicious!  No frozen patty here.  It was definitely made fresh!  I would definitely come back again.

S1MDhSawuOcdEUfmWs8dNw.text: Cute place! My best friend and I went for brunch to take advantage of the drink specials and believe me, they did not disappoint. Usually it's some basic cocktail that establishments put on special but Windsor lets you pick your poison!

PI3RgPZ9tDspGnbGnvQ7zA.text: Great atmosphere and amazing food! The crab cake sandwich is incredible! Hosted an office party here and had excellent service!

5TSnMESPqKIMz7cJJKhO4g.text: 2 friends and I ordered cocktails. I ordered their soup of the day. The bartender acknowledged my order of the soup because she clearly told me what the soup was. When questioned where the food was, a male bartender said she never rang it in. I explained the situation to him and he sternly looked and said, "So, do you want it or not?". Unacceptable. How about an apology and comp the food that was not rang in or delivered after 25 minutes of the customer ordering. His attitude was unacceptable and I will NOT be back. For having the display and decor of a fine establishment, the service proved otherwise. Pity because we all just moved nearby- They just lost 3 longterm customers.

CEv3qF3vzy1ShSTYtAJCFQ.text: I can't believe it took a pre-bachelorette party dinner to finally try Windsor. The ambiance is cozy and the food matches the restaurant-bar atmosphere to a "T."   For cocktails, #17 seems to be our party of 14's favorite. I'm not surprised because cucumber vodka with green tea syrup appears to be a unique yet satisfying blend. I stuck with my own routine and ordered an Old Fashioned. It definitely packed a punch here! 'Twas not a bourbon drink for sissies but kicked off the night quite well!  The cheddar fondue appetizer was highly addicting, so I'm glad my friend and I shared this heavenly delight. Onlookers glared with envy, and said "Now I wish I had ordered the fondue too." Screw the carb free diet! The pretzel bread and cheddar are worth the affair! Don't even get me started on the sausage that accompanied this power duo! Pure bliss!  Hello Porkwich! Pulled pork, sliced ham, and bacon join forces to envelop you in pork ecstasy. The coleslaw adds a nice texture and flavor to the meaty goodness of this buttermilk bun packaged treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheddar fondue! Loved it!!!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Porkwich - bring on bacon, pulled pork, and the sliced ham!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber vodka with great tea syrup! Guess what # cocktail this drink is...

Npz68I2-KF3kdvHpGj1I7g.text: Absolutely amazing!! Food, service, hospitality, atmosphere! My friend and I were looking for a cute little place to host a small baby shower, and we came across Windsor! We had such an amazing experience! We will definitely be coming back!

kYS7DyDMz5AyuuxVUPx9Zg.text: Being a long standing patron of Windsor and always loving the location, menu and drink specials I found myself to be very shocked and disappointed when my boyfriend and I went there this last Sunday night at 10:30pm hoping we could grab a snack and a drink.  When we pulled at the door it was locked so we assumed we had missed our chance and through the door we heard the guy say WERE CLOSED ASSHOLE!  It was shocking and rude and even if he did not know we heard him yell it out what would be the cause for him to say it?  We go all the time and bring our money to the establishment and that's what they think of their patrons ?  And just for the record the hours posted on website and Yelp do say from 11 to 11 "ASSHOLE"  There are 20 Resteraunt 's in a half mile  radius   That I'm sure would want or loyalty and money.  Don't take your patrons for granted!!!

9dUro3MTFPIUh64z8QtZtQ.text: I'm obsessed with this patio! It was one of the main reasons why I wanted to try it out. I definitely wasn't disappointed. I love the ambience with the comfortable seating and it's great for people watching. The food was solid, it's not anything that I would write home to Grandma about,  but the drinks are really good. I would definitely recommend coming in for their happy hour which ends at I believe 6 o'clock, to take advantage of their craft cocktails. save a little extra money in your pocket. But again the best feature for me was the patio I would definitely come back for drinks and happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Family time on the best patio in Phoenix
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy! Mac and cheese.  I forgot the name of this dish but it has quinoa and mixed vegetables.  It was solid.

3Kdd1Pl5nF_79UCqamyv2Q.text: Can't help but love this restaurant. The food and the charm make for a beautiful symphony of service, cocktails, and food. A definite must try!

nfoylMCjnyU78Ytd-WD64A.text: We go here several times a month! We love all of the Upward locations, but today I felt specially compelled to write a review. I purchased a $75 gift card donated by Upward Projects at a silent auction last Saturday (yay!), so we stopped at the Windsor for Sunday brunch the next day. But when we handed over the gift card to close the check, our bartender said our gift card had zero balance! So this morning, I placed a call directly to Upward Projects and explained the situation to an insanely nice lady (Victoria?) who promptly got to the bottom of the situation and took care of it completely! What a great way to start a Monday: the customer service is just phenomenal with these guys. Love it!   Btw, brunch was absolutely fantastic, also in part to our wonderful Aussie bartender. If you were wondering.

CxxNmomy4Cr0xP85b3TcIA.text: This place was excellent! I had two #4's, the chopped kale salad, and fondue. It was delicious. The staff was also great. A little pricey, but I'll go again.

72-aFf011dQXIuws5y8aWQ.text: Staff was amazing. Cole slaw was amazing. Delicious. Classic burger good. Brown bag Chicken sandwich interesting.  Did take out. Will try dine in for the experience.  Returned for a patio visit. Devoured the Windsor Burger and cup of soup (de jour was a butternut squash = Amazing!) Waitstaff was awesome...went above and beyond! Try the #67 for a very refreshing cocktail!!

zRIcaea57od4qMhPHAjTSA.text: Unassuming bar-restaurant. Windsor has a pompous name but offers great quality comfort food. The bestest burger in town, delicious pulled porksandwich, and if you come in on Friday or Saturday give the spicy wings a try. All that with $5 signature cocktails.  Top it off with friendly service comfortable atmosphere and if you decided to break up with your scale Churn ice cream is right next door.  This is not a Michelin guide restaurant, this is a simple, good quality, reasonably price with good service restaurant. Ready to become regular!

1mAOXoKOJw9ieGnGak1-Tg.text: This place was delicious! My BF ordered a burger and I had a salad. I was amazed at how tasty it all was! Definitely a place to visit again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. He devoured it!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious burger! Can&#39;t remember the name!
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious salad. Can&#39;t remember the name but it started with an &#34;F&#34; lol

GtdZWvhL0RcjvWN1Mym8EA.text: Out with some friends and wanted to hang out and relax along with enjoying some good food. From the moment we walked in the door we felt welcome. The service was outstanding from all the different people that were checking on us, We had the amazing fondue and the Russian Roulette peppers, the first one on top was crazy hot.  We never felt rushed and felt very welcomed.   We will be going back.

rFiNNUjhAg7zLxE4LLP7QQ.text: Absolutely delicious!! Server name was Brandon! Him and the manager made my family of four feel like royalty! Food was hot. Came out quickly and the sauces are all in house made. We will be back.

zbZkmhBwvkHgtyJe2JGHuQ.text: The atmosphere here is awesome! The bartender was sweet. The food was fantastic! I especially liked the deviled egg dip with chips. I also got the grilled chicken sandwich and macaroni and cheese. You can tell it's a pretty awesome place with some loyal regulars. A few folks at the bar were more than happy to help me make my meal decision which I always appreciate. I'd definitely recommend this place.

BZVRcFUs8f01i43bkI03JQ.text: This is the ultimate hipster joint, but all are welcome here and treated with A+ service. Our server, Janella, was friendly, efficient, knowledgeable, and downright amazing! The fondue is mouth watering and the sandwiches are unique and oh so delicious! Whether you are here to meet a friend, to have an intimate date, or just check out the scene, this is the place to be!!

8ZENcdlpMm2ZbAq5O3oKPg.text: Have been three times and each was good, but by far, the best was brunch on the patio in March!  Best pancakes in town and happy hour prices, everyone needs a pitcher of Pimm's with their eggs!   Kale salad at lunch was a big serving, a bit of an overload. Friend's burger looked delicious. Love the bar, but it's pretty loud in the restaurant when it's full.

e97NT_lZ7xXn93_2dEIoBg.text: i skimmed through the menu and the first thing that got my attention was the mixed grain salad. quinoa + kamut + barley + butternut squash + beets..annnnd goat cheese? all of my fav ingredients!   it seriously did not disappoint.  maybe there was a bit too much mixed greens because I would definitely prefer more of the grains than leaves!  i cleaned my platter, making sure i got every bit of the specks of quinoa off my plate.  delicious!

dGiVxo4d5epsHXDF65vijA.text: Windsor is great. My boyfriend and I visit every week or two and we both have our favorite menu items. They do sandwiches and salads really well here! We like to stop by on weekend afternoons for Happy Hour--five dollar glasses of wine can't be beat--and also to enjoy the patio seating in the evenings during the milder months. I love this family of restaurants.   Go and enjoy!  :-)

7MKd4bekgVMOxsKi-T7YJw.text: Went here last weekend and had a great meal. It was pretty busy when we arrived, which is always a good sign. We wanted to sit on the patio since the evenings have been so nice lately and the host said it might be a little while. Not a problem, we just went to the bar to grab a drink while we waited. He came by once or twice after to ensure us that we would be seated soon, which was nice.   I had heard good things about the cocktails and ended up ordering the No. 17. It was awesome and I would definitely order it again. My sister got the No. 6 and she thoroughly enjoyed it as well. We decided to split the fondue and crab cake BLT. The fondue was great and the pretzels and sausage were perfect dippers. The crab cake BLT was good, but nothing really memorable. I don't think its anything against the sandwich itself, but just that I realized I prefer crab to crab cakes. Church potatoes were an awesome side!   Service was attentive and the food was well spaced out. We weren't rushed and enjoyed spending the evening enjoying the nice patio dining. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place.

dI3eFyzfxTaU7nEs8ACiZA.text: Tried Windsor last night for the first time. I was having dinner with a friend and she really wanted something with a patio dinning area because of the awesome weather we've had all weekend. Thanks to some fellow reviewers we stumbled upon this place and thought we would give it a try.   Well worth it!! The outside seating section was excellent and got crowded just after we got there around 6:00pm. Unfortunately their happy hour ends at 5pm but both their beer list and cocktail selection looked outstanding.   For starters, we tried the Cheese Fondue appetizer with Pretzels and Apples. Amazing! Very creaming and tasty, could have been an entree on its own if you were in the mood.   For dinner I had the Porkwich, it combines bacon, pulled pork, ham and coleslaw a top a Kaiser roll. Very Tasty!!! All of the pork was tender and the crunchy coleslaw added to the various flavors. For the side dish, I had to try the Mac n Cheese. A bit more cheese and less bread crumbs would have make them perfect but you can't have it all. It was all mighty delicious.   We didn't wander over to the ice cream parlor next door but maybe next time.   Yes, it is bit pricey but seemed to be well worth it. Their happy hour does run all week long including weekends. Alos, make sure you look for street parking in the neighborhood next to the restaurant before surrendering your car over to Valet to save a bit.

JecJW1dAKn9iCHrRwJQGPg.text: We finally got a table here last Sunday night - it's ALWAYS packed! I had the No. 17 cocktail (cucumber & mint) - it was one of the best drinks I've had in a long time. Their menu has something for everyone. My boyfriend had the chicken sandwich and couldn't stop talking about it. I had the veggie stack (beets, quinoa, tomato, hummus on a pita) which was different, but delicious. I love that they pool tips so every waiter is your waiter. More restaurants should do this. Two thumbs up for Windsor!

C-nGbop83be9y9PdzVYwJw.text: Cool spot.  I've been here multiple times of the day.  Great food, good service, cool atmosphere, great draft beer.  Free wifi.  Love this place.

YFcgBrXPsng9Sus0DVTwZw.text: Very cool place with almost a California feel. Food was awesome, service was good and they had some nice craft beer options. We really liked the feel and they had a huge outside patio that made you feel like you were sitting somewhere fun in LA. Price was fair, not too high but not cheap either. We will be back!

GTk4kAnyR_L6H9t_8v9jiw.text: I finally made it to Windsor after I got an e-mail for free ribs! That was the extra push I needed to make it a priority to visit this new spot. As I flew down Central I passed up the unassuming building and had to turn around and come back. The parking is a disaster like at Postino's in Arcadia but they have comp valet! But I was lucky enough to find one of the few parking places inside of the small lot. When I walked up I immediately noticed the fab patio and thought it would be a great place to enjoy brunch or lunch one day. Since it was 100+ outside my and the girls decided to eat inside at the bar. The place has great ambiance it's kind of dark and has a pub like feel to it. They have a great group of eclectic servers and bartenders that compliment the place very well!   I didn't order a drink surprisingly but  of course ordered the ribs and the kale salad as a side dish. The ribs came out and were mmmm mmm good!! Not because they were free either, lol...they were tender, flavorful and were covered with this AHmazing BBQ sauce... the sauce was sweet, tangy and just plain good. The chopped kale salad was yummy as well, it tasted really fresh, it had dried cranberries, almonds and some other stuff going on. Definitely something to think about making at home. The servers were all very nice and one of the bartenders talked to us about how he installed the purse hooks underneath the bar! We told him we def. appreciated his efforts :-)   I'm excited to come back and try some more deliciousness of the menu and maybe I'll even save enough room to get an ice cream sandwich from Churn next door.

GhtzBWQCW0fGRinFD0ptgg.text: It's quite loud and generally pretty busy. Great drink specials before 5pm, but the food is lacking. The Russian roulettes and fries were superb, but the Mac and cheese was dry and bland, the bacon cheeseburger was dripping with grease, the oyster PO boy was overpowered with boiled egg, and the fried okra was really dry. The service was pretty great with frequent check ins and drinks full the whole time. The atmosphere is nice and the staff are professional. Overall mixed feelings.

hvzTwL6bSUcZ6gJTbZWajw.text: Yes please! I could eat their Chopped Kale salad every single day...yes I'm obsessed with Kale.  Besides this delicious and nutritious side dish, I ordered the Brown Bag Pulled Chicken sandwich, which was good too- although it somewhat lacked in flavor. My mom's side dish was the Fried Okra, which was yummy too.  Besides the food, I love their outside patio- such a cute place to enjoy a glass of wine with the misters in the summer! Also I like the candy/ice cream shop in the back...I got to stock up on Pop Rocks which I don't see often enough. I also have to admit that I love their bathrooms, haha I know weird right? But seriously, the walls were cool inside and they were blasting reggae! Also the walls leading to the bathroom are covered in cassette tapes- such a cool idea!! I totally wish I could do that in my own place!   All in all, I would definitely come back when I'm in Phx again.

5LjpNZqpSFRcNvNrfG7C3g.text: Great cocktails for $5 during happy hour. I liked the herbacious #17. Lobster roll was a huge disappointment. It was dry, had more fillers than lobster, and tasted more like a tuna sandwich. The cheesy potatoes were not my favorite. The cheese dip appetizer was decent. I like the relaxed neighborhood vibe. The service was friendly and prompt, but the food was average at best.

lMAHUcyye-Gi8csK34X8hA.text: I love everything about Windsor. I've been here a couple of times, and I loved them all. The last time was my favorite. We came here on Saturday night for my boyfriend's birthday and got a candlelit table on the patio. Patio's are perfect in October, and this one rules. The music they play is really good, but loud..which we enjoyed. It's busy, but not so busy that you have to sit and wait forever. I've gotten the brown bag chicken sandwich and the Windsor burger. While the brown bag has all the amazing ingredients to make an amazing choice, it lacks just a little bit of flavor and is a little dry and "herby" tasting for my liking. The burger however, is amazing. The sweet potatoes and fried okra are delicious as well. Four peaks pumpkin porter is a seasonal and we had that and the Sam Smith's cider.  (Two of my favorites). One of our friends ended the night by getting the birthday boy a Chocolate Elvis...which is ice cream, bananas, peanut butter and whipped cream. Windsor is awesome!

UHDqzQ4OX4QffwEXJenAvQ.text: My taste buds got a sneak peak of Windosr back in March. I was a cocktail judge for the Arizona BBQ Festival and the friendly folks from Postino's introduced Windsor as a contestant in the whiskey competition. As I sipped a refreshing cocktail with only a subtle hint of whiskey, I made a mental note that as soon as Windsor opened their doors, I'd hop, skip and jump there as soon as possible. So with that, today was the day I made it through the whimsical doors of Windsor.   I met fellow yelper, Christina P for a patio lunch at this new Central Phoenix restaurant. Similar to its neighborhood brother, Postino's, Windsor's architecture has the same modern and minimalistic feel to it from the exterior, but once you walk through the doors, you enter an entirely different world. Parking is extremely limited at Windsor, but I decided to risk it and found one last spot on the side of the residential street. However, I don't think this residential parking will last long, so I suggest saving yourself a possible ticket and valeting it instead.   Atmosphere:   Like I mentioned above, Windosr is completely unassuming from the outside. I had no idea that it was so open and airy throughout the interior of the restaurant and they also have two patios in the back. One patio is smaller and more intimate, and the other is a little larger and seats more. Both are quirky and fun as well as airy but protected from the sun by an overhang. I felt like I was lunching on the back patio of a stylish friend's house. The tables are close together, but I never felt like I was in another table's conversation or they were in mine. This is a great restaurant for patio dining and I could see it not being too hot in the summer should I crave an outdoor lunch. The staff was also friendly and attentive and consistently refilled my diet coke, which is always a plus in my book.   Decor:  I love the decor of the Windsor. Think retro chic. Everything is very clean and minimalistic but once you look closer, you see how retro and fun everything is. Take the cassette tape wall for example. Yes, it's an actual cassette tape wall and all of the cassettes are authentic and awesome. They have everything from Genesis and AC/DC to MC Hammer and homemade workout mix tapes. It's almost like a memory wall for those who are products on the 80s or earlier! The bathrooms are funky, the walls have funky writing on them and the whole decor resembles a classed up garage that's been converted into a bar/restaurant.   Food:  Now moving on to the food. The menu is just as retro as the decor in the sense that they have classic items with a twist. They have everything from hot dogs and a crab cake BLT to pastrami Reuben and of course plenty of salads and starters. I am excited to go back and continue to try items off the menu, but today I decided to go for the Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich which has pulled chicken with oven dried tomatoes, toasted hazelnuts and herbs topped with avocado, watercress & green goddess goat cheese. Yes, it was as good as it sounds, but note that this is a cold chicken sandwich and not warm. It was a tasty sandwich but I think it would have been better heated. We also tried the Kale leaves as an appetizer. If you are a fan of Kale, you'll probably enjoy them. They also come with a chive mayo sauce that tastes a lot like the sauce you get with artichokes.   Between the food, atmosphere and decor, I really like Windsor and plan on adding this to my Central Phoenix rotation. Between Postino and Windsor, I am one happy camper!

5FZYKq9TjEBCYvecS5SUrA.text: They made a nice exception for my friends and me on a Saturday evening - we got a reservation for 6 on a round table and the party started off just right. I don't drink alkohol, but they have my favorite non-alcoholic beer from the Guinness Brewery: Kaliber! My friends got martinis, white wine and then the food: Halibut Steak, Salmon, crab cakes...Veggies, we tried almost all different sides...all are so yummy, but the 'gratin potatoes'....heavenly! The portions are just the right size; the whole presentation looks great and believe me: It is enough...and leaves just a little room for dessert.All ingredients are superfresh, most are locally grown and cooked to perfection.Prices are budget friendly for the value and that's why the place is almost always busy, it's a bit of a family affair place, the staff made "most" of your wishes come tru and is friendly, experienced and so lovely. We left our valet parked cars on the premises, drove just with one car (we were still somehow able to all squeeze into the truck after dinner !!) to the Flash light tour at the Botanical Garden -another birthday highlight, walking around there at night...but still a bit warm in August- and back to the Windsor, but this time to their sweet sidekick: CHURN...ice cream parlor and sweets store, and got our various favorites*, sat outside in the packed backyard und just had all together a marvelous time. Another delicious pearl on the Restaurant string in Phoenix. *...I tried the "Elvis" at Churn a few weeks later - you don't even need dinner before, all I can say: Salty caramel cream...Elvis is alive!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EMirWgTY6EtBzuLb-7SDaA.text: I have a special place in my heart of this location since I worked as a florist there when it was a flower shop.  The ambiance is great with the nice patio, cool bar and fun wall of tapes for your walk to the restroom.    The food is amazing! and very good service even when it's packed.    A def must!

PZplvJuukoNVQrHtSTd8dw.text: I have been going to Windsor since they opened.  I don't know why it is just now that I am writing this review.  This place does not, and never has, disappoint.  Just like Postinos they have the same drink special, $5 pitchers, special cocktails, and glass of wine before 5pm, but their menu is more extensive.  The menu is always changing, but some staples you will want to try are - Kale Salad (chopped or Caesar), Windsor Burger (if you get fries ask for the Gold Sauce for dipping), Ceviche, whichever platter they have in the starters, and the Pastrami Reuben.  When you are adding sides I would suggest the Jo's Church Potatoes (it is like hash browns mixed with mac and cheese), the Mac N' Cheese is great, and I am a fan of the Fried Okra.  Finish or start any of these with a pitcher, cocktail, or glass of wine and you will leave with a smile.  The Tape Wall is definitely worth checking out if you have never been here, it will bring back memories if you remember what tapes are.  Thank you Windsor.

KV0fKNFjfNP-xkay5cBHSA.text: Delicious! I went here for the first time today and loved it! The workers were very kind and took good care of my friend and I even though the restaurant was packed. Our food was fantastic and I'm looking forward to going to Windsor again!

2FH5q6LFYIgS1GD4LyV6Fg.text: This place is fantastic, would definitely recommend.  Cool atmosphere, some good seating both inside and out on the patio.  There are a number of appetizers that are good, but I would probably recommend the loaded chips and the seasonal peppers.    Can't go wrong with the White Fish Sandwich, I think it is the best item on the menu  Looking forward to going back again soon

FK7QArkB0imocj7jiaHf9A.text: They had me at Pappy Van Winkle. I wish money grew on trees. Actually, I wish there was no such thing as money and Pappy flowed freely from my faucet--I just assume money growing on trees is a more likely scenario.

ZF7jg3U6wIIdDTRyrFdSQg.text: Since I can now post on here again, I'd like to say that this place is great.  Pulled chicken sandwich.  Macaroni and cheese.  Do it.  Great restaurant.

b-GWSmty1V0k-aNGrYq1qA.text: What a great new restaurant.  Cozy booths inside and nice patio seating outside.  Gourmet menu items at great prices.  Multiple salads with different ingredients (kale, corn, etc), fresh bean side dish, so many choices to try. Staff was extremely friendly and we were even pampered with valet parking  We will be regulars.

wpq0sSA1prUv5lwG5Vylwg.text: This place was great. I've been passing it going to and from work daily and finally on a Friday afternoon, my coworkers and I stopped by. There's no self parking, there's only valet (FYI-have cash). We sat on the patio and it was great. Our server was friendly and our food arrived promptly. We all got burgers and fries, and it was amazing. Will come again.

eJRPmVY6VPrqUyfcin6hHQ.text: Went their with friends on Thursday night--not too busy at 7 p.m. when we arrived. Friendly greeting and went to bar to wait--she was willing to seat us even though our other couple was about 20 minutes late. We said no--nice bartenders. Excellent Hoegarden wheat bear--we ordered 2 pints but wish he'd said get a pitcher-better deal.   Food--nothing special here. Pulled pork sandwich had about a tablespoon of coleslaw, bacon was overcooked/burnt. Ham didn't taste anything special-best part was the pulled pork; serving of that was light Mac and cheese not much flavor but at least it was warm. Partner had hamburger--he gave it a pretty good but his hash brown thing side dish he said was undercooked.  Friends had fish sandwich and ribs--nobody raved. Service was really great and friendly all around.  Would we go back? Not sure--was not all that memorable. Maybe our expectations were too high. At least the sides were included with the main.

reWl0i3IvjeLf-WqimLJfg.text: Good quality for what it is... Doesn't touch Postino, but full bar, hip surroundings, and cool music are a plus. Try the crab cake BLT or the Bahn Mi. Avoid the fondue and the grain salad.

-saLvdNDWfr666ju5C3QMg.text: What a gem! Found it on yelp tonight and tried it. Started with the cheese app good, not as good as Arrogant Butcher but good. Dinner and staff was excellent. At one point my daughter and I comment on how nice the wait staff is at the same time. Very kid friendly!

hW4jAIO8ifyWJg6-FAnkjQ.text: First off... needs better signage. I walked past all three doors in front looking for a way in... felt kind of stupid. Entrance on the side. Very hip feel, good energy and very busy. Wished they had a few more general beer selections. It's nice to do local and different, but I found both my picks to be not be what I was looking for. Like that someone walks thru the waiting crowd and gets drink orders, saves fighting at the bar. Had the Kabob appetizer and the Church potatoes as my entree. I make these same potatoes for every holiday meal.... they were good comfort food. The Kabobs were a selection of meat, shrimp and veggies (one of the veggies I had no idea what it was, although good) I wasn't thrilled with the dipping sauces though. It was a bit like a twist on mustard and ketchup with other things mixed in. Hard to describe, but would have rather had a good peanut sauce, or a spicy tereyaki like dip. Didn't do Churn next door, but will save that for a visit of it's own!! Hate the whole valet thing, although I understand it here since there is virtually no parking. But I did find a LEGAL spot in the neighborhood.... please be respectful of the folks who live nearby. All and all, I'll be back... the sandwiches at the table next to me looked wonderful, and I didn't get to see the restrooms (a strange quirk of mine)

Khvv5fOMICKq-8yGAIr8iw.text: i visit this place over the weekend to give them a second chance since last time the food server is lack of training and very bad attitude not precise with serving food and still the same even worse this time!!!

imRLd_xlv-mApRyr1pNI4Q.text: Love all the Postinos/LGO/Chelsea's Kitchen places, so obviously had to try this one out! A friend and I went for lunch on a Tuesday. The patio looks wicked, too bad it was 140 degrees out and everyone was definitely waiting for an inside table. Had to wait about 15 mins but finally got a great table by the wall that says YES. Lunch cocktails and wine are apparently all $5, so I had a great pear cocktail/martini concoction that was delish. My friend got the paper bag chicken sandwich (YUM) and I got the quino (I always forget how to spell that word...) salad with a million grilled veggies. Flavor was a little bland- but it was just grains and veggies and goat cheese- so it was still yummy. I had to try the mac n cheese (I always do) and it was GREAT! Service was lovely- really nice waitress and the hostess gets 4 stars for having to deal with customers who appeared to be mad at HER that it was so hot out??? Weird.  We stopped at Churn (gelato place next door) after lunch and it was fantastic.  I'll come back to enjoy the patio, cheap drinks and mac n cheese soon!

mIBdJWjOWsAB4bxVDdobQA.text: I have eaten here a few times now and I have really enjoyed everything I have tried. The first time I got the Crab BLT and the church potatoes. Hot damn, I would go to that church anytime. The pickled veggies are really tasty and the fondue is really good. The second time I had the porkwich, which was a LOT of pork and the warm bean salad. It was all really good!

MwegWSIUlUeHiSVWXWUL1w.text: We made our first trip to the recently opened Windsor tonight in North Central Phoenix.  Very enjoyable!  The influence of the Postino's ownership is felt when you enter the restaurant.  Cozy indoor space opening up into a well shaded patio area.   The menu selection is limited...think salads and bar food.  Drink options are plentiful.  We had the Halibut and Crab Cake BLT sandwiches, with good side choices beyond just the standard french fries and fruit salad.  Excellent and well recommended.  The only negative tonight was the waits at times once seated.  It certainly wasn't for lack of the servers' efforts, as they were clearly diligent and keeping busy for too many tables.  Hopefully this ratio is just a blip in opening, as the food and setting are definitely there.  We didn't try the ice cream options at Churn next door, but they definitely looked good.  We'll be back.

rwfjtDe9LdixZ5Cf4WL9HQ.text: Great food and drinks! It's pricey, but the portion sizes are large and their happy hour menu has discounts on appetizers and $5 drink specials. Our favorites are the kebabs and brown bag chicken sandwich. Windsor is a regular date night spot for us--great patio area and a dimly lit romantic vibe if you eat inside. Definitely check it out!

7y9eVhVI1Q0AMcrh5tXIxg.text: Postinos little sister! Went here for lunch very good! The staff was friendly and the prices were good!

G5yL_DJrBGO0va4BIK76Bg.text: Really enjoyed lunch there today. Great food nice ambience and friendly staff. Also went for my birthday with my family and we all loved it!!!

7OMxes9eMKJtJd14BaHSvA.text: I agree with a lot of the other yelpers on this one. The design and vibe of this place is oh-so-cool but the food is pretty far off. We started with the vegetable chopped salad, which was amazing. The fried okra really made it. I had the bahn mi with macaroni and cheese. The sandwich was really fishy and the bun went soggy and gross immediately. The mac and cheese was completely inedible due to its saltiness. The boyfriend had the Reuben (which he really liked) and fries (another salt fest).  We'll probably come back for the atmosphere, but we'll just stick with drinks and salads next time.

QbV9OPuQQ7PpH99mlkyBQw.text: This place is great and has a wonderful ambiance to it. The wait staff is friendly and very knowledgeable. They have a great happy hour on weekends too! The ribs and the hamburger are delicious. I will be back!

3WMIo_fzJHdQ0txJx-y3aw.text: It is exactly what you would expect from the Postino crew.  Cool warm urban place, big patio (too hot to go out during the day though, it's Phoenix baby), and a great $5 happy hour.  The service was good, the food was hot and tasty, the cocktails they have on their menu were very unique and we tried a couple as well.  Good stuff.  The #1 was very good, I guess i would call it refreshing.  The wall of cassette tapes was vintage and cool as well.  These guys understand what customers want.

F-D-qpwrcDXfmgX9RtvKdA.text: They have a great deal for happy hour and the food is consistently good.  I opt for the patio if possible.  Good place for after work drinks.

VBYX4kju3Opige5Qc4nE0A.text: It was great! We came from out of town and that was our first stop. It was super cute and trendy inside and outside. It had great music, staff, drinks, food, and vibes. I'm glad we went :)

piHvhZ6crt44vtNkS5q6kg.text: Oh, how I adore the Windsor. I've been here many times. And it's taken me far too long to write a review. Centrally located (Camelback & Central) with a kick butt happy hour they offer impeccable service.  I like that.  On a sunny day when thinking of a patio? You should come here. The servers are a mix of pin-up dolls and retro styles. A bit of punk but no attitude. You can stand for more than a minute without multiple people asking if you've been helped.  I like that.  If you've got a large group, the Windsor can accommodate you. If you've got tiny human beings with you, the acoustics work in your favor. The rest of us can barely hear you! (And there are crayons for the tiny ones!) This is a dog friendly patio too. Neat!  I like that.  The sandwiches are wonderful. The soups and salads are too. I've eaten my way through quite a few. My first experience here with a sandwich was with envy. Yes, envy. I had eaten prior to joining for a happy hour, and my friend ordered the "Brown Bag Chicken Sandwich". Toasted hazelnuts, avocado, oven roasted tomatoes, goat cheese (HOH), chicken (OK, yes, I almost forgot that) and some green stuff hits the spot.   I came back and had that. A few times.  Today I had something called the "Porkwich". I was sold immediately by the mere mention of bacon. Pulled pork, tender belly ham, smoked bacon, layered with gold sauce & crunchy coleslaw on a buttermilk bun. YUM. No, I did not share with my table mate.    Hey, it was my HBD weekend :)  Nom, nom, nom! None for anyone else!  When the sandwich greeted my palate we were immediate friends. The bacon was perfectly cooked. Not over cooked or dry.
