But not under cooked either. Mixed with the ham and pork, the sandwich was a delight.  I like this place. I'll just keep saying that.  Got it?  I like this place!

KTWH7SYinN6XKqgpPpYF5g.text: I used to frequent this spot when I lived in the neighborhood years ago.  I've moved abroad and came home for a visit for the holidays and my friends wanted to visit with me for my birthday and to say goodbye before I left town.  My small group suddenly doubled and as a courtesy I rang the restaurant to give them a heads up and see if they could save a small section for us.  After being shamed by the assist general manager for expecting a same day reservation (on a Tuesday) he explained he would see what they could do.  As a group of working professionals, many who live in the neighborhood the staff appeared very bothered to accommodate us, we had to beg for service and they were visibly annoyed on the two occasions we asked for help with a group photo.  My friends all commented how rude and unprofessional they all were and it was really disappointing that my efforts to support a local business clouded a great reunion of friends. Sad to see what was once a great business go downhill.

2U6UtwRYcPZCxo2VJv3Y5Q.text: The wait is frustrating. Space is small and loud. I requested the music to be lowered on the patio so I could actually speak to my coworker and the server stated "the owners are in and they like it this way. They want certain vibe for their restaurants" okay but what about the customer? I've always had average customer service at the Windsor. The salad I had was good but the overall experience was a headache.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cobb Salad

tzLHEonw5mTn7Rc8nJr-eg.text: Ordered from UberEats for a party of 4.  All ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger.  One requested no cheese or bun due to food allergies.  The three regular burgers were great and tasted wonderful.  The burger ordered for the allergy arrived with no bun and covered in cheese.  Windsor made the error right and I look forward to trying Windsor again.

_VQXvaEvxSyFXFo447rfiw.text: Windsor is a super fun spot and in such a great location! The bar is really cool looking and fun and it also is connected to churn, an ice cream place for after lunch, dinner, or drinks if wanted. The restaurant and outdoor space is really beautiful and this place is just a fun time to get drinks and relax.

HPwe--nX5HkreKAND_SPtQ.text: Love the patio and the food! It is such a cozy and inviting place.

_gpxyKulHIMj6MjYjOtlkA.text: Great ambience and indoor/outdoor space. Top notch cocktails and wicked good food. Try the porkwich sandwich with three types of port and Joe's church potatoes. Yum!

-b5SufsyKT6xpnFRJQSnmg.text: My fiance & I were going out for a date night & decided to give this place a try for the first time. The atmosphere is really well designed, fun & relaxed. The food was phenomenal (we had the pastrami sandwich) & came out pretty quickly for how busy they were. We can't rave about the customer service enough!! Both our waitress and the manager made a direct effort to make our meal & dessert unforgettable and they provided the best customer service that we've experienced in a loong time. Two thumbs up!

1cWOrp2laszSQAL2pQEVoQ.text: This was a great meal overall.  Everything tasted great, the service team tag teamed us and never left us needing anything.  The decor and setting were lively yet still relaxing.  There was a certain buzz in the air.  My only complaint is the undersized serving of fish in my fish and chips.  I have had dozens of varieties and this very small portion of 6 oz fell short of expectations.  We will go back to try a few other items on the menu!   D.

Of5IqAA3Ua69UX_YVNjOcA.text: I haven't reviewed The Windsor yet? Shame on me!  Before you enter, be very careful where you park. Pay attention to the signs in the residential streets, you will get ticketed. I almost always valet as I am impatient and lazy.  The architecture is similar to Postinos, it has that old- wood-modern-minimal-rustic-charm feeling. The patio outside rocks, if weather allows sit outside.   The food is wonderful. My favorite is the Bahn Mi fish sandwich, second favorite is the ribs, and of course the 5000 calorie porkwich is also delectable. The Vegetable Chop and Mixed Grain salads are wonderful and so is the Burger (order it Windsor style, trust me)..   The bartenders are friendly, the drinks are stiff and the wine list is hefty. This has become one of my Cen Pho Favorite Spots.

HME0UzDcmIC6lc0chNZNNA.text: Excellent place to bring out of state foodies. Prior to our dinner being served we enjoyed the egg salad and the Cheddar fondue appetizers. Both were excellent. We were just as happy with our dinner choices too!  Service was spot on and the outside courtyard was a delightful place to enjoy a relaxing Sunday dinner.

EXoENfpZIVhDXuSFJVXHwQ.text: I love this place. Everything we have had so far has been good. From salads to the burger to the crab cake sandwiches Reuben and Mac and cheese and close slaw. I cannot wait til another weekend to try the lobsta roll! And my boyfriend cannot wait to try the buttermilk chicken.  So far so yummy and delicious!  Only thing if I get the burger again I'll probably ask for no Carmelized onions just a tad too sweet for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackberry lemonade

-8WtxIsF8lB5b0UXswd7yw.text: My husband and I went to Windsor last Saturday at around 4pm.Have been there before and enjoyed. This time was only a 2 out of 5 and that is my husband who is usually happy with his meal. He ordered the porkwich sandwich.he said it had no flavor.I ordered the Berkeley Veggie Burger. It was the worst excuse for a veggie burger. I always will go toward a homemade veggie burger. This had no flavor other than a mushy texture served almost cold  on almost raw kale. What is going on?Service was poor at best. Not only to our table but the table next to us had to get up and grab his waitress to get ketchup. We used to love Upward Projects Restaurants. Seems like something is amiss. Last time we went to Federal Pizza the manager took my pizza off the bill without my saying a word. Reason they put raw broccolini as a topping on my pizza. I didn't put that evening in Yelp. I just thought it was a fluke. But twice??? I am glad they have a thriving business and wish them well. Just might need to hire more of a staff to accommodate the business.

3P7j2DX-jeNdFW7vjjHO3Q.text: I have been here several times with my husband and normally I have the fish sandwich or a salad.  The food is consistently good and the ambiance is pleasant.  It's usually pretty busy but they have plenty of waiters to take care of customers.  I'm happy that they have more parking, as it used to be a real pain to use their valet or find street parking.  I would have given four stars, but there were small gnats flying around our food for most of our meal.

WO6Ev45GJ02jIC8j3dLr5g.text: I tried both lox salmon Benedict and crab cake Benedict. Both were tasty, but in my opinion, nothing special. There was a fairly small amount of salmon and crab compared to other toppings. Spinach seemed a little heavy on theses. Fried potatoes were well flavored, but there were too few.  Service was exceptional, and staff very friendly. Atmosphere and music were very tasteful!

LF75xTt3nkTumfl7hrQQLg.text: Okay, so I've been here now... I cannot even count how many times!   Granted, it is within a close distance of my residence... that aside, I love coming to this place. The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable. The food is tasty and fresh as always... *sidenote* don't ever get rid of the fried okra... only place in town I can get it (and it's delicious)... it's expensive to travel home south to get more LOL...  The ambiance here is perfect for dates, friends, groups and even kids to take to Churn next-door.  Thanks Windsor for being a staple in my culinary world!

photos.caption: Photo of Windsor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best salmon w/lentils ever!

lvXhd6adRuriE86U8bhLPA.text: I had drive drinks at the bar, the Greek God appetizer and a bowl of excellent chicken tortilla soup. Highly recommended.

KmjkYljw6MmTzpXhd8M9pA.text: Food and atmosphere is great. Nice patio. Only down fall is that you can't make reservations so sometimes there is an hour wait. Parking is also difficult.

LrV3EB1PS9paAOuAidgInA.text: We came here for brunch on a Sunday and loved the $5 dollar "pitchas" of beer they offer. I ordered their salmon kale Caesar salad and my fiance ordered the Windsor style backyard burger with Mac and cheese. Both were absolutely delicious!  I enjoy eating healthy but rarely do you see a salad coming your way on a server's tray and think "wow I can't wait to eat that". However, I found myself thinking that exact thing when my salad made its way to the table. The biscuit croutons are a nice little contrast to the kale and the salmon was cooked just right.  Service was spotty at best.. We waited maybe 10-15 minutes before someone greeted us but the food made up for it. Will be back and hopefully better service next time!

H70Fx9P1EakZago-apQGkQ.text: It was alright.   Had a group of 8 and tried to make a reservation but we were told they already had too many reservations and could not take more. So one individual in our party was the sacrificial lamb that was sent to wait ahead ; she went 45 minutes ahead. Everyone else arrived at 11:00am.  We were seated outside and had a long bench seat, which was nice but we only had two tiny bistro size tables. Three of us hung out sort of in open space with no table- awkward. The server didn't address the odd seating arrangement so I tried to get the attention of the next closest server. She said she couldn't help me but to see the hostess about the situation. The hostess said that they had a large reservation for 30 at 11:30 so they could not move any of the presently empty tables or chairs, we would have to wait until the next table vacated. The three of us hung out tableless for 30 minutes.   The wait plus the lack of space really doesn't make for a great start.  The food was okay, I had the grilled chicken sandwich and the kale salad. The grilled chicken sandwich was decent but not memorable. The kale salad was good. I had a few of the donut holes with marscapone cheese and preserves, that was my favorite part of the meal.  Others in my party also felt that the food was okay, but not something they would necessarily crave. The big negative was the pitcher of Pimm's with ginger beer- three people at the table said it was not a good combination.   "Meh"- that's about all I can say in summary.

GoHieYbILMueG5ldKmq09g.text: I love Postinos, and I love Churn, so naturally Windsor has been on my list for awhile.  Finally got to check it out and I must say, can the savvy folks that own these establishments do anything wrong?  Windsor was a win.  When we arrived there was a wait, but  the cocktail servers quickly had drinks in our hands ( a 17 and a 63) and we wondered around  the patio area.   The wait flew by as we took a walk down their musical memory lane in the form of the hall covered in cassette  tapes and were told by the friendly hostess that our table was ready. We sat down in the dim dining room, the atmosphere was fun and light hearted, and our server was there with some water.  She was kind and attentive, and brought us more drinks ( a 22 and sean minor pinot noir) and took our orders. We opted for appetizers that night, The charcuterie (loved the assortment of picked vegetables), the Deviled Egg dip (this one caught our eye, and glad it did!), and the loaded chips ( good, not the best we had that night, but good).  Overall we had a great time at Windsor, there was a little mix up with my credit card and another tables tab, but the server caught it before she even set the card down and fixed the issue before it ever became a problem.    Great night, we will be back.

3_PVtHbmLHSn_uk5_tJoPg.text: New favorite brunch spot!!!! Wifey took me here for Father's Day brunch yesterday and it did not disappoint!  First off, they have $5 cocktails, pitchers of beer and mary's! They have a traditional Bloody Mary and my fave, the Verde Mary! Think green salsa with vodka...but in the best way possible!!! They also have a set up inside where you can customize your mary with 10-15 different types of pickled goodies, tons of different hot sauces, salts and seasonings. The ultimate mary bar! I also had this breakfast dish with cheesy mashed potatoes on the bottom, a crisp tortilla covered with two over easy eggs and salsa that was the quintessential Arizona breakfast. Just awesome! Great service as well!

JirDcWCgRaLF_xb8SMLLMQ.text: My wife and I visited this locally owned establishment on a  Sunday afternoon in August prior to a d'backs game.  We had visited Churn several times in the past (an artisan ice cream shop that's connected to Windsor), but never got around to dining at Windsor.  So we got there around 11am, and it was busy...20 minute wait busy.    To kill time we browsed the menu and noticed a couple of things.  First, happy hour...they have $5  drinks until 5pm everyday.  We're not talking well either.  They have a solid selection of craft beers, and eclectic cocktails.    After a few minutes a couple seats at the U shaped bar opened up so we took those instead of waiting for a table.  What a great move on our part.  The bartenders are great people and like to hang out and talk.  Plus when you need help understanding some of the ingredients in their cocktails they're right there to answer any questions.   My wife ordered the No. 22 and absolutely loved it.  I tasted it and although i'm not into the fruity drinks, this one was refreshing and flavorful.    I ordered a Deschutes Mirror Pond to kick things off, and then followed up with the No. 63 based on the recommendation of the bartender.  At first I was leaning toward the No. 87 which i'll try next time.    Food....we started with the cheddar fondue appetizer.  I'll warn you, this is a meal by itself.  It's served with fresh apples, sausage, and soft pretzels.  The fondue had tons of flavor and even a little spicy kick.    After gorging on the fondue we could have stopped, but for whatever reason I was still hungry.  We chose the Grilled Chicken Sandwich with sides of fried okra and chopped kale salad.  If you like spicy you'll love the sandwich.  It has a curry rub, along with a spicy jalapeno mayo.  Plus the bread seemed rather fresh, but I'm not sure if they make it in house (maybe they get it from a local bakery...dunno).  While dining we looked around to take in the full experience.  The restaurant has a rustic feel, but the patio is where it's at.  I can't wait for the temps to cool so we can go back and chill with friends on the patio.  Oh yeah...and grab some ice cream at Churn.  Don't forget to check out the cassette tape wall!

uqMSMXDRZAKYlKc_ucu66g.text: One of my faves.  They just added a new ahi salad that is to die for!!!  I haven't been disappointed yet! The Ice cream place attached, Churn, is so cool!  Always have to have my sweetie after dinner.

07dp5jN3cemol0rjtIdnNA.text: What a delicious spot next to plenty of other great places to try - Churn and Federal are awesome too. Jared S was the Manager on duty and he took such great care of us we are sure to go back. Delicious food/drinks, great service, cool atmosphere!

9IndhU_YpI0SmwhUmh0bdQ.text: Great food!! Loved the environment and the surroundings, made me and my party feel very welcomed. My friends are regulars there, so they showed me the ropes. If you come in with a group of friends or even just a date, try the Russian roulette for an appetizer.(highly recommended) I've already recommended a few of my friends here and will defiantly be back!

TMWkg93ZJ6VTA5T9BVE7vg.text: Oh no! Beware! Once you have something that's really amazing and mindblowing it's hard to go back! It might seem dramatic but... Nearly two weeks ago I had the most amazing cheeseburger at Windsor. It was everything and more! I felt happy, high, relaxed, and satisfied. Woo! I decided to come to my usual burger joint for a $6 burger and it was just ok. Now that I have experienced Windsor cheeseburgers I don't know if I'll ever be satisfied with Smash Burger. I feel like I cheated on my husband with a sexy man and now I look at my husband and although he has been consistently great, I now know that mindblowing is possible. I know, I'm so intense when it comes to food but you only say that because you haven't had that cheeseburger...  I ordered the Windsor cheeseburger with an heirloom tomato salad and #17 off the drinks menu. It was so good! I would consider it a food orgasm!

oZqdFXD-fQzpDhMwMol37A.text: Shall i shall...tis worth the calories, tis.  Ummm...me likes.  Five dollars drinks add up to 50 dollar bills b4 five in a minute.  The 63 goes down like a gatorade.  It's a five star place.  Nice, affordable fun...

HOve0lWGqgoxAT29aL2feA.text: I come here for lunch all the time. Every time I come I always get the deviled egg dip & chips appetizer. Its soooooo good. Windsor has a great patio and right now I love taking advantage of the beautiful Arizona weather. Last time I was here I got the grilled chicken sandwich which comes with a mango jalapeno mayo that compliments the curry spice rub perfectly. The sandwich also comes with a side and my favorite is Jo's church potatoes which are these fantastic cheesy potatoes. If you haven't tried them yet I highly recommend them.   PS Churn is right next door and they have some of the best ice cream!!!

Wmeubmy7iQ05Tnl62U_TXg.text: I personally would go to Postino over Windsor, but this place comes in a close 2nd and with Churn the homemade ice cream right next door you cannot go wrong. It's gloried "Pub" food, but much pricier.  The atmosphere - 10  Food - 8 Service 7 Price - 4  I think they are a bit pricey for what you get and wished they offered discounts on food  during their AMAZING Happy Hour and not only the drinks.  We usually end up with the Pretzel and Cheese Fondue and a Burger or Sandwich.  I love that you can also get Mac and Cheese as a side and not just fries.

3jOw8IoNUMgHjDB7N34JQg.text: Cozy, friendly local gem. The food is really good, nice patio, lots of people to watch and/or talk too. They have good drink specials and an ice cream shop in the same building. It's great to see places like this popping up down the street, makes living in the area so much better.

32VGvqQ3VAWN9OULw1hrDQ.text: Came here instead of waiting 45 minutes at postinos and I'm glad we did! Nothing against postinos, I just wasn't in the mood to sit and wait to eat on a Tuesday.   Great atmosphere, good food and drinks, and good service. Can't ask really ask for much more. On to the good stuff:  I had a glass of the rickshaw Pinot noir, which I haven't seen for over a year when postinos stopped carrying it, +1 for Windsor for that alone! My girlfriend had a hoegaarden (though she asked for a lemon twice and never received it). The wine by the glass is on tap, so though I could buy it by the bottle, I couldn't take what I didn't finish home.   We started with the ceviche, which was pretty good, but the bowl of actual ceviche was pretty small, and the seafood in it was difficult to find in all the avocado. I'd probably skip it next time and try something else. There are some good looking apps on the menu (deviled egg dip, sauteed peppers, cheese fondue).  For entrees I had the brown bag chicken with Mac and cheese, which seems to be a favorite, and my girlfriend had the picnic skewers. Both of us thought everything tastes fresh and had no complaints. The ribs looked and smelled really good too!   Our original bartender was a little slow and not very helpful, but the guy bartender that was in and out of the bar was very friendly and makes a great margarita.   All in all it was a good dining experience, and we will be back. Churn is right next door for dessert too!

gyLtuzoSlJa87uwTI-ru6A.text: I'm in foodie love because this place is completely perfect. The decor is an awesome, pseudo-industrial feel with a lot of metal and brick work, but they kept the padded benches and booths for a comfier feel. The bar is really cool, and when the weather is nice their lush patio can't be beat.  My fiance and I love going here for lunch during the week or on weekends for happy hour. They serve $5 wines and $5 pitchers until 5pm every day, but there are no food specials that I know of.   The salads are hearty, though not huge. They make their soups fresh and the ones I've had have been very good. My fiance likes the BBQ pork ribs, and I mix it up. The lobstah roll and fish sammich are yummy. If you go here and neglect to order the church potatoes as a side....just don't.   Service is as expected--a motley crew of young--ish hipster types who don't mind chatting but will leave you alone if you're not into it.   So far, so so so good.

R3uNoYI2z8DdUOwjx3yP0g.text: This place has a charming atmosphere. The food was good. I especially liked the deviled egg dip with bacon and homemade potato chips. Parking can be tricky.

lMPopQNmHwfwaga4iECoog.text: Windsor is hands down one of my favorite places to go to in all of Arizona.  The Backyard Burger and the Pastrami Reuben are both delicious but my personal favorite is the Porkwich and as a guy... I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT.  When I first discovered Windsor earlier this year, the Porkwich was the menu item that caught my eye as unique and a must try.  For the longest time, I had a difficulty trying other menu items because I enjoyed the sandwich so much.  Stepping out of your comfort zone and being adventurous is a good thing because they have other excellent menu items as well.  The Porkwich is still my guilty pleasure.  Windsor is part of the Upward Projects group who also own Postino's and Federal Pizza (both of which are amazing restaurants in their own way).  Windsor is an excellent establishment for both their food, bar, service, and atmosphere.  Inside where the bar is, there is a wall full of cassette tapes on a side wall.  Definitely cool.  They play great music in the restaurant / bar area and the atmosphere is definitely cool, the reason why the place is enjoyable.  Outside is a very laid back lounge / outdoor dining area with a fireplace.  Great food... fun and enjoyable atmosphere, what more could you want?  Oh yeah!  The reason why my brother loves this place is because they have a great liquor menu and I'm pretty sure the bartenders are amazing enough to make something complicated too if that's your thing.

cfADEHIgXGjri1bAKTQguw.text: SOOOOO delicious!! I got the veggie stack and fell in love! The quinoa was soo flavorful and everything went together so well! My boyfriend got the Fish Sandwich and that was super yummy as well!!   We were in town for a wedding and tried this place out and were so sad that we can't be regulars because we live so far away in CA!!

MOJT028FWD1fWtLHxF4q4A.text: We love eating at Windsor. The food and beers are great. Parking is tough but they do have valet.

GP1MOArkAjPbRzbEL6i5Qw.text: I have eaten here multiple times.  Everything I have tried is delicious.  They can get pretty busy at lunch and dinner time, but the service is always the best.  This is probable my favorite restaurant in phoenix!

ArAwM8M4NqU1ajNekUFG1Q.text: On our 5-year anniversary, I had hoped for a slightly better experience.  *Plus sides:  Fantastic fondue appetizer Great crumb-topped Mac n' Cheese in a cute silver dish Wonderful Blackberry Lemonade Servers were accomodating to our desire to change seats Charming and open concept patio Cute ice cream shop next door   * Down sides: 1) Valet parking almost gave me a heart attack. First there was a long wait to get to the booth, where there were pedestrians meandering in the car line. Then, once we passed off our car to the valet man, we heard an ear-piercing shriek coming from our car as it was being driven away. My husband guesses that he did not pull out the emergency break. It was a little scary. Not a great way to start the evening, although I'm sure it was a mistake. 2) Interior a bit dark and overly masculine for my taste, especially where we were originally seated, crammed into a corner. Hence the desire to be moved. 3) Music was not very enchanting. Rather, it was a lot of early-2000's radio hits (think Nickelback or Linkin Park). It did not match when we were seated in a fancy, beautifully-appointed outdoor patio. I would suggest something lighter or more romantic.  So, overall: great food but the atmosphere needs a little work.

1EYL_kf47pKf48pBWM0C7w.text: Windsor is brought to you by Upward Projects, the team of superhero masterminds behind the much loved Postino Winecafes. They sneak into our dreams at night and create restaurants inspired by our innermost wishes and dreamscapes of the perfect urban bistro.  At least that's what I thought when I walked into Windsor. "Damn, they nailed it again. I love this place. They have got to be infiltrating my head."  Comfortable but cool interior, great patio, large bar area for some neighborhood camaraderie and a little food voyeurism, and a zigzagged wall that says "YES!" in big red letters. Know what I say to that? You guessed it! It's YES, btw.  The bartender deserves a gold star for being totally attentive, soooo friendly, and a bonus glittery star for being too darn cute. Actually, all of the service staff were really, really nice. Gold stars for everyone!  The mixed grain salad was just one more reason I will be returning ASAP. I added smoked salmon and, holy moly! It was like 4th of July in my mouth with all the flavor explosions. I agree with some other reviews that a  couple of bites were a little overwhelmed by orange zest, but still loved the dish overall. Seafood ceviche was scrumptious, but not quite revelatory.  The guy next to me ordered a pork sandwich that looked out of this world. It also looked big enough to have it's own gravitational pull, and on second thought it probably did, because the entire bar area pivoted to stare, mouths agog. He said  "shish ish sho schmood", and that's a good enough endorsement for me. I'm coming back. And I want that sandwich.  Nice wine and beer list, and some very refreshing sounding cocktails with all manner of blueberry this and lemonade that.  Wake me up. I must be dreaming.
